description:
Mmmm I loved this place! It seemed pretty crowded for a Friday night too which is to be expected. You walk into this tiny restaurant and the walls are lined with awards from magazines and newspapers and pictures. 

Because I was there to order and pick up food, I decided to go with something I'm familiar with when I go to any Thai restaurant. Pad Thai! It was delicious and they gave you quite a big portion. I was only able to eat half of it, but it was amazing! My boyfriend ate the rest of it later that weekend. 

I will definitely come back when I'm in sf and I'm glad that my boyfriend suggested it to me and took me here. I need to come back and try the other dishes.
author: Heather I.

description:
This place was good but not amazing.

Papaya salad: overly fishy in my opinion and just lack luster all around

We also got a work chicken dish. This was good but I wasn't a fan of the ground chicken and again heavy use of fish flavor. It was just a bit much. But the spice was really njce. We also got padkhee Mao which was good and the beef was extremely tender.

The dessert was SO GOOD black sticky rice with fried banana and coconut ice cream..an amazing combo. Pretty standard for most Thai places I'd say
author: Menana B.

description:
I would give this place an extra star if  it weren't so loud or if it was easier to order online   Food is good if a little expensive 

I always feel slightly frazzled by the entrance which is very small always crowded
author: W M.

description:
EVENT: just your casual weekday... you know... went out for a run at the park... and we're feeling hungers! And all you can think about is food, food... thaiiiii fooddd... Mmm! **Drools**

SERVICE: great service! Greeted us right away and found us a table by the door.

FOOD: we only had a few dishes... well, just two but I'm eager to visit once again to try other delish food. Here's what we got....
(1) Tom Yum Chicken Soup: sweet and tangy flavors! Tom Yum is my favorite thai dish to order! But, this soup here is made very well here with fresh mushrooms (unlike straw/canned mushrooms) Highly recommend it! 5 stars!!!
(2) Pad See Ew: another favorite dish to order. Well made! Although on the sweeter side - 4 stars!

**OVERALL: recommend getting the tom yum soup! 4 stars!
author: Mindy Y.

description:
To me, four stars means I'll go if my friends want to but I wouldn't suggest it. Three stars means I'd fight to go somewhere else. I didn't fight this time, because my main beef with this place is that it's too expensive and I was on a work outing. 

Northern Thai Style Tea Leaf Salad $12.50
Crispy Oven Baked Pork Belly with hot chili paste and green beans, $15.95
Spicy Angel Wings $8.75

Tea Leaf Salad was good! I shared with the group and everybody loved it. I would order this again, maybe as my main. 

Spicy Angel Wings were also good, but not so good that it's a must-order. 

Crispy Pork Belly ... the skin was hard, not crispy, and kept cutting stuck between my teeth. I wouldn't order it again.
author: Julia C.

description: Honestly, the food was just ok. I guess I had high expectations based on the previous reviews that didn't quite deliver. I got the fried rice with beef so perhaps there are other things on the menu that are worth a great review. It was pretty packed on a Monday night and while loud, I was still able to enjoy conversation. The service was decently quick with such a high volume. If you're in the area and want a fast meal, stop in. But if you're a foodie on a mission for great Thai food, look elsewhere.
author: Kristina O.

description:
Dropped in with a friend on a weeknight and was met with quite a crowd! We were lucky to get a table in about 15 minutes because the wait was incredibly long after we were seated! 

Being the basic human being that I am, I went with the spicy ma keur -- aka the spicy eggplant with mushrooms, fried tofu, baby corn, bell pepper, chili, garlic, and Thai basil. It's usually my go to dish because I absolutely love eggplant and Marnee Thai's version of it did not disappoint! It went super well with the brown rice that I got on the side and had a great stand alone flavor as well~ 

Definitely considering making reservations or going in early if you want to avoid a large wait or have a larger group. Such a yummy option for thai food!
author: Lakshmi M.

description:
I found it to be good standard thai. I'm only giving it three stars because I had heard so much about how good it was and I found that it was just normal.

Having said that I thought the food was good. We got the Tom ka which was solid. The veggie pad Thai was a little strange I thought maybe just a little too saucy? Basil pork and summer rolls were also just pretty normal. Probably the thing I thought was the best was the Thai Samosa.

It was pretty crowded on a Sunday at dinner time but we were still able to get a table. The service was quick. Our waiter was helpful. One of our party is allergic to fish and we learned that if you ask for anything without fish sauce in it they can make it for you, it just takes longer.

All in all I don't really have any complaints or any raves so I guess I'm for it!
author: Sarah C.

description:
This restaurant was a great find near the San Francisco Botanical Gardens! We were in town visiting and decided to see what was within walking distance of the gardens, and I'm glad we chose Marnee Thai. It was right across the street and took us about 2 minutes to walk there. The restaurant wasn't too crowded when we arrived around 5:30 pm, so we were able to get seated and served quickly. 

Food (5/5):
The selection of food here was great and it all came out tasting amazing! I got Pad Thai (I know, basic) but still GOOD. My husband got a pork dish off the "Specials" menu that was suggested by the waitress. It came with sticky rice and I'm pretty sure I stole 75% of his rice. My sister got a chicken dish (wow I wish I could remember the name) and it was on the "Chef's suggestions" list. All 3 dishes were SO good (we are a sharing type of family). There was some spicy sauce on the table so that you could add heat to your liking. 

Price (5/5): 
The pricing here was INCREDIBLE for San Francisco. At dinner we all paid $13 - $14 for a main dish. WOW. 

Service (5/5): 
Our server was friendly and gave super helpful suggestions. We really enjoyed being at her table!
author: Hillary S.

description:
This restaurant is a bit small, but the food is good overall.

We started off with two appetizers, the mango avocado salad and crab cakes. The salad had a spicy twang to it and was pretty good. As for the crab cakes, the outside was very crispy but there was so little crab inside that it was hard to discern the taste at all.

For my main, I had the yellow curry with chicken. Absolutely recommend this dish. Crunchy bites, interspersed with tender chicken and potato, bring this classic to life. One of my favorite choices, especially sprinkled over rice.
author: Karen Y.

description:
Ever have a meal that was so delicious that you can't stop thinking about it days later? Well for me, Marnee Thai did just that. Unfortunately, this little neighborhood hole in the wall gem is in San Fransisco's beautiful Inner Sunset neighborhood, a thousand plus miles from my home in Dallas. So I'll have to recreate some of their delicious menu items it at home. But for those who are in the area, listen up! 

Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp mango salad with spicy dressing. It's divine. Fresh shrimp and avocado on a bed of lettuce, a vibrant mix of Thai flavors and a fiery red house dressing that took it over the top. We also tried the panang curry which was impressive as well.

The place itself is cute, but small and to the point. But who cares since you're probably not going here for the ambiance. The service is decent but unremarkable and there isn't a lot of seating, so don't come with a large party. But who cares? Their food is totally worth it!
author: Helina G.

description:
Came here for lunch with friends.
We arrived around 1pm and they were a bit busy.
But we were seated 

So surprised that this place is highly-awarded for its food.
We ordered Beef Salad($9.95), Kang Keaw (Green Curry)($11.95) and BBQ Chicken($13.95).
Taste pretty good and fresh.

Service was okay. 
Pricing is reasonable in San Fran.

Highly recommended for ppl who wanna try Thai food in town.
author: Naiyun W.

description:
I came here for dinner on Father's Day with my family and i have only ever visited the location in the lower sunset but this place is just as good! Reservations are easy to make on Yelp/OpenTable. 

For a party of 5, we were seated shortly after checking in and the waiters are very attentive and efficient. They explained the menu very well and announced their specials before leaving to get our water. 

Must get dishes are the Angel Wings, Pad See Ew and the Pad Thai. Classic dishes that are extremely well executed and super tasty. We also ordered Sea bass with yellow curry and Tom Yum soup. Both tasty as well. We did not get a chance to order dessert because we were so full! But the sticky rice with Mango looked very good and one of my favorite desserts i definitely need to save room for this next time!

The restaurant gets pretty packed and the layout is pretty narrow but still a good place for a large group + kids.
author: Anh T.

description:
I actually hate going to the same restaurant more than once. But this is the second time I've been to this restaurant in less than a week and I ain't even mad. Food is just amazing here. I really don't know how to capture the deliciousness with the words. The first time I came here, I got the pad Kee Mao with prawns. Magnificent. I just went today and got the Woonsen vegetarian. Astounding. Their wine choices are also pretty good however, I'd probably get a cocktail since they're only one dollar more. Food is also cooked pretty fast. For a group of 10 people, we only waited about 10 minutes after we ordered for the food to come out.
Overall, just a wonderful food experience. Highly recommended. Bring the whole fam, they've got group seating in the back!
author: Angela L.

description:
Not bad, not great! I had recently watched Anthony Bourdain's episode in Thailand and came away with such a craving for good Thai food. I realize it's hard to get truly authentic Thai food here, but was still looking to be transported to the land of fiery spice, freshness, and interesting flavor combinations . 

My destination of choice - Marnee Thai 9th Avenue.

The place was hopping the Saturday evening we dined there. People were spilling out the door and lined the skinny entrance way. Fortunately, we made reservations via Yelp (yay yelp!) and we're seated instantly. Great start!

Service was efficient, but almost too efficient. Menus and water were served immediately upon being seated, but we had to wait a little too long to order despite making eye contact with several servers to indicate our readiness.

Nevertheless, we finally ordered - all from the Specials:
- hot cakes - interesting! Slightly sweet rice flour and coconut batter baked into soft custard-like clouds and topped with corn kernels, kabocha squash slivers. This reminded me of a savory maja Blanca - a Filipino dessert
-tea leaf salad - tasty, but not the best I've ever had. This one had fresh greens (romaine), but the tea leaf mash was too salty and definitely needed acids to balance it
- curry mousse snapper - so interesting! Great combination of soft curry mousse and hearty fish. I'd enjoy this on a cold winter night.
- shrimp pad Thai - I had such high hopes for this as I've had it here before and it was AHMAZING! I had dreamt about it for YEARS since it became the gold standard of Pad Thais. Not so much this rime around :( Texture was spot on, but it was severely lacking acid to balance all the sweetness. It certainly was not bad, but again fell short.

Overall, it is very good! Everything was freshly prepared and tasty - just not as balanced as I had hoped.
author: Bella L.

description:
When my sister lived in the Bay Area, I would hear her speak of Marnee Thai often. So when a friend suggested that we meet there for dinner, I was looking forward to the meal.

We started with the papaya salad without shrimp. When it came out, the portion was a nice size and there were tomatoes in it, which was unusual but a welcomed sight. We dug in and after a couple of bites, it was clear that the chef had a very heavy hand with the spicy lime dressing. It was so hot, to the point where we could only eat a few bites. My mouth was on fire. I then became concerned about the curry I had ordered. Our waitress clearly had the same thought so she brought over a spoonful of the curry for me to taste before our entrees came out.

I got the green curry with vegetables and my friend ordered the pad prig khing with chicken. The green curry was not as rich or as thick as I'm used to So the vegetables were not really coated in it. Neither Andrea came with rice so we ordered two sides of brown rice. Everyone around us had the homemade hot cakes that they appeared to be really enjoying. If we ever return, that is definitely what we should try.

I am not sure if this place has gone downhill over the last several years or if we just didn't order the right things. My sister loved the pad see ew there and I'm guessing that that is what I should've gotten. But, despite our being underwhelmed by the food, given it's proximity to the UCSF medical center, the place was really booming and benefitting from the after work crowd.
author: Maisha R.

description:
We came in for dinner around 6:30 pm on a Saturday night and it was super busy. We had to wait to get a table and waited a very long time to get our food. It was super cramped and tight in terms of seating. The restaurant isn't that big so all of this took away from the overall experience.

The tables next to us all had water upon seating but I had to ask for ours. Other people who were seated at the same time as us also got their food first. One of the tables next to us was given food and had it taken away just before they ate it because it was for another table.

However the food was very good. I'm vegan so I ordered the jasmine rice with praram phak. This consists of assorted fresh vegetables like cauliflower or broccoli, mushrooms, baby corn and fried tofu with peanut curry sauce (with coconut milk). It was delicious. The peanut curry sauce tasted very good.

When I ordered I specifically asked that no oyster sauce and no fish sauce be included in my order and the waitress said it was vegetarian so it didn't include it and not to worry but I'm skeptical because one of the items in their vegetarian menu section says it is made of oyster sauce in the description. I hoped mine didn't have any and thought the chances were good since it wasn't included in this items description and the waitress said it was fine.

I would recommend for the food but warn you not to come at a busy time. My fellow vegans and vegetarians, be sure to double check for any fish or oyster sauces to be safe.
author: Karishma M.

description:
For a small restaurant , they sure are busy and definitely short staffed but they proved to be very attentive. We had a group of 11 people total . We were sat in the separate room in the back. Fairly small but can probably hold about 30ish people. The menu is very large.. so it was kind of hard to pick... so we went on yelp to see what we're their most ordered dishes. 

A P P E T I Z E R S 

Angel Wings (3/5 Stars) 
- I didn't read the description and I honestly thought they were the stuffed wings .. but they weren't . They tasted almost like Buffalo Wild Wings asian zing wings . They weren't bad though. Came out nice and hot . Drenched in sauce . 

Imperial Rolls (3.5/5 stars) 
- these fried rolls weren't bad. They're not the typical meaty type of egg rolls . They have clear noodles and shrimp inside. Not sure what else we're in there. The wrap is very thin so it gets crumbly. Not too bad though...

E N T R E E S 

Honestly .. all the food tasted REALLLLLYYY good cause they brought out this hot sauce that was for the Thai fried rice ... and omg that sauce tho. Bommbbbb AF ! with everything ! I wished I could buy the sauce and take it home . 

Thai Fried Rice (5/5 stars) 
- I actually really liked this dish !! Cause of the hot sauce it came with ! But even alone it was good. Not too salty . Not sweet . Just right :) 

Chan Pad Poo (3.5/5 stars) 
- This dish was good but it wasn't like OMGGG GOOOD .. it was one of the more common pics I saw on yelp. So I thought I'd try it. Glad I did . But it was mehhishhh. 

Pad Siew (4/5 Stars) 
- can never really go wrong with this dish. It tastes the same at almost every Thai place . But it was actually better than most places. So I do recommend trying it :) 

The one thing I do give 5 stars to is to our water guy ! Even though it was busy, he never let my tiny cup go to empty. And he's not even watching me kill my water . Ahhaha. He just knewww. You the best ! Wished I got his name. He worked in the back room around 6ish PM on 6/10/18 :)
author: Jenny N.

description:
Definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in the area. The food here is super flavorful and well balanced. The prices are reasonable while the portion sizes are good. I've been to both this location and the one in Irving and both are consistently tasty. I've only been here for dinner so the restaurant is always dimly lit with lively chatter. 

My favorite things to order here are the spicy angel wings, chan pad poo, and red curry with either roasted duck or chicken! The angel wings are perfectly crispy and are coated in this magnificent​ sweet and spicy sauce. I love the fried basil as a garnish on the dish! Chan pad poo is stir-fried spicy rice noodles with crab meat and egg in a chili garlic sauce. It tastes like pad thai but on the more acidic side! It has a great kick to​ it and is not too spicy. The curries here are on the lighter side and less dense than the coconut curries I'm used to. However, still very tasty when accompanied by​ some sticky rice!

If you're ever in the mood for some Thai food, Marnee Thai is the way go! It will be sure to satisfy your taste buds and make your tummy happy :)
author: Natalie D.

description:
This place is highly-awarded for its food - and rightly so! The food definitely met the hype. My vegetarian pad Thai was so delicious as well as the samosas I shared with my friend. The food arrived quickly too.

My only complaint was that I felt rushed ordering so...not the friendliest service I've ever had. Nevertheless, it was really easy making our reservation over the phone and the food was everything. Definitely recommended!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Got a chicken green curry and a pad thai delivered.
I was pretty excited to eat from here, having heard and read raving reviews about the food.
I order a veggie pad thai with soft tofu specifically and was immediately disappointed to see that it came with fried tofu. No problem, it happens. I thought I will eat the rest if it already.
Ate a few greasy bites but it really didn't not live up to the reviews I had read. Kinda sweet(I ordered medium spicy) and not the usual peanut flavor that pad thai has. Oh and did I mention greasy?
The green curry was even worse and tasteless- not worth talking about.
Plain rice was the best part of my meal.
author: Dhanashree K.

description: Very nice people, good environment and service, and delicious food! We chose this place by the reviews and it was a good choice! I liked they have the option of white or brown rice. I would like to come back next time to try something else.
author: Cristina Y.

description:
This place was so so great. After spending 6 hrs at California academy of science, this place was PERFECT for dinner. It was a short walk away from golden gate park. It's located in a really quaint area and there was no wait! We were starving and ordered 4 dishes of food. We ordered the pad Thai, the red curry, the angel wings, and pork potstickers. The food came so fast and every single bite was absolutely delicious! At the end of our meal we paid $62.34 with tip for 3 people. 

The portion were great too and we had a lot of pad Thai left over. Highly suggest if you're near by
author: Taylor S.

description:
I came here for lunch today with a friend. The staff were very friendly and attentive, which I know can be hard given how busy things get during lunch time.
The place was pretty small, but has a good amount of seating given the space. We were outside the door at 11:30 waiting to  throw elbows to get a seat, but it wasn't necessary;). 
We ordered off the lunch menu, I went for the pad prik pao with chicken, mushrooms, shoots, and corn. I though it was good, though not great. I wish I got the basil chicken or pad kee mao. I felt like my dish was a tad bit sour, but it was my fault for not saying anything. My friend got the tom yum soup with wide rice noodles and it looked wonderful... next time I'll get that too;).
author: Gita r.

description: Favorite Thai place in SF. I used to drive from the Haight to the original one so I was thrilled when this one opened nearby. I love the angel wings, the tom khan is second to none. Service is attentive but not suffocating. Seasonal specials like soft shell crab are always a good choice. And while pad Thai is super "ordinary," Marnee makes the best in town with al dente noodles and tofu that is crisp outside and creamy inside. I also love that they will do the angel wings in a vegetarian version with the tofu.
author: Skylar R.

description: Came here for dinner because of the great rating on yelp, and eat again yelp did not steer me wrong! The staff is friendly but very quick- they're definitely trying to turn tables over and get people in and out as fast as possible! I tried the eggplant dish, the barbecue pork, and the pad phed with chicken. Everything was really good! The eggplant had just enough sweetness, and the pad phed had a real kick to it! (You can specify spice level for the pad phed). The prices are all very reasonable as well. Overall, really good food, and I'd definitely go back!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I haven't forgotten about the time when Marnee Thai got shut down in 2013 due to several health violations, but 4 years later after a brief closure, the restaurant is back in full force. 

Since we were tired after a visit at nearby UCSF, we ordered food for pick up. It still took 25 minutes to get our order ready. Understandably since the dining room was slammed on a Friday night. 

We received our food items hot and fresh. The pad Thai with tofu was classic flavors in its entirety as hubby devoured it in minutes. I love anything deep fried and crispy, the imperial rolls stuffed with pea shoots, carrots, glass noodles and ground chicken hit the spot. I also ordered a Tea Leaf salad, while not Thai in origin, is a decent rendition of the Burmese version. I prefer Burma Superstar's preparation over Marnee's any given day. 

This simple spot for Thai keeps their prices affordable despite having a business in SF. Let's hope they also keep their cleanliness score for the years to come.
author: Janice C.

description:
The boyfriend and I was out in the city with a group of friends and we all decided on Thai for dinner. Luckily, we stumbled upon Marnee!

We were a party of 5 and I greatly appreciate being seated immediately despite it being dinner time on Saturday! The restaurant is quaint with tables set up close to one another. The decor is simple with a warm and cozy atmosphere.

We ordered:

- Papaya Salad
- Spicy Angel Wings
- Pad Kee Mao
- Pork Belly Stir Fry
- Banana Curry 
- Mango Fried Rice
- Thai Iced Tea
- Thai Iced Coffee

Food was absolutely delicious! There was not a single dish I disliked. The salad was tasty with just the right amount of heat to it. The wings were flavorful, again, with just a right amount of kick to it. I could have eaten the entire plate by myself, but of course sharing is caring! The Banana Curry was something new to me and I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was great! It had a good balance of sweet and savory. I recommend ordering if you like bananas!

Beverage wise, I enjoyed their Thai Iced Coffee over their Thai Iced Tea. However, be warned that it is sweet!

Overall, I had a great time at Marnee Thai! Service was pleasant and quick, and food was awesome. I will definitely be back when I am in the area and craving Thai!
author: Julia L.

description: Very authentic and wide selection of Thai cuisines. My fav Thai dish has always been KaPaw, which is minced pork with holy basil, and it is hard to find this dish in the States. So glad I was able to have it again at Marnee Thai. Their curry was delicious also, so were the pad see ew and other popular Thai dishes. Service was great. We had a rather large group and they were able to take our orders and bring up dishes in a timely manner. Will def come back again for some more food in the future!
author: Yingna L.

description: Marnee Thai was delicious. I had the duck fried rice and I ate every single last grain in that bowl. The duck was tender and wonderfully seasoned, and there was a good balance of other veggies in the rice. I would recommend
author: John M.

description: This place was amazing! I made a reservation on yelp, and I'm glad I did because it was pretty crowded even at 8:30 PM on Wednesday. We got a fish dish with garlic and the pumpkin curry with chicken. The flavors were extraordinary and The dishes tasted very fresh. For dessert we order the sticky rice with mango. It was covered in a delicious coconut sauce! I will definitely come back here again. This was the best Thai food I've ever had in SF.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
I like the food here a lot! I also love that they have a lot of space including a whole back-room area.

Highly recommend the yellow curry, tom-ka soup, and pad see ew, but there are probably a lot of other things that are worth trying.
author: Joe B.

description:
Marnee Thai is my favorite!!! It is the gold of the inner sunset and the uniting force for groups that can't decide where to eat. Like when was the last time someone told you that they didn't like Thai food? Okay maybe it's just me who thinks that.

About a year ago I would occasionally get Tom yum soup or the panang beef curry. But one beautiful Sunday, my friends and I drank lots of wine in Golden Gate park and got hungry. We got the yellow curry, pad see ew, and Tom yum. 

For some reason, I never liked Thai curry because of the coconut milk, but that day I tried it was the day my world turned upside down. It was so, so good. All I could think about was the yellow curry. Days and days would go by when I would eat other things for dinner and crave that yellow curry.

Was it just the fact that I was drunk on wine that made it delicious?? I didn't know what to think!! But finally, I went back and tried it again (sober). It was just as good as I remembered. 

Marnee Thai gives me so much hope and joy, giving me the motivation to try new things because one day, I might find another yellow curry (metaphor for finding an amazing thing in life, unexpectedly).
author: Stephanie K.

description:
My mom and I were touring the city, and decided to stop by here for some Thai food. We ordered the mango and grapefruit salad from their today's specials, and went for old school pad Thai. The mango and grapefruit salad was delicious. There was a large variety of vegetables and fruit, and the sauce was delicious. The pad Thai was also very well seasoned and flavorful. But the pad Thai did have a whole lot of noodles, and not that much vegetables or meat. My one request is that they would balance out the noodle portion with other veggies and meat. 

Service was okay. It wasn't very busy, but I felt that we had to wave down our server often if we needed something. But overall, helpful when we did ask questions. Pricing is reasonable in SF. 

There are 2 locations. I imagine the one closer to outer sunset would have easier parking if one was to drive. I would come visit again if I was craving a good Thai fix :)
author: Jackie C.

description:
Mango sticky rice!! So Yummy! 

I tried mango sticky rice with black rice for the first time, I don't know what makes it black but it was de-lish! It had a little bit of a nutty-er taste.

For my main dish I got pad se ew with beef and honestly one of my favorite pad se ews I've had. It was a little more on the greasy side, but that's probably what made it so good.

Also tried the red curry and green curry, I personally liked the red curry better, but the green was still very good.

The place is small and a little run down. There was a funny smell when we walked in, but not bad enough to make me want leave or anything. The chairs were unsteady. They served water without ice in it, which was a little weird to me. The staff was nice enough.
author: Rasha S.

description:
The thing I like most about Marnee Thai is that they serve interesting dishes that I don't find at other a Thai restaurants.

Banana blossom salad:  Delicious!!!  The blossoms and shrimp were cooked so the salad was slightly warm.  If you never ate banana blossoms, it's good to know that the cooked blossoms have a texture similar to artichoke hearts.  It was mixed with a delicious savory sauce.

Pad Thai:  It was similar to the Pad Thai I got on the streets of Bangkok.  This can be both good and bad depending on your view.  It is very simple yet tasty.  Some Thai restaurants will spruce it up by adding nicely sautéed prawns and toasty tofu but not here.  There is no sear to this dish.  Once again, like the street food.

Fried pork belly:  They offer 3 sauces to choose from so we chose the basic chili/garlic sauce.  It was very good.  It is essentially a roast pork topped with a sauce.  The skin was crispy but the meat was a little dry. Fortunately the layers of fat complemented the meat well.

Thai ice tea:  unfortunately it was very weak in tea flavor (even though we asked for less cream) and super sweet.

Fried banana & honey:  it was good tasting but the portion was tiny.  They quartered a banana and fried two quarters, which is one order.

The service is a bit lacking but the staff was nice.  This is my 2nd time here and I will be back again if in the area.
author: Lily L.

description:
Exceptionally flavorful food! The spices and herbs are perfectly balanced in all of their dishes. I keep coming back as their pad Thai and roti are an absolute favorite! Their lettuce wraps, pineapple fried rice, lychee martini, mango salad, papaya salad and special sauce (found in the jars on the table) are excellent! 

This place is cozy. You can hear and see the food being made. It makes you hungry if there is a wait! Typically it's less busy and food comes out quick when they first open. It's less busy and quiet from 11-4. Watch out for the crowd after 7!
author: Courtney W.

description:
Pros: Food is very good. I love their pad Thai! They chicken skewers are also very tasty. Large portions

Cons: Service needs improvement. We didn't receive one of our appetizers and when we asked our waitress about it, she seemed annoyed. The place seems very crammed. 
Good luck finding parking.
author: Raisa G.

description: Good curry with beef. the beef is a little dry though. I think Im pretty like juicy meat.
author: Clare G.

description: Enjoy the food. The place is small but delicious- wings and curry were great . I would recommend it
author: Miles M.

description:
The service is excellent and the food is great! 
Love the Roti bread and curry sauce, beef pad se ew!
author: Dalla D.

description:
I arrived around 7PM on a Tuesday. It was pretty packed but there were still some tables available. 

We ordered the lychee iced tea, chicken pad Thai, and the coconut stir fried noodles. And I must say, I enjoyed everything!

Lychee Iced Tea
This is not your average lychee iced tea. It taste like it when you first drink it, but then you get the pleasant aftertaste of Thai tea. The refreshing flavor of lychee and the nice sweetness of the Thai tea really brings this drink to the next level. I highly recommend!!

Pad Thai
With so many great options at Thai restaurants, it can be hard to choose. But, you can't go wrong with Pad Thai as long as the restaurant makes its well. Some do it too sweet, while others not sweet enough, etc. It has to be the right balance of sweet and tart. And Marnee Thai gets it just right! If you are not feeling like playin around with a new dish, go with this classic!

Coconut Stir Fried Noodles
I was so glad I decided to try this because it's a new favorite! It has taminard so it does give you some pad Thai vibes but the type of noodles used along with the coconut flavors provide a unique twist to a familiar dish. I will definitely come back for this. 

Overall, a solid Thai restaurant! 4.5 stars!!
author: Nicole K.

description: Found this on yelp and decided to give it a try. Small, unassuming place. Prompt, fast service. I ordered the prawn red curry and a Thai iced tea; my friend ordered the pad Kee Mao and a lychee iced tea. My Thai iced tea was perfectly brewed and possible the best I've ever tasted. My friend loooved her iced tea and said it was refreshing. My red curry was delicious, especially with the sauce that's on the table. The pad Kee Mao was the real winner. Noodles tasted fresh and perfectly seasoned. It was DEFINITELY the best pad Kee Mao I've ever had.
author: Sunia C.

description:
Man I used to love Marnee! But last night I was walking by and and thought some takeout would be nice. I ordered and paid and went to the book store for a bit. Came back and saw my dish ready to be handed to me. Instead a staff member understood that I ordered brown rice and was not charged the extra 50 cents. She took it upon herself to dig deep into how this could happen, yelled at 5 employees, the kitchen and then re-rang up my order and gave me a new bill. Very detailed I guess but if you want that extra 50 cents just ask me and let me go. Instead it was another 15 minutes of waiting. When I showed surprise at this amount of time for such a small amount of money she told me not to talk. Maybe she was having a bad day? In any case, Marnee I know you can do better. 
Bussaba is around the corner and is better Thai food if you ask me.
author: heidi h.

description: Great Thai - nice mix between hole-in-the-wall feel with enough space and good service. The coconut stir-fried noodles we're the highlight. Panang beef was also tasty, as was the Thai iced tea (get it with less ice). Will definitely return. We had to wait for a table for two on a Wednesday at 8 so consider making a reservation!
author: Rich S.

description:
I've come here for many years And really like the food.  Almost everything is good and usually there isn't a wait for seats if it's just two of you. I like their Thai iced tea but if you're watching your calories,  you might want to hold off.  I really like ordering the corn cakes which is fried corn fritter or the hot cakes which is a vegetarian coconut based appetizer.  Their Thai style potstickers are also really good. 

In terms of the main course, the red curry with soy protein is delicious.  You have the option of getting white or brown rice with the meals and usually have the option between pork,  chicken,  prawns,  or soy.  The Pad Phed (#37) is my favorite. I get sauteed chicken that comes with baby corn,  mushrooms,  onions and bamboo shoot.  There is also red and green bell peppers in there. 

Overall,  this place is great and reasonably priced.
author: Arman J.

description:
The food is good, see my previous review. But if you want lunch special make sure to come with plenty of time to spare. They are apparently VERY strict about it. 

I called and asked when kitchen closed for lunch, I was told 3:10pm. We get there at 2:58 or so, and are ordering by 3pm. The waitress gives us dinner menus.  I ask her why.

She pointed to the clock. She says "it's 3pm, and lunch service ends at 3pm."

I said I was told on phone service ended at 3:10. She said that was incorrect. 

I asked if she could make an exception - after all, we missed the deadline by 20 seconds, and more than 20 seconds spent waiting for her. She paused, then said "nope sorry".

I was stunned. Then, we said "no thanks then" and walked out. I won't be going back - I don't agree with how strict they were. Now I need a new fav Thai place :(.
author: Charlie B.

description: Probably one of the most as authentic Thai restaurants I've ever been to. I randomly found the place allured by the amazing smell while I was walking. Inside the restaurant, there are beautiful decors; orchids in water in cilynderical tanks, beautiful paintings. There are even fresh orchids at each table. There was also home made chilli & garlic in fish sauce, which I loved. I ordered one of my usuals; tum yum soup. I would have to say it was one of the best tum yum soup I've had. The flavor of the broth was great harmony of bay leaves, lemongrass, ginger, and lime leaves. I would go there more often if it is close by. However, I will definitely come back when I crave a good Thai food session :9
author: Lisa O.

description: We ordered the vegetarian red curry, Guay Tiew Koor, and sweet & sour prawns- all divine. It seems to be popular, and for good reason! The staff is kind, the atmosphere a quaint gem, and the overall experience quite enjoyable. The pricing was reasonable as well. Great for lunch or dinner!
author: Gigi M.

description:
First time here, I don't come to SF so often, but since I was in the area, I just yelped around and came to this little cute restaurant! The staffs are friendly, the place is kinda small, but I think that's just how San Francisco is? Parking here in SF is a hassle since it's all street parking with a meter. I came here on a Wednesday noon, It was not too busy around 11:30ish am. The food was good. I came here with my mom and we order Roti and Pad Thai. The Roti was really good, I love it. The pad thai was a little on the sweet side. It is a little pricey considering that they want you to eat a minimum of $10.. They entrees dishes are already over $10 unless they don't want you to come in for just a snack? 

Overall, I enjoyed my visit here and also in SF. I would be back again in the future.
author: Sheena C.

description:
For what you pay: Great portions.  Entrees dont always come with rice.  
Ambiance: meh.  Not the best place for a first date
Service: incredible.  Very fast
Taste: great!

Most of the Thai places I have been to are excellent. In fact I have yet to find one I dislike. However this place stands out in its taste and service. They tailor each dish to your liking of spice. I asked for very spicy.  No regrets...for now.  My dish was one of the specials: Pork belly stir fry.  Yes spicy here is actually spicy. Yes you will drink 3-4 cups of water.  But its delicious!  I have also had takeout here and I can attest to the mussaman chicken which is also delicious and left me very full!  

Despite this place being very small, you can still have a good time.  In the back it seems much more secluded and seemed to be more settling than the tables adjoined to the entrance way.  

Again, not a first date place unless your date is asking strictly for good Thai food.
author: Rob C.

description:
I've had Marnee Thai delivered to work before, but I finally got a chance to dine at their restaurant. Even on a Thursday night, this restaurant was filled with people! 

- Hot cakes ($9): six little hot cakes that come out pippin' hot! Great way to start your dinner
- Pad Thai ($12): great texture and flavors
- Panang Beef ($14): good portions of beef and flavorful curry paste
- Pad Krapow ($12): Another dish with a delicious sauce, and it comes with chili, basil, and bell peppers

Every dish was flavorful, and the portions are very filling. One appetizer with three main dishes was just perfect for four girls! Service was also fantastic!
author: Christine S.

description:
I should have heeded the early warning as I walked in the place. It smelt bad in there, the place needs a complete work over. It's dimly lite & dirty ... WTF.

The food was not up to snuff either. A plate (barely) of veggies with tofu, I think I counted 4 pieces of tofu. Double WTF !!! AVOID at all costs, seriously this place is a DUMP.
author: Henry K.

description: Small establishment but very tasty food. There are two locations; this one is closer to Golden Gate Park, tucked away in the inner Sunset. The seating is comfortable, and the decorations well-chosen. The food -even the more common items- is pretty memorable; we ordered dishes like the tea leaf salad and crab cakes. Presentation is great, utilizing garnishes, plate shapes and sizes, and the soft lighting to really accentuate the vibrant colors of the food. Prices are also reasonable for the portions; note that rice is a separate order.
author: Albert W.

description: This Thai place is great- always bustling with people and for a good reason! The chan pad poo (?) and the pad see ew are amazing dishes. They are so flavorful and impossible to stop eating- though their servings are more realistically 1.5 servings.. or 2 depending on the day. Their other stuff is good too- like the mango sticky rice and the pad thai. The flavors are rich, and the service is friendly when you dine-in. For takeout, it is super simple to order through yelp and just hop on in and pickup your order. Overall, this is a great place to eat at and also a great place for takeout.
author: Nadia H.

description:
It was okay but nothing special! Kevin and I got the green curry, which the chicken was kind of funky, and we also had the wok see. I would say this is a good place to order delivery with if it's offered on Uber eats or something because it's a clean, nice place. However, the food wasn't the best.

The service also was not great. I waited when I walked in, and he kept helping new people that walked in after. They also had us change tables to make room for other people. Even though that party wasn't any bigger.
author: Nadia H.

description: Omg .. the mixed seafood curry was disappointing.. the water sauce without favor.. n small portion for $21.00????  We won't be coming back..
author: Crisy G.

description:
All around 5 stars!  This place is awesome.

They happily accommodated our large party on a short notice.  The service was excellent!  Prompt and friendly, each server was glad to help us out and make recommendations.

The food was great!  So many vegetarian options, something I wish they had at my local Thai place!  The food came out within a timely manner and was very delicious and flavorful.  It definitely exceeded my expectations and then some.
author: Eric C.

description:
Good ambiance, food and service.  (3/5 green stars)
Our appetizer was roti paratha with peanut-curry sauce ($9) - this was very tasty but considering it was a few pieces of fried bread and a small bowl of sauce, $9 was a bit excessive. The cocktail - pomegranate martini ($7) was the reverse situation: surprisingly cheap but not terribly strong or interesting. It was fine though. The main course, a pumpkin curry with tofu ($12) was good - flavorful even though it was mild (on request). Overall: a decent meal, nice ambiance, good service. 

I'm also giving Marnee Thai 3/5 "green stars" for social and environmental impact, based on these reasons:
* A decent number of dishes are vegetarian or can be made vegetarian. A few are vegan. 
* Family-owned business.
* The website has plenty of information about the chef and his background, their awards, and even videos from TV shows like Check Please, but virtually nothing about the ingredients. 
* To elaborate on that, the website has about 600 words decided to chef Chai Siriyarn, a whole webpage dedicated to reviews and press coverage, but only 3 words dedicated to ingredients: "...freshest seasonal ingredients..." Nothing on the menu either that I could see. 
* So, with all of that, I'm giving a neutral 3/5 green stars.
author: James K.

description:
Best Thai food I've had in California, ever.

Perfect level of spice in a Thai food - hot enough to pant but not enough to cry. Each and every dish is sooo tasty, we couldn't stop eating even though we were pretty full.

Dishes we recommend:
-pad Thai 
-pad see ew (hot hot hot - be warned!)
-green veggie curry
-Tom yum soup

Intimate and casual, not too crowded! Love this place and definitely will be coming back again.
author: Ria J.

description: The food is decent, but nothing to rave about.  The service was horrible.  People that came in after us got there food.  They forgot our order, and they kept making to go orders. It took half an hour to get an appetizer. Another 14 minutes for our food.
author: Linda Y.

description:
Hello Marnee! Parking is a mission here. 
Ok so we ordered the fried corn cakes for an appetizer, a Chang beer (obligatory) and Thai iced tea. Everything arrived promptly and was delicious. For entrees, we got the pad ke mao with tofu and green curry with tofu (yes, vegetarian much). Both dishes were delicious and we highly recommend this place. However, we've had better Thai in other cities and so for that I can't give it 5 stars. Will definitely visit again though.
author: Jay S.

description:
Recommended by my brother, we were excited to feed our empty stomachs after visiting the DeYoung museum. Lucky to find a parking spot right across the street, we were equally lucky to get a table for two right away!!

Airy, cheery, bustling atmosphere with beautiful Thai decor, we quickly found three choices from the lunch menu. Our shared roast duck over spinach and rice and our chicken pad see ew dishes were good portions and delicious!!! Too full to finish our curry pork belly plate, we took it home to enjoy. Great service, great menu selections, fair prices, and great flavors will have me coming back again soon!
author: Janice O.

description: Took two friends to Marnee Thai on 9th Avenue in the Inner Sunset District of San Francisco. It's been 10 years since I last ate at Marnee Thai (and it was their other location in the Sunset) but ohhhh the food was as good as I remember.  I'm glad that I made a lunch reservation because the restaurant was full during our meal. Spicy angel wings, corn cakes, pad thai with shrimp, chicken in yellow curry. Food was absolutely delicious. Next time, I want to try the pork belly stir fry and the pad kee mao that I saw on other tables. I will definitely be back again for my Thai food.
author: Ben J.

description: Overall would recommend. Papaya salad was amazing. Out of the 10 dishes we ordered, the green tea salad was the best dish. We were a group of ten, and we expected to have an hour wait time but they had a back party room that they arranged for us in 5 minutes!! The pad Thai was way too sweet but the rest of the dishes were good. The tea salad was outstanding. My mouth is watering right now!
author: Manashree P.

description:
Busy busy place !
A brisk walk away from the California academy of sciences it's a place bustling with noise and smell of  Thai food.
The dishes are well described and they serve what is on the paper as is. We had PAD dishes a pork and a beef variety and both tasted amazing.
What was surprising to us was the extra charge for rice/noodles which usually is a part of the dish price in most places of such nature have it included in the price.
Another factor to note is the wait time, it took them more time to take our order than the time we took to eat the food and same was the situation with getting the bill. 
These two factors cause it to loose a .
author: Rps G.

description: Stars for food only. Actually food is very good, but the service is unappreciated because some servers are very rude. If you love Thai food and don't care about the service then it's a good place for you.
author: Karine C.

description:
I've been here a few times now and every time my experience is different-- whether it's with the food or service (or even both).

The first time I was here, I ordered the pad-see-ew and it was pretty amazing! However, the second time I got it, it was super greasy, oily, and salty. I had ordered it to-go and I couldn't manage to finish it. I figured that maybe it was a different chef and I gave Marnee a third try. This time, I got the pad thai and it ended up being really, really sweet. Like abnormally sweet. It didn't have the normal balance of flavors Thai food has and I was really disappointed. 

Marnee is such a convenient place to fulfill my Thai cravings, but I'm never able to finish it all anymore because of the inconsistent experiences I've been having lately.
author: Andrea K.

description:
I feel very sorry to give a bad review because the food in this restaurant is excellent but the customer service is gross . I have been several times to this restaurant and also to the other location and at both restaurants some of the waitresses seem to be very moody , unfriendly and RUDE. 
Yesterday I went for dinner and I was waiting for the appetizer, it happened that the waitress gave the plate to the wrong table  and someone in the other table took the appetizer with his hands, he almost gave a bite to it but then he realized that they didn't order that and they starting talking that the waitress gave them something they didn't ask for . Then she (the waitress) went to the table picked the appetizer up and checked the orders and then came back to my table and gave me the same appetizer. I told her that I didn't want it  because the other people already put their hand on it . I explained to her everything and that I saw the guy with the appetizer on his hands but she kept saying that they didn't touch it .... Then she rudely took the plate and went to the kitchen and after 3 minutes she came back to my table with the same appetizer. I know she didn't change it because it was even cold ... how she could think I was so naive to believe they changed the food in just 3 minutes and gave me a cold appetizer ? Plus she forgot to put napkins and my utensils when my dinner . 
I have worked as a waitress too and what she did was completely wrong. 
I really hope they hire better waitresses because the food is really really  good and I would love to go back .
author: Diana Sofia S.

description:
One of my original gangsta Thai restaurants. I told you so;) Quick story when I was in college another student was convinced I was Thai, but she just assumed, I guess it's because of my thighs or my love for Siamese cats? I guess we'll never know. Yet, one thing is certain my love for Thai food will still go on...

I was turned on to Thai food by someone not of Thai origin, but that's usually the case with this kinda Thai looking dude that has a weakness for non-Thai peeps that love Thai food! I just confused you, eh? Oh, I really dig Thai food and that's what really matters, well it matters too if you have a hidden Siamese twin! Marnee Thai has been on my GPS before GPS was an acronym, and yes, years before Jeremy S. created Yelp. Okay...

Marnee Thai offers traditional Thai food and daily specials as well. I admit the menu is hella busy, but if you have your favorites then Marnee will have it! My personal favorites include, Pad See Ew, Mussamun Curry, Imperial Rolls and always topped off with Thai Iced Tea. And for you lovable vegetarians... Marnee has a vegetarian menu! Another plus is the large selection of rice plates (most veg. substitute) which makes a great under $10 lunch option. Oh, and did I mention the mango sticky rice or the Golden Triangle? Mmm is what's up! 

Okay, it's been a long minute since my last visit to Marnee Thai, but I'll make sure I make a visit for Siamese deliciousness the next time I'm in the Sunset area. Just hope they don't speak Thai to me... or I'll just wink and nod and hope it's for the right reasons. Meow, meow;)
author: Eric R.

description: Great Thai restaurant with amazing curry. Would definitely recommend their Thai fried rice and massaman curry. Great service but slightly overpriced.
author: Kristine C.

description:
The service was quick to seat us, even though it was pretty busy. The food came quickly and it was beautifully presented! We had the chicken satay wraps (perfect if you're not sharing) and the bag salad (Nam Tok). We finished off the meal with mango sticky rice. 

The satay wraps came with all sorts of mix ins. The peanut sauce was top notch!

The Nam Tok I ordered with spiciness of 1 out of 5. It was equivalent to the heat of sriracha (perfect for this white girl). 

The mango sticky rice was so decadent and with such a generous portion of delicious mangoes.

Excellent meal here. Will go again.
author: Melissa E.

description: My girlfriend and I were debating where to eat because she wanted thai but usually I don't like going to thai places since I eat really big portions. After much bickering from her, I looked up the most reviewed/best rating thai restaurant and all I can say is that I was very pleased with everything about this place. Food was phenomenal and the portion size was perfect for someone who has a big appetite.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This was quite a good place, and I'm happy that my dining companion recommended it. It has made some headlines and won some awards, and as such, there will be a wait, but it's not as bad as you'd think; it's just that there's no space inside to really wait, so even six people waiting for a table, four of them will be standing outside, giving the impression that there's a huge queue. There's not.

Servers were efficient but not overly friendly, I've definitely had nicer service from waiters and waitresses who were a bit more charismatic, but that's not what the vibe was here. Everyone just seemed in a hurry to get folks in, get them served, get them out. Hazard of one's success, I imagine.

The food was quite good. The curry had good flavor, the beef was incredibly tender. The angel wings were tasty and hot. The basa was very mild, a bit too mild for my tastes, to be honest, but I can see why it's popular to those who aren't wild about fish that taste too fishy. Overall food quality was way above average.

Admitting my bias, I think that Kitchen Story remains my favorite Thai place in San Francisco... but Marnee may very well be my new silver medalist.
author: Sean B.

description: I found a cockroach leg in my Tom Ka Soup. I don't think I need to say anything else.
author: Christy T.

description:
food was bland - nothing special - uninteresting - not even bad. same for setting and decor - table for 4 was actually more a table for 2. 
Service was meager. I got charged for items that never arrived; requested silverware never came, server bumped into my chair.

It's an OK place but there are so many others...
author: Flo B.

description:
Lovely little place. Friendly wait staff. Hottest papaya salad ever. Panang beef was sensational. Pad cha tay was delightful!

Sorry I'm not eloquent. Also ordered sake. Buzzed.
author: Timothy L.

description:
Great restaurant, food was a 5*..
I'm not a huge fan of the atmosphere though. I little squishy, and cluttered. 

But the food and service was on point :)
author: Sarah X.

description:
Marnee Thai is my very favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco. Super unique offerings you don't often encounter at other Thai restaurants, affordable prices, and most importantly, really delicious food.

I've been twice, and each time I've tried and loved the chan pad poo, which is essentially a crab pad thai with egg. Most recently, I also ordered the (vegan) coconut hotcakes, crab eggrolls (these were unexpectedly drenched in sauce but still great), and shrimp tom yum soup. Everything was fantastic, and I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu next time I'm in the area.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Rough parking on weekends, easy parking on weekdays, come early and grab a seat :). If you want, you can also call in for reservations (recommended for weekend nights).

There's also another Marnee Thai on between 23rd - 24th & Irving as well, but this place has more seating in the back. Of the two, I think I prefer this place better, the cooking seems more consistent here. 

My favs go to are the Pad Kee Mao with beef, chan pad poo and the northern style tea-leaf salad. The Pad Kee Mao is really good here, leans more on the spicy and sweet side.

The tea-leaf salad is delicious here, so savory and filled with tea-leaf flavouring. I was really surprised at how flavorful it was and packed with nuts! It's really comparable if not better than B-star/Burma Superstar. Yummy & delicious!

My boyfriend really enjoys the Chan Pad Poo, which is similar to Pad Thai, but with crab flavoring & it's really tasty! If you want a spin on the pad thai, check this dish out, it's really a game changer.
author: Melanie T.

description:
Marnee is a popular local Thai place. I can't say it's my favorite that I've had, but it's a solid restaurant. We had a basil chicken-like, the beef panang, and the pad thai. The chicken was delicious, especially paired with the chili oil they have on all the tables. The pad thai was passable but the beef panang was just weird - nothing like a normal  panang curry. 

We finished up with the sticky mango rice which was wonderfully flavored with perfectly salty coconut milk sauce. 

The staff was very nice and overall it was a good experience, but I'll stick to my existing favorites.
author: Kim B.

description: Their pad kee mao is really good and spicy, just like I like it! The other food was relatively unexciting though. I tried the pumpkin curry and it didn't really have any flavor. I would stick to their noodle dishes!
author: Sonia S.

description: The best Thai food! They also have tea leaf salad, which I like more than the one they have at Burma Superstar. The Pad Thai is amazing!!
author: Vivian W.

description:
The food, guys. THE FOOD IS EXTRAORDINARY. Marnee is hands down the BEST Thai restaurant in the city!!

I was first introduced to this gem when I was going to school not too far away, and as a treat, my hard-working girlfriends and I would take mini trips into the city for food, boba, some memorable nights out etc. I've celebrated birthdays here, Valentine's Day, post-test hoorahs... Seriously, you name it. 

The experience has never changed. The service is always fast, efficient and extremely friendly, but most importantly, the food is so worthy of the five stars I'm giving.

Dishes I've tried and love (and keep ordering):
- Spicy Angel Wings (must try)
- Calamari Salad (delicious spicy lime dressing)
- Green Papaya Salad (always tastes fresh)
- Fried Roti Paratha with Peanut Curry Sauce (not a huge fan of curry, but this is a game changer)
- Pad Thai (comes w/ shrimp, egg and tofu)
- Pad See Ew (bursting with flavors)
- Chan Pad Poo (one of my favs! It's spicy fried rice stick noodles w/ crab meat, egg and green onions)
- Thai Style Fried Rice (get it with crab meat)
- Tom Yum Soup (amazing flavor; spicy and sour)
- Fried Banana with Ice Cream (self-explanatory)
- Mango with Sticky Rice (also self-explanatory)

Reservations and take-out are both options, and I'd recommend them for the busy weekends if you don't want to wait. Don't forget there is another location close by on Irving. 

As the waiter described (and I agree), the spice levels are "American spicy, not Thai hot." So if you're a spice fanatic, spice it uppppp!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I ate at Marnee Thai on a Sunday evening of Labor Day Holiday weekend and was seated right away around 7pm (upon leaving close to 9pm, the line was out the door.) I had the tom yum soup, which was very flavorful with ample other ingredients inside. The pad see ew was delicious! It wasn't greasy, yet the flavors came through the egg and noodles. The spicy chicken wings were just ok, no "wow" factor for me. My favorite part of the meal was the dessert, mango sticky rice. It wasn't too sweet and the rice had just the right texture, not too chewy, and the mangoes were ripe!

Service on the other hand was below average. I think there's a miscommunication some where in their team. Different staff members walked around to different tables but never remembering the right requests. Also, it was difficult at times to flag down a staff member. 

Overall the food was great, service was so-so, and ambiance was also so-so. Not sure if I'd come back again given all the Thai food options in the city.
author: Jean L.

description:
On my most recent trip to SF, I found myself with a strong craving for Thai food. I searched Yelp for Thai places near where I was staying in the Inner Sunset, and decided to try out Marnee. I went alone and ordered two entrees for myself with the intention of bringing half home. The Pad See-U and Thai fried rice were both good. The See-U was very flavorful but could have used a bit of spice, which they provide on the table. The fried rice was similarly a bit bland without the spice, but that may just be my own taste. Regardless, I would order both again.

The disappointing part of the experience, and thus why I'm only giving three stars, is that when I asked for my leftovers to be boxed up (half of each entree remained), the waitress took the dishes to the back and returned with only a small fraction of what remained on my plate, perhaps 25% of my leftovers. I planned on eating the leftovers for another meal, but this was no longer possible.

The food was good, but I left feeling very angry that I had wasted my money on two entrees when I really only needed one. Had I realized that my waitress discarded so much of my food before I left the restaurant, I may have said something.
author: Alex D.

description: Fantastic Thai food. This is what I compare other Thai food I eat with. Even when I went to Thailand I thought marnee stacked up very well. I usually order the papaya salad, chicken pad kaprow, chicken pad Thai and rice
author: M S.

description:
Some Of the best Thai Food in all of San Francisco... maybe even Northern California. 

Trust me when I say that you want to eat here. 

Today. 

Right now. 

And again tomorrow.
author: Mike G.

description: Love marnee thai!! Their pad thai is amazing, and i am really into their yellow coconut curry. Not too spicy and there is a lot of food! The only thing is you have to remember to get some rice separately as the curry does not come with rice.
author: Lilly P.

description: Everything looks good for me, but looks like its not enough food for me. Im the young person and i will need more food . That why i went to taqueria after thai food
author: Don F.

description: I love this Thai restaurant so much,Tom Yum is my favorite!!! We don't eat too much coz we're only two person.Should try again！！！
author: Sally W.

description:
Marnee Thai is pretty much the premier Thai restaurant to go to in the city. I'm writing this review with the background of having gone to Thailand. We ordered:

Pad Thai: good portion size. Pretty saucy, but really good flavor. I wish there was more bean sprouts but that's just a preference. It tasted pretty similar to Thailand. It wasn't overly sweat either and the noodles were perfectly cooked. 

Angel wings: I actually prefer it to be more fried than it was. It wasn't that saucy either which I wish it was. The only time I had Thai wings was at pok pok in Portland. Honestly they were better than these. I really liked the garlic though. I love garlic and there was no shortage here. 

Coconut cakes: so freaking good. Just like the street food in Thailand except way more expensive hahah. Really enjoyed it. 
 
Pumpkin curry: had it with tofu. I wish the curry was a little thicker but that's just preference. It was also in a very small dish but there was a good amount of pumpkin and tofu so that was nice. 

Overall, I'm not from the city and it seemed pretty expensive to me but apparently it's more affordable than most other ethnic cuisines. Knowing this I would give it a 4 star rating and definitely want to come back!
author: Kevin J.

description: Glden Triangles and Pot Stickers were good. Pad Kaprow was okay and the Masammun Curry under-delivered
author: Mrinalini S.

description:
Marnee Thai will always have a nostalgic place in my heart. 

Our past visit here - we ordered the avocado salad with soft shell crab. The crab was fried in heavy batter and was pretty fishy tasting. My seabass entree lacked pronounced flavor.

But.
 
Marnee Thai is a San Francisco institution and if you order the right items - their stuff is absolutely fantastic. They've been doing their thing for years and I hope that they will be able to continue doing so. I have nothing but fond memories here and I look forward to many more.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Thai food. Everyone loves Thai food and the Bay Area is flooded with great options. This isn't one of them. 

The specials menu was of great interest so after ordering appetizers and a yummy lychee iced tea, I ordered the fish in curry mousse wrapped in banana leaves and the banana curry with chicken. 
Everything was delicious. 

I give them credit for that. 

The staff were rushing all over the place creating a chaotic unpleasant vibe. It took forever to flag anyone down to give me things i needed  like a straw, napkins, my rice (well after the entrees arrived), the check. 

The menus are sticky, the space is small, the line of people out the door obstruct your way when you want to leave, and finding parking isn't for the faint of heart.

The perfect storm for one of my amazing panic attacks. 

The girls seated beside me were a mess. One was angrily flipping trough her menu so hard the gusts of air were making hair fly onto my curry soaked spoon. The other girl was staring dead into my face which is really unpleasant. Conversations around me were at a ROAR. I can tell you all about Bob's prostate issues and Madge's diarrhea IBS when she eats spicy food. They were 3 tables away from mine. I heard every unsavory word. 

The tables are so tightly placed together you fear your butt will upend it when you get up to leave. 

I tasted everything and asked for it all to go. 

I literally brought full entrees home because I was so uncomfortable. 

Ideally you eat in the restaurant when you have a night out. 

That wasn't my night. 

I ate everything at home while watching Game of Thrones. 

Panic attack averted. 

No thanks. This place can enjoy the many who enjoy this kind of experience. I am not one of them.

PS: I appreciate the Yelper who posted the detailed city health inspection closure note from a few years ago.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
Solid 3.5 stars, however I had to round down because: 
1. We had to ask for a brown rice to be taken off the final bill because it never actually came. 
2. The hostess gave me a really intense stink-eye when it took my family 30 seconds to cross the street when our table was ready and must have believed that I didn't actually call them, so it stressed me out while I waited that long minute.  
3. There was a hair in my summer roll (and could be seen through the translucent rice wrapper (you are welcome for that visual)). 

These issues aside, the food was really good.  The pad thai nodoles had a great consistency, the Prig Khing (string beans with tofu and chili paste) was very flavorful, and the curry seabass was also good (though not a ton of fish for $20...)

A surprising item on the menu was the Soy Protein Salad with "vegetarian abalone".  Sounds kind of weird, but it was actually really good.  The protein had the consistency of stir fried fishcake (without the fish flavor). And the "spicy lime dressing" had a little kick to it (it was more of a light vinegar/fish sauce kind of dressing, not creamy or anything).
author: Alison L.

description:
Pad see ew (beef), spicy angel wings, and chicken fried rice were on point! Definitely a must do if your in the area and love thai food. 

Originally came to the neighborhood for San Tung wings but after seeing the wait we wandered around the neighborhood for something comparable and were pleasantly surprised by this find. Service was fast and friendly, everything looked clean, and food was just perfect. 

Great establishment I'm definitely bookmarking this place for next time! 

P.S. Try the Angel Wings omg you'll die and go to Heaven.
author: Noy R.

description:
Tasty food.
 The hot cake is not something I have ever tried before.
I finished it in five minutes.
Duck and prawn pad Thai awesome too
author: Blue B.

description: I've been here a few times now. For pick up and eat in, this place is good. I don't think you can go wrong with what you choose. Their papaya salad is delicious and their other dishes as well. It can be a bit crowded sometimes, but I've never had to wait that long. This restaurant is not on the cheapest side for Thai food, but it's pretty good, so I don't mind paying a bit more when I go there.
author: Julie L.

description:
After seeing the Check, Please episode for this place, I thought 10 years or whatever was long enough between visits. This is not a fine-dining place, in case you wondered. Parking is miserable at times, of course, but its worth finding one as its so close to GG Park! Anywho, once I got there, I was seated soon enough but it took them about 10 minutes to get to me, and there was only 2 other parties there while all the staff b.s.'ed away in Thai (assuming it was Thai). The Thai iced coffee and tea are pre-made and come out right away, and taste like it, but ok. 
The chicken satay was really nice with the lettuce wraps, lots of flavor. Price is ok, but not cheap. In any case, I wont go out of my way to go there again, as there is no surfeit of really nice places in the area.
author: Kevin F.

description: We had a terrific lunch of three dishes. Duck with rice over spinach, a chicken curry dish and a spicy pork belly dish. All were delicious and we had leftovers to take home. Prices were average, the only drawback was the parking. We will be definitely coming back for dinner!
author: Russell O.

description:
Environment
We came here for lunch at 12 on Sunday. It was relatively empty. The restaurant itself is quite tiny as the seating is parallel to the kitchen.

Food
For food, I ordered a beef pad kee mao. The beef was extremely tender and flavorful. The noodles were more spicy then your average kee mao, but I was in favor of this! I also ordered a Thai Iced Tea (It was standard, not much to say about it.)

Service
The waiter was really nice. My friends arrived a little late, and the waiter was telling us to remind our friends about coming to the 9th Ave Marnee Thai, as they have another restaurant in sunset too. He consistently checked up on us and refilled our waters throughout the meal.
author: Kristen L.

description:
Had this place bookmarked to try out and it was close to GGP. When we walked up the open neon sign was off and there was a closed sign in the front door despite it being passed opening time. Decided to try the door and it opened. The weird thing was that the waitress was right near the door and saw us looking, but didn't change the sign or open the door for us. We had to ask if it was open. 

Despite all the good reviews, nothing was amazing or anything I couldn't get at other Thai restaurants.Shared a sweet and sour shrimp rice lunch special, noodle lunch special, and vegetable entree from the regular menu. Food was tasty, but seemed pretty standard to me. A big negative was that portions were small and it was pricey. The lunch specials didn't come with anything extra like rolls or soup. There were only a few shrimp and small amount of vegetables. Seemed like there was more rice and sauce than anything.Thai iced tea had a lot of ice. 

Service was nothing special and didn't refill our waters. Tables were really cramped inside. I would rather try out the many other restaurants around this area.
author: Sherille S.

description: We came here for New Years Day dinner and we were not disappointed. I made a reservation via Yelp and when we walked in, they did not seem to have received my reservation. Thankfully, we only waited about 5 minutes for a table for 2. The place was pretty busy. The food was delicious. The green curry had a kick of spice in it. The mango shrimp salad had great flavor but it only had about 3 shrimp in it. Overall, I recommend this restaurant, it's tiny but it has a great atmosphere.
author: Kim S.

description:
Marnee Thai was an all right restaurant, but considering the price and the freezing temperature inside I don't think I'll be visiting again soon. We were quickly seated towards the very back of the restaurant, as far from the cold door drafts as possible. I thought this would be sufficient to keep us warm but alas, the tendrils of cold snaked their way back and engulfed us. We quickly ordered our food and Thai iced teas, which came out before the meal in tall narrow glasses. Once the drinks were finished, we were able to see that almost 3/4 of the glass was filled with finely crushed ice; I estimate we only got a few ounces of tea in our glasses. The drinks were good, I admit, but very short-lived unfortunately. Mine didn't even last until my meal came out. Free refills would be a godsend. 

Once our meals came out, we were a little surprised at how little food arrived on the plates. Personally, I ordered the Pad Phed, which was delicious. I would have expected a little more meat, but was still content with the seasoning and everything else (minus the portion size, and the fact that I had to pay an extra $1.50 for rice).

One redeeming quality of Marnee Thai was that we had some leftovers that were packed up and bagged for us by the wait staff, an unexpected but welcome touch.

To summarize, the food was okay, but in short supply given the size of the bill. The drinks had tons of ice and felt skimped on, but were also delicious. And worst of all, the place was extremely cold and uncomfortable for everyone inside for the duration of our stay. I don't think I'll recommend this place before trying other places in the area, since there are so so many other options.
author: John B.

description:
Nothing Can go wrong with this Restaurant...Id say An Icon in Thai Restaurant in the Bay Area...They have 2 Locations 9th St and one in Irving St. Both Adjacent to each ..(Less than a Mile)

I tried the 9th Street...Good to say ...I came on the right time...Its Busy..but Managed to Get a Table at the Back (Traverse the Kitchen area)...Its a Small tight Place...Im not going to Complaint about it...Im here to Taste and Savor SF Iconic Thai Food...

Bit Pricey compared to the Rest of the Thai Restaurant..but this place is up to its Standard....

Id Suggest this Place....
author: Donovan L.

description:
This is my new go-to spot for thai food. The portions are huge- I can usually get two meals out of one dish. The restaurant itself has an authentic feeling, and every single person on the staff greets you with a smile. 

They're also great with take-out as well- they get your order to you super quickly. I normally get the Pad Kee Mao, which has the perfect tinge of spice without being too much. It's a pretty popular spot though, so if you come on a weekend, I recommend coming at an off hour or being prepared to wait a bit before being seated.
author: Bertha T.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants in San Francisco. Order the angel wings, corn fritters, pad see ew, roasted duck and roti with ice cream.
author: William S.

description: This place has really gone downhill over the years. I recently ordered green curry to-go for lunch, and they didn't even bother showing me the lunch menu (which I've noticed they rarely do). So I order the green curry with a side of brown rice and the total came to $17. They obviously default to the dinner price if you don't ask specifically for lunch. Since I had already ordered I sucked it up and decided to go ahead and get the dinner version, assuming it would last me for 2 meals. Then I get back to work and see that the contents of my green curry are almost ENTIRELY eggplant and tofu. No broccoli, no carrots, no green beans WHATSOEVER. If I had wanted an eggplant dish I would have ordered one. To top it off the sauce itself was extremely bland and watered down. There are much better options for Thai in their neighborhood, namely Sriracha Thai. I'll be going there exclusively for Thai until Marnee gets it's act together.
author: Rachel D.

description: My boyfriend and myself  were looking for a good solid meal. My sister had told me about this place, so we decided to give it a try. You will find authentic Thai cuisine here. They use strong spices and flavoring in their food, which is absolutely fantastic. I tried the red curry and pad thai and they were both amazing. You'll be in for an explosion of Thai seasoning and flavors in your mouth. I'd say order a side of white rice because the dishes are extremely flavorful.
author: Nancy E.

description:
I really enjoy Thai food. My family and I eat eat here often and over the years the service has gone down. The busier they are the worse the service. 

Durning the weekend or Friday nights they are very busy. Expect to wait, but do not expect service. Their food as always is quite good and authentic. They have good flavors, average prices and portions, and always fulfill my Thai craving.

Parking in this area can be hard during peak times, but not impossible.
author: Herlina N.

description:
Located close to Golden Gate Park, this place looks so unassuming from the outside. As soon as you enter, you can see all the various awards they've won on the wall. And by golly, they deserve those awards. The service was great and the restaurant was fairly clean past the entrance. The service was quick.

I ordered their pad thai and it was one of the best pad thais I've ever had. It was so good I ordered one to bring home too.
author: Tabitha H.

description: The food is delicious here! It does get crowded so I recommend making a reservation. The fried roti & peanut sauce is amazing. So so delicious. It's on the "todays specials" and not under the appetizer section for some reason? We also got the homemade hot cakes and they were amazing!!! So yummy! The pad Thai was also so delicious!! The noodles are amazing and so is the sauce and everything! I definitely recommend it. I got mine vegetarian with no egg and was charged the same amount with egg... so that kinda sucked. And then I was charged $3 more to add tofu.. I feel like it should have been substituted for the same price. I also hate when you add something and are charged more, but you only get like one piece lol this wasn't the case! They were pretty generous with the tofu so that was nice. I definitely recommend this place! For sure get the roti & peanut sauce, homemade hotcakes, and pad Thai! All to die for!!!
author: Kim P.

description: OK food. RACIST staff. I came to pick up my food I ordered on Caviar and the guy was gave me a hard time asking me for the email and ID. While that's happening a white girl walks in and says I'm picking up for Maggie and he instantly gives her the order and she leaves. I pressed him about why he gave it to her no questions asked, and why I needed to show the email, and he couldn't give me a good answer. I am presuming it's because I'm black.
author: Abdul K.

description:
