I was craving some comforting curry. Seeing that Marnee Thai on 9th is now on Eat24, I decided to order delivery for dinner last Friday, December 11th. I placed my order around 7pm and it arrived a little after 8pm.

15. Green papaya salad (som tum): shredded green papaya with dried shrimp, green beans, tomatoes in spicy lime dressing, no peanut ($9.50)
18. Tom yum: spicy and sour soup with mushroom, tomato, lemongrass and a touch of lime juice ($8.95)
25. Kang keaw (green curry): spicy green curry with coconut milk, long purple eggplant and thai basil ($10.95), add Brown rice
27. Pad kaprow: chopped chicken sauteed with fresh chili, garlic, bell pepper and thai basil ($10.95)
46. Pad thai: fried rice stick noodles with prawns, bean curd, egg, bean sprouts, no ground peanuts ($10.50)

I've actually had all these dishes at the other location. Their tom yum here was much better as it didn't have what seemed like coconut milk in it. And was a nice balance of savory, spicy, sour, sweet, etc. I liked this one much better. The papaya salad, chicken and pad thai were as good as I remember. And they made them all extra spicy, which I adored. The only disappointing thing was the curry. It was super running. Not the thick creamy curry consistency I love. It was almost like having a rich soup.

With my old go to Thai place lacking in consistency, I'm glad I can order delivery from Marnee Thai.
author: Elena N.

description:
Well worth the hype and the Michelin Star. Only ordered take out, and was thoroughly impressed by the quality of each dish. I recommend the golden triangles and pumpkin curry. 

Our order was accidentally picked up by the wrong person, and once Marnee Thai realized this, they prioritized remaking our entire order immediately. It only took 10 min longer, which wasn't a problem at all.
author: Jen C.

description: This place has the best pad Thai ever!  Their noodle selection is super delicious! Red curry not so much
author: Gaganpreet S.

description: It's pretty good! That angel wing sauce I could probably just eat with rice and be content. I think we had larb, pad khee mao, angel wings, green curry and some other things. They were all pretty good! The larb tasted very healthy which I like. All of the foods were good. We had reservations at 7 on a Tuesday and were seated within 10 minutes. This place is super poppin on a Tuesday! Highly recommend reservations. The only down side is that it's stuffy in there...
author: Kylie L.

description:
After eating our take-out order from San Tung and finding ourselves still a bit hungry, my friends and I decided to walk over to Marnee Thai. The reviews looked promising and even though they were preparing to close for the night, the servers still welcomed us in. 

The restaurant is fairly big, but more narrow than wide. There's a slight tinge to the lighting, making everything seem more subdued and quiet. 

With the six of us having slightly full stomachs but room to still eat, we all ordered smaller dishes and shared items amongst the rest of us. I'm not the biggest Thai food fan and don't particularly care for any specific dish, so I just ordered a simple spring roll dish. I don't have any complaints about the dish - it was simple and what I expected. There were six spring rolls stuffed with cucumber, lettuce, carrots, etc. and came with a side of peanut sauce. I wouldn't say the dish was memorable, but it was good for the price. 

Their Pad Thai dish was also quite tasty. This dish was a lot better than my simple spring roll dish - the flavors were on point, there were lots of ingredients in the dish itself, and it looked good. I'd probably order this dish again. My other friends tried the curry and Pad See Ew, and both dishes were highly praised by them. Good flavor and a good number of ingredients in each one. 

Overall I would say a pretty solid Thai food experience. I liked the food here, but since I rarely get a Thai food craving, I probably wouldn't be back. But from what I tasted and the service we received, I have to give this place four stars.
author: Tiffany C.

description: There was a gratuity that was included that the waitresses did not tell us about. It was complete bs because the waitress charged more than what we wanted. It made the experience entirely unpleasant
author: Kevin P.

description: Service was fast and friendly, the food was really flavorful and fresh. Got the pad thai and green curry and it was really good. Definitely a good place to go if you're craving pad thai while you're in Golden Gate Park. It's pretty close if you're around the Academy of Sciences.
author: Angie C.

description: I love Thai food and Marnee doesn't disappoint! Reasonably priced as well. Love all the orchids in the space too. One of my favorite inner sunset Thai spots for sure.
author: Kelsey D.

description:
Authentic delicious Thai food! I've been to both locations and this one is my favorite. 

We were sincerely greeted upon entering and seated right away even at 9pm on a Friday night. Someone had just left. The restaurant was packed the next hour. Very friendly service. 

We tried the taro coconut hot cakes which were amazing. The taro and coconut flavors complement each other perfectly. The waiter told us that this dish is traditionally served at breakfast in Thailand and street vendors would sell it in front of schools. 

The pad see ew with chicken was great! Eggy and full of flavor. You can tell that the wok was well seasoned. 

Green curry with soft tofu. This dish was good and also flavorful. It was a bit watery and wasn't as thick as other places. 

#35 eggplant basil with prawns. This was my favorite dish tonight. Generous amount of shrimp.  -i think I counted at least 7 or 8! The eggplant was perfectly cooked and bursting with goodness. 

I'm not sure if they take reservations as I could not get through to them on the phone to even ask. It was that busy with togo orders lined up at the front. 

Definitely my go-to place for Thai if I'm ever in the city. See my posted pictures of the food for a visual.
author: Tim Y.

description:
Go here only if you are not in a rush, because - 
1. you won't get seated right away since it is likely to be running busy (for the right reason) 
2. it probably won't be justice to the food if you eat it in a rush and don't savour it :-) 

We ordered the vegetarian red curry (tofu + veggies), Pad kee mao (veggie) and homemade coconut pancakes (highly recommended!). All three of them were delicious, Pad Kee Mao was one of the best I have tasted (and I often order this at Thai restaurants)

Will go there again in the future.
author: Shikhar V.

description: I got the tofu hot basil to go - it was pretty bland. It was disappointing and I would not recommend the trying the hot basil here.
author: Aishani P.

description:
The food here looks and tastes so good that I automatically start going for it and forget to take photos beforehand. 

I went here twice in a week and basically ordered the same thing. Together, we got the Tea Leaf Salad (either $12.50 or $13.50), Tom Yum ($10.95), Chicken Pad Thai ($11.95), Pumpkin Curry ($11.50), and Tom Kha Pak Soup ($11.50). 

Tea Leaf Salad: I started loving tea leaf salad ever since I went to a Burmese restaurant, so I was quite excited to see this dish in a Thai restaurant. Though I wish the salad leaves were chopped a little smaller and that there were more ingredients, I was pretty satisfied with this dish. It was very flavorful!

Tom Yum: So, so spicy!! The server was very nice and split the soup into separate bowls for us though. If you're into spicy food, you might enjoy this dish. If not, don't bother. 

Chicken Pad Thai: Not bad. We originally ordered the shrimp pad thai, but I think the server mixed up our order. This could be a good take-out item!

Pumpkin Curry: So good!! Definitely recommend. It was so good I got it the second time around. I enjoyed that it was packed with vegetables. It doesn't come with rice, so you'll have to order it separately. 

Tom Kha Pak Soup: I enjoyed this one as well. It definitely wasn't as spicy as the Tom Yum soup (my taste buds still survived to taste it!). The brown rice we got for the curry paired well with this soup too. 

The ambiance of the restaurant is clean, relaxing, and comfortable. The decor is nice and the servers are very friendly and well dressed. There might be a wait depending on what time you come, but it's worth it!!
author: Kris C.

description: Good Thai food. We had pad thai, pad siew, chili chicken wings, & Thai iced tea. All of them are delicious. My only complaint is the service sucks. We waited for our food for like 15 minutes. The server didn't bother check on us while we were eating. When we asked for our check, it took more than 10 minutes. It was lunch time and the restaurant is almost full. But still, good Thai hospitality is lacking in this restaurant. We may go back but not soon.
author: Jonjon M.

description: Some of the best Thai food I have ever had. The service was great and the owner was so friendly. She and her husband, the amazing chef, came and talked with us and made sure everything was perfect. I will definitely be back every chance I get.
author: Cobbler S.

description:
We ordered the banana blossom salad, hor mok (fish custard), and chan pad poo (pad Thai with crab instead of shrimp). The chan pad poo was out of this world. The noodle was perfectly cooked, the sauce was delicious. We requested our dishes to be extra spicy (Thai-level spicy) but everything came out quite mild. The banana blossom salad and the hor mok were just okay. The hor mok tasted kind of like a blander fish curry and the banana blossom salad did not taste very special (I imagined there to be more banana blossom). However, the Chan pad poo was so good we will definitely come back. 
We went here at 2:00 pm on Saturday so there was no line. The restaurant is quite small inside so I can imagine that it would get quite crowded during peak times.
author: Catherine T.

description:
We have come here for many years and always enjoyed it very much. The food is consistently delicious and we always order a little extra for leftovers. The staff has always been prompt, friendly, and accurate. 

This evening was different, only regarding the server, who made a mistake in our order (shoving a menu at my wife and asking her to verify what she actually ordered), didn't ask if we were through or wanted desert, but just brought the bill, and was overall quite frosty.

Other than the experience with the server, meal was excellent and we will return.
author: Robert W.

description: Excellent Thai cuisine and very helpful staff Always busy but the staff are efficient at getting you seated and ordered & fed !!
author: Joni D.

description:
How does this place have such a high rating? My experience and food here was below average. I came here on a Sunday for a late lunch and there weren't very customers in the restaurant. There also aren't very many seats in the restaurant to begin with so the restaurant felt cozy. 

Tom Ka soup w/ chicken: (2/5) Very underwhelming with mostly just mushroom and dry chicken. Best part about this soup was the broth. 

Pad Thai w/ chicken: (3/5) Best dish we had but it just tasted like take-out pad thai. The noodles were a little dry and it wasn't that flavorful. 

Panang Beef curry w/ side of rice: (0/5) This is nothing like the Panang Beef curry at other Thai restaurants! Perhaps this is what traditional Panang beef curry is supposed to be like, but at least they should indicate this on the menu. The dish was chunks of beef covered with some sort of strange sauce and some steamed broccoli on the side. The beef tasted very gamey, which was gross. 

Thai coffee: (3/5) Good but I would prefer it with more coffee. 

Service: Took us forever to get any of the worker's attention because they were all busy socializing or eating. 

I really don't understand why people would wait to eat here, when you can get better food at a Thai take-out restaurant.
author: Melanie H.

description: Authentic Thai food. Everything was very delicious. Tofu Pad See Yew was just right not overpowered with soy sauce. Curry were very taste. Definitely will go back!
author: Sabina A.

description: Great Thai food spot over in Inner Sunset. Their minced pork lettuce wraps were good and super spicy (minced with chili peppers). Their papaya salad was fresh and light. We split the Chan Pad Poo, crab mixed with rice noodles that has become one of our common orders.
author: Ben M.

description: Very solid solid solid Thai food. I love the ambiance here and friendly staff. Everything we ordered was good. I forgot the names. I guess it doesn't matter. If it's good it's good!
author: michael c.

description:
Good, authentic Thai. Pan noodles were good. Pad Kaprow has a LOT of meat, and very few veggies- wish it had more baggies. The spice of the dishes is excellent. 

Service was good.
author: Albina O.

description: Friendly and relaxed service, and apparently popular and a little different - sometimes it's hard to distinguish yourself amongst the many excellent Thai restaurants in SF. I had a boiled snapper in curry dish that is apparently only available at the weekends and was delicious, my companions had more traditional pad thai and tea leaf salad but enjoyed them both, and they were easily able to accommodate someone with a gluten allergy. Fairly standard decor (and beer) but very pleasant and not at all noisy.
author: Steve B.

description:
I have always preferred the food at the Marnees on Irving St but this one is closer. Over the years we have been here several times and the taste of the food was hit or miss.  We arrived early enough that there were tables for 2 easily.  Maybe I should have asked if the Daddy chef was cooking tonight but it was the son in the kitchen. 
For the $50 we spent for dinner, I could've tried a few more places up the block. 

Our Tom Yum soup with prawns and a few slices of tomatoes and mushroom$10 was too sour/tart. Really spicy too. It was hard to consume and Hubby didn't like it.  
The 1st time I ever tasted this soup was at the Irving place and it was so good and the flavors were well balanced, but not here. I didn't like it either. At no point did the wait staff check to see if we liked the food. The chicken with onions, bell peppers off the Chef's Special list was OK but we both agreed we wouldn't order again. I told Hubby to get a curry dish instead and as a teaching moment, the wife was right again. 

The chicken Pad Thai was not as good as at Irving St.  The noodles were over cooked, soggy like over done spaghetti, not enough peanuts on top and normally when the bean sprouts are on the side to allow you to mix into the dish or on top, we were surprised to find it buried under the noodles.  Over all the main courses tasted as if they had too much sugar. 

Hubby's Thai iced coffee and the mango sticky rice dessert were the best items of the evening. The coffee tastes great in a milkshake type glass. It took awhile for the dessert to arrive.  A small mound of warm sticky rice drizzled with sweet condensed milk and served with slices of mango was not only visually pretty, but tasted great. If we had room, we would've each had our own and not shared. 

If you want Marnee, either wait for the Daddy chef to cook that evening or head to the Irving Street one. Thai iced coffee and mango sticky rice are excellent. We were not happy with the soup and entrees.
author: Ry T.

description: Amazing food!! My wife and I are vegetarian and we loved  the food as well. We tried the Vegetarian Green Curry and Pad Thai. The Green curry was very flavorful and did not have too much coconut milk which was good . I'll go with 4 stars since the only issue was the weird fish smell from the nearby fish market.
author: Ajay I.

description: Amazing food, service and environment. The Curry's are the best in SF! I love this restaurant!!
author: Hannah C.

description:
These are the reviews of Leo I. My continuing mission -- to eat at every Thai food restaurant within the city limits of San Francisco...

Marnee is a nice little spot just on the outskirts of Golden Gate park in the Sunset district. It's probably one of my favorite Thai spots in the city, but it's a bit of a hike for me to get here. Service was quick and respectful. Even the traditional wai (sign of respect) was given.. color me impressed! The food was delicious - prepared just the way I like it which I'm finding somewhat difficult for other Thai spots in the city to nail down completely. 

If you're in the area, give this spot a shot!
author: Leo I.

description: One of my favorite Thai spots in the city! I'm a pretty tough critic when it comes to Thai food and all the noodle and curry dishes I have tried so far are so flavorful and delicious!! Highly recommend this spot if you're looking for some authentic Thai meals that are reasonably priced.
author: Micaela R.

description: Loved it!! I had the Pad Thai with chicken and medium spicy and it was spectacular! The kitchen is clean and quickly cook orders and I appreciate that kind of service! Portions are large and satisfying. Service was OK and can improve. Overall, Thai food here is tasty, yummy and deliciousoooo! Keep in mind this location is smaller than the other :)
author: Noor S.

description:
World Class Thai. "Marnee Thai" is another reason Thai Town Hollywood and San Francisco are the capitals of Thai food in this country. You don't come here to order Pad Thai. The menu is too excitingly diverse for that. Since 1986, this family owned restaurant has served up exotic mouthwatering dishes that you can't necessarily get anywhere else.

Must starters include HOR MOK (steamed snapper in cabbage bites) and MORNING GLORY SALAD (crispy green bites).

For sweet taste noodles, the COCONUT STIR-FRIED RICE NOODLES WITH PORK BELLY, the whole thing is a fantasia of flavor. 
 
Peanut curry lovers will get their fix with the PAD PRARAM, it without fail delivers a strong emphasis on crushed peanut curry.

For something usual there are two: BANANA CURRY with perfectly sliced plaintain bananas soaked in curry sauce, or more importantly, the BASA FILET SPECIAL which is a souffle/pureed fish wrapped in banana leaf that's velvet in your mouth.

Do get yourself a spicy pork dish and curry shrimp dish on the side as well. Remember, you come here to share plates. The ideal is to come with four people and try everything around you family style. Order everything spicy, but have white rice and Kirin Light beer or Singha to cool the tongue down.

Last, most times after gorging you can forget the dessert but not this time. ROTI WITH ICE CREAM is like a crispy pancake with a perfect coconut scoop. This time, be rude with your mates -- get the first and last bites. MANGO WITH STICKY RICE is also top-notch. 

"Marnee" has an enormous reputation, and it is earned. This isn't my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco when it comes down to personal tastes. I'm still captivated by "Lers Ros Thai," due to the fact they have a few dreamy dishes nobody else has, I'm simply hooked by them. But this is a must stop destination for Central and Northeast Thai made by a staff who are in touch with their deep family roots. #classiceats
author: Sean C.

description: Everything that we ordered was DE-LI-CIOUS! Service was very nice. It feels nice to be having dinner at a very friendly atmosphere. We'll definitely be back here on our next trip to San Francisco.
author: DaNe S.

description:
The food is good. More Americanized then authentic. Ordered the beef pad see ew and they replaced the original greens (Chinese broccoli?) with regular broccoli. The beef and string beans at other places would come w the long green beans but here it comes w the kind you'd find at the asian market and had a lower grade cut of beef (more chewy than soft).

Dessert was delicious!!!! 
Service was alright. She took my order and disappeared till the food was ready.
author: Liz N.

description: I had heard a lot about Marnee Thai but ended up being a bit disappointed. I'm obsessed with pumpkin chicken curry and it was probably one of the worst ones I've had in the city so I really don't recommend anyone getting it here. We did try the Pad See-Ew and really loved it. Their Thai iced tea was also really good. The server was a bit pushy as a lot of people were waiting. Come here but don't get the pumpkin chicken curry.
author: Mira B.

description:
Went last night with two of my friends.
We waited and waited at the table until we had to call someone to take the order from us.
Almost every waiter was impatient to us, barley staying at the table to even listen to what we asked for.
We had to ask for cups and water twice before we got them and for new plates after the starters.
I ordered iced Thai coffee that was so sweet like it was made out of only sugar, I could not drink it and has to return it.
The food was ok, at least we thought so until we got up we a stomach ache this morning.
So disappointed and did not except this from a place with so much experience that my friend and  I even enjoyed in the past :(
author: Moshe A.

description: My favorite Thai place in the city! Not just for the amazingly delicious food, but because the owner is awesome! She's loud, friendly but demanding all at the same time... but somehow it becomes entertaining and accepted. Not to be missed are the corn cakes and the angel wings. Curry is delicious but over the years, the Panang beef has been on the decline. I probably won't order that again. But honestly anything and everything on the menu is awesome. Even the dessert is delicious! This is probably the best Thai restaurant in the city!
author: Anna V.

description:
It was a very cold and rainy day visiting Marnee Thai with my party of 8. The wait area was limited to only 4 chairs at the time and it was near the front door. being an asian restaurant there was no host to greet you at the front.

       The food was not anything that stood apart from your average thai cuisine and service is not as prompt as i had wanted it to be. The one thing i liked is how they had an extended room in the back to accommod-ate for larger parties. 

       The servers are here just to serve the food and not to connect with guests and I feel it is a shame because this would improve the overall experience for most guests and keep us coming for years to come. If I were to recommend a place for good thai food and ample friendly service I would not recommend this place.
author: Bernard W.

description:
Located in the Sunset, Marnee Thai is a quaint little place that is very cozy and homey. Its decor is very Thai and has lots of cultural elements that make the place seem very authentic. When you walk in, you immediately smell the strong Thai herbs & spices that they use for their curries and dishes. 

Overall, I would say their food is quite good for a casual dinner with friends. Having been to Thailand multiple times now, I am very particular about Thai cuisine - and Marnee Thai is decently authentic (better than most Thai places in the city, but not super comparable to those in Thailand). 

Pros:
-loved the decor, dim lighting, and overall ambience 
-personally had great & super fast service
-diverse and delicious curry selection

Recommended Dishes:
-Spicy Angel Wings ($8.50) - highly recommend this appetizer. it's chicken wings in this special chili garlic sauce. Not very spicy, but has just the right kick to whet your appetite 
-Red Curry with Duck ($13.50) - the curry was extremely flavorful and goes well with separate noodle dishes! the duck was also made extremely well, and make for a very great entree. 

Cons: 
-slightly overpriced
-the noodle dishes are a little bland; i had to request extra sauce to spice up the dish
-might get packed on the weekends (limited seating)
-rice does not come with the curry and costs extra..which I find weird because most thai places give you a rice with a curry entree

Overall: decent food; a little more expensive; less oily than other Thai places in the city; great atmosphere!
author: Winnie L.

description:
I absolutely hate giving Marnee Thai a bad review because I think it's delicious and used to eat here frequently, but I had an allergic reaction last time and hope my review can spare others with allergies. (Side note: If you don't have allergies, their noodle dishes are second to none! Curry sucks, though.)

I've been eating Thai food all my life with a nut allergy with no issue because I am super careful. Generally speaking, restaurants will let you know if they can confidently prepare your dish without cross-contamination. If they can't, I don't eat there. No harm, no foul. BUT, when Marnee Thai insists they can accommodate my allergy and instead I end up with anaphylaxis, that's just not okay.

I don't doubt at one point this restaurant was careful with cross-contamination. Literally their website says: "And if you've got special dietary needs, food allergies, or plain old taste preferences, just let our servers know. We're happy to accommodate." I myself ate here for a few years with no problems, but they have obviously let their policies slide recently.  If you have life threatening allergies stay far, far away. I also would imagine they aren't *that* careful about vegetarian/vegan requests either, so proceed with caution here.
author: Amanda B.

description:
On a raining Saturday afternoon, my roommate and I were looking for some warm and delicious food, thus Thai food came into our minds, and found this solid 4-star rating joint. Despite the 30-min parking hunt (yes, it's on Irving), I must say their food is pretty good!

Came here at around 12:30pm. It was just about 70% full. Inside the restaurant it looks like a hut which is pretty unique. Staff was nice and attentive.

Angel Wings: A-.
I really liked the sauce. Not too spicy but strong sweet-n-sour + chili flavor. The wings were slightly fried which added a sense of crispiness to it.

Summer Roll: A-.
Honestly, I don't know what's the difference between summer roll and regular thai/vietnamese rolls, but they were pretty bomb. All ingredients was fresh and the rolls were tightly wrapped.

Green Curry with Beef: A-.
The curry smelled very good. It did not have a strong flavor, but I guess it was the eggplant which intrinsically enhanced the taste of the curry sauce. Beef was tender as well.

Mango Fried Rice with Shrimp: B+.
Nothing too special about this dish. I picked this just because I really like pineapple fried rice and wanted to see how it would go with mango. Because of the mango's tropical flavor it definitely increased my appetite.

Chan Pad Poo (Pad Thai with Dungeness Crab): A-.
Ordered this dish based on fellow Yelpers reviews. Pretty good! Pad thai was nothing special, but crab meat amount was generous and tasted very fresh.

Overall, I had a pleasant experience. All the dishes were good, would definitely come back again.
author: Simon C.

description:
Get the spicy angel wings, green curry, and mango fried rice (with shrimp) when you get here! But all of the menu will make you want more.

Came here with my family for dinner after searching around for suggestions and was really impressed with the quality. The mango fried rice was light, yet flavorful with mango. Along with the green curry with beef and eggplant, you can't go wrong with the selection.

The line was about 15-20 minutes to be seated which wasn't bad for a Saturday night. I would definitely recommend going to the Irving street location if you're looking for a more parking-friendly location.
author: Nick C.

description: Awesome Thai maybe my favorite restaurant around inner sunset. Ordered vegetarian pad Thai and ginger pad plus veggies and summer roll amaze
author: Jesse M.

description:
My friend told me this was a "Michelin starred" restaurant! It is actually just Michelin recommended. Don't really know the difference, but I'm glad I went! 

I had the Pad Thai vegetarian. Definitely one of the top 5 Pad Thais I've had! I chose it off a special vegetarian menu section which definitely made my life a lot easier! The food had a good amount of spice and would have been filling enough if I hadn't just gone on a 7 mile hike! 

Would come again if I was near golden gate park, but wouldn't make a special trip up to SF for it!
author: Nishad J.

description: Just got back from dinner here... Tuesday at around 8 o'clock. We were one of two other groups in the joint and our food was served suuuuper quickly after we ordered. Food was absolutely to DIE FOR!!!  I got the Pad Se-ew Vegetarian style and it was amazing. Also tried my friends Red and Green curries which were also delicious. Service was really good and quick too! LOVE this restaurant; I will definitely back. Major stars for this place!!
author: Liz B.

description: Marnee Thai offers the best thai food overall in the Bay Area. My favorite go-to dishes are the spicy angel wings, thai style potstickers, tom kha soup, green (and sometimes yellow) curry, basil chicken, and my favorite basa fillet with garlic and black pepper sauce. I think the food tastes better at the 9th Ave location than the sister Irving location.
author: C L.

description: Best Thai restaurant that I tried in the City. My favorite dish Duck curry is the best.
author: Helen Y.

description:
Marnee Thai hits the mark every.single.time! We have a usual order that consists of Pad See Ew with pork, Pad Kaprow with minced Chicken and Imperial Rolls. This time we added a menu special "Chicken Satay lettuce wraps" in to the mix. Damn! All those tasty accoutrement made for a killer lettuce wrap. Peanut sauce, vermicelli noodles, coconut, pickled cucumber and onions. It was just awesome!

Our entrees are exactly as you would hope they'd be. Flavorful, cooked perfectly and not swimming in unnecessary sauce. 

Little pro tip for ya, they're corkage fee is only $12!!! Bring your own wine, save some money and dive in!
author: Lindsay D.

description:
I had the spicy angel wings, sub deep-fried tofu, and let me tell you, mama LIKE. 

Fried tofu, dressed in their signature garlic-chili sauce, topped off with crispy basil. My. Mouth. Will. Never. Recover. All kinds of spicy righteousness. Best Thai dish I've ever had. My husband also had the wings, chicken, and was uh-mazed. We are hooked, and are only door dashin ' Thai from this joint from now on. 

Oh yeah, had to call in to clarify our order, and the nicest gentleman answered, fixed our order quickly, and then BAM, perfection knocked at our door soon after.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
To be fair, I think food here are decent. Tried the Spicy Pad Thai, egg plant, special banana curry with duck, all very good. Mango coconut rice is not bad either (although I think it's a bit pricy for the portion). Not a huge fan for the chicken wing and the stir fried pork belly can be more tender.  

The service though, was not pleasant last time. Our waiter with a long pony tail is very nice, but the waitress is kind of rude. She's not patient at all when we have food questions, and doesn't allow us to split the bill for a huge group (However the waiter said we can split 4 ways). I might still come back because it is in my neighborhood. But I do think there's room for improvement on the service.
author: Sophia H.

description:
We came here on a Sunday night. We got seated really fast and ordered food very quickly too. However, it took around 30mins for us to get our food. The table next to us ordered after us but got their main dishes way faster than us and they were a group of 6 people..

I got the pad see ew for 10.25 and it was NOT that good! It tasted really blend so I had to add on lots of chili powder.. The noodles tasted very dry and the broccoli was half cooked! I felt like I could even make pad see ew better than this! It was definitely not worth the $10.25. I would not recommend that at all! 

My friends got the pad Thai and pad kee Mao. They said that it was only alright. They got spicy for both but it wasn't spicy at all.. The meat were also over cooked. 

Overall experience a 2.5 to 3 stars..
author: Anna X.

description:
I tried out Marnee Thai for a late lunch after visiting the DeYoung Museum, it's just ok.  I got a seating pretty fast for a Holiday and solo.

I got Chan Pad Poo - crab pad thai $9.95 - prices are a little bit cheaper at lunch, huge amount of food.  I took some home so I wouldn't get food coma.  Tasted just ok, nothing special.

Thai iced tea $2.5 - average.

Before tip was $13.54.  Charged it.
author: Ann L.

description: Went to both restaurants in Irving and they're both really good.  Had the chan pad poo which was a pad Thai , with like crabs bits and a duck fried rice . Both were really good
author: Nathan W.

description:
One of the best, if not the best, Thai place I've been to in SF.

Got the Spicy Angel Wings for an appetizer. So good, crispy and flavorful with plenty of meat on the wings.

Also got the Pad Thai with prawns and the Pad See Ew with beef For entrees. Both were excellent. Generous portions and both were for sure a cut above the often bland and meat-lacking versions of these dishes that I've gotten at several other Thai places around SF.

I do wish I'd gotten the noodle dishes a level or two spicier though. 

I was wary about ordering extra spicy because at some places they overdo it and it tastes like they cooked your noodles in bear mace and it drowns out the other flavors. I got one above medium level for both noodle dishes here and could barely taste any spiciness. 

All in all, I'll definitely keep this place in mind if I feel like Thai again though.
author: Graham H.

description: Portions are pretty large and the dishes came out really well. My partner and I shared the pad thai and pad see ew and both dishes were pretty good!
author: Alex G.

description: We stopped here after a walk in Golden Gate Park. The service was very friendly and the food was good. We had chicken satay and pad thai.  I wish they had more curry items on the menu (curry pad Thai, peanut curry, etc), but the food was very good - fresh ingredients and hot!
author: Kristen P.

description: We ordered four dishes, and the two that we ordered from the daily menu were AMAZING.  One was only limited to weekends: fish with curry mousse and cabbage.  WOW!  The other, a silver noodle dish full of flavor and originality.  Have eaten at many Thai restaurants, but these dishes were original and extremely tasty.  10 stars!
author: candide o.

description: Just ok.... nice restaurant and waiters, food is very mediocre. We ordered the most classic Thai dishes and it just wasn't great.
author: Erica K.

description: My roommate and I ordered Marnee Thai off of Postmates tonight. I ordered the Thai Fried Rice and she ordered the Pad See Ew. Both were very flavorless and the chicken was dry. I asked for my dish to be made Medium Spicy, which is a common request, and it has no spice added. We were a little disappointed since we read all the good reviews :/
author: Niyatha K.

description: Their tea leave salad was and fish cake appetizers were just great!   we were lucky to get a table for 4 and service was good.   Waiter took time to recommend some of their special menus.  Minced basil spicy chicken was done right and very tasty.   Prawn in red curry was delightful.  it was our first time to tried braised pork belly with basil, garlic and chili and then it came with some type of special Thai chili.  Wow, very satisfying and definitely a top Thai restaurant choice in SF.
author: Tkd K.

description: We called to reserve at 6:30 and when we came in our table was ready. The service was good and fast. We ordered three dishes, all of which were amazing. The pad thai was so delicious! The environment was nice, clean, and welcoming.  Yay, yum!
author: Steph L.

description:
I wasn't really impressed with this place. Came here on a Tuesday for lunch and it was super busy. Given the top reviews I had seen, I expected excellent Thai food. My friend and I both got lunch specials. The lunch specials are just lower priced, smaller plates of food. They do not come with anything like soup or salad. I ordered beef Pad See Ew. The noodles were cooked nicely and the flavor was good, however, the beef was awful. It was over cooked, yet chewy, with absolutely no flavor. My friend was allergic to gluten so she normally gets yellow or red curry. However, the waitress said the curries contained soy sauce already mixed in and that since they make the curry at the start of the day they can't make it without. Alternatively, she ordered Pad Thai but asked for no peanuts due to another allergy. The waitress brought out her pad thai about 10 minutes later with peanuts on it. I'm not sure how she forgot so fast. However, when we complained she immediately took it back and brought us a steaming fresh plate about 10 minutes later signifying that they actually made her a new dish which we appreciated. Overall, the food was okay, but I don't have any desire to go back.

OH ALSO, they have a $15 minimum for credit cards and a $10 minimum for any purchase in general. Meaning that if you were to come in to get a thai iced tea you couldn't unless your bill was at least $10. Kinda a strange rule, but none of their entrees are under $10 anyways.
author: Tanita J.

description:
Arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 4 pm, and even though Marnee Thai was pretty empty the traffic around the Inner Sunset district sure wasn't.  Somewhat plain exterior but vibrant interior decorations with Thai cultural motifs.  On entering you can catch a glimpse of the cooks working, and tables stretching out into the back area.  

My family and I ordered two appetizers and four entrees.  The spring roll was average and expensive; each little portion basically cost a dollar.  We had their famous chicken wings, and they were tasty in a sweet and spicy way but I also felt that they were a very American thing to have.
As for the entrees, my mom was a big fan of her Pad Se - Ew, the large flat noodles with a spicy flavor.  My brother was a fan of his chicken curry.  My dad felt ambivalent about his sea bass special; I tried it and it was not very flavorful.  As for my pad thai, I felt kInd of disappointed: the sauce tasted like a mixture of peanut butter and ketchup, a flavor I loved when I was a kid but not so much anymore.  The entire meal ended up costing about $80.

For me, Marnee Thai is still a one time thing, and I would not come back again.  But for my first foray into Thai food, the restaurant has great decor, the service was good, and overall it was a very interesting experience.
author: Emily Y.

description: The best Thai food. Not greasy and solid portion sizes. My new favorite Thai place to go in the city
author: K I.

description: Great prices, great food. Dry erase board at the front door, I entered with suspicion. Service was friendly and fast and food was awesome!  Summer rolls, Pad Thai and more ...
author: Rick A.

description: Fantastic Thai food! The noodle dishes are stellar (pad kee mao is my favorite by far) and the curries are great too. Definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Roz M.

description: Love this place, if you like spicy be sure to get their papaya salad. So GOOD!
author: K C.

description: The food is awesome. The Pad Thai is not dry. The prawns in a blanket are the best deep fried shrimp anything. And the vegetarian Thai fried rice is great when paired when spicy angel wings. While the wait can be painful especially in SF's cold weather, it is very rewarding and even better if you had reservations. Squished between a gym and a place selling gyros, Marnee Thai is not easily spotted. But, upon entering, there is almost never an empty seat that speaks to its stellar food.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Marnee Thai, with all its awards and accolades and rave reviews, had exceedingly high expectations in my book. 

So here I am, wandering in with a group of four, waiting in the extremely narrow waiting area (don't be deceived by the narrow restaurant--there's actually a pretty hefty amount of seating) reading the entire wall of awards and reviews on my right and watching the cooks in the kitchen to my left. Didn't have to wait too long to be seated, and almost instantaneously we ordered our food. 

Fresh rolls with peanut sauce - 4/5 one of my weaknesses; I order it at almost every opportunity and this one hit the spot. The peanut sauce had a tiny bit of kick with it and was very savory

Pad Kee Mao - 4/5 despite the description saying "spicy", make sure you explicitly specify to your server that you want it spicy. I bumped this up to a 4 as a return visit and second try with this dish was much improved; the first time, I neglected to specify and it ended up being a bit too bland for my taste

Chan Pad Poo - 4/5 think of it as pad Thai but with crab meat instead. This one was pretty flavorful and one of the better items I've had on the menu! That being said, I was disappointed that it was lacking in the assortment of veggies that come with the pad Thai 

It also doesn't hurt that the restaurant has some cheap bottles of wine you can order for the table. If you're not a sommelier, it'll do quite nicely (~$27 for a bottle? I'll take it), but don't expect quality. 

Overall, it's a good experience with some pretty yummy Thai food that hits the spot
author: Jay P.

description:
Love Marnee Thai. SF is a place where you'll find an abundance of all types of Asian food. Despite such a Thai cuisine competitive market, I feel like Marnee Thai has always been a strong contender. 

It's been around since I was a kid wandering the streets with my parents and still proves to be good to this day.

Solid choices:
Tom yum soup
Pad Thai (extra spicy )
Pad kee mow
Pad see ew 
Tea leaf salad 

I love their garlic and thai chilies on each of the tables. Really adds to any dish and is so delish!! 

The one thing to note is that it's a small place and it always fills up quickly so call ahead for rezzies. 

Love you Marnee Thai! Thank you for your wonderful flavors, ongoing consistency, and great service!
author: Lauren Y.

description: Great food. As of last night there were no working bathrooms so 4 stars. Please get those bathrooms fixed
author: kathy d.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening for a late dinner. I can't speak to the actual authenticity of anything, but I did like the decor of the place and the overall calm and quiet ambiance. Since it was late on a Sunday, we didn't expect them to be as busy as they were. Still, we were seated almost immediately.

I was craving wings for some reason, so this popped up as a suggestion. Spicy Angel Wings were delicious and definitely spicy enough for me. Satisfied my craving for sure! I would definitely order these again. And again. And again.

The other dishes we ordered were the Chicken (Larb) Salad, Kang Dang (Red Curry) with Beef, and Pad Woon Sen with Pork. The salad was delicious and very flavorful, without an overpowering fish sauce taste. I don't know what else they add to it, but it tasted better than at most places. Red Curry was pretty good, but a little watery in consistency, I think. Pad Woon Sen was also a good dish and a nice change from the usual Pad Thai/Pad See Ew that I order.

Something I don't usually comment on is food presentation - Marnee Thai hit the mark with their presentation. All the food looked beautiful and colorful.

From the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left, the staff were very friendly and nice. They were perfectly fine with accommodating my friend's food allergy. I felt bad for our waitress because I kept going through my water like crazy (I'll admit, I don't handle spice well). But this place was like the epitome of service with a smile!
author: Eryn H.

description:
We were lucky to have Marnee Thai close by for a quick dinner-- we were starving!  I wasn't expecting much, maybe some mediocre Thai food.  

To my surprise, everything we ordered here was delicious and authentic.  The Pad See Ew, Tom Yum Soup, Angel Wings, and Mango Sticky (black) rice are all dishes I would recommend.  

I freaking loove TOM YUM soup, and this one was spicy enough, sweet enough, tangy enough.. everything!  The PAD SEE EW here was pretty good-- I always order this with beef but they have chicken available.  The dish that stood out the most were the ANGEL WINGS!  Crispy fried wings, sauteed in a spicy garlic sauce-- this is topped with fried basil, which were actually pretty tasty.  The wings could have been a little spicier (but then again, I love spicy food), so all you wimps should try it! haha.  

For dessert, we had the MANGO STICKY RICE.  I've never seen this dish served with sweet black rice, so that was interesting.  Sweet rice grains tend to be sweeter, stickier, but also have a thicker outer shell.  Some of the rice tasted hard/dried, so I wish the sticky rice were made fresh.  On the other hand, the mango was sweet and ripe.
author: Stacey K.

description: So good! I tried the yellow curry and pad see yoo and the amazing seasonal mango salad w prongs everything was amazing, service was great as well
author: Patricia L.

description: The worst Thai food ever. The veggies and tofu looked old and not at all fresh. I don't understand the hype as it was way below average!
author: Meg T.

description:
There are soooo many Thai restaurants in SF, they all taste pretty good or at least decent (it's hard to fuck up Thai food cus they always taste so good), but Marnee Thai is the best! 

Must order the papaya salad!!! If you like spicy, ask for more spicy cus they can actually make it spicy! It's so good!!! Literally the best papaya salad ever!!Other things on the menu were mediocre. Their papaya salad alone deserves a 5 star rating, and don't forget the Pad Thai
author: Carmen G.

description:
My coworkers and I went to Marnee Thai for my birthday last Friday. I was so stoked because it's my first time coming here and I've been wanting to try this place out for some time now. I'm also a huge Thai cuisine fan. 

Service was very good. Our server was so involved, he totally helped us figure out how and what to order just to make sure the food was enough for our group of 9 people. 

The food was great!
Chan Pad Poo - amazing!
Pad See Ew - one of the best I've tried
Tom Ka - very tasty but the portion is quite small considering they said it's good for 2-3 persons
Panang Curry - good but not what I expected, I've had better Panang curry elsewhere
Corn cakes - this is an unexpected hit! Crunchy and chewy on the outside, super tasty and quite addicting
Paratha with Coconut ice cream - to die for! Hot and cold contrast makes it irresistible!

I give Marnee Thai 4.75 stars! The .25 I withheld is only because I had super high expectations for the panong curry... But overall was a great experience and I would totally come back for more good food from Marnee Thai!
author: Edzy C.

description: Go to, standby, delicious food, great price, kind of cozy. Get the softshell crab and mango salad.
author: Peter S.

description: This is a nice 3 star place, no split check, also they forgot to put pineapples in my rise... but in general its not bad for thai place
author: Valik D.

description:
Although I like their Irving St. location, I've never cared much for this particular Marnee Thai.  I ordered takeout from here a few times in high school and college and the food was so mediocre, I never had the urge to come back.  Of course, getting shut down last year for "numerous food safety and health code violations" didn't help much either...

Fast forward to my friend's birthday last month and I (reluctantly) found myself here for dinner ("Don't worry Mike, at least they *should* be cleaner now...right?").  Clearly not where I would have chosen, but at least there were a few silver linings: dinner with friends, getting to write a review, and a chance to order "The Poo".  

-- ANGEL WINGS - Deep Fried Chicken Wings Sautéed in a Chili Garlic Sauce with Crispy Basil...$7.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco-2?select=gdeX343-yYSVXbH1za3E-A#bRWSLRNybi3QlueSbS_b8A)
Their signature dish.  It didn't seem as amazing as I remember it to be (the sauce tasted a little different), but it was still pretty good.  The outside of the wings were crisped up nicely while the inside stayed moist.

-- GOLDEN TRIANGLES - Thai Samosas filled with Pumpkin, Potato, and Curry...$7.95
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco-2?select=gdeX343-yYSVXbH1za3E-A#M5onc_Rz-Mzs0CemGxaa-A)
Pretty "meh" to me.  They came out nice and golden, but I didn't find the flavors to be all that different from samosas you can get anywhere else.

-- STIR-FRIED STEWED PORK BELLY with Bamboo Shoots, Mushrooms, and Baby Corn in a Garlic Chili Sauce...$12.50
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco-2?select=gdeX343-yYSVXbH1za3E-A#OQ49TClJVzq1OQ1hqdlPKA)
My buddy and I wanted this and "The Poo", so we split both.  The pork was tender and the taste was great.  However, the portion was small and there was a lot of filler.  Unless my friend took all the meat...

-- CHAN PAD POO - Stir-fried Rice Noodles with Crab and Egg in a Spicy Chili Garlic Sauce...$10.75
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco-2?select=gdeX343-yYSVXbH1za3E-A#PvEpN3MNennE9W-gldOVxw)
aka "The Poo".  Amphawa's is still the best for me, but Marnee's is a close second.  It's more on the mild side, but it's better than being too spicy (like the one at House of Thai).  The kick is subtle and complements the crab and Chili Garlic Sauce well.

Despite the fact our meal went better than I had hoped/feared, I doubt I'll be looking to come back to this Marnee Thai.  Just knowing they had prior vermin issues is enough to keep me away (their other location MIGHT have the same problems, but I KNOW this one did and they were only closed for a day to clean everything).  Plus, parking is just easier over on Irving.
author: Mike L.

description: The service was really good & I liked that I can reserve a table online. But, of the 4 dishes we tried only 1 was really really good, the others were just ok. The drunken noodles were the best I've ever had though the other dishes weren't even close. The thing that made my review three stars is the bathroom... It needs some deep cleaning. It doesn't look like they spend much time cleaning it and it grossed me out when I used it...
author: Brandee G.

description:
Pro:
-Good portions of meals and decently priced
-Variety of vegetarian options 
-Have both brown and white rice 

Con:
-Not spacious
-Understaffed
author: Linda K.

description:
I had high hopes for this place but it came pretty close to disappointment. 
 
Service: terrible. The waitress didn't even ask my friend what he wanted to drink or eat. She kept ignoring him and forgot his order twice. Food came out exceptionally fast. 

Food: decent. Not as flavorful as I would have hoped and nothing really stayed on my tongue.

Glad I tried this place out but I probably won't be returning.
author: Raman D.

description: Pad kapow spicy with chopped chicken is AH-MAZING. I've probably ordered this dish dozens of times in the last 2 years and it never fails to disappoint. Unfortunately, because it's so good, I can't tell you how good other dishes are - if you're going to Marnee's order this and you're set
author: Noms U.

description:
This place was decent, and the food came out quick- though I will caveat that I came here on a Wed night an hour before closing time. We ordered the Tom kha soup which was really good, some ground beef dish that would have been even better if we got it a bit spicy, and also a Thai tea leaf salad, which tasted very similar to the bstar tea leaf salad except it has crispy broad beans.

Don't be scared by the pics of this place which make it look more formal and fancy than it is. It's a nice place but definitely a casual feel. I'd come back again for sure:)
author: Nancy W.

description: I can handle spicy food but damn the pad Thai tastes as if they accidentally spilled chili flakes into it and did not make a new one. I had ordered medium spicy and it is unbearably hot. Definitely not medium hot that's for sure. Will never order from here again. My mouth is on fire! I can't even eat it. Can't even feed it to the dog. What a waste of money.
author: Tom N.

description: Food was amazing. We ordered delivery and arrived right on time. The Papaya salad was incredible. Definitely have to try other dishes.
author: Carlos A.

description: The reviews are fantastic, the food wasn't great. The coconut cakes were fantastic but the chicken fried rice and pad thai were horrible. I'm so sad because the first course was so good!
author: M S.

description: Was disappointed in their Tom Kha Gai soup (2 separate visits) and their salty Pad Kee Mow. Tom Kha soup is my absolute favorite, but the last two times I ordered it here, it was too sour and not creamy enough. Their Pad Kee Mow is super salty, to the point where I couldn't even finish it. I'm hoping that I just got unlucky and that they cooked it badly on the days I went, because Marnee Thai on the other side of Sunset isn't like that. My review is based on only 2 visits, but I feel like restaurants should be consistent in their taste and quality. Also, the ambience isn't the best since it's really noisy and the tables are too close together. I'll probably go back in the future, but most likely won't order the dishes mentioned above.
author: Angela C.

description:
Marnee Thai oh Marnee Thai, wow just WOW. My friend kept telling me to go try this Thai place, but I kept making excuses for myself- it's so far from where I live (SSF), it's probably like any other Thai place around home, if I'm in outer sunset I definitely should try something more San Franciscan right? Man am I soooooooo wrong. 

THIS PLACE IS WORTH YOUR EXTRA MILES AND WORTH YOUR EXTRA EFFORT TO COME. The food is absolutely delicious.

Coconut Hotcakes for $8.75. This is on the special menu and is a seasonal appetizer. So, come during August because that's when I was able to remarkable dish. It is a coconutty jello like cake (it's like those Chinese coconut dessert jellos) with a slight crunch on the bottom topped with corn, pumpkin, scallion, and coconut cream. It's so coconutty that coconut lovers will go nuts because it's so absolutely amazing. Oh, and if you like spicy, use that condiment that they provide on the table for these cakes because the condiment definitely goes well with these hotcakes. 

Pad Thai was just enough sweet, salty, and sour with lots of meat and veggies. Noodles are nice and chewy.

Green Curry with chicken wasn't too spicy but was all spiced up. It also had a lot of veggies and meat in it. The curry was pretty coconutty and creamy. So goodddd. 

***** -1 STAR *****
So there was the three of us, and us teenagers really can't eat all that much. We kinda knew what we were capable of eating so we only ordered the curry with two bowls of white rice and the coconut hotcakes. The waitress looked at us and gave us a pretty rude look saying, "WHAT? That's it? There really isn't enough food for three people." We said that we'd order more if we felt hungry after we finish, but she had walked off to another waiter to say something that caused both of them to look at us with furrowed brows. Man, we felt so threatened to order another dish- pad thai. UGHHHHH we really didn't finish anything but the hot cakes. We ended up taking 3/4 of the Pad Thai home and leaving 1/4 of the curry behind. WE WASTED FOOD. Tip to waiter: Let customers be in charge of ordering their own food, they know what they're capable of and what if we just wanted a light bite because maybe we were going to eat somewhere else after??? Please don't make your future customers feel obligated to order more than they can eat. 

Just glad the food here was good. It's worth the bloated stomachs that we later encountered. Just come to Marnee Thai you won't regret it!!!
author: Wendy T.

description:
Came here again a couple of months ago and ordered a curry dish. It came with a medley of vegetables including eggplant. The eggplant was completely inedible. You know that taste you get when you cook with veggies that have been sitting in your fridge for way too long? That disgusting sour taste of expiration? That was what was in the eggplant and it of course ruined most of the curry and my overall experience here.

Also, they were shut down earlier this year because of a rat or cockroach infestation. Their health score is listed here in Yelp and it's not even 60/100. The eggplant incident occurred after they reopened so you would think their standards have improved (and maybe they have - at least I didn't have diarrhea like I did the very first time I came here), but given that there are tons of other Thai options nearby, I'm done with Marnee forever.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Excellent food! I especially loved the beef salad, garlic fish, crab with flat rice noodles and the dessert --  naan bread with condensed milk and Mitchell's coconut ice cream...
I've been there with only one other person and it wasn't as  good an experienced. Last night we were a party of 13, and we were able to taste so many dishes... Yum!
author: Cay A.

description:
What makes this place is the staff. Came in yesterday for lunch and it ended up being one of the staff's birthday. The entire restaurant sang happy birthday and they shared cake with all of the people dining in the restaurant. It was pretty adorable to be part of that. Felt like something a small family owned place would do. It was very sweet. Our server was wonderful as well. Very timely and took great care of us. Food is great as far as thai goes. 

All in all, this place is a little gem.
author: Hannah B.

description:
Best Thai food I've had since I moved to California! This place was definitely a neighborhood gem, small but felt very homey. We came at 8:30 pm on a Saturday night and was seated right away, probably because it was way past supper time.

We got the chicken red curry, basa fish fillet with ginger & pork sauce, pad thai, and papaya salad. These are usually the staple items I go for to evaluate a Thai restaurant's authenticity. The papaya salad came out first as an appetizer, but because I wanted to take a picture of all of the food, I made everyone wait for the rest of the food (#doitforthegram :P) The food took awhile to come out, but was hot nonetheless. Our waiter realized that the salad was untouched until the hot food items came out, and apologized saying that he assumed that we wanted the appetizers first, so they paced out the entree dishes til much later. That was nice of him to clarify. 

Foodwise, portion was a little on the smaller side, but the flavours were SPOT ON. Fish fillet was fried to a delicious crisp, and the pad thai was bursting with flavour. The chicken in the curry was nice and tender.

Can't wait to come back/Go to the other location to try out more stuff!
author: Ivy W.

description: We had the Thai ice tea, roti and house special coconut cupcakes. The latter was the most delicious thing ever. Then we had the cashew chicken and red curry both of which had very distinctive yet mouth watering taste. This place is definitely a must go! The only con, not exactly a con, is that they don't serve sticky rice or jasmine rice which we love!
author: Joyeta S.

description: One of the best places to get take out. They are super fast. Most orders are ready within 20 minutes. Prices are decent, not too expensive. I really like the papaya salad and green curry beef.
author: William B.

description:
A year later..

So I decided to go here for  lunch today . It was a hot summer day and they gave me water with no ice! Then I ordered the chicken Pad Thai and they seriously gave me like two pieces of chicken and a bunch of Tofu. I don't know , it doesn't taste authentic as I thought maybe my expectations are higher because I'm also Thai. The customer service could be better instead of rushing.
author: Mary S.

description: I came here due to the overall ratings here on Yelp. In summary this is one of the worst Thai restaurants I've been to. I will not return again based on the food alone. I've never had such greasy food before- probably a whole ladle to make a noodle dish (I got a terrible stomachache after eating here). And then to top it all off they just hide a bunch of romaine under the dishes (the pad kee mao for example) to make them look bigger.
author: Nona T.

description:
I have to come here whenever I'm in the area. Every dish I've had here was bangin'. You won't go wrong with whatever you choose. 

Thai iced tea though, always hits the spot. Must have
author: Ragel G.

description:
Everything about this place was sub-par. First, the inside isn't really what I expected from the pictures. The pictures shows a place with good ambience and some what clean, but it was not clean. The tables have bits of grime everywhere and the window sills were very dirty. As soon as you walk in, the smell of vinegar / stinky-tofu (like smell) hits you. At this point I really wanted to leave but didn't cause of the people I came with. Then we got waters that tasted like tap water with a hint of something fishy. Our hot water was served in a glass cup without handles... 
The food... pad thai definitely had ketchup. I'm not sure if that's how you're supposed to make it, but the ketchup smell was too over-powering. 
The pad see-ew was prob the best out of the three dishes we ordered. The beef in it however was terrible. Tasted like the vegan fake beef that don't have texture or taste. 
The fried rice was a standard fried rice. It was alright. It had cucumbers that are decorative and the people I was with told me some restaurants reuse them on other plates if the customers don't touch it. I'm not saying they do this but... just the thought was cherry on top to this extremely bad experience. I hate leaving bad reviews... but all honesty here. Second to worst place I've eaten at in my life.
author: Irene S.

description:
One of my favorite Thai places to go to! Very authentic Thai food dishes with decent portion sizes and a good mix of choices!

Must haves:

1. corn cake appetizers: these scrumptious fried corn cakes are to die for! they are lightly fried cakes that are made of actual pieces of corn! Complimented with a cucumber salad that is very yummy! A great way to start the meal and is not too heavy or greasy.

2. Pad see ew: very flavorful and the spices are on point! Noodles are never overcooked and the meat and veggie are always portioned perfectly!

3. Any type of curry!! - their curry are always so good, especially the pumpkin curry! The curry is of great consistency that is creamy and not too water downed, unlike many places I have tried.

4. Eggplant! - I am a big fan of eggplant and they make it with basil and minced pork - PERFECT COMBINATION! and the portion size is huge! that with a bowl of rice and your tummy is a happy camper :)
author: Wendy Z.

description:
Plus: awesome food, some of the best pad woosen I've had in a while, tasted delicious and fresh, not too heavily greased like many Thai takeout options.

Minus: my takeout soup had a cockroach in it, which was disgusting! How did that get by the health and sanitation department?!
author: Yi C.

description:
With a 4 star rating and over 1400 yelp reviews I thought we would give this place a try..... it didn't disappoint. Three of us split 3 apps and 2 entrees and every single dish was delicious. Our apps were the coconut hotcakes, angle wings, and their "spiciest app" whose name I forget (which was essentially a glorified chicken lettuce wrap). The hotcakes were one of the most unique things I've had - slightly sweet and a perfect texture. The wings were the perfect mix of sweet an spicy. The chicken wrap was amazing and the perfect amount of spice. 

For the entrees we had the coconut noodles and the hor mok. The noodles were spot on. I've never had hor mok before, but it is basically a snapper curry basil mousse and it was delicious. I'd highly recommend it. 

To try a new restaurant and have 5/5 dishes be delicious is a rare find. On top of that the service was spot on and out water cups never empty and the food was pretty cheap. Overall 5 stars no questions asked.
author: Joshua K.

description: Third party delivery service delivered wrong order. Immediately reported problem and was told order would be replaced and re delivered. 2.5 hours after original order was placed I was notified order was cancelled after repeatedly being notified order was in process. Pathetic.
author: Visit T.

description: One of the best Thai places I've ever had! I got the Beef Pad Kee Mao while my friend got the Chicken Pad Thai. The Pad Kee Mao was really good. I just wanted to keep on eating and I still was craving for more when I finished. The place is small and it can get really crowded. My friend and I arrived just in time before the rush.
author: Peter N.

description:
Seeing all thosr beautiful yelp reviews, we thought it could be a killing thai food which we always crave.  creativeness of the food and incredibly nice staffs made me give 4 stars to this place. But if my review were only based on the food itself, I wouldnt be giving more than 3 stars. 
We ordered 1 appetizer, with the shrimp and lettuce. But the shrimp size was no more than a pistachio. We suppose to wrap shrimp nuts and some other small staffs inside the lettuce and eat it. I have to admit appetizer looks tiny, and interesting but flavor can get 4 stars.
Our entrees were a beef and chicken curry. Both didnt meet the expectations we were waiting. 
Overall 4 stars are the best I can give it to this place.
author: Stacy U.

description:
Best Pad Thai I've ever had!

Amazing! I could really sense the peanuty flavour standout in my Pad thai but it was deliciously balanced and not overpowering. Girlfriend had the vegetarian version of Pad kee Mao, which I tried and it was delicious too. Great little thai place, in a quiet street, cannot recommend it enough.
author: Prashant A.

description:
One of the better Thai foods I would say around the area. The place is pretty small and crowded but not too bad. There's usually a line for seating, but lucked out and had an open table right at arrival. The staff are pretty helpful and accommodating as well. I've never had as frequent of water refill as this place provided me. It was interesting enough that my friend, who is a SF local, comment about it as well.

We ordered Pad Thai with Shrimp, Red Curry with Chicken, Pad Krapow with sliced pork, and white rice. Everything was good for sure. The red curry had a bit more coconut milk than I'm used to, but it doesn't overpower nor exaggerate flavors, it was a nice blend. The krapow was a bit more saucy than I'm used to as well, but was good regardless. Pad Thai doesn't compare to authentic ones in Thailand, but that's always the case right? So I won't judge it with that but say it's not so bad either.

I would definitely come back here and eat again, maybe try the sticky rice with mangoes for dessert the next time I'm ever around the area again.
author: Joel L.

description: very bad experience with the  thai chicken red curry, they gave very small amount of curry sauce, they did give a lot of chicken but it was all dark meat and not marinated at all, chicken tasted awful, had just bamboo shoots for veggies, waiter told us they used to use white meat before but not anymore,  pad thai was ok and had white breast meat but it was mostly noodles and very little veggies and meat. based on other reviews had high hopes but were very disappointed. This review is for Marnee thai near golden gate park in SF.
author: Mayank C.

description: moved here from nashville recently, and this happened to be my first thai food , stop! the egg rolls are amazing, i haven't had egg rolls like that before especially coming from the south... i ordered the pad ke mow, i always order this particular dish. it was amazing. however the noodles were over cooked which caused them to be mushy and soggy. the overall flavor was amazing tho, i had the medium spice in addition. i was very pleased with my order and i am definitely up for my next visit ! the green papaya salad was superb as well!!! well done!
author: Juliet Q.

description:
I've had Marnee twice- once dining in, once with takeout.  I'm writing a review based on my takeout experience here, however. My boyfriend and I ordered a chicken salad and an order of shrimp fried rice with mango to split. Both dishes were super, SUPER disappointing.

The fried rice had no spice, which could have been fine- hey, maybe they forgot to add spice based on what I said over the phone. The shrimp in the fried rice still had the shells attached, which made it hard and awkward to eat- but also, I can live with that...maybe it's the traditional way of cooking shrimp fried rice. However, there were PIECES of shrimp tail within the rice that were disgusting and made it almost impossible to eat. I don't know about you, but eating fried rice and consistently coming across many, many pieces of crunchy shrimp shell is not an enjoyable experience.

The above fried rice on its own would have maybe given this place a two or three-star rating. However, when we bit into the chicken salad we ordered and there were pieces of ground BONE in the salad. Rock hard, crunchy pieces of chicken bone were mixed into the ground chicken. It was nauseating, and I shudder to think what the process of making this chicken salad is that allows for giant chunks of bone to be mixed in.

Final verdict: not one, but two dishes with gross bone/shells in them is enough for me to never go back here again. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
author: Charlotte H.

description:
Went here on a Friday with the wife and her mom for lunch.  Started with Imperial Rolls and a Chicken Satay Salad.   Recommend the latter as you wrap the chicken in lettuce while adding cilantro, rice noodles, dried coconut, and spicy peanut sauce.  Textures and taste make this a good start.  Imperial rolls were ok.

Shared Pad Thai with Shrimp - we thought the Pad Thai was above average as the noodles were not clumpy, shrimp cleaned of the vein, and overall nice taste.  Can't stand non de-veined shrimp....

Closed with Mango Black Sticky Rice.  Think we'll stick with white sticky rice next time as the black rice seemed to be more glutinous than white rice.

Service was very good - waters refilled without prompting and recommendations made that lived up to the hype (Chicken Satay Salad).  Like this location better than the Irving location as the Irving location is a little too cramped for my taste...
author: Scott L.

description: I just ordered Pad Thai for pick up from this place, with side of Peanut Sauce. They charged me $3.00 for a side of sauce. After I got to my car, I realized there's no peanut sauce, I called them back and they said we are very sorry but we can't refund you. Well it took me over hour on a Saturday night to find parking, there's no way I'm spending another hour trying to find a spot to pick up my sauce. I asked to talk to a manger and she said, "he will be back in a MONTH, I'm really sorry." I asked what can be done, & she said, we are very sorry, but nothing. If I could give your customer service zero, I would.
author: Samira N.

description:
We really enjoyed the flavors of our dishes, especially as they compared to those we order at other Thai restaurants.  The one vegetarian dish we ordered, which is basically mixed veggies in a broth was on the bland side, so next time we'll likely order a veggie dish with more punch to it.

The price-to-portion ratio was probably on the high side, but we certainly felt we got enough with 3 mains and no apps for the both of us.  I did wish they had more beer options - they only had Singha - as I generally prefer beer with Thai food vs. wine.  They did have a more extensive wine list.

We'd definitely go back.
author: Scott L.

description: Pretty goood! Red curry was yummy and so were the noodles #48 can't remember what it was called
author: Connie H.

description:
This place is so good, I enjoy eating here the chef is legit, been on check please, Bay Area tv food critic channel,
And it's 4 stars with 1600 reviews that's a lot for a Thai restaurant in sf.
author: Kenneth G.

description: This Review is base on food only.Food was awesome. Pad Thai has a well balance of sweet and sour, Angel Wings was garlicky, sticking and yummy! Best Thai Food for my taste bud!
author: JJ T.

description: This is a literally a hole-in-the-wall. From the outside, Marnee Thai looks like a small dingy place and you, as a customer, would at first think their food is so-so, decent, not that worthy of your tastebuds. However, I found myself lured into Marnee Thai due to the high ratings and raving reviews. I got green curry, as recommended by Yelpers, with prawns, and it was a decent price ($10.98~something) for lunch-time. Enjoyed the green curry so much, I would eat it again. Very satisfying! Also, waiters came several times to refill our glasses with water and took our plates away one by one as we finished eating, which is nice!
author: Grace P.

description: I love Thai food and this has to be one of the best in San Francisco. My daughter always goes here and the crab pad Thai yummmmmm the best! Busy place but great service and amazing food
author: Ahna B.

description:
Hands down one of the best places to eat in SF. I've been coming to Marnee for 25+ years and they continue to produce delicious, authentic Thai food. There are other spots in town but this one is where I find myself coming to time and again. Angel wings, pad Thai, curries...all the usual suspects are well executed.

Ambiance-quaint, small, and yes can get noisy

Service-efficient, courteous and welcoming

Food-sublime

Must add the garlic fish sauce with everything! (A condiment on the table) ask if you're brave!
author: Liz C.

description: One of my favorite Thai restaurants in San Francisco. My favorites are coconut pan cake and pad thai.
author: Devan K.

description: Super  overrated food, i have had much better thai food compare to this. Thai friend rice lacked flavors and pumpkin curry was average. Less portion and ok service.
author: Chandrika G.

description: Pretty much everything about my last dining experience was perfect. We were seated promptly on a Friday night, service was appropriately attentive, and everything we ordered was delicious. A particular star was the green bean dish one of my companions ordered- I was worried because he asked that it be spicy and I'm a total wimp with heat, but it was right at the top of my spice tolerance range.
author: OnlyatBrandei S.

description:
I've been coming here since the week it opened and had a big write up in the chronicle food section.  Has gone super down hill  Nothing is made with love anymore, they are just riding on the famous name.  The pad thai is slimy and overly wet, not how it used to be and too sweet.  

My biggest lament in the Pad Prik King, which used to be made with fried long beans tossed in a thick chili sauce that would cling to the pork and long beans.  Now they use regular beans and the sauce is an oily red soup.  

I'm done with you Marnee  Thai!
author: Mike P.

description: Used to like Marnee way backkkkkk like beginning 2000 ish. I don't know what happened now. Everything so gross and oily, taste is filled with pork oil. 2 Stars is a fair review to sum up my friendships w Marnee. The pad see uew, spring rolls, fried rice ended up in a trash. The eggplant basil is not bad.
author: Maryda P.

description: Yummy food and good service! Love the food- it tastes very fresh and comes out piping hot. I've been here a few times now- pad see ew, pad Thai, tom yum, and larb are my favorite dishes to get here. Once I ordered the imperial rolls as an appetizer, it was tasty but VERY heavy so be careful about the combo of appetizers and mains because you can end up over-ordering/ feeling too full.
author: Sarem G.

description: Good food. Service was slow and the dishes served were served at an abnormally erratic pace. Also a very peculiar smell in the Restuarant. Could not place the smell but not good. My daughter thought it smelled like hamster...
author: John M.

description: Five thumbs up from 5 happy people. Great authentic Thai. LOVED the Tom Kha soup and the pumpkin green curry with prawns. Other greats: pad thai, fried rice... the standards are all solid choices here.
author: Krysta W.

description:
Amazing food so good I've bought the cookbook to try some at home. Lots of flavors and very good price. we were 4, had 2 appetizers, 4 plates and a bottle of wine and it was $30 each.
Try the Miang Kum.
author: Ricardo C.

description:
If I could I would give this place a 3.5 stars 

Minus 1.5 star because service was pretty bad I'm not sure if someone didn't go to work or what, but we waited for water, food, water refills and the check for quite some time. I mean come on.. we didn't even have any napkins!! If the service was at least a tad better they would have gotten more stars. Especially if water and napkins aren't self served.. If it was, I wouldn't care if they came around until we needed our checks. Just saying, service is a big deal.

The food overall is good! We got the daily special pork belly stew or something and that was good! And number 47 i forgot the actually name, but it was some kind of pad thai. My boyfriend and I enjoyed it.

Hopefully whenever we come back he service will be better
author: Vonnie T.

description: It was great. Small and cozy place, nice and friendly service. The food is more authentic than many other Thai places I have been to ... great Tom Yum soup.  the ROTI/ICE CREAM desert is a MUST TRY !   we came with my 6 year old and my 3 year old, and they tried fried rice for 1st time and they finished it all :)   Did I mention the ice cream ??  :)
author: Kharazm S.

description: We ordered a several dishes and sampled them all. Each dish was full of flavors.  The food was spicy enough for me and tame enough for the kids. Best thing was that I felt satisfied.
author: Ozzy C.

description: My go-to spot for Thai food, and a go-to spot in general when I'm with friends at 9th and Irving and we're not sure where to eat. Every curry is flavorful and delicious (love the kang ka ree, but I've never found a dish I don't like here), and the chicken satay and peanut sauce are very satisfying appetizers without spoiling you for the rest of the meal.
author: AJ P.

description: It was our first dine-in stop in SF and we were not disappointed. The restaurant set-up is so-so...it is basically a hole-in-the-wall, so it felt a bit crammed with people coming in and going out. My mom and I shared the pad mee tai (not sure if the spelling is right) with beef, and it was delicious! Very aromatic spices for only $10.50. My dad got the pork belly curry and he found the fatty part of the meat a bit too greasy. It was also a bit spicy. Rice do not come on the side so you have to get them separately for $1.50/bowl. Service was great but serving time was a bit long -- we waited ~20 minutes for two dishes.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Checked it out after a colleague raved about it and I'm glad I did! Food was so delicious, staff friendly and attentive, and very reasonably priced! 

Green curry was a smaller portion than you'd expect but it had a ton of flavor.
