Special coconut noodles were to die for, pretty sure I licked the plate afterwards. 

Roti with ice cream made me not want to put my spoon down..although I definitely had to walk it off afterwards. One of my new favorite Thai spots, I'll be back!
author: Sarah G.

description: Food was delicious, slightly on the sweeter side. As a vegetarian had plenty to choose from and service was excellent.
author: Chintan P.

description:
Love Thai. 
Walked by here and saw the great reviews.
Had (on a 10 scale):

Beef Satay (6)
Checked Salad (8)
Chicken Pad Thai (3)
Chicken Red Curry (3)

Didn't love it. 

Would not try it here again.
author: Bruce L.

description:
Heard some good things about Marnee a few years ago so thought I would give it a try.  Big mistake.

Interior old and crummy.

Seating and tables old and crummy.

Food quality sub-par, small portions and overpriced.

Bathroom smelly/nasty yuck.  Where is the Health Department?

Found out later their SF Food/Safety Health score was only 71/100 and they were shutdown last year for vermin and bugs.

Wait staff were nice and did their best but these issues seem to be a management/ownership problem.

Never again.
author: Robert M.

description:
This used to be a good place but after several recent bad experiences I need to leave this honest review.
Their food has become very low quality. For example when I order a vegetarian dish I don't get much vegetables . Mostly tofu and cooked lettuce . Plus their price had increased 30% over the past year .
There are much better Thai places in the area. Not going there anymore after 15+ years.
author: Al S.

description: If you are in SF.  This is one of the Good place for Thai if the one on Irving is busy.  We order one appetizer a tofu angel wing which was tasty.  We had the yellow curry with chicken which is good but it was a bit salty for my taste.  Over over it was good but don't come if it hot because no AC.  It was uncomfortable to eat.
author: Sum N.

description: I have been coming here for years. Great food but mediocre service. Tried to order to go tonight. Called multiple times (more like 10) and no one picks up. When I get there I asked if they changed their number and the hostess says no. Told them I tried calling many times and they need to pick up their phone.. not even an apology and even rolled her eyes. Really?! If my wife was not pregnant and craving their food I would have just left.
author: Jacky L.

description: Ehhhh, would love to have loved it more! :( I think I messed up by reading the glowing reviews BEFORE trying the food. ;) But anyway! I ordered delivery tonight from Postmates - got here so fast so my food was very fresh. I got yellow curry with chicken, one of my favorites and kind of difficult to mess up. I have to say - it was VERY watery, and the chicken was a mix of dark and white (mostly dark), so tasted a bit gamey. The potatoes were way undercooked and it lacked flavor overall - it really was very watery. So disappointed!!! This review coming from a girl that will eat anything. That being said, I ate the curry; it was edible. It wasn't disgusting. But it wasn't that good. Hoping for a better experience with a different dish when/if I order next time.
author: Nicole M.

description:
So, yeah, pad thai is like the most basic of all thai food, but for some reason it's actually really hard to nail -- and more importantly, Marnee Thai rocks it. It's delicious every single time -- steaming hot, saucy and untangled, a perfect balance of flavors. I really can't go to this place without ordering it. 

I've dappled in the other dishes - green curry, spring rolls, papaya salad, silver noodles, soups - all of which are good, solid dishes but not necessarily must-haves. I'll come back soon to try and push myself out of my comfort zone and explore new terrain. 

I really like this location, and mostly because this one doesn't have that obnoxious lady who always tries to move you to another table, or yells across the room as she tries to orchestrate a dinner service. I actually really sort of hate her and think this business would thrive is someone spiked her Thai tea and set her in front of some Chinese soap operas for the night.
author: Natasha P.

description:
Marnee Thai is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. They have two locations (the other is on Irving and 24th). Both locations get pretty busy so try to make a reservation if you can! I've tried many dishes here, but a few of my favorites are:

--Spicy Angel Wings - chicken wings marinated with a spicy chili-garlic sauce, perfect size appetizer for sharing. 
--Pad Kee Mao - rice noodles pan fried with a choice of chicken, beef or pork, chili, garlic, tomatoes, string beans and sweet Thai basil on a bed of lettuce. 
--Kang Ka Ree (Yellow Curry) - Mild curry with coconut milk, turmeric, fresh herbs and spices with yukon potatoes, served with a choice of chicken, prawns or lamb. Love love love the this dish, great curry made with fresh ingredients. 
--Pad See Ew - pan-fried rice noodles with soy bean, broccoli and egg and a choice of chicken, beef or pork.

I really enjoy the friendly service and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant. Definitely check it out if you're in the area and craving Thai food!
author: Elaine N.

description:
Love love love. Probably one of my fave Thai places that I've tried in SF.  Everything is incredibly delicious - booming with flavor, spice, sour, and everything you expect in Thai food.  I have yet to be disappointed.  Place is small and take out can take forever, but it's worth the wait.  

Larb salad, tom kha, and red curry are my favorite.  I'm not usually a fan of Tom Kha (I'm more of a Tom Yum person) but theirs is SO good.  It's rich from the coconut, but it's got the perfect about of spicy-sour goodness.

If you're in the area, try it! i'd recommend to eat in.  Take out has taken up to an hour before :(
author: Steph S.

description:
I had been wanting to try Marnee Thai since, well, you guessed it... I saw all three guests on "Check, Please! Bay Area" rave about it while Leslie Sbrocco was having one too many glasses of her reserve chardonnay. Unanimous praise is not that unusual on that program, but the dishes looked so uniquely succulent for what I thought would be just another Thai place that I couldn't resist its allure. Now here's the challenge these days. Jamie W. and I are going all plant-based with our dining choices, so we were wondering if we would be able to find anything on the menu to compete with the likes of the Spicy Angel Wings or the Stir-Fried Stewed Pork Belly, both of which I would have easily ordered and devoured just weeks earlier.

Well, it turns out our concerns were unfounded as their vegetarian options are genuinely tasty and satisfying here. First things first, Marnee Thai passed my spring roll test, the true litmus for the quality of any Southeast Asian fare that lies ahead of me. The $7.95 Summer Rolls, a seasonal special, were crispy-fresh with just the right consistency in both the rice noodles and the wrapper. Yes, I recognize there was shrimp in them. Don't expect me to be perfect, OK? Bottom-feeders are in my diet, I swear. Regardless, the hoisin peanut sauce was the perfect complement (see photo). We then shared two veg-head dishes. The first was Jamie's predictable choice - the $9.50 Pad Thai Vegetarian, which mixed the savory fried rice stick noodles and fresh bean sprouts with a bounty of stir-fried vegetables - broccoli, cauliflower, peppers, snap peas, asparagus and baby corn (see photo).

Warmed tofu, egg and a carpet of ground peanuts completed the picture. It was a nice, fresh execution on an old standby. But I have to tell you I was completely blown away by the $9.50 Spicy Ma Kuer, a peasant-style plate of sautéed eggplant with mushrooms, fried tofu, baby corn, bell pepper, chili, garlic and Thai basil (see photo). Again, it was the consistency of the eggplant that really made this dish almost carnivorous in nature. But the eggplant has no face and no mother, so I'm cool. I would order that dish again in a heartbeat, and I can't wait to try the Pumpkin Curry next time. So if you find yourself in the Inner Sunset after an afternoon traipsing around Golden Gate Park, I say this is a great place to rest your weary bones and indulge in some of the tastiest Thai food I've had in this fair city of ours.

FOOD - 5 stars...robust flavors pop at this compact, busy place
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...a bit tight in there
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...genuinely attentive and quick
TOTAL - 5 stars...could be my go-to Thai vegetarian place from now on
author: Ed U.

description: I love Marnee Thai! It's probably my favorite Thai place in the city, having ordered a variety from their menu. I'm a big fan of the pad gra pow with that spicy, sour sauce they keep in the jar on the side. I also love the angel wings, tea leaf salad, and pad see ew. The atmosphere is warm and lovely, and the service has always been good to me.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Ordered pick up because we were going to a friend's house nearby. Ordered via eat 24 around  7:30 for order to be done by 8:20 and got there around 8:12ish. They said 10 more minutes so we went to a convenience store nearby to pick up some stuff we needed. Got back there and had to wait a few more minutes but it wasn't too bad of a wait. It is a very small space but I loved how the servers and hostesses were wearing traditional garb and you could see many chefs/cooks in the kitchen. Smelled great and you could see their Yelp recognitions and Zagat stuff on the wall. 

Ate it 5 minutes later and it was still very hot and fresh. My boyfriend and I both got pad see ew but one with pork and one with chicken. The eggs were great!! I really liked the eggs. Good portion- I still had leftovers. I'd come here again but be prepared to wait a little while during busy times.
author: Samy L.

description: Used to think this place even better than Lers Ros. Picked up green curry w chicken and pad se ew. Both the chicken beef looked unappetizing and tasted worse than they looked. The curry looked and tasted watered down and bland. They must have changed their staff or something. Can no longer recommend this place.
author: Monica R B.

description:
The curry looked and tasted amazing.  I also ordered the eggplant dished.  It came through on taste, but the eggplants were a big soggy and overcooked.

I suspect it's best to research best dishes.
author: Seth E.

description: The waitresses were all pushy. It seemed like they were more interested in getting us through our meal quickly for the next customers. I thought they were pushy with the table next to us. It was also annoying how closely they pack the tables were.
author: S T.

description: I spent a lot of time in Bangkok and can say the taste of the food is pretty close to the real thing. But portions are too big, the ingredients are not quite right & the attitude is not quite Thai. But none of this is the fault of the place because we are not in Thailand. They get the recipes right.  Try it. I think you're go back. I will.
author: Leung T.

description:
Would go again.

Chicken wings: good, not the best I've had. For better ones go to Manna down the street.

Coconut griddle hotcake: YUM! Almost dessert like, really good coconut flavor, but not super rich tasting. Definitely recommend this, never seen this before. (but it does remind me of a dessert I had a long time ago)
author: Audrey L.

description:
Was going to get pho and got a great parking space right in front of Marnee so changed up the plans.

Imperial rolls, pad thai, pad see ew, and beef gra pow (standard dishes).

This place is delicious and fast. Totally worth it.
author: Julia P.

description: I'm in San Francisco visiting a friend and I've never have had Thai food Before. This place was absolutely delicious! I can't even begin to describe the spices and how everything was perfectly seasoned. I recommend this place if you're ever in San Francisco and want good Thai food!
author: Rhianna D.

description:
We used "Caviar" to get Marnee delivered.   We got chicken pad Thai, veggie cold spring rolls, and some fried triangles that had a curry potato inside.  Utterly delicious food.  

The pad Thai was so tasty.  They sent a huge portion.  Even my young son loved it.  Not spicy at all.  

The triangles are bomb.  Yum!   Taste like an Indian samosa sort of but with a tangy Asian dipping sauce.  Wow.   

The spring rolls were okay.  Nothing to get excited about but just fine.  

Well worth the $10 Caviar delivery fee.
author: Pauline C.

description:
I have been to the original Marnee Thai since 1996, I've always loved the food there.
Angel wings
Pad thai
Pad kee Mao (my favorite)
Pad woon sen gai
Roti with ice cream to end
So delicious! 
Today is my craving for pad kee mao.
Somehow it was not what I remembered it to be. 
Pad kee Mao to go was $11
author: PreciousSwt P.

description:
EH... 

Ordered from that app that delivers to you, I forget the name.  I wanted a yellow curry chicken and they sent an orange one.  Looked like it was originally red curry then they added the yellow curry.  Was not that great.  Ordered Pad Thai, usually when I order Pad Thai at any other restaurant they serve the same type of noodle.  Well here they give you a choice. So like a dummy, I unknowingly ordered the silver noodles and was so unhappy when I opened the box.  The silver noodles are very thin and the taste was very bland.  I tried holding the food in my mouth for as long as I could to try to get the flavor out but it never happened.  I just unsatisfyingly chewed and chewed.  

The "eggrolls"   -_________-

I have never had eggrolls stuffed with nothing but silver noodles inside.  It was weird. As I previously mentioned, the noodles didn't have any taste, this time around they were stuffed in a wrap and deep fried.  So I had fried tasteless noodles wrapped in an eggroll.  It tasted like rubber. The dip didn't help.

Overall, I paid upwards of $40 for food that had no taste.  My stomach was very unsatisfied, I was full but unhappy.  I wouldn't give them a second chance.
author: Adriana T.

description:
Caviar order. 

I almost never give bad reviews - seriously look at my review history - this is one of the very, very dining experiences that deserves 1 star.

I ordered chicken satay, spicy ma keur, brown rice, and a thai iced coffee.

The chicken satay was SEVERELY undercooked - very pink in the middle, obvious after one bite. All 6 pieces were undercooked, which is almost impressive when you think about it - how many restaurants with legit chefs can do that???

The ma keur was not spicy at all, and incredibly soggy - the eggplant was falling apart because it was sitting in a gloppy, soggy, not too flavorful sauce. I also got no baby corn nor mushrooms, both of which are listed on Caviar as being in the dish. I LOVE Thai food and this is probably the first entree in 3+ years I can remember not liking - since a salad at Pok Pok in Portland I believe.

Thai iced coffee was good. Thanks for at least that, I guess.

Yuck.
author: Rohan N.

description:
Not bad, but not great either. 

My friend did like her dish. 

I thought my duck dish was okay, but the duck was mostly fat and cartilage. 

The samosa-like appetizer was not good. Something seemed a little off about the filling, like it tasted old (or maybe it was the oil). 

The service was excellent, however. I would say that, overall, I'd give it 2.5 stars.
author: J K.

description:
Oh my goodness gracious

It was a Saturday night, my brother and I were visiting home,  and we decided to get some soup with mom.  Thai soup.   If we're being honest, we secretively wanted to be transported to a magical thai kingdom with fairies and other thai magic kingdom sht whatever that might be.  Maybe magic egg rolls that can play the piano and tell fart jokes.   That would be cool.  You see, we were hanging around at home and a little bored.  Anything passable would do.  

They were on the busy side but we were seated right away and ordered right after that.   Our waitress was not warm and spoke in a disinterested monotone.  We were made to feel like we were bad at ordering somehow.  Even though I am very good at ordering and pride myself on my fast ordering abilities.  Anyway,we ordered Thai soup, thai bbq chicken, and thai egg rolls, please and thank you. 

Then we waited.   For 15 minutes.... for 30 minutes...asked for an ETA...got the egg rolls...waited to 45 minutes...then were told by the host(manager?) that they don't have the bbq chicken and what do we want to order instead. I was befuddled and was like uhhh??  you're out of the chicken, uhhhh?? what??

Then my mom went postal.

"You waited till now to tell us you are out of the chicken?  What the hell is wrong with you?  Where's the soup?  It's already made, right?  Are you kidding me?"  Are you making the soup from scratch?  What the hells going on?"

Our distracted /disinterested host used her best monotone voice to let us know she would check on the soup.  She didn't come back for another 10 minutes. It's a small restaurant.  Like the size of a crappy little Thai restaurant that's 15 steps front to back.

Shaking heads, we decided to leave. But, there was the small matter of the bill.  They said we should pay the $8 for their mostly lettuce egg rolls.  Mom said they should get their heads examined.  We didn't pay. 

Marnee Thai needs to learn some manners.  If you go here be ready for trouble.. and bring your mom if case you need backup.
author: Asper K.

description:
I think everyone will agree when I say that when you decide you are going to eat out at a restaurant with your friends that you expect to be eating with them and not after they're finished with their meal. What is ironic is that after my friends and I ordered our food here, I had read aloud a friend's yelp review for Marnee where she wrote that while she was there, they forgot to take one of her friend's orders.. 

First came our appetizers. We ordered Angel Wings and the Imperial Rolls, both which were really good. Then one by one each of my friends received their entrees. When the last one came out, the waiter asked me "what did you order again?" -_-... I told him what I ordered thinking that he was going to go to the back just to check up on the status of my food, but I was wrong. It was obvious that they had not put in my order to begin with because 15 minutes later and I still had no food. 3/4 into our meal, a waitress came by and asked how everything was. We said that we were still missing an entree and I asked her to check how much longer until my food was ready. A few minutes later she came back and said it was on it's way.. That's fine except it wasn't "on its way". Five minutes later and it still wasn't out and by this time all my friends were finished with their entrees. At this point we called the waitress over to let her know that I wanted to cancel my order. There is really no point in eating when all your friends have already finished! She said okay and put in the cancellation while  simultaneously, the other waiter brought out my food. I told him I had just cancelled my order and that I did not want it anymore. He said he knew I had been waiting 30+ minutes for my food and that he would take it off of the bill but could I eat my food anyways. It was funny how he had said it but I'll give credit to him because he knew it was his fault. So in the end, I did end up with my food which I took to go but 2 stars is the max for this dining experience. I have definitely had better.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Good basic food .
The place is quaint . Uniforms of servers very traditional and nice .
Very polite staff .
The spicy Tom kha soup was good .
Pad Thai - good 
Beef and green beans - good
Wine - very cheap but very bad . Is great to offer a cheaper wine option by the bottle but it has to be decent ! There are a ton of great , cheap bottles of wine out there ! Marnee just did not pick those .
The fried banana with coconut ice cream did the job . Was really good . 
Place was busy , but the tables very small and very close to each other ... 
lots of activity in the kitchen with a ton of to go orders , and people waiting by the door to get a table that made it feel very crowded and overwhelming .
But overall a nice place .
author: Junior V.

description:
I was planning a team dinner that needed to be close to the CA Academy of Science.  I saw the excellent review rating of this place on Yelp so I decided to book the reservation here.

There is a secret back room that was perfect for a party of our size.  We got the whole room to ourselves which was great!  It kind of felt like a dungeon though since when the room filled up, it was a bit cramped and there are no windows.

We got a few appetizers to start.  The chicken satay was great and the peanut sauce that came with it complemented the dish well.  The imperial spring rolls were decent although they had shrimp in them - luckily they were easy to pull out!

I got the panang beef dish and I was a little disappointed about the dish.  The dish had little curry and the beef chunks looked like beef stew meat, which is quite honestly not that good.  The broccoli that they had on the side also tasted slightly undercooked.

I did take a bite of my friend's pad see ew.  It was a good spicy level and the flavor was not bad.  I should have gotten that dish.

The prices here are pretty standard although they do charge extra for rice (sigh).
author: Danielle C.

description: Service was excellent  and we were seated promptly. Pad ke mow was excellent and maybe one of the best I've had. Red curry was bland, and basil tofu was mediocre.
author: Veeral S.

description:
This place was recommended to us by a highly respected restaurateur and chef, so it was with great anticipation that we arrived at Marnee Thai for lunch.  The menu has a great deal of variety and there are some pretty creative specials available (Banana curry, you say?)

So here's the lowdown: I had the Pad Kaprow with prawns, my friend had the chicken Prig Khing, my wife had the chicken green curry, and my son had the Thai fried rice with prawns.  Everything was good, but nothing was particularly noteworthy.  My son complained that there weren't enough prawns in his dish (only about 4, apparently) but the fried rice itself was above average.  My dish, although cited as "spicy", was good but again...no spice.  Like, at all.  The prig khing and the green curry were both good, but again...nothing super.

But this is a popular place, so if you don't show up early for lunch you can find yourself waiting in line for a while.

The service was efficient and friendly.  

So its pretty standard Thai food at a decent price.  I would have hoped for better in SF, but it's not bad and if I'm visiting the aquarium again I wouldn't be upset if I ended up here again.
author: Ben G.

description:
I just visited the place for the 3rd time, and it was the most unimpressive outing.  
my wife was craving for some Tom Yum soup, so I yelped around and found this place... highest rating Thai Food nearby.  Well, was I disappointed.

3 things stood out for the whole experience:  small portions, high price, cheap ingredients.  I don't mind if you are more expensive than other similar restaurants, but don't ALSO give me smaller portions AND pretty much dishonest use of ingredients.  It was  highlighted by 6 small pieces of "summer rolls" which consisted of nothing but some wrap and lettuces/carrot... i only found a half piece of shrimp in there.  that dish cost $7.95, and I can definitely find something at less than half of that price, bigger, with more generous ingredient in many Vietnamese places.  We also ordered Tea Leaf salad for $11.95... again, smaller than what we had in other places. I also found a lot of peanuts, which I don't remember in my previous Tea leaf salad experiences.  seems like they replaced some of those crunchy ingredients with peanuts.

We end up paying almost $40 for 2 people.  Tom Yum Soup(small portion too, and my wife said it was too salty), Tea Leaf Salad, and the Summer rolls.  $40 dollars.  Doesn't feel like we ate anything.   And we end up having some pearl milk tea and pop corn chicken across the street afterwards.
author: gswfan ..

description:
Tried the green curry chicken, Penang curry chicken and pad see ew beef. Noodles were super dry. Penang curry hardly had any curry. Green curry was overflowing with eggplants.

Pass.
author: Vighnesh R.

description: I honestly don't know how this place has four stars because to me it was one of the worst thai restaurants i've been to. I went with a bunch of friends and no one dish tasted particularly great. I myself ordered the pad kee mow as usual but it had way to many veggies in it that aren't normally there and the flavor was a bit off. The pad see ew had to be the worst tho. It was literally soy sauce egg and pepper? i dont remember pepper being in pad see ew let alone so much of it. It tasted like chinese food if anything and nothing like how legit pad see ew is supposed to be. The fried rice was dry and so was the meat that came with it and the curries were mediocre. You wouldve thought at least the service was good but no not really. Our food came in like 40 minutes later and they took forever on our order. It also took a good minute to flag down a waiter/waitress to get our bill. We definitely did not have a great experience and I would not come back.
author: Jane K.

description:
Best Thai food I've had. Hands down. If I could eat here every day... I probably would. 

Must try:
-Thai style potstickers
-Angel wings
-Any of the curry dishes (you can't go wrong)
-Pretty much anything. Really. 

The waitstaff is attentive and helpful. Ambiance is on-point, not fancy but not whole-in-the-wall either.
author: Robin J.

description: The food was overcooked, the place was dirty and it smelled like a wet rag. We persevered because we had a good experience there before...tonight was definitely not good. In fact, both of us feel sick. Try Thep Phenom--now THAT'S great Thai.
author: ronit d.

description:
We've walked by here a couple of nights in a row and noticed the line outside.  After a day at the museum, we decided to stop here for a late lunch as there wasn't a line.  We were seated immediately and they were quick to take our order.  We got the thai fried rice and beef salad.  

The fried rice was amazing!  It had the right seasoning, and not greasy at all.  Will definitely get again.  The beef salad was refreshing and the beef was seasoned lightly and tender. 

You should try this place out when there isn't a line.
author: Monica A.

description: I've been to this place twice recently. Not so good on both visits. It's disappointing since this used to be one of the better Thai restaurants in the city. No more, sadly. First visit, red curry chicken which seems pretty hard to screw up. The chicken was inedible. This visit, coconut noodles with tofu. Also, wouldn't recommend. We didn't want our leftovers even.
author: Tina Z.

description: Came here for dinner with some friends. We were really hungry due to biking all day. We wrote our names for 4 people. The wait took a little bit long like 30 to 45 minutes. But it was okay because we knew the food was bomb. So we got seated and I was undecided on what I should get because everything on the menu sounded so good. So I went with pad Thai with beef and spicy angel wings. Best decision I ever made. The pad Thai had the perfect amount of flavoring. The wings were crispy and had a mild spicy garlicky taste. Overall, the meal was perfect. I had my friends to enjoy the good food with. The service was on point, our waitress kept checking in on us. 5 out of 5!!!!
author: Bailey C.

description:
Do you remember? I bet'cha remember.
Back in the spring? I bet'cha remember.
Every morning, I bet'cha remember.
Birds would sing. I bet'cha remember.
Do you remember? I bet'cha remember.
Those special times? I bet'cha remember.
They'll just go on and on, I bet'cha remember.
In the back of my miiiiiiiiind.
Do you remember the Thaime?

I brought friends years ago, and I brought friends again. So did whoever had the birthday party a few tables down and the big black dude (wardrobe, not skin) who was openly vocal to just about anyone for any reason.

Our more recent visit was one of those scenarios of waiting to order, waiting for water, waiting for plates, waaaiting for food... you know what I'm saying. At the end, we stayed an hourish after eating to just talk and laugh.

Servers have interesting names, like "Gift" and "X". Everyone was polite, but X wouldn't tell me where to get a shirt like his.
author: Dan B.

description:
Funny that I should love and hate this place so much that it ends up averaging 3 stars, though I will separate my review to clarify my somewhat bipolar opinion.

Disclaimer: Sorry no pictures.  I was celebrating my friend's birthday so I didn't want to do the obnoxious "Omg don't eat that yet!!!  I need a picture!!!"

[PART ONE: THE 5-STAR COMPONENT]

This place has some seriously tasty food.  Yup, I'm talking about Thai comfort food carby goodness of stir-fry noodles and fried rice.  

The noodle and rice dishes definitely tasted different from your average Thai place, which usually derives more flavor from greasiness than sauce.  Marnee Thai's noodles/fried rice had the homemade touch: there was something about the soy sauce/fish sauce/secret ingredient that was reminiscent of Thai temple style cooking.  

I would recommend the Thai fried rice (a lot of chicken and veggies, not just all saucy rice), pad kee mao (interesting that they add a layer of black pepper on top, but I liked the extra kick), and pad Thai (though the shrimp weren't very fresh).  

We also had the Panang beef curry.  Instead of a bowl, it came in a dish so IMO it was more like stir-fry.  I think it was a bit too salty and there was this weird mayo sauce, but the beef was tender and the curry was alright.

Rumors say the angel wings are highly recommended, but personally I would say it doesn't beat the famous San Tung chicken wings.  To my understanding, angel wings are supposed to be stuffed, but the ones at Marnee Thai were just deep-fried wings with a sweet and spicy BBQ sauce, sprinkled with some fried basil and served on an aesthetic square plate.  Be warned that some people found it rather spicy.  Not bad, but it didn't stand out--the noodles and fried rice were the main highlight.

[PART TWO: THE 1-STAR COMPONENT]

The main drawback is the service.  Or more like the management... essentially their business practice is finding every way possible to make us order lots of food.

We came in a large group, and it was nice to have the back room, which had great decor and was separated from the noisiness of the rest of the restaurant.  However service was spotty; some people didn't always get their water refilled.

The main problem was that they kept convincing us to order more food.  Our initial judgment would have been fine, but because they were so adamant that it wouldn't be enough, we ordered more and in the end everyone was stuffed and we had a lot of leftovers.  The portions are big, so if you go in a group I suggest a ratio of 2 dishes for 3 people (assuming no one is ravenously hungry), and perhaps some appetizers for flair.

We also asked for rice, and they were sneaky in putting in an order of rice for EVERYONE.  We only finished a small fraction and took the rest to go after we found out how much they charged us for it.   

They were nice though, smiling and being courteous and all.  My chief complaint is the shady business.  

PS This review is dedicated to the bday girl!  That alone should make 5 stars (but Yelp would vehemently oppose to that sort of criteria and this review would never see daylight again)
author: Edna C.

description: the red curry and medium spicy pad kee mao was absolutely amazing and the food came very fast. great ambiance as well.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Disappointed. A neighborhood spot, we will try the one on the other side of 19th Ave before writing it off completely. We had a friend in who used to live here and remembered this as a great spot. 
We were seated and it was so loud from the clanging dishes we had to move. The summer rolls were underwhelming, veggies tasted old and water logged. The Tom Kha soup was barely passable (trader Joe's has a better version), angel wings which used to be a specialty were less than mediocre but the worst was the BBQ pork. It was bright pink in places and tasted sour. The pieces were such a mish mash I wondered if it was garbage they accidentally served. We couldn't take anymore and sent the pork back. Everyone was as nice as they could be but we should have left when the clanging of dishes being put away was too much to bear- we would've saved $80.
author: Janine S.

description:
We stopped in here again after another visit to the de Young Museum at the request of my folks, who had enjoyed the cuisine the first time around.

It was just as delicious this time : )

The front room was the only area being served, and it was packed, but the service was prompt, courteous, and helpful.

We had:

Fresh Thai-Style Egg Rolls
Mango Fried Rice with Prawns
Garlic Chicken
author: Diana V.

description:
I came here for lunch. The spicy angel wings are great. They are spicy and sweet. I ordered the Pad Nor Mai with chicken. It was a stir fry of chili, garlic, bamboo shoots, egg and Thai basil. There was some rice on the side too. The dish was spicy and had very good flavors. I like the flavor of the Thai basil in the dish. 

Service was great. Food was spicy so I ended up drinking a lot of water and my water cup just kept being filled.
author: Alexander L.

description:
My boyfriend, cousin and his wife to be came here to eat one night... im not sure what day or week it was but ANYWHO! 

Its a small place, small enough where you can pick food from a strangers plate! haha BUT! it was a cozy little place. The Owner... she was just MAGNIFICENT! Funniest and most sweetest lady EVER!

I forgot about MOST of the dishes we ordered... but FOR SURE we ordered the ANGEL WINGS! they were mouth watery and flavorful! EVERYONE must try it at least once!! (and after that you would always want to order that!)

We also ordered the typical Pad Thai,  and two other dishes.... i wish i paid attention to the names to help everyone!! but i have the worse memory EVER!

But we did have some help from the Owner... she will suggest some meat selection as well... and how spicy you should order it... and let me tell you... she sure knows her FOOD!!! EVERYTHING that we ordered... was REALLY GOOD!! i would not mind eatting there once a week!!!

Everything seems fresh to taste and as if their basil was grown right from their back yard! Our water was always filled and never empty! There was a time when i tured around to grab some  more wings... and BAM! my cup was full again MAGICALLY! haha

Sercice was great here... everyone is friendly and always on top of things! We were so tempted to buy the cook book!!! By the way we did get a chance to actually look over the cook book!! its not cheap quality at all!! it was a Hard cover book with PLENTY of delicious recipes and PICTURES!! I LOVE PICTURES!!! It would be a great treat to have one in our shelf!! and even one to give as a christmas gift!! 

Once we got our bill it was reasonable and it came with GUAVA CANDY!!! we asked for more because it was so yummy!! 


I think for sure the next time we go back we will definitely get the cook book ANDDDDDDDD order dessert!!  I will defitely snap some pictures and take down names for the UPDATE review!!
author: Sally J.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place for a while, since my boyfriend has been raving about this for so long. And this meal did not disappoint at all! This definitely has to be one of the more under-rated Thai restaurants in the city. 

When you walk in, you can instantly sense the lovely aroma of Thai spices in the air, as the open-faced kitchen showcases the chefs at work. The restaurant isn't too big, but it's spacious enough to seat a copious amount of people comfortably. We came in on a Saturday afternoon, and seated immediately by a very welcoming staff. 

We came here just to try their Angel Wings ($7.95), which served a hearty portion for an appetizer. It was lightly crisped on the outside, super moist and tender on the inside. It was lathered with a chili garlic sauce that was super tasty! And sprinkled with a couple basil leaves. Highly recommended

We also ordered the Coconut Stir-Fried Rice Noodles ($12.50), which were thin rice noodles made with coconut milk and a light tamarind sauce, that came with chicken, shrimp, and a lightly fried egg! It was deliciously tangy, and quite flavorful.

Lastly, we had the Stir-Fried Stewed Pork Belly ($12.50), with bamboo shoots, mushroom, & corn. The pork belly was super tender! It's lathered in a garlic sauce that was quite enjoyable, and it went super well with rice. I am always happy when any place does pork belly right...That's all I have to say!
author: Krystal O.

description:
N.B.: If, like me, you usually skip low reviews based on service rather than food, feel free to move along.

The other half and I went to the 9th Ave. incarnation of Marnee.  We made a fairly straightforward order, avacado salad from the specials menu, a soft tofu and chicken soup, vegetarian pad thai and a basa filet with the pepper & garlic sauce.  She and I are sure that
we not only clearly ordered avocado salad but we agreed heard the server confirm this in 
the order readback (a good practice, assuming you get it right).  

We got the salad (papaya salad, it turns out) and I commented that there seemed to be a lot of vinaigrette -- the recipe must have changed.  The other half noted that it's way spicy for an avacado salad and sour from the dressing -- a bad combo for her digestives, she asserts.  The salad she had taken was still on her plate, I had gone through some of mine.  We requested a swap out (yes, the avocado salad costs more, but we expected that and told the wait person that).  The wait-person returned and said if we wanted a replacement, we'd have to pay for both salads (say what?  Were they hoping we spotted the error early so they could recycle the salad to some unsuspecting rube?).

We declined and had the (inedible for the other half) salad removed.  Yes, we were charged for the mostly uneaten salad.  And as much as I dislike service whinges, I now appreciate the negative impact on the rest of the dining experience... we just wanted to eat up, Shriners,  and get out of Dodge ASAP.

Other differences caught our eyes as well... portion sizes seem to be smaller (less soup, less basa).  Something seems to have changed at a place we've enjoyed many times before;  our return is not so likely.  With 39.3 restaurants per 10,000 households in SF, we're fortunate to comfortably move along to something more inviting.
author: Bruce B.

description: Good flavor, but has anyone else noticed how small their portions have gotten over the years? It's like every time I go back, there are less noodles, etc., Plus, no fresh peppercorn berries like at Lers Ros. Still tasty though.
author: Dennis W.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered Hor Wok and coconut fried noodle. Both are very delicious! The Hor wok is steamed snapper with basil. It's wrapped in a banana leaf. You definitely want to have a try. It's weekend-only special, though. The desert with sticky rice and mango is also good!
author: Emily S.

description: Best Thai restaurant in town!! Try the corn cakes! Everything is great!
author: Bernadette Gates F.

description:
Good traditional Thai food.
This is one of their two locations.

Waiters are dressed in traditional looking Thai uniform.

The place is a bit tight on space. Be prepared for the line outside the door, but beware not all these people are here to dine in - many are just to pick up takes outs.
author: Andy M.

description:
Questionable restaurant set-up.  They've got this sketchy little hallway that leads to a back section of the restaurant.  I had doubts in my mind that the waitress was leading me to some secret dungeon in the back before they sell me to Mexico as an exotic asian slave.

Aside from that, the food was great.  

Main dishes were mehh for me.  I asked for 0 on the spicy level for one of the main entrees, but when the food came up it was too spicy for me that I felt like I lost most of my taste-buds afterwards.

However, LOVED the chicken satay and corn cake for appetizers, and LOVED the mango with sticky rice and roti with ice cream for desserts.  The roti with ice cream was like funnel cake except better, and with yumyum coconut ice cream on top instead of annoying powdered sugar that always stick onto my face and make me look like I just sniffed a bunch of crack.
author: Tian Q.

description:
Marnee Thai has two locations- 9th Irving and 23rd Irving.  I've been to both and I enjoy the food and service more at this location.  

All the dishes have tons of flavor.  Nothing makes me pout more than a bland dish (*hint hint* 23rd location)
author: Linda N.

description: Deceptive and tricky billing !!!! Got my itemized bill and didn't notice an 18% tip was included.  It was easy to miss because it was slipped in at the bottom in very small print.  We only had a party of 5 too!  I gave them my credit card and when they brought it back, they conveniently did not include the itemized bill.  Not only that, the credit card bill listed the total (with the already added tip) AND the amount I should add for a 15%, 18% and 20% tip. Fortunately my wife spotted the tip on the initial bill while I was in the bathroom but I never noticed it.  When I told the manager about it he acted as though he had been caught trying to trick me into including a 2nd tip.  WATCH OUT FOR THESE GUYS AND READ YOUR BILL THOROUGHLY!
author: scott f.

description:
THE BEST THAI SPOT I'VE BEEN TO IN THE CITY

No lie, I am very picky when it comes to food, but these guys come correct all the time...

Consistency; Great Food, Clean, and Friendly staff... I just wish that there was one closer to my place ;( so I wouldn't have to travel so far to get some good grub.  

TRY WHAT YOU WANT AND BET IT WILL BE GOOD!
author: Corey G.

description: While the food is serviceable here, it's not as good as I expected. Both the Tom Ka and the beef salad were completely devoid of the tart, acidic notes I've come to expect from these dishes. They were also both extremely bland. The Pad Kee Mao was swimming in oil, and since I normally and unapologetically enjoy anything super high fat, like the good American I am, I was surprised I could barely stomach more than a few bites.
author: Amy J.

description: Review on the Silver Noodle Salad (Pad Woon Sen). I LOVED it. I was sick of ordering the Chicken Larb Salad and wanted something new. This Noodle salad has 3 prawns and mined pork. It was missing the mushrooms but oh well I didn't miss it that much. It is American spicy but that may still be very hot to some people. New fav from this place .
author: Marie M.

description:
Awesome place. That about sums it up.

I like that this Thai restaurant is small and intimate, and has a lot of beautiful and unique decorations that are specific to Thailand and done in a tasteful way (unlike a lot of "hole-in-the-wall" restaurants). Me and a friend decided to sit at the bar because there was no wait. This area actually turned out to be one of the better spots: because you can see the chefs cooking and there are these canisters filled with water and (fake, but still nice...) flowers. 

The menu has a lot of selection and a good amount of the dishes have choice of meet. As expected with any Thai restaurant: a majority of the food is healthy without trying. This is always refreshing and ordering a salad here feels cool, because the salad has so many ingredients and also includes a bit of meet. I had the green papaya salad, by the way, which actually contains more noodles than greens, but was still extremely tasty and satisfying.

My friend ordered the pumpkin tofu curry, which was tasty and actually had a light sauce. This is my is my usually issue with curries, the heavy and thick sauce, and is why I ordered a salad. They commented that it is one of the best pumpkin curries they've had.

The service was fast and friendly and the prices are very reasonable (most Thai places are, anyway). I will definitely make it a point to be back. After all, it was the best papaya salad I've had: even better than my favorite version in Austin. And there are far more Thai places in this city and I was not expecting this place to be this good. A wonderful find!
author: Jonathan A.

description:
Anything and everything is good on this menu. Honestly, you won't be disappointed with whatever you order. It's not pricey at all for this area, as my date and I ordered the housemade hot cakes to share as an app and two entrees (a meat wok item and woonsen veg) to share with brown rice. I also had a beer, and it only came out to $36 before tip. That's pretty damn good, along with very prompt service and plenty of space to sit.

So, onwards to the food. The hot cakes were really good. Imagine potato skins with a creamy interior and a couple of baked veg. Very tasty. The stir fry was really, really good. Moderate spice and very delectable seasoning. The noodles in the woonsen were a little clumpy, but the flavors melded really well. All-in-all, an excellent meal.
author: Danny C.

description:
I came out here on a Saturday night stuffed from a whole day of eating. My friend was hungry so this is where we went. I came in, stuffed to the fullest and still ordered the special soft shell crab mango salad. We also ordered satay wraps which were wrapped in lettuce and also had a dip. I wished that I came here starving because if that was the case I would have gotten a tasty dish. Oh well, at least there is something out there when I come next time.

Now, get here early (or call in to order), as this place has definitely a good amount of business to keep a waiting line as my party and I got stuck on. We waited for at least 30 minutes before we sat down and ate. This place has also got the rewards to back up their food and service. I will definitely come back to explore more of their menu and definitely write an update for this amazing restaurant.
author: Bruce K.

description:
SOOO they closed a month ago because the health dept found cockroaches and rodent droppings. I had come here before they closed, so I was PRETTY grossed out, rightfully. Then some other friends visited and Thai struck their fancy. I notified them of the recent closure (and reopening, since I guess they cleaned up), and they decided to rough it anyway. We have iron stomachs, we're Asian.

Food is okay, standard Thai food. The duck I hear is good, will try that next time.
author: Vivian H.

description:
They don't care about the people the serve. They are so greedy they will not spend the money to keep roaches out of your food.  I dated someone that worked there a long time ago and they don't care about anyting other than your money. 

Now where to go when I come to visit. 

From sfgate.com

The branch of Marnee Thai on Ninth Avenue boasts 1,004 Yelp reviews (all of them useful), and as it turns out, it has nearly as many health violations.

The full health inspection report can be viewed below, but Marnee Thai got a score of 58, which as Richard Lee, Director of the Food Safety Program, notes: "That's not good." According to the report, all restaurant operations had to be stopped "due to the imminent public health risk." However, the other reason that the restaurant immediately got shut down after the routine inspection is that a previous ruling in January 2012 stipulated that if any further immediate health risks were found, the restaurant must go dark ASAP.

So now, Marnee Thai is closed, and the permit suspended. An inspector will stop by later today to see if any improvements have been made; updates on a reopening will be shared as they come in.

A nice lady who answered the phone at Marnee Thai's other Sunset location (Irving/24th) said they hope to reopen sometime this week, and she explained the closure in a very matter-of-fact manner: "We clean up."

Here is the full report, which contains mentions of live cockroaches on prep tables, rodent droppings next to food containers and utensils, and several dead cockroaches scattered about the kitchen like peanuts in pad Thai, among other food safety violations. It certainly appears they need to clean up.
author: Randy K.

description:
We saw the great reviews on Yelp and decided to give this place a try.  Maybe I held too high of expectation coming here, I was not too impressed by the dishes we ordered.    There are so many Thai restaurants in SF, so it has to be spectacular for me to want to come back again. Unfortunately, Marnee Thai did not do it for me.


1. Angel wings: not bad, but did not blow my mind.  It seems like fried sweet chicken wings are a popular dish in SF (have seen it in many restaurants).

2. pad thai: not bad, but not too special either

3. green curry: this is THE dish I order to make my decision about thai restaurant.  We asked it with pork.  I was quite disappointed. the portion was a bit small, and did not have a lot of vegetables in it.  Did not have a lot of sauce either.. and the worst part was that pork was pretty dry.  I have to say Ler Ros thai still has the best green curry!!!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Stopped into Marnee on a whim and was well rewarded with a delicious, memorable meal and warm friendly service - quite reassuring on a foggy Sunset District night.

To kindle our chilled bones, we ordered the tom yum gai. The soup was piping hot with just enough tang - spikes of lemongrass enhancing but not overpowering the effect.
I ordered the special Basa Fillet with coconut milk, fresh garlic, curry wrapped in banana leaf. It was presented very beautifully, a large white plate framed the deliciously intricate dish. The banana leaves acted as a bowl of sorts, penning in the richly flavored coconut sauce and flaky, moist basa filet. 

Very generous portions left little room for dessert. 

Great little neighborhood spot...especially when the fog belt thickens.
author: Carole B.

description:
We headed to this Thai place after our Lands End hike. It has great reviews but we were disappointed by their service and also how the place was run. The owner / manager of the restaurant was walking around yelling and shouting at the waiters. It was also a very busy evening and we were squeezed in a corner with almost no room.
We ordered mango fried rice and red snapper dish. They were good. This is not a place to go if you want to enjoy a relaxing night out.
author: Raman S.

description:
As someone with pretty high Thai food standards (I'm pretty sure I tried every Thai restaurant in Hell's Kitchen in NYC already), I was pretty impressed by this restaurant.  The food was good, the price was decent, and the staff were friendly. What else do you need? 

Friend and I came here on a Monday night at around 6:30 pm and the restaurant looked fairly full but we still were able to be seated right away. We ordered the Panang Beef and the Chicken Pad See-Ew. The Pad See-Ew was as good as I've had elsewhere (you could taste a hint of black pepper...yummy), and the Panang Beef was flavorful and delicious. The only thing I didn't appreciate was that rice wasn't included in the price of the panang beef. Are people usually expected to just eat the curry without any type of carby-side? Maybe a good thing for those paleos out there.

Overall, I was impressed and wished it was closer to me so I could go there more often! But will hopefully be back again. 

PROS: good food, friendly staff, not overly crowded
CONS:  a little pricier than standard Thai, but still decent, wish curries came with rice
author: Sarah C.

description:
Somewhere along the lines of casual, hole in the wall and decorated. From outside it doesn't look too appealing and even as you walk in. The back seems a bit more decorated, but still lacking. However don't be fooled, the food is still good. 

Fried rice with pineapple and shrimp. Pretty basic dish, I give it 3-4 stars. It wasn't the best, but still good

Pork belly with bamboo shoots and some kind of sauce. The sauce made looked a lot like tomato soup, but was nothing like it. It had a unique taste to it and a hint of spicy. It was worth trying even as someone that doesn't like spicy foods. It's a very mild spiciness 

Service: good, but would be nice if they gave us more time to order 

Popularity: seems high, a few reserved tables on a Monday night 

I give it 3 stars, only cause it wasn't my personal taste
author: Roxy E.

description: Delicious food. The sitting area is a bit narrow, which makes it intimate and noisy. The food was amazing.
author: Marcos G.

description:
My buddy is getting married this week but an ill-timed professional test kept us from throwing him your typical "Hangover"-style bachelor party. Instead, we had a group dinner instead at Marnee. Not as wild or crazy but still full of spice.

We started off with some po tak spicy seafood soup. It had great spicy and was full of shellfish and everybody got a taste. I ordered the green curry with chicken and my girlfriend got the pan-fried noodles with crab. The curry was pretty good but the portion size was kind of small. There seemed to be a lot more eggplant than chicken though and not much curry sauce. The noodles were a little too sweet for my taste ad the crab was difficult to discern. It would have been nice to dial down the sugar or sauce to make it possible to savor the flavor of the crab.

Overall it was pretty enjoyable though getting a seat can be kind of a pain. The restaurant is cramped but I would recommend checking it out. I hear their pad thai is good so I will give that a try next time.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: A few staff at UCSF recommend this restaurant. I could not have been more disappointed. I had the chicken curry with noodles. It was cold and the chicken was not very good. The service was also terrible. The server mad me feel unwelcome and never asked me if I was doing Ok. One of the worst dining experiences ever.
author: S L.

description:
PSA: This place serves khao soy! I did not see it at all on their menu, and I know that the other location on Irving has it, so I asked and they do make it here as well. Maybe that item was accidentally left off their menu at this location, since it's listed on their website as well. And at $8.95, it's actually fairly cheaper than a lot of other dishes on their menu.

The reason why I get excited about khao soy is because during college I went on a trip to Thailand, and in Chiang Mai my friends and I had khao soy for pretty much every meal since it's so delicious. It's not common to find it served in the US though so whenever I do find a place that has it, I will always order it.

Anyway, this is a nice Thai restaurant in the Inner Sunset. Consider it a victory if you can find street parking within a few minutes. Despite being in a busy area, this place doesn't really have as many patrons as a lot of the other spots nearby so it wasn't that difficult to get seating. Compared to its other location, this place has a nicer atmosphere, but fewer seats.

The food is the same as the Irving location. Angel wings is a popular appetizer. They say it's spicy, but the sauce they use for it is barely spicy at all, which I actually prefer. Aside from the typical pad thai and pad seew you can find at any, this place serves a variety of other Thai rice and noodle dishes. Just read the menu to find out the differences between the items. I found the service to be very nice and helpful in explaining the differences in their dishes.

I definitely recommend this place if you're in the area and craving Thai food, but if you don't want to deal with the headache of parking around here, you can check out their other branch too. But I personally found this one to be nicer.
author: Allen C.

description: We came in for a quick dinner on a Saturday night. The food was okay however the place is really cramped with limited seating. The hostess is rude and loud. Not recommended if you are looking for a quiet and relaxed dinner experience.
author: Aditi S.

description: Haven't been here I years and just came back with some friends. Used to like this place but I was very disappointed in my experience this time. They messed up my order. Even thought they offered to fix it I just decided to take it anyways to save some time. After that, however, they took about 20 min to charge the bill. Once we got the check the gratuity didn't match what they had originally written on the receipt. They tried to explain that the math added up and that the total was what was written on the original receipt but based on my calculations they charged a 20% gratuity.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
I was hanging out at Golden Gate park with my sister and family. It came time for lunch, so I looked to my Yelp app and found this restaurant close by. We walked over and were handed both menus and the specials. This is what we ordered:
Calamari salad - grilled marinated calamari with flavorful veggies and a vinaigrette dressing, the calamari was cooked perfectly and was very fresh
Coconut curry noodles - vermicelli noodles, with chicken, shrimp, & vegetables. The sauce was similar to pad Thai but less sweet with an added mild curry coconut flavor, it was fantastic!
Chicken satay wraps - these were a Thai version of lettuce wraps, the dish came with butter lettuce as the wrap, with satay chicken skewers, a cucumber salad, vermicelli noodles, bean sprouts, cilantro, Thai basil, and peanut sauce. This dish was also very good, try it if you can!

Portion size was generous, the service was attentive, and prices were reasonable. If I'm back in this area I would definitely come here again.
author: Britt C.

description:
Marnee Thai was good, very good in fact, but not impressive enough to live up to the tremendous amount of buzz surrounding this popular spot in the Inner Sunset.  One reviewer from Check Please was so thrilled about this place that it ended up in my bookmarks for months.

Overall, I think Marnee deserves its recognition as one of the better Thai spots in San Francisco, though some level of inconsistency is making me hold back that final star; well above average, but not the best.
 
The best part about Marnee is the menu, which features a diverse array of creative and affordable dishes - $8 on average and about $12-$14 for specials. 

Dishes arrived fast, but really could have been warmer.  The Angel Wings were great.  Though the meat could have been more tender, the sauce had a tremendous amount of garlic kick and the overall flavor was more sweet (perhaps too sweet) than spicy.  

The highlight of the meal was the mango fried rice...probably the best fried rice dish I've had.  The sweet mango flavor complemented the hint of saltiness of the rice.  Love it.   The mango salad with soft shell crab was also all sorts of amazing and the mangoes and salad leaves were fresh...the soft shell crab was not to be missed.

I wasn't a big fan of the Tom Ka soup, though I realize that it's one of the more popular items.  Perhaps the biggest disappointment was the fried banana w/ coconut ice cream dessert - a dessert I always order.  The bananas were dry, dry, dry and overcooked, plus the coconut ice cream was way too creamy, that it didn't really melt into the fried bananas.  The bananas were also on the cool side.  In retrospect, I should have ordered the sticky rice.

I'm not sure I'll be back.  The Inner Sunset area is full of amazing choices.  But I'm glad that I finally had the chance to try this place.
author: Angel S.

description: Angel wings and green curry all the way! Awesome Thai food! Also had Thai fried rice along with pad thai. Visiting my daughter and she took us here and we really enjoyed it.
author: Neal R.

description:
Excellent Thai spot in the inner (and central) sunset. It's my go-to thai in the area. 

You won't be disappointed!
author: Melanie M.

description:
We visited on a weekend afternoon, after hearing good reviews.  However, I was very disappointed.  Our pad kee mao was the wost pad kee mao I've ever had: soggy noodles drenched in sweet chili sauce.  The coconut pancake was interesting, but very sweet for an appetizer.

Will not return.
author: L.L. M.

description: If you're craving Thai in the inner sunset don't bother going anywhere else. This is a good place to branch out from your typical Thai favorites. Make sure to get the coconut rice cakes- they come sizzling in a hot cast iron skillet.
author: Stephen M.

description:
Service was quite slow, but I liked food I had.  It's in a great location; we walked from California Academy of Sciences.

Fresh Egg Roll (V): It was good though sauce can be less.
Noodle and Curry w/Prawns: Wide noodles. It was very tasty.
Fried rice: It was delicious.
Roasted Duck: My favorite of the night.
Red Curry w/Chicken: It was ok.
Tofu Praram (V): It was good but a little too sweet on it's own.  It's good with other dishes.
author: Akiko O.

description:
Dropped in for lunch with a buddy on Fleet-week Saturday; got stuck in traffic for about 3 additional hours on the way home --- long story, another time.

We started off with the potstickers which were plated with a nice twist --- they were served on peanut sauce and was served with sour-cream on top. It was tender, succulent, and very satisfying.

The spicy angel wings were really good too, though I'd have to say the ones at "SO" was slightly better (as well as a little spicier). It was sticky, spicy, and sweet and the fried herbs on it added to the kick (not sure if they were curry-leaves)

The Thai Chicken fried rice was really good and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The chicken, though, stood alone as it tasted like thai bbq chicken without really melding into the rest of the dish. But that didn't take anything away from the dish

The chicken massuman curry was pretty good but we wished there were more chicken in it --- half the serving all turned out to be potatoes.

Finally, the Pad Thai was a tad disappointing and didn't measure up; it's counterpart from Osha Thai tasted way better.

Our lunch for two (including tax and tips) at $60 was a little too expensive.
author: Umesh T.

description: Tried this place on a whim. The wait was long (but totally worth it). Food tasted fresh. Great flavor. Portions are small though. Overall great service.
author: Julie L.

description:
This has gotta be my new fav Thai place! Usually Thai places have the same formula in terms of curry, noodles or stir fries. 

But, this place has such a rustic charm to it. The food and service is impeccable! The menu is pretty diverse too.

I will be back and absolutely recommend it!
author: Akshaya M.

description:
This was a very disappointing experience. The appetizers were tasteless (spring & fresh roll) and the roti pratha were so oily that it was impossible to eat. 

The curries were not good at all, very liquid and blend. 

We will not be back. There are a ton of other great thai restaurants, especially in the Peninsula and in South Bay. We will not be back.
author: Kartage B.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco, hands down!! Would highly recommend to anyone. Amazing food and fantastic service.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Excellent food. Every dish we ordered was excellent. The salad recommended by the waiter was the only not 5 star dish - had way too many peanuts and not enough dressing. 
Four stars are for service. Although very friendly it is not prompt. Waiter tired really hard to please customers but I think she was the only one waiting on the whole place. Our water glasses were never refilled.
author: Jada C.

description:
As a frequent visitor of Thai restaurants, I must say, this may just be my new favorite of them all! Wow...just wow.

The place is small so there may be a little bit of a wait, but it's totally worth it! I came for lunch on a weekend and the wait was only 10 minutes, so not bad at all, especially because my friends and other Yelpers rate this place so highly.

The staff was friendly, quick, efficient. The prices are comparable to other Thai restaurants, and the food, is just delicious like no other! They have a great menu, lots of options, specials, and mouth watering desserts! We got the Phad Kee Mao (AMAZING!), Pad See Ewe (YUM!), and Red Curry (DEELISH!). Packed with flavor, made very well, fresh, and excellent quality ingredients. All of their amazing reviews speak the truth!
author: Akvile D.

description:
BEST THAI FOOD EVER!!!!!!!

Tom Yum Soup: SOOO sour, soooo perfect! There was a bunch of chicken and mushrooms too. Awesome.

Pad Thai: SOOOO saucy and delicious!

CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!!!!
author: Annie K.

description:
Not impressed by Marnee. My favorite Thai restaurant closed after a 20+ year run and left me wondering who was going to fill that void when I visit the city. Spent a great deal of time searching online and was led across town to the Inner Sunset District to Marnee Thai.

Yes, they had a duck salad (Larb) my favorite dish but it just wasn't as good. Anytime a place 'adds' something to a classic dish, like Marnee did by adding iceberg lettuce it cheapens the meal and the whole dining experience. No peanuts either.

The beef in the beef dish didn't taste fresh, and the portion size wast adequate for the price. Not everyone in San Francisco is a tourist and I usually find a great place by going where the locals go. In this case it wasn't the right choice so I will continue my search.

Oh how I miss you Little Thai (J2 Thai).
author: Nick W.

description:
This little restaurant is very cozily nestled to the almost the point where it's invisible. I came at 2:30, so the noise was quiet. The staff were friendly, and the decor was charming. I was very impressed with the time it took to bring out our food. About 5 minutes for the appetizer, and about 7 for the entrees. My only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is they charge extra for a bowl of rice which I took for granted that the rice came with the meal. I don't know if it's common in San Francisco (I'm not from there), but nevertheless it was something new to me.
The food was amazing. I had the pad Thai with beef, pretty standard, and it matched my favorite place to go to for pad Thai.

This is a great place to stop by for a delicious bite!!!
author: Julia V.

description: Well I ordered 3 items for take out, after I struggled to find parking in the area, I was soo excited to try their food: yellow curry, veg dish and roasted chicken.  I found out meat was rather dry on both curry and chicken... Veg was ok, it was my first take out, I may order something different next time
author: Takae K.

description:
It's an ok place.. I have a " rule" to eat only at places 4 stars and above, so I won't waste my calories budget on not so good food. That's why I got kind of disappointed at this restaurant. 
It is a 3 star place.. I gave it a 2 star so it brings down an unfair"4 star" to two 3? It make sense in my mind...
author: Lila Z.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here because we heard this place was amazing. Plus it had good Yelp reviews. Thank you Yelp for telling us about the ANGEL WINGS - so delicious and a definite must have. 

The place was a little smaller than what I expected, and if I had never heard about it and passed by on the street I would've thought it was a hole in the wall. 

We received quick and friendly service. The food however, was so-so. Except for the wings, we weren't dazzled. Probably won't come here again. I will miss the angel wings. :C
author: Cindy K.

description: The wait was Not long and they did GREAT SERVICE !  Food was amazing !!! And will go back !!! Follow me on IG : TouristMafia
author: Tourist Traveler T.

description: went here on all the glowing reviews. Had the Pad See Ew beef. It had almost zero flavor. For me Pad See Ew and Pad Thai are the basics for all other dishes. Will not be coming back.
author: David I.

description: Pad Thai is very good. Downside, there was a lady with big proportions who was very rude. Ironically, the food proportions were small. Good place for thai food all in all. P.S. you have to spend at least $7 to receive service .
author: Eric Y.

description: Ordered on postmates. I got the pad thai and the noodles are pretty bland but still sweet (maybe because I ordered it not spicy... I like to add my own spices on the side). The portion was bigger than most of the other thai food places I've tried. But their thai tea was in the smallest cup ever... I dont think it was even worth $3.
author: S S.

description: The Thai food was great. I came here 5 times already. Price was ok. I wish their table space in between is bigger.
author: Mila N.

description: great! Love the pad thai and spicy coconut soup!
author: Joey N.

description:
Mellow green curry + unassumingly plain Jane pad see ew = meh, mind unblown.

The green curry wasn't very spicy (had a very slight kick), this is a very safe choice if you're afraid of the spice but want to try something new. You'd have to like eggplant too. I seriously love the 5 peas for garnish. Cute. le sigh...I never seem to have enough rice for all dat sauwce!

$5 Singha beer = tasty light beer + the only choice you have + have another one, the food'll taste better!

Service = exceeded expectations made up for the food.
author: Thu T.

description:
This is place is fantastic. The sauce on the table is so good, you can have it as an appetizer. Its an awesome blend of sweet, sour and tinge of spiciness.

#62 string beans tofu and #25 prawn in green sauce are so good, you want to keep ordering them.. .. All that with Singha beer makes it a very satisfying meal.
author: Mayank R.

description:
Pros: The food tasted great.
Cons: We came at lunch, and the waitress brought us only the dinner (more expensive) and specials menu, until we asked for the lunch menu (and then she brought them reluctantly and seemed a bit surly). A couple of hours after eating, we both felt stuffed up -- the waitress said that the oyster sauce did not have flour (we don't react well to gluten), so maybe the food had MSG in it? Six hours later now, the effect seems to be wearing off.
author: Alissa F.

description: Delicious. Great service. My favorite is the thai basil with minced chicken and their papaya salad. I've ordered delivery from them 3x in one week!
author: Lien T.

description:
Pad see ew is way better than the ones I've tried. And I get it everywhere. I try to deviate from my normal order but every time I order something different I always wish I just stuck to good ol' pad see ew.

But here, the portions are large and the sauce is delicious! I asked for it spicy but I the overpowering taste of the savory sauce was delish. And the price is reasonable, considering typical San Francisco restaurants-in-touristy-areas prices.
author: Daina H.

description: I had one of the best Thai food here. Being a vegan it's difficult to get a nice taste. I really loved Thai samosas, pad Thai and pad mee korat. Must definitely try that if your vegan and craving for really tasty food.
author: Mahek C.

description: The best Thai restaurant hands down!  I've eaten here a couple of times and the food never disappoint me.  I love the chan pad poo (crab fried noodle) here, there were a generous amount of crab meat and the flavor is just perfect.  I've also tried other dishes including their curry which is amazing.  Marnee Thai is a small restaurant so expect a wait, but it is worth it.
author: Len L.

description:
The place is very crowded and not very clean. The floor was slippery from oil. The food was not very good. They were generally salty and had odd ingredients. Definitely not authentic Thai. 

Our group of 10 had, among other items, Pad-See-Ew chicken and beef. These came in very small amounts with barely any vegetable. Worse yet, they were made with American broccoli instead of Chinese broccoli. We also had Larb, also made incorrectly as a salad with chopped up iceberg lettuce and no mint or ground rice. 

The Sriracha was sour and watered down. Yuck!

Not going back.
author: Moni K.

description:
Normally when I come here the place is packed.  But today I was pleasantly surprised to see only one other table occupied when we walked in for lunch.  It was a little after they opened up.  We were told to pick any seat we wanted, so we sat away from the couple who arrived before us.

I wanted a light lunch, so we passed on the appetizers.  We ordered the mango fried rice with pork off the specials menu.  I'll eat anything with mangoes in it.  Then we had the chicken pad thai.  

The mango fried rice arrived with plenty of mangoes, which was great.  It also arrived topped with cashews, and both of us really like cashews.  I think I liked it more than the pad thai.  But the pad thai was also good, I loved the chopped peanuts on top.

Service was pretty good, portion size was a little larger than I expected.  All in all, it was a really good meal.  Nothing off-the-scale or OMG good, but I will come back again and again.  Just a tad on the pricey side.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description:
Loved the tasty green and red curry with thai fried rice! Potstickers on the other hand were quite oily with loads of butter!

Highly recommend the place for dishes other than the potsticker!
author: A S.

description: Good food. Two locations. I usually do takeout. But eating in is fine too. I love pad Thai. Always. But it isn't great everywhere. Here I love it. Same with spring rolls. Service is fast.
author: Marian G.

description:
Is there an option for six stars?
Pros: relatively cheap (60 for four with an appetizer)
Food was amazing. I had the red curry with duck and I need to put more in or around my mouth ASAP.
We sat immediately at about 130 pm.

Cons: does not compute.
author: David R.

description:
Service staff was always busy, but took reminding quite kindly. 

Chicken wings were an absolute delight.
author: Jason T.

description: Excellent! This is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood. The Thai food here is well-balanced, unlike a lot of other American Thai restaurants--the dishes aren't cloying. Lots of fresh vegetables and fruit, a great, big menu with lots of options and enticing specials. The curried mouse fish dishes are always exquisite.
author: X-topher B.

description:
Walked by this place a million times and finally tried it last night. Marnee Thai has authentic Thai food that is surprisingly delicious. 
I had the Special which was an Avocado Salad with Soft Shell Crab (which is the green mango salad plus avocado for no additional cost, and the avocado added a lot to this dish, well worth it). The dish had a very mild zing which the avocado toned down and the acidity of the dish made it perfect. 
I would definitely come back when I'm in the area (I'm usually there if I visit Golden Gate Park. Last night I was visiting the Academy of Science for their Thursday Nightlife.) thanks Marnee Thai for a delicious dinner!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great service, kind, and food not bad at all. I have a food allergy and they were very respectful and accommodating to it. Waiter forgot one of the things we ordered but it's okay because we were full.
author: Jessie A.

description:
Came here by recommendation of my tattoo artist down the street from here. Got seated promptly and ordered the green curry with beef. Food came out quick considering I was the only one here. 
The green curry came out in a tiny bowl and contained a lot more beef and eggplant than I thought! The beef itself was tender and juicy. The eggplant was okay. The curry was spicy and flavorful, just the way it should be! 
I wish I had ordered rice along with the curry, however I'm on budget currently. That was the only downside, having to buy the rice separately which is standard of Thai restaurants. 
I hope to try the mango fried rice next time Marnee!
author: Tram N.

description:
A friend recommend this place after we couldn't get into Lime Tree (since they were open later in the day). Got seated pretty quickly and had our order in before several other parties came in.

The two things that stood out as to why this place is getting 1.5 stars (rounded up to two) is:
- Our food took longer than it should to come out. Parties who ordered after us had their food come out much more quicker than ours. It doesn't take too long to make curry and fried noodles and the place wasn't so busy that servers couldn't take orders, so why was there a long delay? My friend flat out told the server that our food still haven't arrived and he needed to move his car because it was parked in a time restricted area. Maybe two minutes after he left, our food came, with our server apologizing.
- The check. What I noticed while I was paying for the bill was that what I received initially was not the same after my card was swiped. The only reason why I caught this is because I was going to tip them the 15% tip, since the food wasn't bad and saw the 15% tip was around $4. After I got back my card and the slip to sign off, the 15% tip suggestion was up to $5. No, no and no. I only tip the price of all the food we were served, not the taxes that I had to pay along with it. I didn't mention this to the restaurant because this was something within my control, that I was able to control the tip amount, so I wrote down the original tip I was planning to give them. 

With that said, please check all your receipts before tipping, and don't be shy to tell your server that your food is taking longer than usual to come to your table.
author: Tom T.

description:
Service was absent.  Food was, at best, mediocre.  Customer service was terrible and we were not even served water.   We ordered a  beef salad, chicken satay, eggplant basil tofu,  and rice.

The beef salad I had here was the WORST I have ever tasted at a Thai restaurant. Although the beef was tender, it was much too salty for my taste. The dressing was very lime-y and salty, yet, it heavily lacked in any traditional Thai flavor. It also had a roasted, ground rice powder dusted on top of the salad, which I have never seen done before.  The rice powder did give the salad an interesting flavor and texture, but did not belong in a Thai beef salad IMO.

The chicken satay was just okay. It was not the worst I've had, but too sweet for my taste and also lacked in flavor. Nothing much else to say. 

The eggplant basil tofu was just edible. I think it also lacked in flavor and there was not enough basil or sauce in the dish. 

Rice was unexciting.  Also a bit dry.  Seems like not a high quality rice. 

Portions are a little bit small. Bathroom was gross with stick floors. Glad we did not order more than we did. I do not understand why such good reviews for this place. 

Overall,  food is edible, but would not go here again.
author: Anna N.

description:
