This time I went on a friend's request and I swear to God this would be my last time. The last two recent times I went for dinner, I had terrible stomach cramp for the whole night with some really bad food poisoning. They are definitely putting something seriously unhealthy in their food.

I personally do not have anything against dogs but it freaks the hell out of me when people bring dogs in at the coffee shops or in the food aisles of a grocery store.  But today Marnee Thai showed me a complete new picture! 

They allowed this woman's dog inside the restaurant. She even let the dog sit on the sofa bench right next to the customers. None of the servers spoke up or asked her leave the dog outside. They were as if waiting on the guests to complaint and then they would make the move. Or would they? But seriously, what kind of a restaurant let dogs in and then allows it to sit next to the customers?!

This place has changed A LOT. The recent bad reviews and their really poor health inspection score reveals a lot about the quality of their food and service. Stop going to this place and report them as soon as you find out anything unhealthy and unhygienic going on in this place.
author: Rabab M.

description:
I will probably never eat here again.

A few months ago, I came with a few friends and we ordered angel wings (pretty good, I would recommend this) and my beef pad see ew came out shortly afterwards. I forked through it looking for the beef, but only found chicken. Then, I notified the waitress who informed me that it was accidentally for another table and I watched her take my plate and gave it to a different customer. The same plate which I put my used fork all through it. I was appalled and disgusted. Strike one.

I went again last week hoping that maybe it was a one time thing and plus I really wanted thai food. We were seated and the restaurant was totally empty but they were so slow to serve us. My friend didn't like the lemons in her water and scooped it out with her used spoon and a few minutes later, the waitress came and took the spoon and placed it back in the pile of clean spoons. DISGUSTING! Strike two.

Don't get me wrong. I love the food here. However, I can't look past the dining experience I had here and I'm not going to wait and see what strike three has in store for me. 

Never again.
author: Pamela B.

description:
I was looking forward to eating here based on my boyfriend's recommendation but was disappointed. 
The potstickers with curry sauce from the seasonal menu were underwhelming, under-seasoned. 
The Pad Thai was very good, but there wasn't very much chicken in it. 
I ordered the Pad Prig Khing which was very good, flavors spot on, but again, only 3-4 small pieces of chicken among all the green beans.
Service was poor. We were sat by the door and asked to be seated further back as it was cold and the restaurant was empty, but instead they only closed the door, which still continued to open and make me cold the whole meal. Also, after signing the check the server immediately swept to the table to collect the receipt and ask for the other copy while my boyfriend was still in the bathroom.
Because the flavors of the entrees were good, I'm hoping it's a location thing and I would give the other location a try for sure.
author: Jeff D.

description:
Worst experience at a restaurant ever; this was happened last month but I didn't have time to write this till now.

So my husband found good reviews about this place so that we came all the way from South Bay and brought some friends here to try it out.

We arrived at 6:40pm and got seated in the back with no windows, tight space and no air; we placed the order by 6:50pm and was excited for our food. The chicken wings and beers were quick to serve within 6min; the chicken wings were just ok, too much sauce for our taste, didn't wow us. 

Now, started at this point, we were just sitting there and watching other tables getting their food and eating, we had NO FOOD after that chicken wings at 7:40pm! My husband was pissed because our friends' kids started getting really hungry; he located our server and asked when we will get our food, or we'll leave if takes too long, server said she'll check and get back to us. Another 15min passed by, server didn't come back to us with any update at all! So my husband went to the front and said that we're done, just charge us the wings and beers; server finally came to our table to apologize and said no charge to us on the wings and beers as apology and said that kitchen was busy... well, we told her that other tables who came later than us were eating and in fact, almost done with eating their food! Right before we left, server added "are you sure you guys don't want any food, I can ask the chef to cook them for you right now." Seriously?! Did you not do that when we first asked at 7:40pm?! Ridiculous! 

So we ended up leaving the restaurant at 8:15pm and we didn't have much time choosing another decent restaurant since they all close at 9:00pm (mostly); hence, we just chose whatever was opened nearby. Not recommended!
author: Sammy C.

description:
When I first moved out to the Bay Area, I hadn't ventured to the Inner Sunset for food...I was sadly disappointed by the lack of thai restaurants that knew how to make delicious, mostly authentic, and SPICY thai food...enough to make me sweat, even a little bit. 

One day by chance a few friends and I came upon Marnee Thai, and decided to check it out. This has by far become my favourite thai restaurant in the whole of the Bay Area. The staff is always very timely, efficient, and polite - and the prices aren't half bad either. 

Big props on the Pad Kaprow...with Tofu. I'm not even vegetarian or vegan and I love this dish, the tofu is tender and seasoned well, the spice factor is a big thumbs up. When you ask for spicy they make it spicy.
author: Sara M.

description: - Yellow curry: sucks
author: Jon P.

description:
I absolutely adore Marnee Thai and May, the owner.

First: food. Delicious. Traditional. Something for everyone. I particularly like the bbq chicken with a side of healthy brown rice. Their corn fritters are scrumptious as well as their rolls and pretty much everything I've tried on the menu that's served with beef, duck or chicken.

Second: May. Be nice to her. Very, very nice to her. You'll know it's her when you meet her. If/when she senses good vibes from you, she'll tell you your fortune - for free. Her sixth sense is real. 

May rocks and so does the food her husband cooks.
author: Meredith R.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco! The first time I ate here, I came with the owner's nephew haha so he knew exactly what to order! This location is pretty small and cozy but the service is fast. Go for an early dinner if you can because it gets very full fast! There is another location on Irving Street in Outer sunset, but I think this one is better! 

Stir-Fried Stewed Pork Belly was delicious. 

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HOR MOK. Which is available on weekends only. It is a steamed snapper in curry mousse with cabbage and Thai basils, served in a banana leaf bowl. And it is AMAZING. The curry mousse is nothing I've ever had before and it is so smooth and melts in your mouth. The flavor is excellent. Not too spicy and the snapper is very smooth as well. I love the presentation. If you have seen the Marnee Thai Cookbook Thai Cuisine Beyond Curry, by Chef Chai Siriyarn, then it actually has a recipe for it!  Actually, everything in the cookbook is in the restaurant and they look exactly the same (well, duh haha)

For dessert, of course the mango and sticky rice is good. 

I posted pics!
author: Amy Y.

description:
Reasonably vegan friendly restaurant with a long narrow dining area by the kitchen in the front and another dining area in the back.  Friendly staff and delicious food - I love the tofu "angel wings" - delicious.  

This is one of my "go to" spots when I have a museum day - though the staff are very helpful in giving a headsup on the ingredients, I was also disappointed by the lack of curry without fish - please fix that soon so I can come try it and increase my rating!
author: Jenn C.

description: We ordered Pad Thai, Green Curry, Tom Yum Soup and Summer Rolls. The bill was $46.00. I will not be coming back bc I can get bigger portions for the same price somewhere else. Good if you eat alone. Not good if you have 3 or more people. Curry was runny and server forgot the pad Thai.
author: Ruby B.

description:
I really sick with busy time attitude,I got really cold curry and also that day is really busy, then they just give me tastes like curry water.i order soft shell crab mango salad, they don't even ask before they served shrimp one@@
I just don't like the pushed style.
author: Lala L.

description:
So delicious!

In particular, the tom kha soup, and whatever your server recommends from the specials menu!
author: Liz H.

description:
Started with the Soft Shell Crab and Spring Roll appetizers.  Both were great.  I was impressed that in a town known for Dungeness crabs they prepared this so well.

Main courser included standard Pad Thai w/prawns.  Well executed with above avg noodles.  Second came Beef Panang, which spice wise was perfect, but quality of the beef could use upgrade to my taste.  Third was Pork Belly which was very very good.  Entrees were washed down with authentic Thai Iced Coffee.

Good meal at a fair price.  I recommend this if you are on Irving St.  Staff was very nice to deal with, good pace and not obtrusive.
author: Mark R.

description:
This is located in a really cute area of San Francisco. We ordered a lot of different dishes to share and all of them were delicious. 

It was also really reasonably priced and the staff was pleasant. No complaints.
author: Erin L.

description:
The food here is amazing. And if I were to give it a rating based on that, it would be five stars. 

The two star rating is because of the customer service. 

I've been here twice. The first time was great; a couple friends came to SF to visit and we decided to try out Marnee Thai. We were all astounded by the quality of the food so we agreed that before they left, we would have our last meal at the same place so they can take some home. Our second visit had less than adequate service, and is the reason that I will not be coming back. 

The service was very slow, which was surprising because it wasn't as busy as the first time we were there. We had been sitting for approximately 10-15 minutes before I tried to call the waiter, in which she responded "yeah I know hold on". She proceeded to talk to her coworker and laugh for another couple minutes before taking our order. Her attitude was very "stand off-ish". She consistently gave us the cold shoulder. When I said thank you, she hardly replied. The only commendable thing she did for us was refilling our waters, which she only did a couple times without asking. When we left, we provided her with a 10% tip. As I exited, she approached my friends and exclaimed that we "didn't tip her enough". That's where my frustration grew. Tips aren't handed out - tips are earned. They are earned through friendliness and good service, none of which she provided. I was surprised that she had the audacity to claim that she deserved more with the mediocre service she provided. 

Never have I ever been approached by waitress with so much attitude, demanding more than she deserved. 

Marnee Thai was an amazing restaurant, but my server, Ying, is the main reason I will advise against this establishment.
author: Jessica V.

description:
Was recommended Marnee Thai from a friend, so I came and tried it out. The food is good, but their service was mediocre. 

Pad Kee Mao: My brother and I both ordered this dish. This is our go to dish at a thai place. I ordered mine with shrimp and he ordered his with chicken. The flavor was pretty good. One of the better ones I've had. Although I wasn't really feeling the lettuce they put in this dish. There are so many variations to this dish and is always different at every place I go to. But overall the flavor was good. So good that my boyfriend kept eating my dish more than his own! They ended up giving my brother duck instead of chicken and when we told them, they weren't very nice about it. He was nice enough to not ask them to remake the dish and just asked for a side of chicken. But the waiter was a little rude about it. 

Green Curry: It tasted like any other green curry. Nothing too special, but still a good dish. 

Spicy squid (Don't remember the actual name): Very good dish! The squid was cooked very well. It was soft and tender. Great flavor without being too salty. 

Coconut water: Thought they would give you fresh coconut water, but they don't. The drink was way too sweet. But they did add coconut flesh to it. 

Parking in this area is pretty hard to find. So just beware that you'll have to circle around a bit before finding one.
author: Chris K.

description:
Can't believe I've lived in the neighborhood about 9 months and hadn't tried this place till yesterday.

I've seen some complaints on here about service, and I can't speak to that, because I took my food to go, but the gentleman who helped me order was very nice and gave me recommendations. They were busy at 5:30 PM on a Saturday (which I think says a lot) but he took time to answer my questions.

I ordered steamed snapper over cabbage leaves and a curry mousse served in a banana leaf bowl, and a side of brown rice. The food was really exceptional to my tastes. The curry was the perfect amount of spice, the basil in it was delicious, the texture was great, the fish was perfectly steamed, the cabbage leaves were tender and almost tasted like artichoke...I really enjoyed the dish. At $13.50, I felt like it was quite reasonable for snapper.

I look forward to going back to try other dishes and see what the eat-in experience is like, but based on what I ate, I highly recommend...
author: Jennie S.

description:
Thought the inner sunset location was better than the one in the outer sunset.  

Ordered the Spicy Angel Wings as suggested.  I really enjoyed the flavor, especially bc it provided a "kick" to every bite.  I'd say it's a must order and I also dare to say that the wings might even be better than the San Tung Chicken wings.  

In addition, also ordered the Red Curry with Chicken and the Roasted Pork Fried Rice.  
The Red Curry was aiiite, nothing too spectacular (could've been a little bit for flavorful imo), but I really enjoyed the Roasted Pork Fried Rice.  It was very flavorful.  In fact, I didn't even have to use any of the hot sauce to compliment it.
author: Joshua P.

description:
Love the fact that this location is walkable from Golden Gate park. My boyfriend and I came here around 1 on a Saturday prior to seeing an exhibit at the De Young. From the outside it looks like it will be a no frills take out kind of place. However, as soon as you walk in, you're greeted with delicious aromas and see the bustling dining scene going on further back in the restaurant.

If I had to describe the service in one word, it would be efficient! These guys have it down in terms of prompt seating, prompt order taking and brining the check/taking your payment. They were also extremely friendly and cool, which gave the place a nice neighborhood type of vibe.

The decor was warm and cozy, but simple. The tables are all close to one another, so be ready to hear whatever other conversations are going on around you, for better or worse.

On to the food. I got the vegetarian red curry and brown rice. The curry was delicious-just the right medium kick to it. The actual vegetables seemed fresh and were colorful and of good quality-this included zucchini, broccoli, baby corn and a nice mix of peppers. AND they didn't skimp on the red and green peppers like some other Thai places do. I was slightly disappointed in the tofu that came in the dish-there were only 3 pieces in it and they were a little oily. However the curry itself and the veggies were so good, it more than made up for it.
My boyfriend got some kind of sweet and sour chicken, sharing my brown rice. It seemed like a colorful plate of veggies with his chicken and he enjoyed it.

Definitely would come back here if I were in the area again. Great value for good portions and fresh delicious Thai!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Best thai in town! Tried different dishes every time I went there and never got disappointed. And the have the best desert ... Fried roti with homemade coconut ice cream!!! It's so delicious!! 
Also try their coconut juice ... Really yummy!
author: S C.

description:
Great pad kee Mao (not many veggies and only a couple of cubes of tofu - but still good) 
Friendly service
author: Zoe D.

description:
Guys. The best Thai food we ever had.

Starting from the Imperial Rolls, which surprised us with the pumpkin, we then went for Mussamun Chicken Curry and Pad Pra Ram. The spinach are really fresh and the chicken was tasty. And don't let me talk about the peanuts. Sweet and peanuty. Still drooling.

The staff is nice and smiley.
And it's really close to Golden Gate park so you can digest the food after. Give it a try.
author: Paolo I.

description: I love the food! Don't get me wrong but making a pickup order at 530 for 6p and waiting 25 more minutes is really unacceptable. No apologies or compromises, not even a glass of water while I waited quietly and sighed after you told me another 10 min (I was a few early early) and still waited.
author: Christopher V.

description: It was a good time.  They didn't deliver on the level of spice I wanted, but I was still satisfied.  The Yelp photo looks more upscale, but it's really casual inside.  The staff were friendly and quick and based on the food and experience, I'd come back.  I think I had the Pad Nor Mai with flat noodles.
author: Shaun W.

description:
I'm surprised I haven't written a review here. This place is the best Thai restaurant in the Sunset. Seriously, awesome Pad Thai, fried rice, all of the curry is delicious. They have the specialty menus that change every once in a while and my advice is to order from that unique menu. Even just one entree. Every time I've been there and ordered from the specialty menu, I was never disappointed. 

Sometimes there's a line, but I've come during the day on weekends trying to cure a hangover, dinners both during the week and on weekends, and random lunches when I have a late start for school and I've never waited over 10 minutes. I'm pretty sure they take reservations as well, but I've never called in nor have I ever needed one. If you're ever in the city, whether it be to explore Golden Gate Park or just enjoy the inner sunset community, pop in and check it out.
author: Cody M.

description:
People...can anyone find an updated health code rating since they were shut down? Isn't anyone else wondering about this?

I can't, and it disturbs me that people still go here after it failed and was shut down :(
http://sfist.com/2013/04/04/marnee_thai_shut_down_for_abysmal_h.php
author: Lauren C.

description:
10 stars!!!!!!

Ooops, fine then, five stars. But, really, their "Red Snapper Curried Mousse in Banana Leaf (Haw Mok Pla)" is 10 stars worthy.

I can't say anything about the other items on their menu because the three times that I have been there, I've ordered Haw Mok Pla because it is soooooooo delicious that I crave it before going to Marnee Thai and for days afterwards.
author: Leena P.

description:
We checked out this place after a lot of people on Check Please Bay Area said it had really good dishes.

The food was not that great, edible at most. 

The pad thai tasted like any other I had tried, and the so called "really excellent" harmak (I think that's how it's spelled) was much smaller than expected and nothing special. 

Their street cakes were not bad, kinda custardy. 

Service was good, they were attentive enough, and although I liked the dessert, we never went back there.
author: Bahar A.

description: Went on a busy Saturday night, only waited about 10 minutes, not bad, but the food was just ok, nothing grand.  Had their popular chicken wings and they were just ok.  Sorry to all of you who love this place, but I've had better Thai food, WAY, way better. The plus, attentive service that will take your glass of beer away even before you've finished it.
author: Dinora G.

description: This place freaking blew my mind. I am from Southeast Asia so I know my Thai food. This place is incredibly authentic and has the best Thai food I have ever tasted.
author: Kaicheng L.

description: Food is OK not as good as before.  Maybe because I went on a night chef Chai wasn't there?  My pad khee Mao was too oily.  The panang was good.  Prices are OK...
author: Sandra S.

description: This was such a nice little restaurant.  It was an easy walk from The California Academy of Sciences and the Japanese Tea Garden.  By the time we got here we were hungry, so I ordered the Tom Ka soup with Chicken, a Beef Salad, and a Thai Iced Coffee.  The service was fine and we sat at the bar.  We happened into the place at about 2pm, so it was busy but no wait for a seat.  The food was wonderful. The soup had a great flavor and lots of chicken.  The salad was fresh and the beef was super flavorful.  Next time I go to SF, I am heading here for some great Thai Food.
author: Lyssa D.

description: My friends and I went to Marnee Thai last minute on a Wednesday night. We were pleasantly surprised by the food and service given that we didn't do any research on the restaurant, besides finding the place.  I have tried many Thai restaurants and my favorite one has been in Los Angeles, where I had lived most of my life, BUT Marnee Thai has become my new favorite Thai restaurant. I will definitely be coming back in and hope to share the same experience with my family when they visit form Los Angles.
author: Karina R.

description:
We had a terrific meal here last night. Loved the Tom Yum soup - could have had two orders - best we're had anywhere in the Bay area!  The fried tofu and spinach, and beef satay were both excellent. 

We lived in Asia for nearly nine years and traveled to Thailand often. We miss those authentic flavors here in North America. Marnee is as close as we have found to what we experienced in Thailand. 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
author: Drew S.

description: I love thai food and eat it often. I got the pad ke mao with chicken and spicy! It was really good.  But what stood out the most to me was their angel wings.  Perfectly crisp, delicious sauce and had the perfect spice to it.  I will be back!
author: Adrianna A.

description: Well service is unappealing and the establishment should be inspected (it's smells weird, dirty and the water smells like poo). I wouldn't come back here for my Thai cravings
author: Claudia A.

description:
Dear God what happened  to you? 
This used to be my favorite neighborhood Thai spot. Fresh flavors, good vibe, fair prices. Then I kinda neglected it in favor of easy (osha), authentic (lers ros), or the neighbors (Laotian, Vietnamese). 
Now I come back after a few years and do takeout...  And it's pretty weak. Pad see ew was soggy, lacking in flavor, and chock full of American broccoli. American?  Som tum was really bland. Green curry with Tofu was 1 dimensional and the Tofu was fried. Everyone knows that it should have been fresh Tofu. Even my kids dissed on the fried rice,which was seriously lacking in flavor. How could you mess that up? 
This has changed so much. New owner? New chef? Anyone know?
author: Al M.

description: The mango fried rice is absolutely absolutely absolutely my favorite plate in SF. I will even take it with the cockroaches. It's that good!
author: Julianna I.

description:
We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks. 

It's actually ridiculous that we've never been here before. This place is so close to our past and present apartment.

We came on something like a Tuesday night and this place was packed! Since we weren't prepared for this we very humbly took seats at the bar. My husband ordered a Thai Iced Tea and we ordered chicken satay as an appetizer. Delicious. For my entree I had the Lamb (Yellow) Curry. It was SO GOOD! It was something like $11.95 and of course it was so much food so I also got lunch for the next day.

The waitstaff was very accommodating and always filling up our water glasses. The food came out quickly and everything was tasty. We will make SURE we don't wait another two years to come here again!
author: Melissa N.

description:
They know their dishes are spicy so they are quick on refilling your water!  

We had the papaya salad (with deep fried crab) and it was delicious and refreshing.  

The angel wings - just as all the other reviews promise, are delicious and very very garlicy.

The hot cakes were ... well, HOT... but I'm no connoisseur of hot cakes and found them to be the least flavorful of everything we ate.

Pad thai - of course was solid.  

Tofu praram - in a peanut sauce over a bed of spinach was delicious ... especially for being vegetarian. 

Minus one star for being so slow on the desserts.  We got our ice cream right away ... but waited 10 minutes for our first sticky mango rice ... and then 5 more minutes for the last 2 orders.  Otherwise, service and food were solid!
author: Kathleen W.

description:
Love, love, love Marnee Thai. 

Really authentic, according to my Asian-American palate. Having only visited Thailand once, I can't say that I'm a Thai food expert, but I do know what I like! My top favorite Thai restaurants include standards such as : Krung Thai http://originalkrungthai.com/ (South Bay) and Thai Nakorn http://thainakornrestaurant.com/ (LA). 

Marnee Thai (both locations) are equally fantastic in their food. Decor and ambiance is a bit older at the Irving location. Food is superbly balanced in flavor with all of the sweet, sour, spicy, and savory components that I love about Thai food.

We always order the Hoa Mok fish curry, a red Panang curry with chicken or beef, a fried noodle dish; Pad Kee Mao, Pad See Ew, or Chan/Jan Pad Poo (garlic crab noodle). I also love the mango sticky rice for dessert. 

Service is great. Asian aunties are always so inviting and the staff are all generally friendly.

We threw a private party in the back at the 9th street location for about 25 people and the staff was great. The manager was easy to work with and accommodated our budget and menu choices. 

Only problem as is the problem in the CITY is parking.
author: Leah H.

description: I went to this restaurant for the first time last week with a couple of co-workers. One of my co-worker recommend this place and aslo a couple of dishes.  The Angel wings, beef salad, chef special pad thai. Everything was great the food had the right amount of spice! Its been a long time since i had good thai food :)
author: Lois C.

description: The service is prompt and polite. Be sure to try the specials, I ordered an entree but the specials looked really good. For a wednesday night at 10pm it they had a full house. The chef let us in a little after closing and thank goodness they did, theyre food and sauce is delicious!
author: Ariele L.

description:
First review of 2013 for a place I went to in 2013!  This year, I resolve to write my reviews as soon as I can.

If you have ever read my previous reviews of Thai restaurants you will know that the Boyfriend does not like Thai food.  So imagine my surprise when he asked to have it for dinner.

We started out with the Avocado salad which is pricey given it only had 3 prawns.  I couldn't taste the fried shallots or the toasted coconut but I did like the spicy dressing.  We then went on to the Hung Lay curry.  This is the only curry that didn't have coconut milk.  The pork belly was really tender & the curry was flavorful.  I know many people hate pineapple in savory dishes but the pineapple chunks in this dish were delicious as it soaked up the flavor of the curry.  In fact, i tis the pineapple that got the Boyfriend craving Thai food (we've had it once before).  We also had a Pad phed with chicken which was really spicy.  We finished with a Roti with coconut ice cream which was divine.  The ice cream was not too sweet, super creamy, & had chunks of coconut meat inside.  I really enjoyed the hot/cold sensation.

For whatever reason, it seems this location is more expensive than the Irving one.  Has anyone else noticed this?  Do they really have different prices?
author: Karen S.

description: My FAVORITE Thai restaurant in San Francisco! Love the Pad Thai, summer rolls, satay, yellow curry, and thai ice tea. Always a good experience.
author: Virginia C.

description: I love this little resturaunt, perfect for my budget and  ,very very high quality Thai food.Only draw back is the lack of parking.
author: Shauntik M.

description:
I have walked by this place too many times and my partner and I decided to finally go out to dinner here for valentines day : )

Service was quick but if you don't already know, please catch their attention by eye contact and a little Jedi mind trick, arm waving and the always trusted "excuse me" they were super friendly.  

The PANANG BEEF was really amazing. I'm a big fan of Panang beef and have eaten this around the city and home made and by far their recipes and quality of beef used tops them all! Enough beef for two to enjoy! The problem here like many other places is they charge for a side of white rice! Not cool. I prefer you charge me more for the beef or make that side of rice bigger. 

Their Pad Kee Mow is freaking delicious and even the basics like thai ice tea was perfect. Not too sweet and can actually taste the tea.

I will be going back cause that menu is pretty big!
author: Tavo P.

description:
I used to love coming here. The food was always good and service was good. One day, all of this changed. We came in and waited to get seated for about 30 minutes, when we previously had made a reservation. Strike 1. Our server came after about 45 minutes (I'm not even exaggerating) and looked annoyed when taking our order. Strike 2 and 2.5. I was staying positive because I knew good food was coming our way. When our food came, our sever literally tossed our food at us. Strike 3. We quickly ate the food and left. When I later called to complain, they said that no such thing could've happened and that I was lying, and thereafter hung up on me. 

I don't recommend coming here.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I am NOT returning again!

This place had been shut down by the city health department recently because of reason you can imagine with a typical restaurant. They just reopened again, i thought they deserved an second chance, but guess i was so wrong.

#1. waitress was a bit pushy (just like the boss lady, maybe that is must for working there) , without even finishing, they already gave you the bill, wanting to take away your plate and ask you to pay and leave. (btw, restaurant was half filled only)

#2. Portion decreased ALOT

#3. which was the biggest reason for me not returning. 

i had a dirty plate, as the waitress passing out the plate, she saw the dirty spot, hesitated not more,  instead of changing a new plate for me, she took out her filthy finger just went "weck", smudged off that dirty spot  right IN FRONT of me, can you believe it??? I was SHOCKED!!!! Yes, the dirt was gone, but a long ugly finger print was left instead on my plate.... OMG!!! Ms Marnee, you really need to learn better!!!
author: Jasmin Y.

description: Probably my favorite Thai place in SF so far. Love the pad kee mao, chicken larb, and soups-- especially the tom kha. It is always so busy here, for good reason, but it isn't a big restaurant to begin with so it's a somewhat cramped space. However, the service and food is definitely worth it. I've heard their other location (also in sunset area) is even better, so I'll have to check it out. As of right now, though, this is my go-to Thai place!
author: Jen W.

description: I love the food here, but they seem to have quality control issues. My entire family is currently dealing with food poisoning from a chicken mussaman curry. Not ok.
author: Komal B.

description:
Very good thai food. Probably one of the best in the city. Try the Mango rice with chicken - it's a little moist but phenomenal. If you like it spicy, just ad the hot sauce at the table - mmmmm delicious! The banana curry duck was also very good.

Call in advance. The lines can get long. May, the host doesn't smile, but he is very nice and tries to accommodate everyone. The tables are tight but the food makes it worth it!
author: Anwar H.

description:
Date night...almost, we had our oldest (11 year old) with us.  Our boy never had Thai food before so we wanted to introduce him to this cuisine.  We happened to be in the Sunset and I remember from YEARS (at least 15) ago that I went to Marnee Thai.  We were nearby, found parking... this could be a bit difficult. 

When you enter thru the doors, you are immediately hit with the fragrance of cooked Jasmine Rice....sooooo yummy.  We were greeted warmly and seated immediately...HINT....get there around 6ish (this was Thursday night).  Line starts forming around 6:30 - 7ish.

The only negative....they brought cold water to the table, after taking our orders...my wife asked for hot water (cold night outside)...the brought her the hot water, but took away the cold water....kind of strange there.

The waiter was really friendly and helpful.

Angle Wings (Appetizer) $7.95
The wings were of deep fried, no batter, this made the wings really crispy without being heavy.  It was then smothered in a chili sauce.  We ordered it mild, but that was bit too spicy for the child.  The wings were meaty and juicy...just watch out, wait till they cool a bit before biting in...first hand experience here.

Avocado Salad with Soft Shell Crab $12.95
The salad consisted of thinly sliced avocado strings (young fruit) over a bed of lettuce with fried soft shell crab sitting on top.  The vinaigrette was both sweet and tangy...this was a really good dish.

Mango Fried Rice with Duck $11.95
This was on the daily special menu, you can also order with chicken or beef or prawns...but I like slight gaminess of duck that seem to lend itself to sweet fruits like mango.  Most places chop up the duck or you have to actually hunt for it....here the pieces were large and generous...you can identify the individual ingredients of this dish.  This is a must order dish if you like to duck or want to try it.

OK - 3 people...1 salad, 1 appetizer, 1 main course...still hungry?  We wanted to share and just try a sampling without going over board...this actually held us over pretty well...we had to save room for DESSERT!!

Sticky Rice with Mango $5.50
The rice was cooked in either cane sugar or another sweetener...yummy!!  The mangos were not mushy and was a good contrast to the rice.  Need to eat this right away, do not give the rice a chance to sit around too long.  The rice was warm, if it got a bit colder, the kernels become a bit toothy.

Sticky Black Rice with Coconut Ice Cream $5.25
Trust me!! If you like to try a dessert out of the ordinary...this is the dish for you.  The rice is black (looks like wild rice), it was cooked in the same sweet concoction as the rice for the Rice and Mango dish.  For this one, if you can resist, let the ice cream melt a bit before digging in.

The Restroom:
They only had a single unisex room.  The room is clean and well maintained, however the waste paper basket needed to be emptied and the walls could use a new paint job though, there was some chipping towards the bottom.

Overall my wife would have given this place 2 thumbs up...if she could have stopped eating the Black Rice Dessert.
author: Jerry W.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant and still hasn't been displaced as my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. I love the chicken satay, pad thai, and pad see ew. I don't really stray from my favorites, but friends have liked the banana curry and the corn fritters too.  They are super fast anytime I call for to go, and service is always great when I go in. I would go every week if I could.
author: Sara T.

description: I really like Marnee Thai. I've been here three times and each time the staff and the menu was lovelier than the last. I love the seating and the quiet warmth of this restaurant. This visit I was very disappointed with a loud party behind me. Work was challenging this week and I was very tired, very much looking forward to a rewarding dinner. Still, even the most terrible SF wannabes couldn't mess with the best. I really like Marnee Thai.
author: Angela F.

description: Delicious! Was pleasantly surprised by the food at this little place on 9th. I ordered the potstickers with green curry (a special) and the yellow chicken curry with white rice. The special was excellent, I loved the green curry! Spicy and sweet at the same time, really nice. The entree was delicious too, but didn't quite surprise me like the special. Really enjoyed my lunch here, will definitely be back again.
author: Kathleen D.

description:
I was a bit disappointed in the Pad See Ewe. 
I would rate it 2 stars. It was overly cooked -- the texture was more mushy for lack of a better description.   It's the worst I have had anywhere and we are big fans of pad see ew. (So we try it at any Thai restaurant we visit. ) 

The tea salad and the prawn salad were ok. 

There are so many good Thai restaurants in San Francisco i would recommend going elsewhere.

I came here a few years ago and wasn't impressed so I thought I would give it a second try today for lunch.    Regrets...
author: Doreen F.

description:
Silver noodle salad: check.
Something pad poo: check.
author: Zachary L.

description: Delivery was so disappointing. I chose "spicy" and what was delivered was extra mild, almost sweet. Chicken and green beans were soaked in oil.  Food was greasy and lacked flavor. Not the Marnee Thai that I remember.
author: Janelle F.

description:
An award-winning take on Thai cuisine!

Came here today with my girl (had great service at the 24th ave Marnee Thai in the past but we were closer to this one) and as like always, had an exceptional good meal. 

The first thing you'll notice when you walk in any Marnee Thai is that they have dozens upon dozens of awards placarded up on their walls. From Best of SF, to 7x7, Yelp, and even mentioning "Michellin" somewhere, so you better believe they must be doing something right.

Moving along, we ordered: 
1. Papaya Salad (with extra chili's)
[http://s3-media2.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hdsu4TKk5zmaSpc1O0bPyQ/l.jpg]
2. [Chicken] Angel Wings
[http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/FYiTumMC0m7tQVrcvDjLqg/l.jpg]
3. Beef Curry (forgot the technical name for it)
[http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/deEYS5ayUI7yPWOpNjbFtA/l.jpg]
4. Roti with Coconut ice cream for dessert
and Side of Rice (yeah.. it's additional)

1. I'm not a papaya fan but my girl loves it, and since she said she loved the spiciness level on the salad, then it must be good. I had myself a bite or two as well and it was blazing good.

2. The angel wings are also a must-get if you dine here. The wings are smothered with a tangy spicy sauce and the chicken is very meaty. Wing restaurants need to get some tips from here, freal.

3. The presentation of the beef curry looked disappointing [see picture] but it did not scar the flavor of the beef. The beef was very tender and soaked in the curry sauce. However, they served it on a plate (dunno why) so there was no room for any actually curry..

4. We ended our meal with some roti over a scope of coconut ice cream. The made to order warm roti over the cold coconut ice cream was the ultimate finish to our meal, especially on 70+ degree weather like today.
author: Albert L.

description:
Yummy Thai food, a neighborhood favorite

We've come to this place together a couple of times now and so we'll write about our most recent visit. In order to mix it up, we went with the beef salad (nam tok) and the chili-crab fried noodles (chan pad poo). Ultimately, it was a tasty meal but we just wanted the salad to have a bit more acid/vinegar and a lot more spice. Despite the fact that we asked the waitress for our salad to be spicy, it was extremely mild. 

Although we've had pad kee mao here in the past and have loved it, we wanted to try a different spicy noodle and went with the chan pad poo from recommendation by the waitstaff. This dish was decent with a medium spiciness and a heavy seafood aroma from the little bits of crab meat (no chunks).

Overall, considering we set 2 stars to be "average food," this place is well above average and had ranged from a 3 to 4 depending on what you order. (We've also had curries here in the past though that was more of a 2-2.5) Our most recent visit was probably closer to a 3-3.5 although we certainly love their pad kee mao.
author: Amy D.

description: I actually wept. Filled with nostalgia for that great Bangkok pad Thai (at Thip Samai of course), that amazing pork shoulder (so reminiscent of the shoulder on the fifth floor of Central World), and the rice (perfect, perfect rice). I wept. I wished I was back in Bangkok again. But if this was the best I could do, I'd be okay. Very, very okay.
author: Andy D.

description:
It's just too expensive for Thai food.  Clearly they are taking advantage.  Expect to spend $20 a person at minimum.  They charge $3 for white rice, instead of including it for free.  I felt like cattle being herded in and out quickly.  The service was OK, but nothing special.  The atmosphere is not that great, and the seating is very cramped.  The food was good for the most part, but certainly not worth the inflated price tag.

Want great Thai food in the outer sunset, for a fraction of the price?  My favorite local Thai place is Lanna Thai at the top of Noriega and 20th ave.  Lanna never has customers, perhaps due to the location, and maybe because no one knows about it.  I much prefer the place.
author: Jackson W.

description:
MmMmMMmmm. Me likey here. 

The Pad Kee Mao is a must. Pretty darn yummy. 

Everything else so far is pretty good too. 

Service is good. 

Tables are a bit small tho... 

Check it out here. I like this spot more than the one on Irving; feels more happen'n around this area.
author: Garland W.

description: The best Thai food in San Francisco! (that is what people told me before I tried Marnee and they were totally right)! The pad see ew is delicious, and for those who love spicy food, try the chan pad poo (rice noodles with a chili limi sauce, crab meat, and egg).
author: Carly A.

description:
Dodged a bullet.

Not good news: http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2013/04/03/marnee-thai-in-the-inner-sunset-shut-down-for-health-violations/

They are back open so things must have been resolved. Few days after eating my Gai Samoon Prai (sauteed chicken with herbs) things seem to be OK.

Less OK was the amount of oil. Asked them to go easy and it was still a soaked mess. Can only imagine how they usually prepare it.

Staff was friendly. Space adorned with the usual assortment of Southeast Asia accents. Food served quick.

All well and good. Just expected more for almost $11. Like more natural flavor.
author: Jason B.

description:
Been here twice, can absolutely recommend this Thai place.
Yesterday I had the stir-fried pork belly with mushrooms, onions, bamboo shoots and bell peppers. It was great, the veggies had a nice texture as well as the pork belly. 
Service staff is always friendly and fast, we had to wait about 20 minutes for our dish. I think that's fine and acceptable around 7:30pm.
author: Sebastian F.

description: So I ordered over the phone for pickup, and when I arrived to pay, I found that I didn't have my card. I asked if I would be able to pay by entering my card number, to which the woman replied, sternly, "No". Because of this, I had to take a trip back to the car, a block away, to ask a friend to break his $100 bill to pay. Upon handing her the bill, she had the AUDACITY to bring the bill to the back for scrutiny by MULTIPLE employees. As I got back into the car and checked the order, I noticed that the employee neglected to give us utensils or even a receipt.
author: Jerry W.

description: Awful experience. After seeing a good review on KQED I made a reservation and arrived to find a smelly place, rude hostess and let me tell tell you the food was nothing you want to have in front of you in a restaurant. The very talked about chicken wings were raw , the curry was tasteless and I don't recommend it.
author: Baha H.

description:
Went there yesterday after telling my friend from out of town : "This is the best Thai place in SF"
It was closed by order of the Health Department.
author: Hank A.

description:
I gave this place three tries because I really love Thai food AND because it's super close to work. 
First try: the WORST customer service ever! 
Second try: the WORST customer service ever! 
Third try: the WORST customer service ever! 

Now I know bad service means bad service everywhere in the restaurant. They closed down for health violations. They really do not care about their customers. 

Food was mediocre anyway. I like a basil chicken spicy with flavor, and they did not achieve that. All it did was make me wish for a Thai iced tea. Oh wait it's served with too much ice so u finish it in one sip, and your mouth is left burning. Coooollllll. 
Those angel wings were so greasy too. Gross. In conclusion, not worth having to deal with the mean waitresses and cockroach frass in your food!
author: Alicia M.

description:
Marnee Thai satisfies my Thai fix whenever I'm in the mood for something spicy!  They give awesome recommendations whenever I want to try new dishes or want something special.  I would recommend the following:

Tom yum soup
Fried flounder
Fried tofu with string beans
Pumpkin curry
Angel wings

Definitely a great dinner spot for the 9th and Irving crowd!
author: Carli F.

description: My mom and I went there after a walk through the botanical garden (meaning both of us were super hungry). Long story short, the service was great, the food came out fast enough and above all, it tasted better than most Thai places I've been to. We had the Yellow curry with Thai fried rice and I was scared that it would be too salty, but thankfully, they went well together.Will definitely go back!
author: Shifali G.

description:
Why / how is this place still in business after their health department closure? 

"...live cockroaches on prep tables, rodent droppings next to food containers and utensils, and several dead cockroaches scattered about the kitchen like peanuts in pad Thai..."
author: D S.

description:
Best Thai curry I've had in the city. I guess those awards and photos on the wall at the entrance aren't just for show. They spice their curries to perfection and the pad Thai is pretty tasty, in fact the best I've had. I haven't had an issue with slow service, the service is quite nice actually. Very attentive, which is good, because I drink my water like a fish. 

There was one instance that kind of made things awkward... 
 I had a party of four eating and we left a reasonable tip. We left the restaurant and a lady came running after us, asking us if we didn't enjoy the food or something, wondering why we left such a low tip. We  assured her that the food was amazing and handed her more money. She apologized, saying that tipping was a big deal there because her manager is quite serious about gratuity or something. Okay, so perhaps we didn't read the receipt or something, not sure. But it was just weird haha.
author: K N.

description: One of the best restaurants in the city, certainly Thai Restaurants. The food is fresh and authentic and if you like your food "Thai spicy " just ask. The waitstaff is great but I especially like Paul. He is so helpful, I often let him make suggestions and order for me. Just a short walk from the N Judah stop on Irving, great Thai food and convenience!
author: Michael T.

description:
Alright.  This review is solely based on their Kanom Krok. These sweet coconut sticky rice disks have me in love at first burning bite.  Yes, burning. They come to the table in the cast iron pan they're cooked in. They're covered in a coconut milk sauce with some corn and squash bits on top. 

Their entrees are pretty good, too. The pad see ew is particularly garlicky (which I love).  It's so flavorful, but not too overpowering. 

The decor is beautiful. It makes it seem like the whole building is made of straw.  Get here early or prepare to wait. This place is popular!
author: Lisa X.

description: So obsessed. I Love this food!! Occasionally have found dirty dishes though. And their bathroom could use a cleaning.
author: Bridgette W.

description:
The best Thai food I've ever had! Seriously! You must get the coconut hotcakes, the steamed fish in banana leaves..........The service was excellent and the vibe is warm and like a home. Love this place! It's very special.

They are on Ceckplease Bay Area TV show. Watch the episode and you will want to go!
author: Emma I.

description: This is the best thai I've found in SF so far. Great flavors, portion sizes, and very sweet staff. If we lived closer we'd eat here all the time.
author: Brenden M.

description: This was one of the most disgusting meals I have ever eaten out and definitely the worst Thai. Everything was swimming in oil and fat, could not taste anything else. I love sea bass, this place destroyed it. Fish 1/24" thick in greasy fried crap so one could not taste fish.  Reviewers on Check Please must have no existing taste buds. Would have given NO stars if at all possible.
author: Cd B.

description: One of our favorite restaurants in SF. We've returned many times and have never been disappointed. The food is delicious and arrives at the table unbelievably fast. The Chan Pad Poo is ridiculously flavorful! The Guay Tiew Koor with Duck is truly amazing too. The Calamari Salad is spicy, so consider yourself warned. The service is excellent, the dining room is clean and we've never waited too long to be seated. Happy eating!
author: John B.

description:
The restaurant can use some upgrading. But the food here makes up for it. Prices are similar to other Thai restaurants. I've had a couple of delicious meals here and will be back.

These were excellent:
-BBQ Chicken-tender and moist, the best I've had at a Thai restaurant
-Pineapple fried rice-uses fresh pineapple
-Angel wings

Pretty good:
-Tom Yum noodle soup

Ok:
-Pad Kee Mao noodles-a little too sweet, I've had better
-Pad Thai noodles

Need to try their curries next time...
author: Ali F.

description: Good food, loud atmosphere, people having fun.....great staff! Can't go wrong..BTW, reasonably priced as well.
author: Phil P.

description:
Meh. 

We got the Angel Wings appetizer. This was the high-point of our dinner. They really were very delicious. 

We also got a curry-something and a something on the special menu that had pork belly. Both were forgettable - and, in fact, we *had* forgotten them until looking up other yelp reviews for Marnee. 

Seating is cramped. 

Ambiance is cave-like: windowless, narrow, low-ceilinged. 

Noisy. 

Mediocre service.

Prices are too high for Thai.

If not for the Angel Wings, we would have given this place two stars.
author: Tim W.

description:
We snuck here for dessert only... you know you wish you could do it too. LOL

The place was empty, service was quick, Roti with IceCream was delish

the bad part that cost them a whole star.....
when we paid the $12 bill with $15 cash the server never came back with the change. We waited, and waited. 
She apperantly took matters into her own hands and decided our change was her tip.

Rude

Bad taste in my mouth (not literally, the roti is pretty damn good)

Poor customer service
author: Leticia G.

description: After knowing about this for a while & a co-worker of my mother's strongly recommending it, we tried this gem last Tuesday after an appointment at UCSF.  Boy, were we not disappointed.  It is a very casual atmosphere with an open kitchen which I love as you can hear all the Thai chadder & smell all those wonderful spices.  We started off with the fried rice griddle cakes with onions, coconut cream, & pumpkin; fried at your table; they were smooth, creamy, & the pumpkin added a nutty flavor.  The fried spring rolls are wonderful with a crispy badder filled with ground pork, vegetables, & silver noodles with a sweet chili sauce that gives a mild punch.  The pad prig king is some of the best with tender chicken, crisp green beans, & chili paste; a wonderfully spicy number.  The coconut noodles are thin with a slightly & nutty flavor with tender chicken & fresh vegetables.  The rice cakes & noodles were on the specials menu for the day.  For dessert, the fried bannanas were good with a crispy greasless badder, but the bannanas tasted a bit underripened as I am use to them being more ripe & soft; the coconut ice cream with them was smooth, creamy, & coconuty.  The service is very friendly & I can hardly wait to come back & try more.  So, for excellent Thai food with friendly service in a casual atmosphere, Marnei Thai cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: The Angel Wings are addictive!!!  Love them. The pumpkin curry is delicious, but needs more pumpkin in it.  The food is a tremendous value - super tasty and reasonable.
author: Steve A.

description:
I am glad that I live only 2 blocks away from Marnee Thai. Despite the fact that I do cook for myself and my boyfriend almost every day, I am happy that I live close to Marnee Thai because I have access to the best Thai food I have ever had in my whole existence. To start, all the waiters and waitresses here give excellent service. I would like to make a special mention for Alex (He also works at Osha Thai at Embarcadero). My boyfriend asked me to hold his raybans for him and I thought that I had put it in my purse. After eating, we were probably 50 feet away from Marnee Thai's door and Alex came running out of the restaurant and gave me the Raybans that I left. Needless to say, there are not a lot of honest, hard working, and friendly people like Alex. He totally saved the day for me.

The food here is sooo GREAT! Their Panang Curry is nothing like all the other restaurants'. It was the best Panang Curry I have ever had. Make sure you get this with Beef. I also like their Angel Wings. It rivals San Tung's hot wings. 

This is seriously the best Thai Food EVER!
author: Iya J.

description:
Best Thai restaurants in the Bay Area? I don't think so. I don't think its the worst, but definitely not the best. 

Boyfriend and I ended up getting lunch here after seeing a big crowd outside on Friday night. We had gotten Gordo's which is right next door, but we wanted to check this place out when it was a litttttle less busy. 

Food:
Spicy Angel Wings: I had actually seen that many people had gotten this on yelp so we decided to try them. They were not too spicy, a little for the flavor. They were hot temperature wise though; I think I might have given myself a little burn from it. Definitely worth trying. 
Mango Fried Rice with Chicken: BF's dish. It was pretty good. The mango had a nice flavor - almost cinnamon like and the fried rice...well it was just fried rice. Nothing too amazing or bad about it. 
Pad See-ew with Chicken: my dish. Nothing too amazing about it.  I guess when I go to Thailand I'll be able to have some authentic stuff to compare all of these to. It's not amazing, but not horrible either. 

I had noticed that the chef apparently won quite a few awards and the restaurant seems pretty well known from its awards and notable mentions in various magazines and stuff, but it's really not that amazing.

It was really just a great spot for us to try a new place and get some lunch. Overall, it's decent, but not someone I'll intentionally go back again because I love trying new and different places...onwards to the next place!
author: Nina Y.

description:
My friends surprised me with a big surprise from a friend from Santa Ana, they know who they are. Well, we had my birthday dinner at Marnee Thai and it was a great experience. Service was very attentive and I was excited to eat. Our party had curry dishes to beef rendang which was crazy good. The sour soup was alright and so was the eggplant. The standout had to be the softshell crab atop the mango salad. That was one amazing salad and one of the best salads I've had at a Thai restaurant.

Other dishes we had included BBQ chicken, samosas, and a tofu dish. I don't remember the names since my friends took care of all the ordering. It was a great birthday dinner and the staff was great as well! I can see why this restaurant is on the top of many lists and has won several local awards.
author: Danster L.

description: Marnee Thais serves delicious thai food but word has it that they've discontinued their hot cakes appetizer. With so many thai options in San Francisco this singular item was what set Marnee Thai apart, it's what made taking the trip out to the sunset worth the lyft ride. I'll definitely be less likely to go to Marnee Thai over the places that are walking distance to me if the rumor is true.
author: Eric E.

description:
I ordered the angel wings and the mango fried rice.

My friend had hyped up the angel wings so much that I was expected amazing-ness. Unfortunately, the wings fell short of my expectations. San Tung's wings remain my top choice for wings in SF. They were still very delicious, but just not amazing. I would rank this as a good second choice to San Tung. The misleading raves from my friend aside, I really did enjoy the wings. The sauce was good, mildly spicy (barely detectable, really), but definitely the basil added an extra kick. 

The mango fried rice left a lot to be desired. I would probably not recommend this dish, but it could be because I went here when mangoes weren't in season. As a lover of nearly all things mango, this is definitely not on my list. I would probably not order this again. 

For a 1hr wait on a Saturday night, I don't think it was worth it. Also, please note that this is a pretty small restaurant and you are pretty much 1 foot away from the next table, meaning no privacy whatsoever. Overall, I would go again, but not for a wait longer than 20 minutes. These wings aren't THAT amazing.
author: Stacy X.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends last weekend after watching the Giants game at a bar. We had heard about the closure, and read about it on Yelp so we called first and asked the staff if they were reopen. They were closed for 48 hours, and cleared all re-inspection issues before reopening. I normally wouldn't go back so soon but my friends and I have been eating here for years and we've never had a problem with our food or the cleanliness of it. 

So now onto the food:

Angel Wings-Must try if it's your first time, these aren't the traditional stuffed wings that a lot of Thai restaurants offer. It's their own sauce that they make.

Homemade Hotcakes-These were a really interesting appetizer, they came with 7 pieces so they're good for sharing too. They're not as big as Hotcakes you're probably used to, but they're a good size to try without getting too full.

Pad Kee Mao with Duck-My friend loves duck and spicy food so this was his choice and we all tried some when it came. The flavors of the noodles really complimented the duck well. With the tomato and basil balancing nicely with the sauce. 

Chan Pad Poo-Step yo Pad Thai game up, son! No but really, these noodles are a crab rendition of Pad Thai with Garlic and Chili. We had them mild but you can ask to make them hotter too.

Panang Beef-The Panang Beef came out with less curry than we expected but afterwards we realized it was because it's a stewed curry dish. There were chunks of beef that were slow cooked in the curry sauce, they have a pork version as well on the specials page.

Basa with Garlic and Black Pepper sauce-White fish with a light flavor to it which was really good with the garlic pepper sauce they made. If you like garlic, you will definitely like this dish.

We had a decent amount of food but still managed to clear it all without any leftovers. Will have to come back to try some of their other dishes next time too, since the menu is so extensive
author: James A.

description:
My first time at Marnee Thai was with my boyfriend who wanted to show me what good thai food tastes like. 

We ended up ordering so much food that we couldn't even finish it. To what I remember we had some type of dumpling, papaya salad, steamed but fried fish, satay, pad thai, and a lychee margarita. 

I was pretty happy with all the dishes. Satay wasn't too dry like what it usually is at many Thai restaurants. Service was great! Food came out fast and everything was good portioned. 

The place is almost always packed too so that must mean something! 

I definitely want to come back here to try their other noodle dishes like Pad See Ew!
author: Ingrid C.

description: Got take out last night and there was a cockroach in our soup. Goodbye Marnee Thai. I won't be back.
author: Kadotah S.

description: This place was great! Just moved to SF and i was looking for a Good Thai food spot! This is it! I started with the angel wings and imperial rolls which were both amazing. The green curry and thai style fried rice for entree which were both great as well. Highly would recommend the green curry. Last but not least, the service was one of the best i have had in awhile. Very friendly :)
author: Emma R.

description:
made the mistake of returning here after several years of not going

the satay was OK - the peanut sauce left much to be desired - the pad thai was without question the worst I've every had anywhere - it was slathered with gloppy sauce
author: S K.

description:
Tasty! Great pad thai, and the Thai pot stickers were a nice twist on one of my favorite things. 

However we sat at the back near the bathroom and could smell a strong chemical smell (air freshener or cleaner) which was kinda gross, so I can't give it 5 stars.
author: Amy G.

description: Roti is out of this world. I come by for the desserts every time I visit SF.
author: najeeb k.

description:
It was good sign when I was able to park almost in front of this restaurant.  L and I stopped for a late lunch and even at 2 pm the small dining room was full.

We started with an appetizer. We shared an order of spring rolls, stuffed with shrimp and vegetables; it was like a salad in a roll. The artfully arrange rectangle plate was set off with an orchid blossom.  L had pork over Thai fried rice.  I tasted it and it was very good. I had ordered one of my favaroite dishes, roasted duck on spinach and rice topped with a gravy like sauce.  There was a generous amount of duck and I did enjoy the sauce. I am not sure if it was the best I have ever had, the skin wasn't crispy, but it was really good and I would order it again.
author: Terry T.

description:
Background: Thai restaurant in the 9th and irving block of restaurants. Smaller sized restaurant with one long row of tables, but can accommodate large groups during slow times. Came here with a group of 12 friends on a Wednesday around lunch time and we were able to get seated quickly. 

Details: They have lunch specials, which I loved especially because I didn't want to shell more than $10 out for lunch. They have a wide variety of common dishes like pad see ew, pad thai, curries on this lunch menu. I got the duck fried rice and I was more than a happy. The rice was super tasty, there were actually good sized chunks of duck portion was fair, not necessarily generous though. 

Verdict:  If you want a nice stable thai restaurant that won't disappoint you, then I highly recommend Marnee Thai. It's not something you'd go out of your way to go eat, but they are good when you don't know quite what else to go to for lunch!
author: Christine B.

description: I am definitely coming back again!! My best friend & I were craving thai food, so we looked up some reviews on yelp for any nearby thai restaurants with good reviews. This is what we found. We were seated shortly after we arrived. Although the seating arrangement was cramped (practically elbow to elbow with the parties sitting next to us), it was forgiven by the excellent food. We got the pad see ew with chicken and the chicken curry with brown rice. We loved both of them!!! Definitely coming back to this place because not only is it so close, but they have quick and friendly customer service & the food is delicious! The Michelin Stars don't hurt either =)
author: Brittany D.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Saturday around 6:30pm.  Good that we did not need to wait.  

The restaurant is bigger than the the other location but if you come during peak hours, definitely expect to wait.  The staffs are all friendly, welcome, helpful and efficient.  

We got the fresh egg rolls as appetizer,  It stuffed with tofu, chicken sausage, egg, cucumber and bean sprouts, topped with crab meat and tamarind sauce.  The ingredient were fresh but I like the one at Osha more.  The sauce was kinda weird.  

Then we had the yellow curry with chicken and PAD SE - EW with pork.  The curry was ok.  But I liked the noodle.  Very flavorful but the pork was kinda dry.

Come back??  Probably not becuase there are so many other good restaruants in this neighborhood.
author: Liza T.

description: Delish! Chan Pad Poo was just the right amount of spicy and the fried fish tofu was crispy and yet tender. Great find just outside the park.
author: Veronica H.

description:
Delicious authentic Thai food. How do you know it's authentic? ..when the waiters and waitresses are yelling across the room in Thai and they do not care. Plus, one of the older women is like your mom or grandma. She is so sweet, recommends what you should get, and just creates this comfortable happy atmosphere. Yeah, you guys should know who I'm talking about if you've been there. 
It is a pretty small place so make sure you are ready to stand outside in the cold for a few minutes. They serve fast and provide good service so I assume the turn around is relatively quick. But, because it was so packed, the mom kept pushing our tables this way and that way to get as much walk space. It was a little awkward but whatever!

1) Imperial rolls: GOOD. The fried skin is very thin so it creates a very crunchy but not oily taste to the roll. Inside is vermicelli, beef, and veggies. Very good start with the sweet and spicy sauce!
2) Yellow curry: Very flavorful and SOOOO generous with their meat! However, they only include the meat and potatoes which makes it very filling. A few peas sprinkled in. I kind of wanted some veggies in there too.
3) Chan Pad Poo: SIGH...at first we got this because of the name (childish we are...ahem gaj!) but it turned out to be SUPER GOOD!!! I love the sweet chili sauce in it, along with the egg and noodles. It's pretty much the same as Pad Thai without all the other ingredients.

4) Rice costs 1.50 per scoop..
5) I want to try the wings next time, heard it's good.

Definitely got my Thai fix here! MAR-NEE-D of this place!
author: Jennifer C.

description: It was my first time this evening. We ordered chan pad poo (9.95), shrimp tom yum (9.50) and the roast duck (12.95).  I loved it all. The food was flavorful and the portions were perfect- just right for three people. I wish I had room in my belly for some dessert. Dishes here range from 7.50-14.50. ps- the credit card minimum is $15.
author: Selina C.

description: Food was pretty terrible. We ordered vegetable curry, which looked like plain water with green color and vegetables, absolutely zero taste. Chicken satay was too sweet. Thai style fried rice were again without any taste. Samosas were a little too oily. Hot tea was good and that's it. Service was polite on face but as soon as it was 10 they started closing down, packing napkins on table next to us when there were so many other vacant ones. And there was this pungent smell. Overall a poor experience, certainly not going back again.
author: Manveer C.

description:
I thought this restaurant was solid but not fantastic. My wife and I visited on a weekday afternoon after going to the De Young in GG Park. The location is perfect for park-goers.

We ordered three dishes: the green mango salad, the eggplant, and the pumpkin curry. The green mango salad was excellent, with a delicious sweet/sour/spicy/bitter dressing, and lots of good veggies. The pumpkin curry was pretty tasty, but there was very little pumpkin in there (maybe because it was August). The eggplant was flavorful, but not terribly appetizing; the pieces of eggplant were cooked within an inch (a milimeter?) of their lives, which meant they were a gray, sloppy mess.

All in all, a good experience, very attentive wait staff, and decent food. They were also very accommodating to our baby stroller, and gave us a nice big (4-person) table in the back.
author: Andrew M.

description:
FINALLY! Thai food I can rave about! Different from all of the recent Thai restaurants I have been eating at. I am so glad I ate here. I felt super satisfied after coming here. The only negative thing about this place is that the restaurant is pretty cramped and the portions are kind of small. I don't think I felt really full after I ate...I just felt content. 

So we ordered the Gai Samoon Prai which was pretty much lemongrass chicken. This dish tasted way better than I expected. I expected the chicken to be dry and bland, but it wasn't. The sauce added an extra taste to it. Eating it with rice was perfect. We also ordered the Guay Tiew Koor. Kind of similar to Pad See Ew, but not. I got it with the Roast Duck because duck is so good and adds a lot of flavor to the wide rice noodles. I love wide rice noodles, so eating a different style of it other than Pad See Ew was excellent. They have  a lot of menu options that are out of the "thai" ordinary. 

Great Thai food!
author: Katrina T.

description:
Super delicious Thai food! Our hosts for my weekend in SF chose this wonderful place for our 1st meal in the city and I think it may be the best Thai food I've ever had. Not greasy or heavy and perfectly spiced. Service was excellent (water glasses always refilled without asking) and there isn't a long wait for the food to arrive even though the restaurant is jam packed.

The food: family style for 6
- Chicken wings: Yummmmmm, bf proclaimed it was the best thing he ate on this trip to SF (and boy, did he eat at a lot of different SF eateries). Perfectly crispy, delicious sauce, 10-12 wings. 
- Yellow Curry w/chicken: Totally satisfied my curry craving, could probably use a few more potatoes in the dish but we definitely cleaned the bowl. 
- Fried rice w/pork sausage, pad pra ram (entree - does not come with rice), pad see ew/beef: running out of adjectives of delicious but all these dishes are super solid. 
- Pad Thai: weakest of the 6 dishes, a little bit on the soggy side, but still good.

Portion sizes was good for all the dishes, and not too pricey for such a great meal in SF. The restaurant is super crowded (with good reason) & if you are in the back room, it is very very warm. They take reservations. I think it is automatic gratuity with a party over 6. 

Don't even get me started about looking for parking around this area.
author: Cindy L.

description: Loved the food at their other location and service too. Seemed the opposite here. Mango chicken rice : not flavorful, dry. Pad thai not so great too. I kind of did n't like how the wait staff seemed to just have no time to throw you a smile or check on anything. Did not enjoy the experience at all. Food is decent.
author: Jisha A.

description:
A-OK, yes sirees.  Most dishes are just fine and a few are wonderful.  I judge Thai places by their green curry and pad thai.  Marnee does both well.  The green curry flavor is good, though it could be spicier (even after I've requested *spicey*) and I do like that you get the option of fresh (my preference) or fried tofu.  Also with brown rice instead of white if you like.  The pad thai might be the best in the city (That's right, Martha T, I'm lookin' at you!).  Order a plate for the table to share and it'll be the first thing gone every time.

Service is always very friendly, although they messed up on a reservation for 5 on a recent visit (had a small table ready for 4, despite a glance in the hostess book clearly showing 5 after my name).  Fortunately, they have that huge extra back room, allowing our group to be seated immediately and to have the room to ourselves!  (Bonus for our group of gals that only meets every two months or so - we've got some serious gabbing to do.)  The waiter was very friendly and accommodating, as I have always encountered at this Sunset standby.

Bathroom and that back room have a bit of a damp smell, unbecoming of an eatery, but the front room is cozy and comfortable.

All in all, it's a solid choice that's quite easy on the pocketbook.  (And the season is right for Thai food IMHO: love me some pumpkin curry on a drizzly, muggy San Francisco night.  Just a little more hot spice please.)
author: Ravena F.

description:
Decided to try this place out after seeing the good reviews on Yelp. The place itself is pretty small; there's an open kitchen, a small bar, and one strip of space with tables. The waitstaff was very friendly and we were seated right away on a Thursday night. The restaurant was pretty busy--almost all of the tables were full. The service was a little slow, but when the food came out, it turned out to be pretty good. We ordered the Spicy Angel Wings after seeing some Yelp reviews about them, and we definitely liked them. They were crispy and not too spicy. I got the yellow curry, which was of pretty good quality. My boyfriend got the Guay Tiew Koor with duck, which was also very good. The prices are pretty decent as well. 

Overall, a generally good experience at Marnee Thai. Would give it a try again.
author: Jennifer M.

description: MMmmm so delicious! Pad Thai & panang curry is what we ordered... I was WOW-ed! So delicious, prices were affordable, staff was absolutely wonderful, waters never reached the bottom, large portions, delicious curry!  I will DEFINITELY be going back to this restaurant the next time I'm in SF!
author: Christy F.

description:
Came here on a friend's recommendation with not much expectation since I feel most Thai restaurants are about the same. But no, Marnee Thai raises the bar. 5 stars are just for the food =)

My eyes popped wide open from surprise when I took in a spoon full of coconut soup- it was cramming with bright, FRESH flavor! Sweet and creamy from the coconut milk, sour from the lime, savory with the mushrooms and prawns, and vividly spicy from the chili oil! 

Since I'm weak sauce with spices, my tongue was burning numb and my nose was eventually runny, but I soldiered through it because it was so delicious. My other buddies were either sweating or turning bright red. Later a few of us felt like there was a battle occurring inside our stomachs. But it was worth it. However, I don't recommend a date here, unless you're both spice-tolerant.

The other dishes were delicious. We had the pad si ew with chicken and another flavorful chicken dish under "chef's recommendation'. Makes great leftovers for home. Best thai food I've had- a big difference from the other Americanized Thai places. About $40 for the 3 dishes and 2 iced teas. For that price, I just wish the portions were bigger!
author: Tes Y.

description: My go-to restaurant for good Thai food. I've been coming here for years and I've never been disappointed. The service is good and the food is delicious. That's all I really ask for. There's usually a wait on weekends and parking sucks around here, but it's worth it! Some of my favorite dishes are: angel wings, prawns and scallop pad phong karee, and roti with ice cream. OMG! I love their roti with ice cream!!! My boyfriend likes their papaya salad, basa fillet with garlic, pad kee mao with roasted duck, and mango sticky rice. Definitely check this place out!
author: Bianca C.

description:
I went once to the other location and now once at this location! Both times were fair experiences - some pretty good tasting food although I think could still be raised to an even greater level. 

First, the spicy angel tofu - deep fried crispy tofu sauteed with chili-garlic sauce, top with crispy basil. This was delicious! The tofu was so crisp and a bit chewy on the outside, with the sweet sauce completely coating each piece with a burst of flavor in each bite. The flavor is quite intense and the crispy basil adds a nice lightness and aroma. Highly recommended!

Then, spicy ma kuer - sauteed eggplant with mushroom, fried tofu, baby corn, bell pepper, chili, garlic and Thai basil. I love eggplant so I enjoyed this, although the flavor wasn't as bright and satisfying as that of the tofu appetizer. The eggplant was very well cooked though, with the perfect soft texture, but not too mushy and falling apart.

We also got the pad se - ew with chicken - fried rice noodles with soy bean, broccoli and egg. I thought the flavor could have been taken up a notch on this. I would have also liked to see slightly thicker, chewier noodles that were slightly more charred, or with a more intense sauce coating it. The chicken could have been more juicy and tender as well.

Finally, we got the roasted duck - roasted boneless duck on a bed of spinach with homemade special sauce. The duck was very tender and juicy, although with a thick layer of fat and soggy skin on top which was not appetizing. The duck itself had a strong duck flavor, which sounds strange as it seems duck should have duck flavor. However, this duck had it in a slightly unappetizing, game-y, not so fresh kind of way. I liked the spinach underneath the duck but it made your tongue feel numb.

Overall, I enjoyed this meal. The wait staff was very friendly!
author: Elaine L.

description: I've always said that this is the best Thai place in the city, very unassuming from the outside. But the food is really nice. I recommend coming here over their other location in outer sunset. I took 1 star off because they used to be better.
author: Davis W.

description:
Great Thai food!!!  I can ALWAYS rely on this restaurant to eat something cheap, filling, and delicious.

My personal favorite is the Pad See Yew. You can't go wrong with sweet and soy sauce thick noodles!  My friends always get Chan Pad Poo, which has some crab meat in it. I can't remember specifics since I'm allergic, but they always seem to love it and order it every time.  The pineapple fried rice is also wonderful.

Service here is also great. Once we got a waiter who was so friendly, welcoming, and made me feel like I was part of his family! 

I always come here when I crave Thai food.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Nestled in the Sunset (among culinary favorites Koo, Ebisu, and San
Tung) lies what I consider to be the best Thai restaurant in the
greater Bay Area: Marnee Thai.

My introduction to Thai food began rather late. As a child, growing up
in California, it was a steady diet of Chinese cuisine, occasionally
