interspersed with a sprinkle of Japanese or Korean fare.  It wasn't
until I headed off to the Midwest for four years that I tried Thai
food for the first time.

Amidst the chilly winters and a dearth of decent Chinese food, I
branched out and discovered my first Thai restaurant, Thai Bistro, a 45 minute drive from where I lived, but so worth the wonderfully flavored and comforting food that subtly reminded me of the Asian cuisine I had grown up with.

When I returned home, I continued my exploration into Thai
cuisine, finding standouts Krung Thai (San Jose), King of Thai (SF) and even traveling to Thailand several times.  Which all finally led me to
Marnee Thai.

While I love King of Thai for the quick meal, Marnee Thai was
always the choice for the more planned sit-down meal; whether for out-of-town guests, family, or friends.

The stars at Marnee Thai are the delectable angel wings (they give San
Tung a run for the money), the curry dishes, and the addictive noodle dish, crab chan pad poo.

Working with Executive Chef Chai Siriyarn, I created a menu for a large group dinner that included these favorites and several of his
recommendations.  While a few of the dishes didn't translate as well
to large portions (the panang beef was a tad overcooked, the basa
fillet was just so-so), in the end, there was a ton of food, happy
and very stuffed patrons, and a perfect finish with sticky black rice and mango.

Service was attentive throughout the night and the flexibility of Chai with both the menu and the allocated budget were duly appreciated. 

An enthusiastic two thumbs up!  If you've not been to Marnee Thai, make your way there (they have 3 SF locations) to try some stellar Thai cuisine. They gladly take all credit cards, including American Express.
author: Randy F.

description:
Perhaps I had an off day, but both dishes I had were so-so.

Spicy Ma Kuer - sauteed eggplant with fried tofu, mushroom, baby corn, bell pepper, chili, garlic and Thai basil (eggplant overly mushy, but otherwise delicious).

Pumpkin Curry - you choose the heat level and meat (beef, chicken, pork or tofu (the batch I had lacked the mild sweetness that I prefer in curries. Next time I'll order the Pad Thai which I've had previously and like.)

They offer brown, jasmine and sticky white rice. 

Extensive menu including many vegetarian options. 

Friendly service.

PS: I was surprised how busy it was on a Sunday afternoon. 3pm and it was still pretty full. A good indicator.

PPS: Close to Golden Gate Park and the N-Judah Muni line.
author: Cathy K.

description: Had some solid mango salad and red curry here. Great spice level; a nice kick without being overpowering.
author: Rajesh S.

description: Found this on Yelp while visiting golden gate park and looking for dinner. They accommodated our 6 person group quite easily although we did not have reservations. We were all vegetarian on this day and found quite a few appealing dishes on the menu once we accepted that they will all have tofu. The appetizer vegetable roll was just right but not great. Then the yellow curry, veg fried rice and mango-pineapple tofu were simply fantastic. We followed up by string beans that were absolutely bursting with flavor! They were able to make the food mild for kids in the group yet did not compromise on the spices and flavor. I recommend this pace and would definitely come back again.
author: A J.

description: The customer service here is soooooo slow.The soup we ordered was too sour and small ,although they said is enough for 2-3 person.Also very cold in the restaurant.I had to wait for like 20-30 min to get some hot water for my tea.Overall I wouldnt recommend  it.Dont waste your money on this place.
author: Olga A.

description:
I used to like this place but they have gone down hill. The food was bland the last two times I went. Also, they are rude. Case in point, my friend and I were meeting for dinner and he was finding parking in GGP in San Francisco. I asked them if I could sit as I  would like to reserve a table as my friend found parking. Unfortunately this concept was lost on them and they refused to sit me until "your whole party arrives". This is the type of tourist trapping nonsense I would expect in the marina, the pier, or the now gentrified mission, however not in the Sunset district, a place for true local San Franciscans.  As a result, my friend who only arrived 10 min. later, and myself, had to wait while people who came in later than us and hadn't reserved were sat. 

So in summary, bland food and rude employees that just want to profit of tourists.
author: Martino P.

description:
This place is AWFUL!!! I ordered the Spicy Thai Fried rice with Chicken and what I got was mushy, bland, rice with chunks of tomatoes, onions and egg??? So strange....the bits of chicken mixed in was rubbery....
DREADFUL Thai eatery....so disturbing that people recommend this place....STAY AWAY!!!
If you want decent Thai Food try Sri Thai on Lincoln and 46th Avenue....way better...
author: Mo D.

description: simply the best thai restaurant I've tried in the area, wok dish specials (duck, pork belly etc) and pad see ew are outstanding.
author: Vince C.

description: Amazing food. Hail to the chef and the staff. We shared the HOR MOK (should have ordered my own), Mango Fried Rice. Curry chicken dish, and Pad Thai. Excellent meal, tight quarters in the restaurant. Service was quick and friendly. I'm a fan!
author: Leon L.

description: It was good, we will probably go back.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Marnee Thai yet! I've been coming here to eat Thai food for 8 years ever since I moved to the Bay Area. This is my favorite Thai restaurant thus far!

I love the pad see ew, chan pad poo (pad thai with dungenous crab instead of prawns), & garlic basa.

The owner, Marnee, is also a fortune-teller and if you're lucky (or un-lucky for that matter), she will come up to your table & give you a reading.
author: Alysha K.

description: You really can't go wrong with Marnee Thai, all their dishes are really good, the chef knows his cuisine and studies it well, traveling back to Thailand learning new things all the time, I like that. But what stood out for me, the Roti dessert. I went to Thailand years ago and remember eating this thai pancake on the streets, it was so good! I was never able to find anything similar to it in SF, until now! I think I have been sent back to Thailand, so happy.
author: Karen T.

description: We were able to get reservation at the last moment on a Saturday night.  The food here is loaded with flavor without the saltiness.  Place is not big, so the table spacing is tight.  If the waiters can move around than it's not a problem for me.  Service was friendly, water was always filled.  Parking can be challenging.  Definitely one of the better Thai places I been too.
author: Eric W.

description: Short walk from Nightlife at the Cal Academy of Sciences, worth the wait in line, best late night thai food around. Make sure to get the cucumber salad!
author: Lisa W.

description:
I ordered take out from here, and my boyfriend and I were happily surprised !

Pad Thai-4 stars. A reliable go-to, and I liked their prawns (shrimp). Nice mild pad thai flavor. 

Green curry-3.5 stars. It was a bit on the oily side of the spectrum but still good. A little spicy!

Spicy wings-3.7 stars. A gingery spicy flavor blast. I could smell it on my fingers an hr later haha. 

Fresh, reliable, yum, and yay for a go-to thai place in SF.
author: Rose M.

description:
Came here with some friends and was excited to try this place because I've heard good things about it and the Yelp reviews were good as well.  It was decent, but I left a little disappointed.

I had the Thai fried rice and the dish was flavorful, with a decent amount of veggies and meat mixed in.  My friends seemed to like their dishes for the most part, but a couple of them remarked that the food was spicier than they would have imagined.  Also, negative points here for not serving their lunch specials on Saturday (even though the menus in the front say NOTHING about not being served on Saturdays).  That and some of the week day lunch items are not available on the weekend (I wanted the Rad Na).  Boooo for those two points.

A decent place.  But there were those couple issues that didn't sit well with me and if I'm looking for decent Thai food, I'll just go to King of Thai and it will be cheaper as well.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Before Marnee Thai, Thai food was one of my least favorite ethnic foods. I was just never impressed with other restaurants I've tried. 

But Marnee Thai excited my taste buds. One thing I loved and appreciated is the fact that the staff is aware of what "gluten-free" means. Almost all of their menu items can be made gluten-free, except for their curries which contain soy sauce. Some of their fried appetizers are also wheat-free since they use a gluten-free flour blend to coat appetizers such as the Angel Wings. 

There was a bit of confusion on separate occasions I've dined here. On my first visit, the owner assured me that what I ordered (Beef Pad Thai and Angel Wings) were gluten-free; then on another visit, I double-checked with my waiter and he said the appetizers contain gluten. I came in a third time and the owner was present again, I communicated my concerns and he again assured me that the Angel Wings were gluten-free. 

I feel so relieved eating at a restaurant that is knowledgable and accommodating of gluten allergies. It's such a pain calling other restaurants over the phone to ask about gluten-free items and all I hear on he other end is "Free? You want a free meal?" Hahaha, you don't have to worry about that here.
author: Juliette R.

description:
Sorry San Francisco, I just don't get it.

Being the connoisseur of Thai food as I am, I was excited to try Marnee after hearing about all of the hype and seeing all of their shiny "check us out on Yelp" stickers and news clippings of "we are the best" taped to the windows... heck, once while I stopped to read a menu some woman came out and told me directly "This is it, this is the place! Everything here is good! Just go!" Ok, I said, I am ready for the mindblowing powers of Marnee, I am ready to question, DOUBT even, every notion of Thai food  that I have ever held and ENJOY it. 

And damn was I disappointed! Repeatedly! I tried, San Francisco, I tried so hard to like Marnee but every time I've been here I've found their food to be heavy (for thai food even!), bland and have a sort of sickly, dry taste... something is just off in the state of Marnee but I can't quite put my finger on it. 

So fair enough, maybe my expectations were TOO high... the place itself does look nice, it has it's charm, service was fine. But ehhhh, I don't know. It's certainly not awful but, well, there's simply better Thai food up the street.
author: Jenna I.

description:
Came here on a Saturday after seeing the Academy of Science. Just a hop skip and jump away! Literally a short walk. Thank goodness...cause I was freezing my patootie  off and needed something to warm me up. SPICY HOT FOOD, mmmhhmmm! 

Cute venue. The first seating area is in a very intimate setting..mainly for small parties, couples. There is another room for larger parties in the back. 

They were pretty busy, but we still got very good service. 

So we started off with a new item on the menu, an appetizer:
Potstickers, filled with pork and green curry. They were cooked just right..not too soggy or burnt, with the perfect amount of crisp! But as soon as I got taste of the spiciness level I made sure to ask for the main entrees to be extra spicy. I'd say it was an equivalent to a mild. 

For our main entree we ordered:
PAD THAI:
This was my favorite dish! Although it wasn't as spicy as I would prefer... I added a bunch of crushed red peppers and bam! Delicious. The sauce was savory and sweet, which complimented the spices. The chicken was proportionate to the amount of noodles. Perfect amount of veggies! I wish I could eat this dish again. The noodles were nice and chewy, not too thin. 


THAI FRIED RICE:
The thai fried rice was average. It was similar to white jasmine rice with some veggies in it. Still good. 

KANG DANG CURRY (RED CURRY):
The red curry was good. Had to add some more crushed peppers...but after yum yum in my tum tum. Coconut milk bamboo shoot heaven. 

Thai iced tea for desert... and my stomach was very pleased!


Overall food was really good, just wasn't feeling the spice.  So for those who like it hot, ask for it EXTRA EXTRA SPICY!
author: Megan R.

description:
I tried Marnee Thai and my wallet came out lighter, my belly a little sad :(

The best Thai in SF, really? Don't get me wrong, Marnee was cute inside & obviously got a lot of loving- there was a wait at around 12ish. I got there closer to 11:30ish and we got a table immediately. I just didn't expect my eggplant to be so overcooked (I mean, that's a basic...) and my dish to be too salty. My friend's dish was just as salty and a disappointment.

HOWEVER, going to a Thai restaurant with a group is so much fun. Everyone orders different dishes and eating family style is the way to go & tables both to my left & right had some decadent looking meals on their tables, so I would def go back to Marnee & give it another go. 

Parking: mmm not the easiest place to find parking. You'll have better luck finding parking somewhere near Judah rather than on Lincoln or Irving.
author: Rosa L.

description:
The wifey had a craving for some Thai food and thus Marnee Thai came about. We were visiting our friends in SF this past weekend and so we spent a lot of the time looking for food. Marnee Thai was probably one of our favorite places this past weekend.

We had the chicken Satay, avocado salad with soft shell crab, thai iced teas, and mango sticky rice...all of which were crack! The flavors were delicious, bold, and memorable. We love Mango Sticky Rice and this place did not disappoint at all. Food was delicious and the Food alone would get 5 stars.

However, service here fuckin sucks. Our waitress did not smile one bit. Whenever we asked for something, it seemed like a chore for her. Taking our orders seemed like the biggest pain for her, but yet we decided everything very quickly.

If service was up to par, I would have gave them 5 stars. A snobby attitude would usually make me talk shit all day, but the food was delicious and I can't deny that.

Come here for some bomb food and hopefully your server will be in a good mood.
author: Danny P.

description:
I first heard about the place on Bay Area Check Please and it's been sitting on my Yelp bookmark list forever. I made a reservation for a few months ago but when I showed up with my group of 6, the lady said that they didn't have my reservation on the books. Fast forward to today, I gave the place another try. I showed up at 6:30 without a reservation and were seated right away. 

For appetizer, we ordered the corn cakes.  This item was highly recommended on Check Please and I liked that it was a novel item, as not many places offer it. I really liked it, it was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. The little corn kernels gave it a good texture too. Don't forget to pair it with the sweet-n-sour cucumber salad that comes with it, adds an extra dimension of flavor.

For the main courses, we ordered a pad Thai, the duck in red curry, and the gai samoon prai (sautéed sliced chicken with onions & lemongrass, wild ginger, peppercorns and Thai basil). The pad Thai was a bit on the sour side and not quite to my taste, although the rice noodles were perfectly cooked and had a nice bite to it. The curry and sauteed chicken were just OK, nothing all that different from every other Thai restaurant that I've been to.

The food here is good, but simply did not live up to my expectations. I somewhat hoped for a more exotic menu than the run of the mill Thai places. I didn't save room for dessert, but looks like that's where a lot of the stand out items were, especially the sweet roti. I will most likely give the place another chance and see if it grows on me.
author: Alice W.

description:
Thai food is MY JAM.  I was bottle fed on Panang Curry. In high school I stole the Thai exchange student from another family. She didn't cook. Story of my life.  Basically, this isn't my first rodeo.

Sister and boyfriend took me here for my birthday meal - Xtremely generous of them considering they don't like azn food.  The place was full, but not too loud.  Our server, and owner of restaurant, May, walked over in a brilliant purple gown made of taut, semi-reflective material. She had little patience for dawdling so she ordered for us. Good thing, because it was BETTER than any Thai food I've had before.

It's easy to fall into a routine with Thai food.  You walk in thinking of the dishes you've tried before.  This is the perfect place to not do that.  Why? Because there is NOT ONE bad dish on the menu.  Ask questions, take suggestions, be adventurous.  Our favorite dish was a green bean dish, but who gives a fuck!?! Your server will have the spiritual intuition to suggest a bomb dish, and you will have the salivatory wherewithal to order it.

Icing on this epic cake is that the owner spent some time at our table telling me about my future.  First she guessed that I was younger than my sister (which isn't SUPER impressive considering I've got a straight-up tween face) and that I had a major breakup recently.  She told me I would have two man options within the year, but that I shouldn't be hasty.  Without showing my hand, let me say she was write on BOTH counts.

She then told my sister and I some things about our personalities that were amazingly insightful.  

THEN without any request, May turned off the lights and some servers brought out coconut ice cream with a candle in it.  She led the whole restaurant in happy birthday and then they had this big gong they banged on.  Birthday win.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Colleague of mine suggested this Thai joint. 

Ordered a fresh egg roll, pad kee mao duck, as well as a green curry chicken. Fresh egg roll were pre-made and left in the fridge to chill out...thus not as fresh as they said they were...

Pad kee mao duck was okay. Not as good as the picture showed on their website. It was slightly sweet like a Pad Thai. All in all a good dish...not sure if it was so good for me to drive up from the peninsula tho...

Green curry was good. Chicken was tender. Eggplant was slightly aged. Curry was flavorful and slightly spicy.

Restaurant wasn't the cleanest...my buddy's tea plate had a piece of rice on it...his plate was slightly dirty...and my cup smelled like bleach...

$1 for hot Thai tea and $1.5 per person for white rice that they come by and give you an initial serving of...
author: Derek S.

description:
Had a craving for Thai last week and my son recommended Marnee Thai. Before going I looked over the reviews and frankly was a little afraid. Seeing all the negative comments and the health scares freaked me out. But he assured me that he had been there many time with many friends and had never been sick and ALWAYS had a great meal. Well, I'm back to let all those negative ninnies out there ...... My son was right!

Marnee is a delightful little Thai restaurant with excellent service, a VERY clean restaurant and GREAT food. We started with the angel wings and if I could have licked the plate I would have. We also had the hot cakes which were light, fluffy and tasty. For my entree I had one of the curries and it was just right. Not too spicy, full of flavor and chunks of goodies. 

Our server was excellent. They were very accommodating and prompt. The restaurant itself is decorated nicely and, oh by the way, the bathroom was spotless. 

I promised my son that if loved it I would write a great review so here it is. I will definitely be back!!
author: Debi S.

description:
(More like a 3.5 rating)

Hole-in-the-wall type restaurant with really good food.  It's literally a hallway of tables.   My cousins and I (group of 3) came here for lunch today around 11:45a. Luckily there wasn't a wait.  We ordered the following:

ROTI - Funny story.  I thought this was the other kind of roti. The appetizer type roti that is normally served with a peanut sauce.  When I asked if they had roti and the server nodded, I kindly asked if we can have it first. He looked at me hella crazy but said "sure, no problem".  5 minutes later, this funnel cake pastry is sitting in front of me.  (???) Turns out.... Thai roti's are more of a dessert like dish served with ice cream. LOL.  Oops! Whatever, it was still hella good and reminded me of a yummy funnel cake.

SHRIMP PAD SE EW - I have to say this is one of the best I've had.  I inhaled most of it.  The noodles were slippery (which I like). I don't care for thick rice noodles that bunch up and stick together. It had a lot of flavor and they were pretty generous on the shrimp.  

CHICKEN PAD THAI - This was pretty good too! I liked the fact that the chicken pieces were tender and not dried out.

CHICKEN CURRY - This was just OK to me.  I've had better. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't great either.  The chicken was tender though.

Regardless, most of the food was memorable and I'd definitely come back and try the other dishes.
author: Resa N.

description: Hands down my favorite Thai place! The seasonal banana curry rocked it and the stand by of the Pad Se Ew was phenomenal!
author: Eve V.

description:
A friend brought me here after a long day and I was excited for some Thai. I checked out the specials first and found the Mango Fried Rice, which is exactly what it sounds like. As Julius Caesar said, "I came, I saw, I conquered." I enjoyed that plate of rice very much and devoured it. The sweet mango was a nice addition which helped even out the saltiness. It actually wasn't that salty, especially compared to my friend's crab fried rice. That was pretty good too, but mango is the best.

We also got an order of Imperial Rolls which was pretty good but not worth the price. You get a total of 3 and I think it's $7ish. Don't quote me on that.
author: Lauren Y.

description:
It's so crowded here! There are almost always lines and though the family-owned, family-operated, [insert descriptives on locally owned businesses and how wonderful they are] restaurant does in fact serve some of the BEST Thai food in the city (Courtesy of Citysearch), it really isn't all that it is hyped up to be.

This particular location (heck, even the other one is pretty small) has nice decor, but is too cramped for me to appreciate. SF real estate, for you...

There is nothing on the menu that I would not recommend trying. One appetizer I insist you try: the coconut pancakes. They're amazing, I promise you won't regret trying them.

Unfortunately I have come on one too many evenings where my service has been lacking. Don't get me wrong, the workers here are sincere and probably the friendliest people ever (dressed in traditional Thai attire too) but I was unlucky enough to be at the buttend of unlucky nights. Think hour long waits for the right dish to be served to your table, or being charged for three dishes rather than one.

Perhaps I'll try a time that's not so busy next time, and maybe then, I'll be able to rave about Marnee Thai.
author: Colleen M.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant ever! My husband I always come here every Friday. We love sea bass dish!  It's so tasty! Waiters and waitress are always nice and kind! Great service!
author: Chala C.

description: Marnee Thai is some of the better thai food I've had in the city. I would not recommend ordering family style here. Also note that rice is an extra charge. Sometimes the waiter might not tell you that rice is not included with that curry you just ordered. Theres a few locations throughout the city, this one appears to get busy I guess because of GG park and the museums next door.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Great Thai food since the days Zagat was still coming out with books that people carried around.

Just don't let the lady boss order for you, will be sure to get too much. 

Go there for a late Asian-time dinner at about 8pm and won't have to wait:)
author: Grace Y.

description:
Pad nor mai with ground pork
Pad thai
Green curry
author: Brandon G.

description:
Addict at first bite.  

I'm going to make a bold statement by saying that their pad se-ew w/prawns is the BEST pad se-ew ever.  It's consistently delicious and cooked perfectly.  I also have an inappropriate love affair with their basa filet (sometimes they prepare this dish with chilean sea bass if you're lucky) w/garlic + black pepper.  For all you garlic lovers out there, this dish is packed with a garlicky punch.  The fish, I prefer the chilean sea bass, is flaky and tender with tons of crispy garlic bits tossed on top and it's served on a bed of bok choy.  I love this dish, but beware of the killer after breath that comes with it.  K-I-L-L-E-R.

I have also tried their thai style fried rice w/crab, which was pretty good but not something I have to order each time I eat here.  The same can be said for their golden triangles (Thai samosas) and spicy angel wings (good, but I've had better).  I do always have to get their thai iced tea though... just wish it came in a bigger glass! 

What I would never get again is their Pad Nor Mai w/chicken.  I'm no chicken when it comes to eating spicy food and feel that I can bite into food that bites me right back, but this one has TOO much of a kick for me to enjoy.  I took a few bites (with tons of water) and had enough.

I've tried a few other dishes, but nothing compares to their chilean sea bass and pad se-ew, so I stick to my faves since I'm a creature of habit.  

Marnee Thai, thanks for the killer bad breath.  It's ALWAYS worth it! :]
author: Peggy L.

description: Phenomenal. I enjoyed every single dish our party of four ordered: spicy angel wings, Thai style potstickers, beef satay, tom ka soup with veggies, avocado salad, pad thai with pork, and pad se-ew with chicken. The potstickers were especially delicate and delicious with a green curry sauce, and the vegetables in the soup and pad se-ew were fresh and still crunchy. Nothing was too oily. Dessert was black sticky rice with coconut ice cream, amazing!!
author: Robin A.

description:
This place is pretty good, flavor-wise. Not a fan of this location's seating arrangement, it feels kinda cramped. The kitchen/sink area is open and the large pile of dishes wasn't particularly appetizing. Waiters are attentive, pretty good service.

I ordered a pad kee mao instead of my usual green curry because their entrees are al la carte! Jasmine rice is $1.50 and brown rice is $2.00. Boooo! My pad kee mao with beef was tasty, although a bit oily and cost $9.95. It was a good sized portion, pretty standard size (about 2.5 cups worth.)

Not sure if it's my favorite thai restaurant but quality food and lots of different options/menu items. Might try out the other location farther down Irving next time.
author: Sannie L.

description:
I would give this place zero star if I could. This review is for a large party of around 18 people a few years back. I had called a few weeks ahead and spoke with the owner to prepare a set menu for my guests. I was very excited about the dishes we came up with, and since I have dined at Marnee Thai multiple times, and they often do large order take-outs to UCSF, I was thinking this would be a sure-win.

Come the day of, I made a reservation at 7pm on a Thursday. The restaurant was pretty much empty. Some of my guests had problems finding parking, and they were a little late. I was thinking it was a little odd when the waiter kept asking me if I was ready for the food. I still had many guests missing, so of course I was not ready for the food! Turns out, the owner/chef had PREMADE ALL of the dishes!!!! They were just sitting there at the pass getting cold. And just to emphasize, at no point did I tell them I was ready for the food to come out. Also, he was cooking for 15 people, not 500.
All the dishes were cold when they got to the table. The eggplant looked like dog food. The wings were worse then the ones you get frozen. Fried rice was greasy. Everything was pretty much really bad.

This was my graduate schoool graduation party dinner, and I really wanted to make it special to thank my family and relatives for all the support they had given me. Instead, I gave them a sh*tty meal.

Thank you so much, Marnee Thai. You ruined my night.
author: Wanda K.

description: LOW PRICE! GREAT FOOD! You get a lot of food for your buck here and it's delicious.
author: Kevin L.

description: Brother and I came here after walking around Golden Gate Park. We got their pad se ew and the spicy angel wings because they both got really good reviews. The angel wings were really good! They came out super hot! It had a lot of chili oil in it but it was really good! I also really loved their pad se ew! Was seasoned perfectly! Definitely will be back and recommend!
author: Shirley K.

description: Marnee is always a solid choice for Thai food. I don't know if I'd make a trip across the city just to eat there, but if I'm in the area I would strongly consider it. Located really close to the botanical gardens and the light rail.
author: roger t.

description:
I loved this rest
Cute and cozy but all foods were so tasty
Pumpkin curry, green curry and pad kee mao
Cannot say much 
Service was so nice but hard to find parking
author: Tina L.

description:
So disappointed in this place. We used to eat here a lot but after this last meal, I doubt we'll be returning ever again.

They are listed on Caviar so I know that this should be prefaced with it being a delivery order. However, our food was delivered in less than 45 minutes and my comments aren't anything like "our food was cold, etc."

Both of our curry dishes were indedible. Completely 100% flavorless and without any spice whatsoever. A total joke. We ordered the Panang Curry and Massuman. My husband and I were just in shock. The white and brown rice weren't even jasmine - looked and tasted like standard, bland, boxed Uncle Ben's type rice. Shame on you, Marnee Thai! The ONLY thing that was good were their Angel Wings.

Some of our friends that live in Inner Sunset say that Marnee has been going downhill. Maybe their closing due to health code violations? Hmmmmm. Makes you wonder. Sad. I used to love this place and even had the owner sign the cookbook he wrote when we were there after our wedding :(
author: Corri C.

description:
Service Grade C-.  Its sad.  My wife and I waited for 30 minutes for a table.  They wouldn't seat us because we were only a party of 2.  I am sorry that we didn't bring a plus 2 so we can be seat in the table for 4.  In 30 mins, we could have been done and you would have a happy customer

Food Grade B-.  Service definitely effects the food.  We had the pad thai and it wasn't anything special and there angel wings had too much sauce.

I didn't give this place 1 star because this was my favorite restaurant

NO hi five...  Try if you want..
author: E T.

description:
We were lucky enough to find a parking spot right outside & scored the last empty table (apparently this place is pretty popular!), so that may play a role in my 4 star review. 

The food wasn't anything spectacular, but it was good & decently priced. We had the pad thai, some ground chicken with basil, and panang curry all yummy in my tummy. 

I'd eat here again if I were ever in SF!
author: Lori N.

description:
So we were here during a moderately busy dinner and were seated in the musty trailer park back dining room. The waitress repeated my order correctly then delivered the wrong items and indignantly stated she repeated the order to me when placed and refused to restitute her error. The food was no better than I could have prepared at home, in fact worse but overall extremely average. I didn't mind she messed up the order, I like all Thai dishes but the freshness and flavor of the Tom Yum Gai soup, Masaman and Panang curries tasted as though prepared by Mexican nationals rather than Thai cooks. Money is not a problem however it was with heavy heart I delivered the $60 for the less than mall food-court quality Thai cuisine. 
I'm certainly not a Thai food snob, I love Thai Chef on 18th, but my experience with Marnee was anti-climactic.
author: Stanley J.

description: I just ordered from here via cavier. The red curry was so oily. The oil was just laying at the top.  The curry also had a strange taste. I will not be ordering from here again.
author: Jeni S.

description:
Dudes, this place is rock solid. 
Found this place on 3/3 after spending a couple of hours at the Free Academy of Science day (wooo!). 
We got seated in the secret back room - which was okay because we were starving and needed to eat NOW, but it would be nice to sit up in the main part of the restaurant to watch all the amazing looking food come out of the kitchen! Plus they totally forgot about us at the end.
I was with two boys, and they decided they were starving, so we got a lot of dishes. 

We ordered: 

Spicy Angel Wings - they weren't especially spicy, but had a nice flavor. They were pretty decent sized (not skimping on the wings), but they were too fried for me. I would go for the Korean Wings at Ssissoo before these. But the boys really liked them.

Larb Salad - the flavor on the lettuce was good. The meat was nothing outstanding (once compared to the flavor of all the other dishes, but there was nothing wrong with the flavor)

Pad Prig Pao (chicken) - My dish. Delicious! The sauce was very good, and the flavors were STRONG. This is definitely more than "just Thai food". The spices they use are quality and it definitely shows.

Simmered Panang Pork Curry (red) - A special. Oh my goodness. I don't even like curry with coconut milk or cream. But this pork is heavenly! This cubed-cuts of meat that were so tender it seemed like they had been slowly simmering for HOURS!

Stir-fried stewed pork belly - the sauce on this dish was by far the best. So interesting, with deep earthy flavors. The pork belly was actually NOT the most favorite pork belly I have ever had (Seemed like the fat:meat ratio was off a bit), but the sauce was amazing.

This is definitely the kind of restaurant where you have to have rice because you can't mix any of your dishes! The flavor of each dish is so unique, and SO GOOD, that you don't want to mess it up by mixing different dishes together. That would be a waste of sauce!

I had their hot tea, which was also delicious. We even asked what kind of tea it was because it was so good (Thai Red tea, btw).

The bf got a Thai Iced Tea, which I usually stay away from (the whole cream thing), but it was yummy yummy, and even came with an extra pour of cream on top for presentation (but I didn't even let him mix it in, I took the top part!)

All in all, this place is amazing. And the prices are SUPER reasonable. I'm almost hesitant to post this review, because this place is already busy enough!
author: Courtney S.

description:
The owner, i think she's the owner, is teo chew! That automatically gives it an extra star! (yes, a little bias=X)

The food was good overall. Very tiny place, so avoid "lunch/dinner rush" if you can!

Ordered:
Pad thai: 4/5
roasted duch: 3/5
angel wings: 4/5 (a little salty though)

Very cute place! always fresh flowers there! We had beautiful orchids at our table!
author: Jen H.

description:
Ordered the red duck curry. For $14+ dollars I was expecting more. The curry was bland and loaded with filler; it's a little comical this restaurant tries to pass itself off as authentic when I even found peas in my curry (totally not authentic). As for the few pieces of duck that was in there, all of it was gristly chewy fat. 

If you're looking for a restaurant that serves watered down Thai food for the masses, I guess this can be a good place to fall back on (especially if you're dining with guests that don't have a clue what Thai food is); but if you want good Thai food I'd look elsewhere.
author: Mike A.

description:
THE best thai food in SF, easy. Must have: -angel wings, they're an explosion of flavor in your mouth and so juicy. 
-anything with duck, I especially like the pad see ew. Their roasted duck is so well seasoned and juicy.
-sticky BLACK rice with mango: share this though, it's divine but quite a lot for one person.

Pad thai and curries here are also stellar but the things above blows my mind every time.

Service is top notch, they're so sweet, really know the menu and my water glass is never less than half full. They even pack up your leftovers for u instead of shoving a box in your face. 

Every time a friend visits me I jump with joy because I get to take them here, share everything and gorge myself guilt free.
author: Emily H.

description: Quick delivery from Caviar..the pad kee maw was too rich (too sweet saucy) for my taste and the pad see ew was too fish-saucy.
author: E T.

description:
As a fan of the outer sunset location, I was excited to try the Marnee Thai on 9th street when a friend suggested it as a dinner option. The space is much more narrow - and packed, even on a Tuesday night! At first I was apprehensive of the long line of couples and groups waiting to be seated. However, the wait staff was able to clear some tables very quickly, and we were seated in no time.

We ordered the angel wings appetizer, satay special, green curry with prawns, and two sides of rice. The angel wings were fantastic! A little bit messy to eat, but very flavorful without being spicy. The satay and green curry were both great as well. It was clearly too much food between only me and my friend. 

My only criticism is the attentiveness of the wait staff. Although they are great at seating people quickly, it often takes a long time to order, receive the food, box up leftovers and get the check. I think we were there for over two hours. It's a small price to pay for a great Thai meal, though.
author: Alyssa W.

description: Family dinner at this delicious restaurant a few times and we always walked out happy. The food was the best Thai food in the area, the service was great. This place is pretty tiny but their food is so well seasoned, so please don't expect a lot of room for your dinner table, otherwise go to a bigger Thai restaurant for your quiet meal. Last time we were there for dinner, we had spicy chicken wings, very tasty Pad Thai, special Pad Kee Mao (Pan Fried noodles with roasted duck), Pad Phed with prawns very good with brown rice, and the Tofu praram. It was worthwhile waiting for 30 mns to get a table.
author: Lisa B.

description: They're good but the food takes foreeeeeeeeeeeever to come. Ordered for take out and didn't get our food until almost an hour later. Yeah, 1 hour. You read it right.
author: Julie L.

description: Overhyped in my opinion. I hear about Marnee here and there from folks, and generally they are saying it's great. It's still a fairly dowdy place and the service is curt at best. The food quality is pretty good, but nothing to write home about. I've had the pad thai, pad see ew, and yellow curry - probably the 3 most standard dishes around and comparatively I couldn't find something special about these, though nothing terrible either.
author: Milan T.

description:
The food was really tasty and there were lots of options for vegetarians. I was boring and got the pad thai which was still good but my friend got tofu in a delicious peanut curry sauce. The service was also really good.

My only complaint was that it smelled a little funny in the restaurant but the food and service deserve 5 stars.
author: Ethan J.

description:
I love this place. I go every time I visit San Francisco.

My friend and I shared the green papaya salad (no shrimp or fish sauce) and coconut milk hot cakes. Both are completely amazing. I think the hot cakes are seasonal, so you may not always be able to get them, but you must try them if you can. 

I have had the tofu angel wings before and they are extremely good. Unfortunately, I tried to order them this time and the waiter informed me that the angel wing sauce has fish sauce in it. Not veg. Not vegan. Really sad.

Oh, and the limeade is top notch.
author: Emily M.

description: Pad see ew was too saucy and they ran out of flat noodles for my friend's pad see ew and switched to pad Thai noodles instead. The Angel wings were interesting in a good way - sweet and sour with a bit of spice all at the same time.
author: Patrick N.

description:
I think it's time to quit eating out at restaurants. Stopped off here for lunch with my husband last week in between jobs and what a disappointment!

We ordered the following with all 1 star ratings b/c that's the lowest allowed on here

Satay chicken-I asked the waitress if the beef was tender and she said "a little, you better order the chicken. Ok, that should've been my warning to leave but we were already seated, hungry, and didn't have a lot of time. The chicken had absolutely no flavor. I've had many, many peanut sauces from different Thai restaurants and this was the worse. Though you could see the peanuts, there was no peanut taste. How is that possible?

Chicken with red curry. I love curry, specially red curry but what the heck was this? Tasted like hidden ginger delight, the ginger was so overpowering that it knock the curry out. I have no idea what the white slivered stuff was. Maybe bamboo shoots? Jicama? I don't know but it was awful.

Pork chop, this was the best of the 3 dishes. Portion was decent but again lacking in the flavor department. Maybe it deserves a 1.5 but this still rounds off to 1 start overall. 

I would not return even if I was offered a free meal. Now you know that's bad.
author: May G.

description:
The whole restaurant stinks as the place is just not clean.
The person who cleaned the table, left the table wet and i don't want to think about that. The carpet is just really soiled and you can tell it needed cleaning few years ago.

Penang curry chicken seemed like peanut sauce mixed with water and they tossed pieces of chicken in it and the server himself was ready to take it back and said "beef is better"...

food quality was no way near some of the restaurants in bay area. I felt Zagat rating was so over rated.
author: R K.

description:
I love Thai food.  LOVE IT. And this place is conveniently close to my pad, so normally when the boy and I want Thai, we make the trek down to this place. 

The food here is some of the best in the city. Seriously, they have awards and a pretty long line to back this up, but in reality it is all about the food. The one thing is that I am not a fan of their curries, but it has allowed me to try other things, like their eggplant stir fry with tofu, as well as their coconut soup. My boyfriend loves their Pad Si Yu, and he is gracious enough to let me have a bite or two of it. 

While the space is small, the wait is worth it for the food alone. We have tried other Thai places in the area and none of them can compare. The service is really amazing as well. I can't tell you how many times I have left this place with a happy tummy. All I know is that I am going to keep on coming back!
author: Diana R.

description: Got to be one of the first Thai restaurants in San Francisco, right? Anyway, a longtime favorite. As far as I know, there are only two tiers of Thai Restaurant in SF - good, and very good. Marnee is the latter. There's nothing so horrible as that you would never eat there again, and I'm not sure if fine Thai dining even exists, as a concept. Anyway if you are new to Thai food or if not, Marnee is great. Good quality ingredients and lots of flavor.
author: Matt C.

description:
I went here with a friend last night and I must say that it was supppppper good.  We had reservations made for two at 9pm and got seated immediately even though we were about 5 or so minutes late.  Thank goodness we had reservations because there were some people waiting in line and it was a packed house.

Upon being seated we were pour some water with a slice of lime in it. I don't know why, but there's something about good sprucing up water with the simplest things such as mint leaves or lemons.  I love it and it really makes the experience of eating out a little bit extra special. heh 

Anyways, we had ordered our food and the staff was just amazing.  Our waitress, Patty? and another guy named Kevin were really great and came to check on us to make sure we were having a good experience. Good customer service = thumbs up! 

Now, the food was just deliciousness!!! We ordered the Pad See Ew, Eggplant something and Pork curry.  All of these dishes were made just right and between me and my friend I would say that we killed it leaving only a little bit left. 

Eggplant: I typically don't prefer eating vegetables, but was recommended to try this by my friend and it was surprisingly good. 

The Pad See Ew was just absolutely flavorful. Most Thai places I feel offer this since it's a common customer selection/favorite, however, it's always lacking in flavor. They always look good and alike, but once you take a bite out of the noodles you realize it's pretty bland.  Marnee Thai did a good job with ensuring that there was flavor in every bite :)!
 
Lastly, the pork curry. OMFGggGG.. IT was just sooo tender and the sauce, though a bit spicy, was damn frigging good. I would have to say this was my favorite out of the others. 

The only thing was that parking is a bit hard, but we ended up closer to the Golden Gate Park where parking is free and easier to find.  We walked over, no bigger. 

Marnee Thai might just be my new favorite Thai place.
author: Suzie B.

description: This place is descent we got the thick noodles with chicken which turned out to be descent. The roasted chicken came in a generous portion. Service was great make sure you get served by ken he was really fast and nice and gives you the time of day even during busy hours.
author: Vincent G.

description:
Yes, believe what the world tells you. Marnee Thai is my favorite and the best Thai restaurant in the city! Basically if you order anything, you will be satisfied. Walk into the restaurant and you'll find yourself standing next to a wall of impressive accolades and reviews on one side and the busting and noisy kitchen on the other side. It's a cozy, narrow restaurant that is always packed so plan accordingly or make reservations.

The food here is incredible - the noodles, fried rice, appetizers, and curries are delicious and full of flavor. As long as you're a fan of Thai cuisine, you'll find yourself overwhelm by the number of options to choose from whether you're looking for a spicy dish or a savory dish. Some of my favorites: Pad Kee Mao, Pad Se-Ew, Fried Rice with roasted duck (definitely a must - that duck is incredible), Green Curry with chicken, and Papaya Salad, and the Ma Kuer (sauteed eggplant dish)! That curry sauce can literally be poured onto any of the other dishes and it will taste good.

I think what makes this place great is the atmosphere and the simple pleasures of eating really really good Thai food. The staff is very friendly and the place is great for family gatherings or reunions. Beware of parking woes - parking at Golden Gate Park is a viable option but beware that cars need to be moved by 10 PM.
author: Cheston W.

description: I have been coming here for the past 10 years or so. Probably one of the best in the bay or at least one of thr best. What sets them apart is the price, authenticity and most importantly service. Management does a great job tackling down the true meaning to customer service. Its absolutely one of the cleanest and best tasting thai restaurants in town and will be here to stay. Just check the awards on the walls....they speak for themselves.
author: Gary L.

description:
Fantastic green curry - which at this meal, came as a sauce for their pot stickers.  

The Pad Ma Kauer, eggplant with your choice of prawns, chicken, or ground pork, was great.  The Pad See-ew was comparable to most other Thai restaurants, though it is heavier in garlic than most. 

I liked that the water came without ice, and with a small lemon wedge.
author: Di Yin L.

description: Yay, I found a solid Thai place in SF! I still love several places in South Bay more (e.g. Krung Thai), but this place is great. I ordered the panang curry and it was delicious. The serving size was perfect (didn't skimp at all) and the service was great. This will be my new go-to Thai restaurant in SF.
author: Kelly B.

description:
After being on TV, this place has been packed!! We came Saturday night and had to wait ~2+ hours for a table for four!!! I have never waited this long for a table anywhere in my entire life, but after you invest 1 hour of waiting time, you just stick with it. Fortunately, Pacific Catch with a lovely bar was across the street, so we grabbed a drink there. 

We finally sat down around 9pm and the angel wings and those coconut rice cakes were already gone :(

Instead we got mieng kum, papaya salad with softshell crab, pad thai, green curry, this fried fish, and two orders of Hor Mok.  The pad thai and hor mok were delicious. The curry was too watery.

The mieng kum was delicious and they give a lot of spinach leaves. The papaya salad was also yummy and the softshell crab was also tasty.

The mango sticky rice with black rice was super good. They ran out of white sticky rice, but we all felt the black rice was far better.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Normally I LOVE Marnee Thai. I come to visit San Francisco from Minnesota where we have decent Thai food (if you know where to get it - Bankok Thai on University if you're ever in St. Paul) and love to try out my current favorites at Marnee Thai. This time the food did not disappoint but the service was a bit lackluster. They are usually so quick and speedy with quality food but the service was beyond slow this day. (Sunday night,  around 7)

Normally when I've gone with my cousin (always just two of us) we have been able to be seated right away even though the places is always packed (good sign in my book). No different today but when we ordered an appetizer of simple summer rolls and nearly 25 mins went by we had to ask where they were.  The waiter apologized saying he got our table mixed up with a table that had ordered the same thing but had a peanut allergy (Which if you have a peanut allergy what are you doing in a Thai place?!) Anyway, the rolls were delicious as usual and their in house peanut sauce is amazing. 

Another 20 mins and we finally had our food. 

Mine- A red curry with veggies, tofu and shrimp.  It's worth noting here that even though I specifically ordered the "Veggie Red Curry" listed under vegetarian options which comes WITH tofu and has more vegetables listed than their normal curries - I was still charged extra for two proteins.  $3.00 for the tofu and $4.00 for the shrimp (which i was expecting but did not expect to be charged for the tofu since it was included in the dish description). In total my curry was nearly $20 of the total bill with the side of rice to go along. NOTE: you have to order the rice separate, it does not come with your meal. But it was great. Just enough heat to make your nose itch but not too much to overpower the veggies (mini corn, mushrooms, carrots, pea pods, broccoli, cauliflower, red pepper). 

Pineapple fried rice was delicious as usual and not a spec was left on the plate. 

We did again, have to ask the waiter for our bill. Which seemed odd since there was now a line out the door for tables. And our waiter seemed to be helping every table along the wall row of seating.  Perhaps they were understaffed but he was overloaded with tables. 

Overall: Food is always good - service this time was a little subpar
author: Alisha H.

description: Wonderful Thai food! Like many of the other reviews, I think they have great food and great service. I often go there for the tom ka soup with chicken or shrimp, the pad Thai, pad see ew, or the duck over spinach. It's always super fresh and warm and the servers are very friendly. If you're in the mood for some great, wallet friendly Thai food, this is the place to go!
author: Jenn A.

description: I had BBQ pork. It was a big plate! Because I am a big eater, I was satisfied. I had summer rolls. The price was reasonable, too.
author: Kaori M.

description: Again, another satisfying journey to my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. This time ordered to-go. 2 orders of chicken pad Thai, skewered chicken, and angel wings. I ordered 15 minutes after they opened and they said within 20 minutes it would be finished. I get there 15 minutes after and right when I walk in they're wrapping up my order. Took it to golden gate park and enjoyed it with friends and a free concert. Food was amazing and full of flavor. Satisfying and fulfilling.
author: Brian L.

description: Ordered the crab mango salad special... The crab looked so grody I sent it back. The waitress gave me so much crap when I told her I wanted something else! My friends' food was great and I exchanged it for green prawn curry. Pretty okay.
author: Medina C.

description: Went here all the time when I lived in the city. Best Thai food I could find. Love the decor and the Thai iced tea was super good too.
author: Courtney L.

description: The food was just amazing!! Loved the mango fried rice, green curry and Tom Yum soup!!
author: Nisha B.

description:
I've gone here twice, once for dinner and once for lunch. Each time the food has been great. Fresh, flavorful, and incredibly cooked. The service isn't anything to write home about yet they serve you when you need it. The place isn't huge on the inside but you can typically find a table. They have a counter and table seating although they only seem to use the counter as storage with extra utensils and menus.

My friend who works at the De Young recommended this place and explicitly told me to skip the new Thai place up on the block. She says to get the angel wings but to replace the wings with tofu. I have always forgotten to order this. I'm sure I will some day.
author: Michael H.

description:
I've always wanted to come to Marnee Thai as I've heard so many great things about this place.  I knew it was going to be a great night when I found parking right in front of the restaurant.  If you know this neighborhood, you know that parking can be tough.

As a first timer, I wanted to make sure I was going to be seated right away to avoid the wait which this place is known for.  I made reservations for dinner last Friday (12/14) and as soon as we arrived, we were seated immediately.  The food is AMAZING!  We ordered the Mango Salad, Panang Beef and Pad Kee Mao.   The Panang Beef was so tender, cooked just right and flavorful.  I'm already dreaming of going back just for this dish!  

Our server was fast and attentive.  She was helpful in explaining some of the dishes and asking if we can handle foods really spicy.  OH, YES I CAN!  The spicier the better.  

The restaurant was clean but pretty noisy.  If you plan to gather here for a work meeting, I wouldn't suggest it unless you feel like yelling across the table.  I also don't suggest this place for large parties as the restaurant isn't very big.  I think it's good for parties for 4 or less.
author: Anne M.

description:
Obviously this place has been hyped up to the max due to Check Please! program and other overly generously ratings from Yelpers, not to mention people who haven't tried real Thai to authenticate whether it is good or not. 

I've said this many times in my other reviews, I just wish that people can be accurate and precise while being generous with their reviews. 

So, allow me to go through the list for y'all: 

+ For the wait time, it varies depending on the time you come and the number of people you have in your group. So, please, the wait time should not be the make it or break it factor here. I do agree if the hostess of the restaurant is a bit more communicative and honest with the clients, Marnee wouldn't have lots of people leaving angry about the wait time. 

+ For the setting and ambiance itself, do not expect much. The place is extremely small and during rush hours, you are literally packed in like canned sardines. I do not think this is an exaggeration at all. It is not a place for you to come and sit and enjoy your dinner. Tables are lined up one after another and there is literally no aisles. So, try to shrink yourself a bit be4 coming here! 

+For the foods, it is just ok.. Really! Spicy angel wings, totally overrated. We tried their pad Thai, pad sew and hor mok. All were ok. No WOW factor here to mention. My friend insisted on trying the Mango Sticky rice for dessert. When we saw the plate, I almost wanted to hit his forehead with the spoon. Nothing special...bottom line. 

+For the service, like most typical Asian restaurants, communication level is at a limited capacity. I believe they do try to accommodate all but sometimes it doesn't come across that way though. I was actually double charged when i checked my credit account. I'm still in the process of trying to resolve this with Marnee since last time I called them and spoke with the person who double charged me on my account. He was brave enough to call me right back and informed me that he'd be working on this. So, stay tune, I will update on this. 

All in all.....It's all just a big hype.....
author: TTK H.

description: Made a reservation on a Friday night, no problem getting in with a table of six. Awesome food, but my favorite in SF is still Ler Ros Thai in Hayes Valley. Of course the angel wings were a must order and they did not disappoint. So great. Then we tried the soft shell crab and mango salad (awesome), mango fried rice, penang beef curry (skip this), ground pork pad kra pao (awesome, although we asked for it with a fried egg and they gave us the egg all alone on a separate plate....), and finally we tried the pad thai (which on the menu it was described differently and called something else so we had no idea until it arrived at the table that it was freaking pad thai! Although this version came with crab which was nice.) We of course had to end the meal with some mango and sticky rice, a great end to a great meal. Highly recommend this place!
author: Jessie M.

description:
So about a month ago, I got Pad See Ewe to bring to work with me and I open my bag to find that the hot sauce had spilled all over the connection port on an iPod nano. The result was a Sriracha smelling, non-functioning, pastel colored paperweight.

It is a testament to how good Marnee Thai's food is that the first thought that came to mind was, "Eh, still worth it."

This place is solid for dine-in and take-out. Service is kinda meh at times but it doesn't really matter if you love Thai food enough. My faves: yellow curry, pad see ewe, pad thai, mossman curry, and sweet and sour vegetable stir fry.

Their phone number shows up in my phone contacts list before my mother's does.
author: Teresa T.

description: Best tom yum goong I've had in a very long while. Pad kee mao, pad kra pao gai were all delicious.
author: Nancy P.

description:
The first thing that hits you is the smell as you walk in. Soooooo good.

I came here for my birthday dinner with one of my friends. We got vegetarian eggrolls and corn fritters as the appetizer. The eggrolls are sliced, but they are relatively bite sized so it's not too messy to eat. The corn fritters were crispy and delicious and came with a fresh cucumber salad that made a great accompaniment.

I had the green curry and rice and my friend had the pad see ew vegetarian style. I was so full by the end of dinner, but I really wanted to keep eating because it was that delicious. Haha. My friend got really scared that there was meat in her pas see ew, but it ended up being seitan. Pretty cool.

Our server was really nice and attentive and I never had to flag him down for anything. Which says a lot because when I eat spicy things, I drink water like I breathe air.

We were so full by the end of the night that we didn't order dessert - though I almost wish we had because they all look absolutely delicious. If I still lived in SF I would most certainly return with frequency.
author: Rusty S.

description:
Momma F. and GMa F. were in town to have lunch with Jenna F., and kindly took me along for the ride. 

The ride was called "Marnee Thai." Apparently, I was not tall enough to ride that ride. Or that ride sucked. I'm not sure which. 

So at thai places, I always get my standard steamed tofu and veggies in a non-oyster sauce and dump chili sauce on it. I have ordered it from at least 5 different thai places near school. I'd like to think I know whats up. 

And whats straight up- Marnee thai's tofu tastes awful. No wonder they usually deep fry it. 

And our service sucked. (Again, I worked in CS, I know you hate your life, I hated mine too- just feed me) But homegirl was BEYOND over it. I got like that once- I almost decided to burn down the building. Instead I quit and never looked back. 

And it took us about an hour and a half from seating to check signing. I'm still not sure how that one worked. 

The seasonal hotcakes were quite good though, and vegan. Oh, and they had good brown rice and good free post check candy. So that's the only reason it's getting 3 stars. 

Maybe its a fun ride for meat eaters?
author: Emily D.

description: The best wide noodles I've ever had! Pad se ew with prawn was exquisite! Works nicely with their lime-ade.
author: Natalija K.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in SF and that's really saying something. It seems like there's a Thai joint on every corner there, but nobody can capture flavor like this place. 
First off, the cuisine is specifically Siamese and they use traditional cooking methods and ingredients for truly authentic Thai food. I love that they offer a variety of vegan entree options. The fried eggplant dish (Spicy Ma Kuer) is amazing. It's cooked perfectly and you can taste the freshness of the eggplant. The tofu with spicy chili, garlic, and Thai basil is one of the best. Its fried perfectly on the outside and creamy on the inside. 
If you're in the area I highly recommend this nice little spot. It's on a good street and a short walk from a Sunday farmer's market and some cool shops. Wait staff is very friendly and sweet. The outside of this place is really ordinary, but inside its clean and casual. Will certainly be going back with friends.
author: Anna M.

description:
Deeeeeeee-licious!

Since having to go gluten-free, my options for dining out have changed dramatically (namely no burritos, pizza, or Italian) BUT Thai is definitely okay. Thank goodness! Of all the Thai home-cooking sitdown style places, Marnee Thai takes the hat. There is inevitably a wait, so either order for pick-up or plan to wait for at least 30 minutes. 

The curries and salads, unless indicated, don't have soy sauce and thus no gluten. So have at it. Of course, always check with your server since recipes and menus do change. Also, good to let them know so that they don't contaminate your dish by reusing cookware or cooking utensils.

Enjoy!
author: Cat T.

description:
My family has been going to Marnee Thai for years, we love their food and have high praises for their Angel Wings, Tom Yum Soup, and Fried Roti. 

But, this location is bad. My boyfriend and I drove across town to stop here for lunch and although the service was great, the food was below average. We spent about $50 for soup, curry, angel wings, and spring rolls.

The only thing I thought was decent enough was the soup (even if the portion was tiny). I would avoid this location and go to the original one.
author: Shaina T.

description:
Been here three times so far with the boyfriend. Service was prompt and courteous every time. When I ordered the brocolli beef and rice thang except vegetarian-style (the irony, i know), they brought it out with beef the first time but realized the mistake after 10 seconds and speedily prepared the right dish.

Good crab fried rice.
Good stir fried prawns.
Good Marnee Thai :)
author: Lauren L.

description: I haven't spent much time in the inner sunset, so my boyfriend and I decided to venture out for thai food. What a great choice! The wait was short, the food arrived quickly, and the food was terrific. We split a pad thai and a panang curry with tofu. Yummmm.
author: Eliza D.

description:
As soon as I walked into the restaurant I knew it was love at first smell.

This was my first visit to Marnee Thai and will be coming back. Below are my top personal reasons.

1. Food was delicious!!! 
2. Service was great and not long wait
3. The kitchen is in front so you can see as they cooking. (pretty cool!)
4. Small place but cozy, you can bring a date or hang out with a friend. 
5. Is delightful to walk into a restaurant where the place smells of yummy food smell. 
6. Prices are reasonable
7. You can make reservations

The only down side would be parking. I went on a Thursday night by 6pm and parking wasn't too great. I would suggest to go after peak hours but if you really can't then just don't rush. There is the golden gate park where you can find a spot only across the street on Lincoln Drive. This place is so worth it I wouldn't care. 

I am looking forward to my next visit.
author: Jessica L.

description:
12.28.11

Dear Angel Wings:

Hi.  We've met before.  Multiple times.  I'm sorry I haven't kept in touch as much as I should have.  I promise to do better in 2012.  You are still my favorite Thai wings.  Cross my heart.

Love,
Jenny
author: Jenny L.

description:
i had the simmer? panang pork curry and it was not as sweet as i was expecting, a lil on the saltier side. but the other chicken curry my friend ordered as just as expected.
i love the corn pancake? and the angel wings!
service was decent, would def come back!
author: Ru C.

description: Very underwhelmed with the taste and quality of food. There were five of us and we ordered family style. The soft shell crab salad was bitter and the crab was chewy & sour with too much vinegar. The Thai noodles were too sweet and overly sauced in their peanut garlic chili sauce. The pan fried sea bass with garlic black pepper crust was way overcooked and the garlic had a burnt bitter taste. Service was very slow. Desserts were pretty good. We got the Roti with coconut ice cream and fried bananas.
author: Toan D.

description: The vegetarian pad Thai is the best ever! Even if you're not a vegetarian, I suggest you try it as it would surprise you. I feel like one serving is enough for two girls. At least one is too much for me. I was too full to try the dessert.
author: Bian Y.

description: Superb food, decently priced. The Angel Chicken Wings AND Thai Lettuce Wraps are a MUST HAVE!!
author: Brian N.

description: Came to this place for the very first time seem like a good place until we sat down and when we were ready to order my bf and I decided to just order one plate for and entree and rice and the waitress told us that there was a minimum of $8 person and I looked at her like "wtf" okay and than she was all like "well this time is okay but next time there will be a minimum " like she was doing a big favor for us .... She was pretty rude I'd say. When we got our food it smelt straight up like soy sauce did not smell like Thai food at all and we know cause we eat Thai 2-3 times a week . Food was not great at all. And we still had rice left over in out tin thingy and the lady just took it away without even asking if we still wanted it. We paid for it so I don't know why it was just taken away like that .. I wouldn't come back here food wasn't that great and the service there was terrible
author: Linh N.

description: Just had lunch there, we both got pumpkin curry with tofu. Yuck! the curry and tofu had a nasty flavor, as if the palm oil they used (floating orange goo) was old and stale. Really, we only nibbled, then just gave up trying to eat it. Makes me doubt all these great reviews.
author: Taylor E.

description: Well, I think not.  We ordered 3 vegetarian and 1 meat dish (for grandpa) to go at 5pm, so they were not busy at all.  When we got home, hungry and ready to eat with 2 kids, we had 3 meat dishes and 1 veg. (And heavy meat, prawns and chicken.) Luckily my kids and I were able to share the one veg dish so at least we ate.  Later when I called to complain they were just like, whatever, nothing we can do.  I don't think they believed me.  So I'm stuck with some nasty meat filled thai food and we are vegetarian. I WONT be going back.  VEGETARIANS BEWARE.
author: Bridget J.

description: Delicious neighborhood Thai. Definitely going back
author: Veronica M.

description: When I first walked by Marnee Thai and looked in the window to see all the Thai guys dominating the kitchen I thought "holy shit this place looks legit".  Well after two visits, Marnee Thai is LEGIT.  And since I live right up the street I hope in the words of the great MC Hammer that they are  "too legit to quit".  Just thinking of this review is making my mouth water.   Mmmm the Tom Ka soup, mmmm the fresh spring rolls with the peanut sauce, oh the curries, oh the tofu dishes.  So far my favorite restaurant in the Inner Sunset...
author: Thomas R.

description:
Marnee Thai never disappoints!

They are still serving some of the best (if not THE best) Thai food in the Bay Area. Consistently delicious food, excellent service and always something new to try on the menu.

Tonight was the first time I ate in the back dining room. Much more quiet than the front dining room. If you're looking for a bit more of a manageable noise level, ask to be seated in the back!
author: Christy L.

description: 4 star is definitely overrated , this place serve ok thai food. some of the local dublin thai restaurants serve better ones.  all their dishes wont come with rice which u need to order separately.
author: Andy W.

description: Delicious food and excellent service. Would definitely go again. Very reasonable priced too. Parked one block away in a public parking lot.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Just outstanding! This is my favorite thai restaurant in the city... everything is mmm mmm good.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Best Thai food I've ever had!

As much as I like Ozone and Osha, Marnee Thai blows them out of the water. Although it's more expensive, it's for a reason. On a Friday/Saturday night it'll be hard to get a table - the best part is that they do takeout! Call in your order and it's ready for pick-up in about 20 minutes.

Get the Angel Wings, Pad Thai, and Mango Fried Rice. You won't be disappointed.
author: Brad Y.

description:
9th Ave - Great location, sweet service, and above all tasty food.  Highly recommended!

The details - The 9th Ave loc is walking distance from Golden Gate Park. Parking is a non-issue and the walk is great for your appetite.  We came in for a late lunch after visiting the CA Academy of Sciences, and there was no wait.  A friendly 'khop khun' (thank you in Thai) and a smile from our party, and we were on for a great time.
[Disclaimer - I am not from Thailand]

We had Tom Kha w/ shrimp (coconut based soup), green curry w/ veggies, panang curry simmered w/ pork, and my go-to dish at any new Thai place (in Thailand or elsewhere), Basil Chicken (Gai Pad Krapow).  The Basil Chicken was killer - pungent with garlic, balanced with chillies, fish sauce & sugar, and flavored with basil.  Mmmm.  The other dishes were good too - nicely balanced.  Their table hot sauce (nam prik) was fresh, and when we complimented the server lady on the sauce, she got us another version from inside, and even packaged small samples of both in our doggie bags.

Overall, this was a great experience - will go there again.  Khop Khun Khap.
author: Arnab P.

description:
3.5-4 stars

The pad thai was pretty good but the spring rolls could have been better. I ordered the vegetable deluxe since I was craving vegetables. It was small but good. The rest of the table got Pad see ew and another noodle dish and everyone seemed to enjoy their dishes.
author: Holly C.

description: I don't know what happened, this place used to be one of the best in the city. They were out of the Hor Mok fairly early on a Sunday, which was the main reason we went. Everything except for the coconut noodle dish was below average. We were both really disappointed as Thai is our favorite food and this experience was probably our worst experience eating ever eating Thai food (out of close to a 100 times eating at Thai food resraurants). We would never go back with all the great options in SF (especially Ler Ros, the Larkin one is best). If in LA, try Night + Market, Jitlada and Spicy BBQ (maybe the best one but it is a hole in the wall) along with all the other ones in Thai town like Ruen Pair.
author: Dave N.

description:
Came here on a weekday night for dinner after seeing that the other Marnee Thai off 22nd and Irving was packed! Came over to this one in a short drive and it was only a 5 minute wait before getting seated.

I think both Marnee Thai's are very small locations, if only they had bigger ones! 

Their food is amazing. I love Thai food and this has to be one of the BEST. You'll see all their features posted on the wall and framed for guests to read when you wait in the front

I ordered a tender pork curry one night and got some white rice along with it. it was soooooo good! Their service is really good too and I can never complain about them. 

Their pan fried noodles are always good too and so is the fried rice!
author: Kenny L.

description: Service was nice but food was subpar. Curries were watery. Rice was very small serving size. Thai ice tea excessively sweet with no discernible tea. Won't go back.
author: Maria T.

description: Great experience.  Everything from the hostess yelling at the patrons to get up in the middle of their meal so that she could move their table, to our waitress telling us what to order because we had too much fried stuff... It was fantastic.  I felt like I was getting bitch slapped by my favorite auntie.  And to top it off, the food was probably one of the best Thai meals I've ever had.  Perfect balance of sweetness and heat.  When my mom ate the leftovers the next day she said, "Cindy!  You need to tell your local Thai restaurant to go take lessons from this place."  Umm, yeah.  A little bitchslappin from Marnee Thai is a good thing, but I'd probably get punched in the face for that one.  But then again, it might be worth it to get Marnee Thai in our hood!
author: Cindy W.

description:
From many of the reviews and magazine/guides awards this place has won I was expecting to come out of there giving it 5 stars and maybe even replacing it as my favorite, above Ploy II.  Alas, no.

In general, I found the food to be nothing special.  Chicken satay was just ok, peanut sauce nothing special, and my favorite dish, Musamun Curry, usually made with beef chunks but here with chicken, was probably the worst I've ever had.  Musamun is not an easy dish to find in SF, it's a Southern Thailand regional dish and only a select few carry it.  This one did not have the right flavor, too much oil, not enough chicken, and the chicken it did have was pretty gross dark meat (sorry I'm a white meat snob -- but even this dark meat did not look great upon further inspection), the potatoes were overcooked and one of the main attractions of the dish, peanuts cooked in the sauce, were greatly lacking.  And it took WAY too long for the food. 

Sometimes I'll go back to Thai restaurants I wasn't bowled over with the first time to try some of my other favorites like Tom Kha Gai soup and Pad Thai, but at this point there was just too much disappointment, and there are too many others Thai restaurants to try -- like the one up the street on the other side of Irving from this one.  

I agree - the staff is very nice and very hardworking, and I even like the narrow, cozy interior.  But it all really comes down to the food and, unfortunately, Ploy II is still my favorite.
author: Merrick W.

description:
I came here with a group of twenty. They forgot to take one of my friends orders -_-.
The portions were on the average to small side. Somewhat pricey. BUT BUt BUT I would have to say MARNEE THAI is one of the best THai places. Everything they got is delicious and I don't care how bad service is because the food is so good. I ordered the RED CURRY with Roasted DUCK. absolutely delicious. I hear the PAD THAI here is one of the best as well. I will definitely come here a bother time. The parking around the area isn't too great but its San Francisco and you can't really expect less. CHECK IT OUT!!!
author: Victoria L.

description:
It's super busy, super crowded. The place is small & the tables cramped up together. Whatever! So what if I'm feeling Claustrophobia!! Arggg #1!! 

Anywho we look over the menus. There's 3 of us & we're not too hungry so we order 2 entrees. The Pad Thai (which for me is the first taste test to see if i like the place) & the Pad Se-Ew. The waitress says there's a $8 minimum per person. Wth! Arggg #2!! We are forced to order one more item. She recommends the Homemade HotCakes. We say "Sure" with such glee! Haha ya right!

The HotCakes come first. There's 7 of them on a egg poacher pan. The waitress takes them off the pan giving us 2 each on our plates & the last one falls on the table. Not so happy about that Arggg #3!! 

I did like the HotCakes & heck no i did not eat the fallen HotCake. Finally our entrees arrive & I liked the Pad Se-ew more that the Pad Thai. 

Date: Friday October 21, 2011 @ 9:30 pm
Arggg: 3 Total
Purchases: Homemade HotCakes $7.95, Pad Thai $9.50, Pad Se-ew $9.50
author: Donna D.

description: Had the pumpkin curry yellow (mild)! Had generous portions of Japanese Kabocha, mushrooms and other veggies. All the ingredients were super fresh and cooked just-right. The curry itself was not too salty or overwhelmingly flavorful. Their portions were pretty generous as well. A good lunch or dinner place.
author: Jenny B.

description: Best Tom Yum soup I've had! Requested vegetarian broth and it was incredibly flavorful, lemongrass? The prices were also very reasonable for SF: soup, 4 entrees (huge portions), and Thai ice tea for $54!
author: Ashlee L.

description: Great sea bass special with crispy garlic and black pepper sauce!  Pork belly special has too many peppercorns and not enough pork belly. Soft shell crab over avocado and mango salad was fantastic!  Choice of white or brown rice. Excellent brown rice! They have pomegranate, mango, or lychee martinis. Overall highly recommended place. Good service.
author: Quinn V.

description: i was not too impressed... the pork belly dish came with mostly dry meat without belly fat. there was also more bell pepper than meat. we also had the fresh summer rolls, egg rolls, golden triangles, papaya salad, chicken green curry, duck red curry, pad thai, pad kee mao, and chicken larb. none that stood out from any other thai restaurant that i've been to.
author: Judy L.

description: I would have loved to give this place 4+ stars, but they were out of a couple items I was hoping to try.  Staff is friendly and helpful, working hard to keep everyone happy.
