When we were in there it was obvious that many of the people eating were regulars, as the staff knew them by name. Overall food was really good, and price was very affordable as well.  Definitely one of the better spots for Thai in the city, too bad you didn't have everything on your menu!
author: Ben S.

description:
Really nice service and staff. 

Marnee Thai hits the spot. I love their pumpkin curry, it's a perfect combination of sweet, savory and a mild spicy kick. Their hotcakes are wonderful too!
author: Jesse K.

description: Don't even bother going. I waited 1 hour 20 minutes for my to-go order. Good service doesn't exist here. Rice is not included with the curry main dishes. Once home my taste buds were murdered by the spice levels of chosen dishes. I say again, don't even waste your time.
author: Kevin C.

description: I used to rave about this place to people visiting from outside SF but NO MORE. Everytime I go there to take out, its a problem.  The wait staff, particularly the unhappy orange haired guy is so rude its unbelievable.  They told me he's the manager and some of the reviews indicated his discusting behavior.   I've had to return there twice because I didn't get what I ordered for take out.   And then he looks at you like you are the crazy one. They do have a vermin problem still but yet they think they are above fixing it or doing anything about it.   The food USED TO BE excellent but now its mediocre at best.    I don't see how someone like this can keep his job when he  goes out of his way to be EXTRA RUDE to customers.    Looking forward to discovering OTHER Thai restaurants in the area! NEVER AGAIN!!
author: Tracy T.

description:
The food is generally good here. The reason to why I say this is because there have been a few times when I felt like there was a new chef cooking or something, because the food was more oily or the flavors were slightly off. But more than often, the food's delicious. This is my go-to Thai place so that should say enough.

Love their appetizers and main dishes:
-Angel Chicken Wings
-Papaya Salad
-Soft Shell Crab Salad

-Green Curry
-Thai Fried Rice
-Pad See Ew
-Pra Ram

I have yet to try more dishes here.
author: Julie H.

description: Eggplant with sliced pork outstanding- great pad Thai.  Panang beef a bit chewy- try the green papaya salad!
author: Joanne C.

description:
My friend and I had a very nice dinner at Marnee Thai. We sat at the bar, right across from the bazaar pickled orchids. The orchids are supernaturally large and are suspended in 2 foot tall glasses of liquid. I was reminded of a vivarium and jarred dead animals. Also, the restaurant has a weird pressure issue that was really annoying for my ears throughout the meal. It felt like driving down the road and only having one window open. You know, that weird throbbing pressure in your ear...

Anyway, I guess I should talk about the food. My friend and I ordered Pad Se Ew and green curry to share. The noodles were delicious! But the green curry was soooo spicy! And we had asked for mild. I myself don't mind spicy food, but this was overwhelming. I had to take breaks. Because of the unexpected spice level, pickled orchids, and pressure differentials I have to give Marnee Thai a 3.
author: Kristen F.

description: Great Thai joint in the city! I liked the decor and their dishes are flavorful. The service is a bit slow but not their fault if the whole restaurant is filled with customers. That says a lot now doesn't it?
author: Helen C.

description:
I love this place. We stumbled upon it when we moved into the area and hadn't even heard any thing about it. Since then, I recommend it to everyone and often they say "oh yeah, I've already heard about how good that place is!" Well, I guess it's not my own discovery but that's cool :)

We used to live in Southeast Asia so we are very picky about food we eat from that region. I can honestly say I've enjoyed everything I've tried here -- especially the curry dishes. I've never had a problem with the service, but I'm sure the place has only gotten more popular and crowded since we've been last. Which reminds me, we're due for another visit soon!
author: Fanny S.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Marnee Thai food flavors and spices.  Their version of peanut sauce based items are the my favorite.  Their staff work hard but they are sometimes overworked and service suffers.

Sadly there are some factors working against them.  The building is old, the facilities are old, the seating areas are old/small and all could really use an update/makeover.    

The food safety and kitchen/prep areas have been getting bad grades and during the summer corrective measures included a temporary shutdown by the SF Health Dept.   

Plus their prices have gone up and portion sizes have gone down recently.

Hoping Marnee can turn things around and improve in right direction.

Marnee Thai
July 9, 2015 -- Routine Inspection  Score 71/100

Violations
Inadequately cleaned or sanitized food contact surfaces
Inadequate food safety knowledge or lack of certified food safety manager
Unclean nonfood contact surfaces
Inadequate and inaccessible handwashing facilities
High risk food holding temperature [ date violation corrected: 7/21/2015 ]
Unapproved or unmaintained equipment or utensils
Improper food storage
Moderate risk vermin infestation [ date violation corrected: 7/21/2015 ]
author: Robert M.

description:
Marnee Thai, you get our first 5 star review! Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. He checked in often, but wasn't overbearing. Our water glasses were never empty. We definitely felt tended to.

We got the yellow curry with lamb and the spicy eggplant. The curry was bomb--we have a lot of feelings about that curry. The lamb was tender and melted in our mouths, and the flavors were in perfect harmony. The spicy eggplant was not as spicy as I would have liked, especially since I asked for it extra spicy, but it was still decent.

For the dessert, we got the roti with coconut ice cream. It tasted like a top-notch funnel cake. The ice cream seems homemade.

We're definitely coming back!
author: Dante and Alleliah G.

description: We went with our kids and try almost everything on the special menu, and I have to say that "Coconut stir-fried Rice Noodles" was our best order ever, we ordered it twice !!! The soft shell crab with mango salad was delicious and spicy (too much for kids).  The homemade hot cake were deliciously sweet. The Wild-Caught Sea Bass was crispy and tasty. The thai style potsticker juicy and yummy.  The kids and us loved our dinner ! The service was really fast ! I would just love that they refresh a little bit the decor and paint of the restaurant and it would be 5 stars.
author: Frederique C.

description:
Delicious. It was Tuesday at 8pm so there wasn't much of a wait. good thing too since I was HUNGRY.

As recommended by the owner, we started with the hot cakes and the spicy angel wings.

Spicy angel wings - ok, while it's not quite san tung down the street, these are good. I wanted to save the sauce to slather on my rice later.

Hot cakes - rice cakes with coconut, topped with pumpkin (or sqaush?) and mango (I think... last night is a bit of a blur). It's a little sweet for an appetizer, I'd prefer to eat it as a hot dessert but I loved it. For those filipinos out there - it was kinda like eating ginataan in solid form.

It was our first time here so we wanted to try some staples. Red curry and pad thai. Both were satisfying. I'm not usually a pad thai fan but it's delicious here. My favorite part was the big pieces of scrambled egg in the pad thai.

Per the owner, we ordered a garlic and black pepper dish with fish. This was REALLY good. fried fish topped with fried garlic and other stuff. You better love garlic b/c there's at least a whole head in there. This was probably the hit of the table.

Service was really attentive. Everyone was really nice and friendly. Can't wait to make it back.
author: Karina G.

description:
This place is amazing!  Reasonably priced, top of the line Thai food.  I LOVE Thai and have tried more Thai restaurants than I can count and this is far and away the best one.  I have never had a bad thing on the menu.  

Recommended items:
Green Mango salad (warning: its spicy)
Pad Kee Mao
Pad Se- ew
Peanut curry
author: shelby p.

description:
Come for the spicy angel wings, aside from San Tung.. these might be my second favorite!

I've been coming here for ages and the food and service is still great. This place can get busy because it's kind of small, so I would opt for take out instead sometimes. The kitchen is in the front and you can watch the chefs prepare your order in front of your eyes while you wait. 

I would come here for their spicy angel wings, any of their curry, pad see ew, or any of their a la carte entrees with eggplant. For all those who only order pad thai at Thai restaurants, I think their pad thai is really good, not too oily like the ones from King of Thai and cheaper than Osha's ridiculous mark ups.
author: Helen Z.

description:
Beside Osha, this is another favorite place for Thai food. I Have not been have for forever since I live in Berkeley and I missed it! 

2 words, Chicken wings! The best!
author: Fenny G.

description:
We came here based on the Yelp reviews and we were not dissapointed. It was very busy but there was no wait which is nice with a 4 year old in tow.

The food we ordered was excellent. My little guy is super picky and wanted fish with no sauce, I asked the waiter what they had that fit that profile and he suggested the Basa fillet with the sauce on the side. It was perfect and the sauce was amazing too.. We also had the imperial rolls, they come with sauce on top not what I was expecting but it made them so good. Last but not least we ordered the Pad Kaprow in chicken and spicy it was excellent and very spicy.

All in all if you are looking for a great Thai place go here you will not be dissapointed. I have been waiting to do my first Yelp review of a place that was amazing and I finally found it.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
Don't waste your money here. 

Came here the other night for a double date. The other couple arrived earlier than us, so they snagged a table before the lines got long around 6pm on Saturday. 

We were seated all the way in the back. Service was so very slow, it took forever for someone to come by and take our order- it was busy but still!. Then we watched waiters come in with food, hoping it would be ours, but it was served to all the other tables but ours. 45 minutes later our food finally came. 45 minutes?! Maybe after 30 minutes of waiting, the waiter came by saying our entrees were on the way but they got backed up. Seemed weird especially since everyone in the back room had left except for our table and a table of 3 sitting next to us also waiting on their food. 

On to the food. I can't vouch for the other couple's food, but as for me and the boy, we shared the Tom Ka and a tofu panang curry. Tom Ka was decent- we had it with vegetables and tofu. Slightly salty for my taste and pricey for the portion. The tofu curry I would never order again. The fried tofu was just deflated and the sauce was pretty oily and was different from all the other panang curries I've had before. Didn't seem creamy at all and was pretty bland. They put steamed broccoli on the side- I thought they'd add some veggies or something in the curry itself. So considering all of that it was not worth the $10.95. Usually tofu dishes are cheaper than meat dishes, but this dish was the most expensive thing on the receipt. Really?! $11 for tofu, bland sauce, and some steamed broccoli? The portion was so freaking small too!

Took another 15-20 minutes just to get the bill- and it wasn't even thaaat busy.

Disappointing experience. However, our server did give us a 10% discount because we waited so long for our food. Still don't think I'd ever come back here though. I'm baffled at the high rating for such a mediocre restaurant.
author: Katrina L.

description:
Good food, nice looking restaurant. 

I lived in inner sunset and had a number of their dishes, all were pretty tasty (noodle dishes and curries).
I recommend the angel wings and the appetizer special (i believe they are fried corn cakes). The fried corn/coconut cakes are SOOO good. Definitely order if they're available.

But go to Soi Gow for green curry with brown rice!
author: Caroline D.

description: Very delicious food! Their house wine was delicious, I enjoyed how it was more on the sweet side. Their wings are delicious! If you are a garlic person you'll love it as well. Their pad Thai is the best I've had since I moved up here from SoCal. Their red curry is okay, not the best but definitely not the worse.
author: Katarina F.

description: For some reason I am never in the mood to come to this place, but then for some reason I do and I always end up loving it. I don't know if its because the restaurant itself is just kind of blah or the service is never anything special, but I really should go more because the food is some of the best Thai in town. I just discovered the Basa Filet with Curry Sauce. Unbelievable! Also they have awesome specials that pop up like these fried dumplings I ordered the last time I was there. I try gyoza, pop stickers and fried won tons every time I try a new place that has something like that and the ones at Marnee Thai were the best I've tasted. If you see them, get them.
author: Dexter H.

description:
Mediocre Thai, charged $3 extra dollars to add literally 3 small pieces of broccoli to a veggie dish.  me thinks not. 
We also had to wait 45 minutes to pick up a to-go order they told us would be ready in 15.
author: Audrey K.

description: We dine at the place Friday, January 2, 2015 about 7:00pm.  Parking was hard.  They gave us the worst table in the place.  We  were seated at the table when you first walk in.  Ladies purses and rear ends kept hitting me as I tired to eat.  The noise level was loud.  Our server could not hear what we were asking for unless we raise our voice.  I order the mango fried rice which was very bad my wife order pad thai noodles and silver noodle salad which was pretty good.  We will try it again but not the best thai food I have ever had.
author: Bryan R.

description:
Great service and great foods 
Specially the curries and the fry rice 

The deserts are the best the fry banana and ice cream
author: GoldenSpoon F.

description: I have been coming here for years. It is by far one of my favorite places in the city. You have to try the  Miang Kum  appetizer the flavor combination is like nothing you have ever had before. They are known for their Angel Wings but you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu. I cannot say enough good things about this place, only if you do not drop by for a meal, you would be really missing out.
author: Toney N.

description: Needed a quick dinner on Saturday night.  Looked this place up on yelp and was sited right away.  4 stars?? Two at the most, maybe 2 and a half! Tom Yom soup was bland.  Eggplant with basil was dry as hell.  Ordered two different kinds of wine - both tasted flat and old.  The place looked dirty.  Will not come back.
author: V s.

description: i don't write reviews.  I feel like i need to on this one. worst yellow duck curry ever!  tasted ultra concentrated and like it had flour in it?  it was take out and i had to add water to it to make it "ok."  i also "had" to drink a lot of red wine to help it down. i eat a lot of curry. Ive often heard people say marnee was the best.  easily the worst I've ever had and i have no agenda to say so.  dunno if the chef was in a funk or actually hasn't eaten their own cooking in awhile, but this sucked enough for me to write my first review in a few years. apparently my GF has bought this before and brought home ( thanks love!) but i didn't like it then either. now i know id never eat this garbage again. boo. yuck, wtf?
author: Adam K.

description: Fantastic joint. Its my go to place for lunch. I always order over the phone before heading out their. They normally have my order ready within 15 mins of my order. Their veggie pad Thai is a personal favorite of mine. Yummy.
author: Martha O.

description: Delicious Thai!  Not really worth ordering online when the wait times are quoted at an hour!  Best to walk in and wait for your order.  Definitely super busy when I came in.  The spicy wings were as good as everyone before me has written and the golden wings were heavenly.  I can't even pronounce let alone spell what I ordered but it had wide flat noodles and roasted duck, YUM!!! My fiancee's pad see yew was tasty, though he says it tasted a little different than he's used to.  Will definitely order from here again!
author: Jessica M.

description:
My husband and I decided to go to the 9th street location for dinner. We  did not get good service on prior visits and decided to give it another chance due to current reviews.

Pros:
Overall service was good. We had reservations so the hostess got us seated immediately over 8 people that were there before our arrival. Server was sincere and professional while taking our order and we did not feel rushed. Water was refilled several times.  We felt they were all very attentive considering how busy the restaurant was that night,

Cons:
1.Based on all the good reviews, we ordered the chicken wing appetizers. I would not order this again because it tasted like it had been sitting out reheated with a glob of sauce. Chicken was not that tender or fresh and I have had better wings.....especially at San Tung (those are  amazing)!!!!

2. Entrees ordered were the Sea Bass and  a type of Coconut noodles (tasted like Pad Thai) and was not what we expected. We were surprised the sea bass tasted so oily and not with a lot of flavor inside. They did not over the fish but just was not season well for my taste. Instead it had globs of fried garlic over it. I LOVE garlic but it was so overcooked it was hard and tasted a bit burnt. The garlic definitely tasted like it had also been sitting out and was recooked. The  bok choy that came with the fish was stringy.  The coconut noodles were not what we expected....nothing that alerted our taste buds to be excited . Flavor was just OK and would not order again. 

3. Thai ice tea....it was ok. I have had better tasting ones where you can really taste the tea and the milk. 

4. Leaving the restaurant was the final disappointment. The kitchen is located in front so as you walk out you can smell that awful smell of lingering overcooked oil in the air. 

Personally for us, we wouldn't mind the crowd if the food was well prepared and fresh. I would have preferred to eat at Park Chow, Ebisu, Hotei, San Tung, Yummy Yummy, Pasquale's, or even Perilla if we were in that general area.
author: mimi c.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in SF.  Explore the menu and you'll find the food is excellent!
author: Dan C.

description:
Originally me and my bf were trying to eat at San Tung about a block or two away, but the wait time was ridiculous. So I yelped to see what was around the area and forgot that Marnee Thai was right around the block. We quickly left that long line of hungry waiting people at San Tung and walked to Marnee Thai. When we got there the restaurant was pretty packed and the host brought us into their back room which I didn't even know existed till that day.

We were starving so we ordered spicy angel wings, chicken pad thai, panang beef, mango fried rice, and pad praram. Everything was de-lish and we had tons of yummy left overs.
author: Kristine K.

description:
I really enjoy Thai food, but I have a hard time differentiating between Thai places because it feels a bit samey to me.

Not this place.  What a fantastic restaurant!

I came here with a friend a couple weeks ago for dinner.  We started out with the Spicy Angel Wings.  My friend heard they were tasty and...they were spectacular!  I wish I had gotten a double order ;)

I also picked up a Singha while waiting for the main course.  I've never had that beer, and I'm glad I got to try it.  Yum!

I got a pumpkin curry (again at the suggestion of my friend) and it was fantastic.  The texture, taste, and spiciness were superb.

Service was quite nice, and the bill wasn't that much with all things considered.  I think if I'm just in the neighborhood looking for a nice dinner, regardless of whether I'm looking for Thai/Asian food, I'd definitely stop by.

Also...their website is really nice and relaxing.  Check it out!
author: Robert S.

description: Love the food here! It's *almost* as good as the Thai food I had in Bangkok, just almost. The dishes are always flavorful and hot. You will leave satisfied if you're craving Thai food. This is my go-to place since it's near my house and well, it's good! I've basically tried all their noodle dishes and thought each one was fantastic, and their Angel Wings are pretty good too, but not as good as the chicken wings at San Tung (sorry).
author: Michelle L.

description:
2 Stars for the HOR MOK with snapper
3.0 for the service and having eaten here off and on for many years 

My family and I have been eating at Marnee Thai for quite sometime, easily 10 years.

Last night we ordered the yellow curry chicken (which had large chunks of potatoes that we couldn't finish), roasted duck with spinach, papaya salad and the HOR MOK which i have really enjoyed in previous visits but not this time. 

What happened Marnee Thai? This dish, of which there are several images on Yelp, is fish made in a banana leaf along with basil, a mousse, and leafy vegetables. I actually don't remember what type of vegetables were included in the past because the fish and the mousse filled more of the bowl and the veggies were at the bottom. 

This time, the bowl was filled mostly with iceberg lettuce and I was literally dishing out lettuce from the very beginning. I couldn't even find the fish. There was a very thin layer of fish, snapper, that covered the top. And that is it. Imagine eating lettuce covered with mousse and some spinach. For $13, I was really disappointed. Would have ordered something else more satisfying. 

Would be curious if others have experienced this as of recent. 

I still think Marnee Thai i one of the best places to eat authentic Thai but I probably won't order the HOR MOK again until I see more reviews that show that they've stopped adding so much lettuce. Also, the chicken curry pieces were quite thin and the huge chunks of potatoes overwhelmed the chicken. But the sauce and dish itself was quite good. We left a few potatoes because it was simply too much. Are they trying to use more fillers? This was not our experience previously.
author: Akiki A.

description:
This place was delicious!! They have a special appetizer (can't remember the name) that are these incredible little coconut milk cakes with corn and carrot that are poached in a cast iron skillet so they are creamy inside and a slight crust outside. 

We had the pra ram chicken, pang beef, spicy prawns as well. Every thing was perfect and not heavy which was great for our late lunch. Reasonable prices considering the food quality and service.
author: Mandy L.

description:
Hands down the best Thai food I've ever had in San Francisco. Actually...the best Thai food I've ever had anywhere. If I end up going to a different Thai restaurant, I always find myself wishing I had spend my money on Marnee deliciousness. I prefer going to the location in the inner sunset as the head chef is always there actually cooking your meal for you. But the location in the outer sunset is just as satisfying. 

Some of the items I regularly get from here:

- Green papaya salad: my favorite of all! I also ask for it extra spicy and it just makes my mouth water. So delicious and refreshing.
- Golden triangles: PLEASE GET THESE! Curry pumpkin fried amazingness. I get these every time I come here.
- Spicy eggplant with basil: I'm not a fan of eggplant. In fact I hate it. But I can eat this dish all day long.
- Spicy minced pork with egg: This is under the chef's reccomendations. And may I say it is a fabulous reccomendation.
- Chicken with ginger and peppercorn: A dish I get a huge craving for every now and then. Fabulous and flavorful.
- Red curry with chicken: My classic fav.

Need I say more?
author: Sara K.

description:
We made a reservation for 5 on a suday evening. We got in and was seated right away. 

So our server was amazing. Be sure to ask for Tim. He helped us choosing which meats to get with which dish. He was also super nice and had a great sense of humor. 

We did a family style dinner between 5 ppl. We order sea bass with garlic and black bean sauce, pad kee Mao with beef, prawn pad Thai, stir fry pork belly, chicken yellow curry, Tom kha gai. 

The food came out staggered, so there was always food on the table without having the table ever crowded. 

The food also came in a great ordered where the spicy food was served last so our mouths could still taste the whole meal. 

As for the food, it was all good and cooked really well. Good flavors. Amazing meal experience.  

As for the spice level, the spicy food was not overly spicy, but did have a nice kick, at least for me.
author: Howah L.

description:
So, how did I find this place? I heard tell of a Thai place on this side of GGP that had the "best pad thai ever," but never got the name of the restaurant. Yelp reviews yielded Marnee Thai, a place where the pad thai was mentioned a ton of times. Yes, yes, I know that Thai food is WAY more than pad thai, but I have a serious weakness for it.

And it was delicious. As were the Angel Wings, and holy hell, can you say coconut-corn hotcakes? Those things were sweet and tasty and would have been excellent as a dessert as well. We may have gotten a fourth thing, but honestly it was a while ago and I don't remember anymore - if we did, it was probably delicious, too! Thai iced tea, same, and very sweet.

Service and ambiance were good as well, but not overwhelmingly spectacular. Still, with food this good, who really cares?
author: Amanda P.

description: We came over for lunch and ordered 4 dishes. Food was great and the service was efficient. The only reason it's not a 5 stars restaurant is beacsue of the look and feel of this place.
author: Eran P.

description:
Luckily it wasn't too crowded when we came here. Arrived around 9PM to grab some actual noms after spending a couple hours at Nightlife in the Academy of Sciences. I've heard good reviews from friends about this place and all recommended to try the Angel Wings. My partner in crime for the evening was a vegetarian so luckily this place was very accommodating and allowed us to order the Angel Wings vegetarian style and the regular style with the chicken wings. That spicy garlic sauce that coats the Angel Wings - MM MM MMMM. It was finger-lickingly good.

Other items we ordered to share was the mango fried rice as well as one of the green curries. The curry had a nice kick to it while the mango fried rice helped to mellow it out. 

I wouldn't say this was THE best thai food in the city, but it's pretty good. Reasonably priced with good service is always a plus. I hear there's usually a line, so next time I"ll just order my angel wings to go.
author: Julia K.

description:
Marnee Thai is the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco.

What I recommend:

1. Spicy Angel Wings
2. Papaya Salad
3. Panang Beef
4. Pad Kee Mao
5.Mango With Sticky Rice
author: Prayoot J.

description: Spicy angel wings are the best chicken wings I've ever had. Not expensive at all either.
author: Chuck D.

description:
We called at 6:15 to make a reservation at 6:30 and they reserved us a table :)

-Angel wings: every boys dream.
-Roti with Ice Cream: Every girls dream.

The atmosphere is so alive and lovely that pulls people in from outside. 

The service is great
The food is outstanding! 

I ordered a pork belly and curry (w/o coconut milk) entree that was ridiculously yummy! Not much else to say because we, (boyfriend and I) have never ordered something from this restaurant that we didn't approve.

Great for dates!
author: EJ G.

description: I had a chicken Pad See Ew here a few weeks ago, which at the time tasted fine and was alright. Nothing crazy in terms of deliciousness, just good. A few hours after I finished the meal, I started feeling a little off. The next day I spent half the day running to the bathroom. 7 days later I lost 12 pounds and had had an upset stomach most of the time. Now I just found out this place has been shut down in the past for health violations. Not going back to this place.
author: Vitaliy D.

description: I had never had anything here that wasn't just tasty and wonderful. Especially the basa with the garlic and black beans. Rarely ever are there leftovers. Awesome!
author: Erin L.

description:
I love the pad thai: very nicely stir fried without being too soggy, the noodles were perfectly cooked (not mushy or tough), the sauce is light yet tasteful.  But there is lack of tofu or shrimp in the pad thai.

The famous angel wings: a bit tough because it was fried too long.  The sauce on the outside is yummy.  

Yellow curry with chicken:  great sauce, chicken slightly dry, order your own rice.

Extremely small space, you probably have to walk sideways to get pass in between tables.  Gets packed quickly and best for tables of 2-4.
author: Ju D.

description: I don't need to write paragraphs to describe how incredible Marnee is. Best restaurant I've ever been to. Done.
author: Sarah S.

description: Bad news, people. I went back and the pad thai was way too sweet. WHAT HAPPENED?! So devastating. On the bright side, I tried the chicken larb (fun to order just to say the name), which was out of this world. It was my first time eating larb, basically a mint salad with cilantro, lime juice and sour/salty chicken pieces. Yum. Will return and definitely order the larb again, and cross my fingers that the disappointing pad thai was a one-time thing.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
The World According to Noelle
~Allergic Girl's Guide to Life~

"Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives." C.S. Lewis

Upon entering one will note the beautiful orchids in tall cylindrical vases immersed in water. Service is friendly and attentive without being intrusive. Water and hot tea were refilled constantly which was nice. Our order: fresh spring rolls in a tamarind sauce, a noodle dish with roasted duck, a beef dish with red curry, samosas filled with curry, pumpkin and potato which was the perfect combination of sweet/savory/spicy.  On a side note, Allergy Girl only consumed the samosas and dessert due to the fact the other items were not on her 'allergy friendly list'. For dessert we shared the Roti with the Coconut Ice Cream- which was a sweet ending to a delicious dinner!

Noelle's Notes
Delightfully delicious.

Noelle's Post Secrets
http://www.imeem.com/missm701/music/haA58iGq/etta-james-a-sunday-kind-of-love/
author: Noelle J.

description:
The food is great, I've never had anything here that wasn't delicious. The missing star is for the giant fan (or whatever it is) that throbs and pulses so loud at the front of the restaurant our heads hurt by the time we leave.

So request a seat farther toward the back, or go to the 23rd Avenue Marnee, and you'll have yourself some excellent Thai food.

Final note: I'm not a vegetarian, but I appreciate that I can substitute just about any meat meal with tofu/veggies.
author: Abe D.

description: The original location is better!!! But both locations are overloaded with oil now, pork oil I assumed. Used to be great in early 2000. Everything has changed in SF. Chicken basil tasted the same as Pad Kee Mao, which is so weird. I'm a big fan of Thai food and I've tried all Thai chicken basil in the bay also in NYC. I like the seabass, but it;s so greasyyyyy, mamma mia
author: Clemencia S.

description:
Marnee Thai makes up for the lack of good authentic Asian food in the city.  

I know a lot of San Franciscans would beg to differ, but I dare these people name three good (non-Chinese) Asian spots that would match the standard fares in South Bay, in particular Korean or Japanese izakaya / yakitori joints. ;) And no, Brothers (http://www.yelp.com/biz/brothers-restaurant-san-francisco) does NOT count.

But Marnee Thai is money.  We knew it the moment we stepped into the place - the fragrant smell from the open kitchen was definitely enough to kick up the hunger a few notches.  

Thankfully we didn't take any risk and called ahead for a table, otherwise we would've had to wait for a long-a$$ time.  That's right, on a Tuesday night too! 

The menu looked like a pretty standard Thai menu: curry, basil and chili stir-fry, larb and oodles of noodles.  Thankfully the taste was anything but. 

We quickly ordered the sickly sweet, addictive (and very money) Angel Wings, which combined my two favorite method of food preparation: deep-fried and coated, or should I say drenched, in sweet chili / tamarind sauce (I do have a blunt palate sometimes).  

A spicy Pad Siew (with roast duck - DO NOT order it with anything else!) and a mild pork red curry soon followed.  I thought they *could* be a bit spicier but I had to also be nice to my dining companion, so I didn't order them extra spicy - I had a heaping of chili powder on the side of my rice plate instead!
author: Ange L.

description: Yeah, the food has been good every time I've been there, but they got shut down for a week due to health code violations. The report was pretty damning, and I suggest you don't read it unless you have a cast iron stomach. I just can't go back there again. Beware.
author: Howie N.

description:
Not the best Thai place I've been to in the city, but the food was palatable to good, so I would come back here if I were extremely hungry and in the neighborhood. 

Service was decent, dining environment was typical. This place was very accommodating to larger groups, however, so that's a plus if you're looking for a venue for a special occasion like a birthday.

If I had to choose one word to sum up my experience here, "eh" would be it.
author: Amy T.

description: This is the best Thai food in the city in the moderate price range. Every single dish that I have tasted has been excellent. The food has never been too greasy. The service is really great and friendly. The wait for a table can be a while because the restaurant is on the smaller side. But it is soooo worth the wait!
author: Michelle I.

description:
I've been hearing about Marnee Thai for so long.  I even tried cooking the angel wings even before I tried it in their restaurant.  You asked how my angel wings turned out?  It was muy delicioso!  Pretty close to theirs.  

So came here couple of times already.  Angel wings is very yummmm.  Panang beef and their curry dishes were good.  Pad thai was yumm.  Service was good and food came pretty quick.  

Their dessert the roti one was yummmmmm.  
I'm writing this months after I came here, so right now my mind is focused on the newly discovered restaurant on Larkin, Lers Ros Thai.  

Comparing these two restaurants, Lers Ros Thai is more convenient to get to, but Marnee Thai has that roti dessert.  Hmmm
author: Claire J.

description: Great service! I came here with my girlfriend after picking her up from work. When we arrived, we were quickly seated and they took our order in a very professional manner. We ordered the coconut hotcakes and they were sooo delicious!! We also ordered the yellow curry with chicken and pad kee mao. Both were really delicious! My girlfriend told me the potatoes tasted a little weird on the curry and when a waitress came to ask me how everything was, I told her about the potatoes. She quickly helped get us a new plate of curry. Once again 5 stars for service and the food. Would love to come here again.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
You have my loyalty Marnee Thai!  Not only was my take away amazing last night, every flavor I was craving, but I saw something that really touched me.  

As I was waiting for my order to be packed up a homeless type man came in and sat down.  I was being my normally crusty self and wondering when they were going to shoo him away.  However a few minutes later the server came out with a takeout container for him and told him to be careful....really brought home the humanity that some people have.  A lesson for me as well.  Thanks Marnee.
author: Brye L.

description: I will never NEVER eat at Marnee Thai again. I've ordered take out a few times and was satisfied but not impressed.  After LEARNING THAT THEIR HEALTH SCORE WAS (58) due to COCKROACHES and RODENTS!!! I'm DONE!! FILTHY, DISGUSTING, and should stay shut down forever.  I can just imagine all the other health issues... so done.
author: Andrew V.

description:
After seeing the review on "Check, Please! Bay Area," I decided to give Marnee Thai a try.

My wife and I arrived at around 2 PM on a Sunday.  The restaurant was quite bustling and it took a few moments for us to be seated.  The place was a bit smaller that I had expected, but still comfortable nonetheless.

1)  We started with the Nam Tok - Spicy Beef Salad.  The beef was incredibly tender comparable to most other Thai restaurant that I have been to.  Greens were extremely fresh, and the dressing of lime and fishsauce along with the roasted rice topping were perfect.  Serving size was very respectable given the price.

2)  As recommended by the server, we tried the coconut and corn hotcakes.  This dish was featured on the tv review and was offered as a special.  It was presented in a croquette "takoyaki" pan which was scooped out by the server onto our plates.  It consisted of a rice flour batter topped with corn, pumpkin, taro, jalapeno, and sweet coconut cream.   Great combination of savory and sweet flavors along with the gelatin texture of the batter.  

3)  Lastly we had the mango fried rice with shrimp.  Raisins added a bit of sweetness to the dish, while the mango added a nice brightness.  the shrimp was cooked well, and they were quite generous with the portion.  The homemade hot sauce which is offered on every table was a nice addition to the dish.

All in all, the servers were extremely nice, and food was very satisfying.  For an authentic Thai experience I highly recommend.
author: David D.

description:
I don't want to write a novel here, but I feel compelled to write my horrible experience.

I came here with my friend for dinner and it took wayy too long for us to get seated! There was an older couple who came after us and they got seated first (I guess because my friend and I look too young, but still) - that pissed me off a bit and I complained. A woman (Im guessing the owner) wanted to appease us and so she gave us the next table.  

The food was delicious - I have nothing to complain about. But the service here was a bit... eh. The same hostess came by and kept throwing out recommendations which was great at first, but I felt she was becoming way too pushy. She then told us to try some desserts and my friend and I said "maybe later". A waiter comes by with the desserts and that becomes included in the bill. I told the hostess that we didn't order the desserts, but she kept claiming that we have agreed. I honestly had no energy to argue, so we just paid the bill and left. I will not come back.
author: Clementine D.

description: I went to marnee thai expecting the good cheap thai food but I was wrong on both counts.  The only reason why I'm giving marnee thai 3 stars was because the angel wings were pretty good.  However, the pork belly that I was served was hard to swallow.  There wasn't much flavor and the pork belly was very rough.  And you know what they say?  Hard to swallow.... hard to come out.  That's exactly what happened.I kinda know why I just stick to the pad sew ew whenever I go to a thai restaurant.  How can you go wrong with soy sauce,sugar, vinegar and whatever else they put inside?  I don't think I'll be back unless I'm forced.  Thai food just isn't that great to me.
author: Steven S.

description:
I've been to Thailand, and Thai is one of my all time favorite foods. I've tried hundreds of thai restaurants in America and honestly, this is one of the best thai restaurants that I have been to in the Bay.

My boyfriend and I come here all the time, and the people there know us. I mean, its SOOO good, I want to eat it now :P

Their Duck curry is my boyfriend's fav. It's really good. And we never leave without eating FBI (fried banana ice cream).

FYI, it is small, and SUPER busy, so you will need to wait. BUT WORTH IT. And you will leave full.
author: R M.

description:
Delicious food. Pretty much as good as it gets. Friendly service. 

Kind of tight quarters, but lovely nonetheless. Had to wait in line to be seated. Well worth the wait.
author: Keri K.

description:
I came here with a friend in the hopes of getting some really good thai food, and that's exactly what we got! We started off with the spicy angel wings (the tofu version), and they were perfect - delicious, spicy, and fried to perfection! I loved the fried basil leaves throughout too. 

For entrees, I got the pumpkin red curry with tofu and my friend got eggplant something (beef?). Mine was a bit salty, but I tend to find most places add too much salt for my taste, but otherwise perfect!

And to round it out, we got one of my favorite desserts - mango sticky rice with black rice. It was divine! The mango was sweet, the rice was appropriately sweet and sticky, and the coconut milk was as rich as I remember it. 

I'll definitely be back! It's a little more than I'd like to pay to make this a regular place ($50+ for all of the above, including tip), but every time I come back, I know I'll walk away very full and very happy!
author: Jas M.

description:
I deeply love Thai food.  That said, Marnee is one of my absolute favorite Thai restaurants anywhere.  Everything on the menu is good, but the Pad Se-Ew is perfection.  The Tom Kha soup is spicy and delicious.  I also highly recommend the hotcakes with coconut cream.  They look and sound super weird, but somehow they just work.

This is not the place to go for a quiet meal on your anniversary.  The tables are very close together and it can also be super loud.  If you have a group, you can reserve larger tables in the back which can be quieter.
author: Rosie R.

description:
Pineapple fried rice was NOT on the menu... So instead I had the Thai fried rice.

It. Was. Amazing.

The quality of their ingredients is top notch. And the flavors and portions of their dishes is superb.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Hands down, the best Pad Thai I've encountered in San Francisco. 

It's very affordable and the service is fast and friendly. The set up is bright and welcoming and while always bustling with hungry patrons and servers, Marnee maintains the perfect level of noise to take the edge off an awkward first date but also be able to hear your conversation. 

I already mentioned the Pad Thai, but the bacon wrapped prawns and pumpkin curry are a must as well. Finish with fried bananas and coconut ice cream and you're set for the night. 

My only complaint is that they don't deliver! Forcing me to lower my standards when I can't drag myself out.
author: Nicole S.

description: Awesome service, awesome food, just overall awesome!!! If you want really good Thai food this is your place. The pad Thai is the best in the city, hands down. Not just good Thai food just really good food.
author: Rachel D.

description:
I initially didn't like this place because I was spoiled by the TL's Thai restaurants, but I kept coming back. Now, after 10+ dinners here, I love it. I only order their tofu pad Thai, Thai style fried rice with sausage and papaya salad. They actually use fresh tofu and fry it upon order. That is the real reason why I come back many times over. Other restaurants would give me those small re-fried cubes of tofu (dry and old). 

One big downer is this: when I request for extra spicy for the papaya salad, they always come out mild! Crank it up a notch people!
author: Alisa M.

description:
Not even close people! 

I have wanted to try this place for over a year now. I live in Santa Monica and visit SF a few times a year to see my sister. She raves about Marni Thai. We finally got a chance a few weeks ago and lemme tell you, I was excited. Unfortunately after walking out after a really uninspiring dinner, the disappointment set in really quick. I suppose I should have known better that on a Saturday night there was the whole back room open and no wait. 

There were 3 adults and two kids, who love their Thai as much as I do. We all placed our orders and anxiously awaited our allegedly divine food. My sister ordered a sea bass in garlic sauce. It looked good, but damn was it oily and just not flavorful. I took a few bites and was waiting for 'the' flavor to jump out at me. Never happened. 3/4 of the fish sat in its oliy sauce only to be thrown out. Strike 1!

On to my Pad Kee Mao. It's my favorite noodle dish. I order it at every Thai place we go to no matter what else is ordered. I love the leftovers for breakfast. What I was served was nothing resembeling any Pad Kee Mao I have ever had. What was placed in front of me was a heaping sticky mess of saucy red rice noodles, some chicken, and occasional chili and I think a piece of onion. This is supposed to be a spicy dish, but is was sticky sweet. I don't know what the hell this was meant to be, but I almost asked if I had been served the right dish. Strike 2!

Then there was the green curry. My 9 year old could eat a bowl of green curry every day of the week. The hotter the better as well. He's not a normal kid. His curry was a huge bowl of very average tasting, not spicy bamboo shoots and chicken. There was a fair amount of chicken, but an insane amount of bamboo shoots. I estimate that there was 2 or more cups which I considered to be filler. He likes the shoots, but I felt this was a cheep move on their part. I think I make a tastier green curry at home. Strike 2 1/2!

Oh, yes, and then after a good 20 minutes of being served all but one of our dishes, my daughter's bbq chicken arrives. I thought that we were actually going to leave without her eating. It probably would have been better to have not even have ordered it. It was so lacking flavor.It was very obvious that the chicken had not been marinated for very long at all. I was hoping that it would have been served with some exciting sauce like all good Thai BBQ chicken is. It wasn't. The sauce was the same sauce served with both bland appetizers. I guess there is only one type of sauce that this place serves. It was some sweet stuff, but that's about all I can remember. Blah! Strike 3!

When we left, I didn't say anything to my sister who had been to Marni maybe 15 times or more. She finally broke the the tension and said that it was not good at all and that she expected much better like her other visits. Then she said that there is a second Marni that opened in town. I'm wondering if they took the good cooks and are using them at the new place to get it going. Such a bummer. I really, really wanted to like this place, but it truly sucked. Maybe I am spoiled because I live in LA which has the largest Thai population outside Thailand and we have a pethora of good Thai places to choose from. I would say that I won't even go back to try Marni again.
author: Melissa H.

description:
As good as advertised.  Simply some of the best Thai food you can find in the Bay Area.  

I can get a bit picky about my Thai food considering I grew up eating it at home every day, so I know I'll have much better luck finding the good stuff in the city compared to the Peninsula and South Bay.

I saw Marnee Thai being reviewed on "Check Please..." and then went to Yelp! to confirm the rave reviews.

Yes indeed,  everything we ordered was fresh, authentic, and delicious.  We enjoyed chicken satay, corn fritters, som tum, mango fried rice, chicken pad see ew, penang beef red curry, haw mok, roti with vanilla ice cream, and mango with coconut sticky (we had 4 adults + 4 kids).  Although I was a bit disappointed that they ran out of the kanom krok (homemade hotcakes), which I really wanted, we'll definitely be back.  

Now when someone asks me for a recommendation for Thai food, I can now confidently say, "Marnee Thai.  Go there."
author: Radit T.

description:
I came here with my mom and my sister on a very chilly day, so I was very happy to start eating hot and spicy foods. We had a total of four plates; tom yum with prawns, spicy angel wings, pad kee mow, and the papaya salad. All four dishes were very yummy. The only dish that was out of the usual thai food fare is the pad kee mow, it was spicy and rich with flavors. The tom yum was filled with prawns and very delicious since it was a cold day. I didn't eat the chicken but my mom and sisters said they were very good and very different from any other chicken wings they have tasted. The papaya salad good but a little bit too salty for me, maybe too much fish sauce? All in all it was a good visit. I was also very shocked to see that Iron Chef Cat Cora paid them a visit before! awesome!!

My only complaint is the fact that it took us 30 minutes to find parking, which is rediculous.
author: phuong H.

description:
Like the other 100+ reviews state, the ANGEL WINGS are bombdiggity! I would come here just for those crispy fried sweet garlic sauce drenched chicken but the other dishes here are just as good. I've found my favorite Thai place in the city!

Marnee is conveniently located right across the way from Golden Gate Park so if you're coming from the Academy of Science or DeYoung Museum like we were, this is the spot you must try for dinner. My friend was visiting from NY and we had gone to three museums that day. We were definitely tired and hungry for something warm in our bellies. 

We ordered pad thai, pumpkin curry, mango fried rice and the must-have angel wings. Everything was delicious. I know pad thai is a standard dish that everyone gets and is always generally good everywhere but Marnee's version is even better. The noodles have a really good chewy texture to them. The angel wings are also one of the most delicious things that has ever passed through my mouth. It's topped with fresh fried basil and the most tasty sauce EVER. I save the extra garlic sauce on my plate so I can eat it with rice after the chicken is gone. 

We didn't get it last time but the sticky mango rice is the perfect way to end your meal. It comes with a pretty orchid so you can take those awesome food pictures for all your Facebook friends to see.
author: Julia T.

description: I personally like this one versus the one in the outer sunset area, space wise. Food is the same-- so delish! Go go go! :)
author: Emil J.

description:
I recently went here for the second time, as the first was such an amazing experience with MoMo D. The food was amazing and the service was excellent. I had the Kang Ka Ree Lamb and potatoes and it was splendid. The lamb was cooked to perfection and full flavored. I've been eating Thai on a regular basis and this is still one of the best restaurants in the city.

The health inspection score was 92 and this concerns me because when we were first seated the smell of the restaurant was not pleasing and we considered leaving because of it. They do have the most refined flavors for Thai in the city but I'm taking one star for the low score on the city health and one star for the smell in the air.
author: Justin S.

description: I visited Marnee Thai before a long visit to Asia and it was hard to find better food in Thailand itself! Everything we had here was fantastic! The papaya salad was a stand out! I'll will be back several times over!
author: Sarah M.

description:
It's a long and narrow restaurant, so I wouldn't recommend big parties. The food was alright. Tom Yum soup and Pad See Ew were delish, but the Yellow Curry dish was bland. The potatoes weren't cooked enough either. We had fried banana a la mode for dessert and they can't go wrong there. 

Prices are nice and low... dinner for 3 was $40 which included drinks, entrees, and dessert. 

The best part was when they brought out our bill and had those little Tamarind candies that come in the brown wrappers. My gfs and I were delighted because we haven't had those in so long. 

In conclusion, I've eaten at better Thai restaurants in the City.
author: Lynn V.

description:
I went there tonight  for a dinner with an advance reservation. We had our parents with us, both in their late 60s and a 17mo old child. 

We reached there on time and surprisingly we're put in the existing line, not honoring the advance reservation we made when we called in earlier today.

we still waited for another 15min, and there was no apology or any reassurances from their side. The lady at the reception was indifferent about the whole thing.  We returned home without eating. THANK YOU for ruining our night!!!!!!  I would have given zero stars if I could.
author: Aneesh P.

description:
This place has an unknown wow factor to it. I admit that one of the dishes, the portion could of been a little larger. 

Found this place by just mobile yelping something close by. Went by reviews and gave this try. Good choice! It was a little small inside but got seated right away on a weekday weds night. Ordered the angel wings, green curry beef, and some noodles (Forgot the name of this one). 

Everything was very tasty. The angel wings had a nice crisp on the outside and the tang and tender meat that went with it. The green curry sauce was really good that I used a lot of it on top of the rice. The beef was super tender to every bite. The last dish that had noodles, basil, duck, and egg was just outstanding.

Every dish was 5 stars in my book. However the Green Curry dish was sized a little too small for the price. Great service, good ambiance, but be prepared to sit close to other strangers as the tables are only 2 feet away from each other.

Give this place a try if you like Thai food :)
author: Christopher J.

description: Best Thai food in the city (or at least the best Thai food I've ever had). I live right up the street and eat here constantly. I love the angel wings, pad thai, chicken larb salad, pad kee mow, the curries.... Basically everything rocks. Plus the people working there have always been super friendly. Can I not give more stars?
author: Tommy H.

description:
Does Marnee really need another stellar review? Don't care. Here it is.

Everyone I have taken here has loved the food - everything from the miang kum (spinach-wrapped appetizers) to the crab fried rice to the roti with ice cream. As for the latter, that dessert has this mysterious gravitational pull I cannot resist. I literally ate at another restaurant one time and then walked down the street to Marnee just for the roti with ice cream. I even waited 15 minutes to get seated. I don't even like dessert. So if that doesn't say it all, I don't know what will.
author: Ash V.

description: I am a fan of Marnee at the other location on Irving but this branch left little to be desired. Although the menu was similar, I find the service very impersonal. Came here a week ago looking to relive the great experience I had a month ago. Unfortunately, our servers were not in a mood to smile. Yes they were busy even though it was 9 PM but there was no reason for our server to give us attitude with her fake smile when she served us rice and when we asked for an extra pair of chopsticks (in two separate occasions). I urge everyone to go to the Irving location instead.
author: Kwoky L.

description:
Typical Thai place but they do the dishes 80% right, had the green curry, wings, beef with string beans, and mango crab fried rice...

everything was good, but they forgot the mango in our mango fried rice and gave us an unobservable amount of crab.. i am still not sure if there was crab in there but they insisted.... my chick friend was not pleased about the crab situation....

Great for a casual night out or a date spot for someone who you are semi-interested in where you dont want to drop too much dough, but still want a semi-decent dining experience
author: B H.

description:
-yummy food you can smell outside

-nice enough service at this location

-moderately priced

-worth a trip there and worth returning to

the end.
author: Athena S.

description: Waaaay to salty.  Everything tastes like MSG.  I have a sibling who likes this place though.
author: M S.

description: Marnee Thai is the best Thai food i've ever had! I I recommend trying the chicken lettuce wraps, pad thai, green curry and papaya salad.
author: April F.

description: Really really great Thai food. Their specials are unique and flavorful.  So far my top spot for Thai Food.
author: Lyly N.

description:
Absolutely the best Thai in the city. We've sampled most of the menu and the food is ALWAYS piping hot, fresh, and delicious. Plus their customer service is great...they're always nice and the food never takes too long. I've been here countless times and will continue to go back. 

Try the angel wings! Yum.
author: Wilson B.

description:
This is a great place to eat after spending time at Golden Gate Park or any of the museums in the area. It's definitely a hole in the wall (we stumbled upon it), but with all the rave reviews and guidebook stickers plastered on the door, we figured it would be worth trying. Little did we know that it would be the best decision, ever.

ATMOSPHERE
It looks quiet from the outside, but the moment you walk through the doors you're greeted with a bustling crowd. From what I know, it usually get's pretty packed (which makes sense since it's a pretty small place). There is a variety of clientele and the service is friendly.

FOOD
Marnee Thai is a very authentic Thai restaurant, decked out with silver pots of rice and cool Thai decor on the walls. 

Everything is best eaten in the form of family style, and it makes the meal more enjoyable because you can try all the different dishes they have to offer. My friends and I tried:

1) Shrimp spring rolls- delicious and the fresh mint leaves inside gave them that extra kick!

2) Gai samoon prai (chicken with onions, fresh herbs, lemongrass, ginger, basil, peppercorn)

3) Pad nor mai (chicken with chili, garlic, bamboo shoots, egg, and basil)

4) Pad ma kuer (eggplant with beef, bell peppers, and basil)- my favorite dish

All the entrees were very savory and they each had a very distinct flavor. The ingredients were fresh and they weren't skimpy with portions. Also, if you like spicy foods, be sure to use the hot sauce-- but beware, it's a lot spicier than it looks!
author: Krystie M.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! The BEST angel wings!!!

Also -- all their dishes are piping hot and delicious! MMMM i love coming here on a foggy night!
author: Shivani S.

description: Chicken wings are better than Sang Tung's. awesome service as well :)
author: Alan S.

description: Ok, update: I went to the other Marnee Thai, the one on 25th and Irving or so, and completely different story. The owner was super welcoming and the food was delicious. The soft shell crab salad was so good I found the recipe online and started making it at home in between visits. After this, I also ended up going back to the 9th avenue location with a group of friends last minute and they were super accommodating and found seating for all 6 of us which was pretty awesome. It seems this previous experience was an isolated incident.
author: Carmen C.

description: The food here was really good. The group of four of us got carry out and shared a bunch of things. The yellow curry was absolutely delicious and the other dishes were very good (pad Thai, pineapple fried rice, pad see ew, and the imperial rolls. Was it mind blowing? No, but if I lived in the neighborhood it would be my go to spot.
author: Erin B.

description: Loved the mango shrimp salad!!! Spicy but fresh and delicious. Next time I'll get soft shell crab. Ladies that work the dining room and efficient and pretty!!!!
author: PK R.

description:
Ate some very good appetizers (which I can not find on their online menu!) which consisted of rice mixed with veggies and sweet corn cooked in a little shell.  They say they only make a few of these a day, so we were lucky to get some.

Aside from that their Pad Se Ew was delicious.
author: Raman S.

description: By far the best Thai food I have ever had in San Francisco. Authentic tastes, good service, and just all around a wonderful find. Highly recommend!
author: Bryce G.

description:
Wear a diaper when you go to this place cause it's so good you might crap yourself. Pork Pad See Ew (apologies on the spelling) best freaking ever! Ever! And that means a lot because I pretty much pick Thai whenever we go anywhere. Chicken Lettuce cups are amazing too. I have never had a bad dish here. 
Atmosphere and service is great too. Just an all around win. This place also goes in the books for being the first date for my wife and I so they get six starts now.
author: Chris M.

description:
Perks;
The food is very authentic and well priced.
Service is on point.
Portions are huge come hungry.
Try the pork fried rice the pork is amazing
Try the spicy angel wings 

Cons
Tables are very close so do expect to hear others conversation
Parking is rough but hey its the city you expect this
food came out to fast wish they would have given us breathing room from appetizers to main course

If you are in the city and want authentic Thai Food give this place a try.
author: Mitchelle M.

description:
Since I had business in the city today, I had to drop by my favorite Thai restaurant in the entire bay area and have a great lunch!  The weather was perfect in San Francisco today ~ sunny with a slight breeze.  We found parking on 9th Avenue, just a few cars up from the restaurant.

We missed out on the lunch crowd and looked forward to a nice meal together.  Our friendly waitress took our order of the following: Spicy Angel Wings, Panang Beef, Guay Tiew Koor with an extra serving of Roasted Duck plus Jasmine steamed rice.  Iced water for all and a Thai iced tea for me!

I had never had their Spicy Angel Wings and they certainly did not disappoint me.  The chicken wings and drummettes were sauteed in a garlic-chili sauce, then deep fried with crispy basil set atop this finger licking sweet and spicy dish!  I like my food spicy so I will ask them to make it spicier next time.  As an option, you can ask for deep fried spicy tofu instead of the chicken wings/drummettes combo.

Chunks of tender beef with panang curry paste, coconut milk and Thai basils make one of our favorite main courses called Panang Beef.  We had the lunch portion which is half the size of what you receive for dinner. Both the lunch and dinner portions are served with steamed broccoli, which is served a tad crunchy which is how I like it.

The Guay Tiew Koor with an extra side of Roasted Duck was delectable as usual.  The only difference today was the wide noodles were not available per our waitress so we had instead a noodle half the size but this did not diminish the overall taste and presentation.  The fried rice noodles with chicken, fried egg, bean sprouts, ground peanuts and that amazing side of roasted duck made my taste buds swoon!  If I were dining by myself, I could order just this dish and take the other half home for another meal.  I prefer this to the Pad Thai that most folks order.

Steamed Jasmine rice was both fragrant and an excellent foil for the flavors of all the dishes we enjoyed!  I can't wait to come back here again.  Too bad they don't have a south bay presence...I would eat there daily.
author: Beth W.

description: What a fantastic place!  Marnee Thai catered for a dinner party I just had, and everything was amazing.  The coconut noodles, pumpkin curry, and summer rolls were phenomenal.  Chef Chai's customer service was excellent and he was very accommodating to vegetarians.  Highly recommend Marnee!
author: Dina W.

description: Marnee Thai is good thai food, my friend swears by it.  I have come many times here, the food is good. The last time I was here, I had the angle wings and mango fried rice.  The wings were good, but the mango fried rice was not what I expected.  Not enough mango tastes. I will come back again because of the service and it is one of the better Thai places in the city
author: Tony T.

description:
The thing about Marnee Thai is that I never know what exactly I want when I go. There's just so many options and almost everything I have had is delicious, so narrowing those options is even harder. 

I do have a few favorites and they are the desserts.

HUGE fan of the fried roti with ice cream. It comes out looking like a giant frosted flake but trust me, it's good. I have even scarfed those down when I had a sore throat w/  the flu kicking my ass,  zero fux given. 
Also love the mango w/ black sticky rice. It tends to sell out quick.

Something not on the regular menu that is sometimes offered as a special:
There are these little coconut rice cake things.. I don't know what they are called, but I've had them a few times. They come out in a griddle that looks like the ones for Eggettes, but circular instead of almond shaped. These are sooooo insanely good. Sweet, slightly crisp around the edges, but also savory and chewy. My friends and I usually fight for the last one.

You know how San Tung is famous for those dry fried chicken wings? Yeah, well Marnee Thai has amazingly good Angel Wings. Give it a shot. Think of it as a Thai version, the Thai equivalent dare I say!? It's crack chicken. 

This location isn't as spicy as their sister spot in the lower avenues so if you want them to crank up the heat,  let 'em know.
author: Susy C.

description:
Memorable dishes at the table were the Angel wings and the Pad Thai.  There was the fish but I forgot what it was called.  

Place is tough for parking.  It's not a large place so be patient
author: Patricia G.

description: I am really surprised by the bad reviews. I love this place. The best part is they are understanding of my food allergies and always leave off the offending food.
author: Jason C.

description:
Ohh...mah...Gawd... some of the best Thai food. In Life.  For as accomplished as this place is, it still maintains a hole in the wall atmosphere.  Humble. Me likey.

For our entrees, my party ordered the prawn red curry, shrimp and scallop curry, pumpkin curry, chili encrusted fish, chicken pad thai.  For dessert, roti, fried banana with honey, and sticky rice with mango.  All of it was da bomb.  I've never had roti like that before all covered in condensed milk goodness....sooo yummy.  Our waiter rocked too.  He kept it real by giving us his recommendations and stopping us when were about to order oodles too much food.

I'm stoked this place is near me and I will be back again and again. I am looking forward to checking out its sister location.
author: Shree R.

description:
EDIT- - - I apologized for hearing the conversation, I was not eavesdropping like you said. Actually, I am not the one who concerned about things around me at all, but just can't stand with some obnoxious situation. So, that's why I was interested in your case. 

Normally, people usually hear something which happened as a trouble. If you had enjoyed your food and everything was smooth, who would care or notice about you? That situation is noticeable. I'm pretty sure that if I wasn't the one who sat at the table beside you, but someone else. They could hear the conversation too and some wanted to know what was going to happen next including me? How the restaurant react to the matter?

Usually, I spoke something out because I felt unfair when someone was lying about the truth or made some story up to make his/her story strong enough to persuade or make people believe what he/she was trying to say.

and you're right you're not the one who doesn't like their foods, otherwise, there're a lot of people who love their foods and feel welcome to go back too! I feel sorry for you that Marnee Thai is not the right place for you :)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I really had a great time at Marnee Thai today. Not only the food was really great but the service as well :D 

Due to the comment below from gookgette c., I'm not sure if it was the same case that I saw today, but it is kind of familiar to me. I am a big fan of Marnee Thai actually and I usually invite my friends to come and enjoy food and service here. I heard everything that happened with this case. 

The thing that I heard and being a witness is the waitress, who is really nice and polite, asked this customer if she could help to recommend some food for her because she took long time to make a decision because maybe it was her first time having dinner here. This customer asked if there were some special dishes and the waitress answered all of her questions and seemed like she wasn't intrigued. So, the waitress asked her if she were super hungry. The customer said she was not so hungry, but she didn't know what to get. Then, the waitress recommended the popular appetizer which is Homemade Hotcakes (I really love this one, it's amazing!!!). She seemed interested in it and she then asked about how the papaya salad looks like. The waitress didn't force or push her to have Homemade Hotcakes and Papaya salad, but she decided to have them by herself.

When papaya salad came out, I saw she had just a little and didn't ask for sending back to fix or complaining about food, then hotcakes came out and she tried just only one piece. It seemed that she didn't like it actually, but she didn't complain or anything until the waitress came around and asked her if everything was alright and she just didn't speak anything out, just ordered yellow vegetables curry and no baby corn (seemed like I heard everything because our table is kind of close to each other) I heard the customer said she loves vegetables, That was why the waitress recommended her to have the vegetables curry :) 

When yellow curry came out, the customer had it for a few moment, and then asked the waitress to wrap everything up back home. When the check came out, she didn't appreciate at all and I heard that this customer asked the waitress if there was any discount because she didn't enjoy the foods at all. Then, the waitress went to ask manager and came back with taking off rice in the check for the customer and packed all the leftovers that this customer could take home. The funny thing is I don't think I heard the waitress said something about DAY-OLD rice!! She just said that she couldn't make a decision to give her any discount, it depended on the policy and manager's solution. 

In my opinion, I have been dining at Marnee Thai for several times. I didn't know how Thai foods here taste like at the first time either, but I think if I ordered foods and I haven't had it before. I won't ask for any discount or anything because it's my choice to try and it's not their faults. If a person doesn't like the food, it doesn't mean that the food isn't delicious, it's just what you don't like and it's your responsibility when you ordered something. It's your choice since you take a step into the restaurant.

I was supposed to review about the restaurant today, but I just didn't feel right when I read that comment -*- Don't take these things personal, I just give my opinion and say what I saw :)

About the restaurant, it's as good as usual. I love Marnee Thai and I love their foods and service :D They're all friendly and I feel welcome!!  Today, I ordered not so many, but still delicious as always, yummy!!!! I won't feel hesitate to invite more friends to dine in here in the near future :)
author: Abbey L.

description:
Three strikes:

The first time I went to Marnee, they got the order wrong, then screwed up the bill. Oh well, mistakes happen, right? Forgive and forget.

The second time I went to Marnee, they made us change tables in the *middle* of our meal, because they wanted our table to feed the staff the family dinner. Bizarre and rude, but hey...I'm a tolerant guy.

The last time I went to Marnee, they took one look at my date and I, one look at the four-seat table that was free, and told us to wait. Ten minutes later, we watched them happily seat a group of three (who walked in off of the street without a reservation). It was transparent: they didn't want to give up a table of four to a couple. We left when they tried to chase off the only other poor couple in the room (who still had full glasses of wine!) to "make room" for us.

Bottom line: I'm impressed. Marnee may serve the same Thai noodle chow that you can get everywhere else in the city, but only these guys find new and innovative ways to treat their customers badly. One star for creativity.
author: Tim R.

description:
I had plans to take my out-of-town friend to a favorite little popular seafood spot, when I learned it had CLOSED - abruptly!  Bummer! Big disappointment. 

So a third SF friend recommended MARNEE THAI. Said it was the best Thai food in San Francisco. Well, I was skeptical. I trust this friend, but . . . the best? I guess someplace has to be, but I figure it is all opinion and what you like.

We entered without reservations.  We were seated right away.

The food was outstanding!
The service impeccible!
The price . . . extremely reasonable!

I have not one single complaint.  It WAS the best!

I will be back here the very next opportunity that I can convince my dining companions that we need to eat Thai everynight!  

Note:  Our server, Tee, was super efficient, super friendly and had a wonderful smile . . . . and cute as he could be!  Thanks, Tee!  You were great!
author: Rachel C.

description: Great Thai food, and the fresh spring rolls are worth the trip in and of themselves.
author: Carl F.

description:
This used to be my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco and I used to come here on regular basis. Now the service is gotten really bad and the food is not the same as it used to be. I am not sure if the owners or the chef have changed, but the food is  just ordinary without any taste.
The service has gotten bad too. Now they just bring the food and never bother to ask you how is everything. They waiter only comes back when its time to collect the money. I am not sure what happened here, but I will not be going here again
author: George S.

description:
My cousins have raved about this place and tonight we finally went with them! Wow! Food was absolutely amazing! Ever since I vacationed in Bangkok, I've been looking for Thai food that comes close to the flavors I had there. Well, the search is over! This place offers the authentic Thai flavors you would find on the streets of Bangkok. As you enter the door, you see the wall of awards this place has won... Michelin, Zagat, Fodors, etc.

The dishes we had were:
*Green Mango Salad- Really refreshing and went well with all the dishes
*Panang Beef- The beef was really tender and had a nice kick
*Chicken Kaprow- Chicken was tender and flavorful
*Prawns and Scallops Pad Phong Ka Ree- The yellow curry flavor of this dish was really good. The curry was not heavy.
*Pad Thai- Had to be the best Pad Thai outside of Bangkok! Reminded me of the pad thai I had in Bangkok.
*Mango Fried Rice- I normally don't like fruits in my savory dishes, but this was a nice combination. I really enjoyed it!

It's a small place. So, if you have a group larger than 4 people, I recommend making reservations. There is plenty of parking in the neighborhood since it's just a short walk away from Golden Gate park and there is a parking lot across the street. The staff is really friendly and always made sure we were doing OK. It's reasonably priced and the portions are just right. For a party of 5, our meal cost $84 including tax, drinks, 3 orders of jasmine rice, and 1 order of brown rice. 

I highly recommend Marnee Thai if you are looking for authentic Thai food!
author: Katrina B.

description:
I came here on a recommendation of a friend. Since I love Thai Food so much, I must come here to see what's all the raves about. I ordered 
1. Papaya salad: 3/5. I could barely see the Papaya in the salad. That's how little they put in the dish. They mixed a lot of lettuce instead. Flavor is okay. I had better papaya in my town before. 
2. Chicken angels: this was the best dish of the entire meal. The sauce is pretty yummy but kinda salty if you're not eating it with rice or salad
3. Calamari salad: I had high hope for this dish but i wasn't very impressed with the result. Kinda plain and nothing extraordinary. They just pour the fish sauce over calamari and lettuce , added some mints. I expected more flavors though
4. Pad thai: pretty good but the raves for their pad thai dish is kinda overrated because I expected a lot from 1000+ reviews for a 4 stars restaurant 
5. Thai fried rice: one of the best fish of the night. I would rate this favorite after Pad Thai. Again, nothing I haven't had before. 
6. Hot cakes: ok for non-asian maybe this looks new and interesting. For me, I was a bit disappointed to see how the hot cakes looked. My friend suggested that I must order this for dessert because it's reallyyyyyy good! Well ok it's good but I made this kind of cake before in my kitchen but I didn't know it's called hot cakes in Thai cuisine. 6 little cakes for $8.50, I thought it was expensive for several rice cakes with coconut milk.
Call me a picky eater for rating this place down but that was my honest opinion. Will I come back here? Maybe no because there are more thai restaurants in the city of SF. I wasn't disappointed as a first time here but I wasn't very impressed either.
author: T C.

description: Am I missing something here?  Maybe this is one of those places where you have to order their signature dish(es), but my roasted duck red curry was probably one of the worst I have ever had (or maybe this is the real thing and I have an untrained palette for Thai).  I ordered it to go with brown rice.  I kid you not, there was like an inch of oil that had risen and settled at the top, it was overwhelmingly tangy (too many tomatoes and pineapples perhaps), and the duck was nothing to write home about.  I'll hand it to you that the brown rice was different and good, but I'm not going to cough up $14 + tax and tip just for a few extra flecks of color in my rice.
author: Jenn C.

description: Luckily it was closed when I went there a couple of months ago! Closed due to health violations! According to inside scoop sf these include live roaches on prep tables, rodent droppings next to food containers and utensils, and dead roaches in the kitchen. They were closed for cleaning. Hopefully they're cleaner now?
author: pj n.

description: Loved this place. Had a fabulous lychee martini. And the satay wraps were to die for!!  Everything at the table was also delicious. Wait staff very friendly!!  Also great prices!!
author: M R.

description: Love coming here when I crave Thai food. Some recommendations are the golden triangles, stuffed wings, pad thai, fresh spring rolls, roti, sweet sticky rice, and coconut ice cream. The biggest down fall of this place is the parking!
author: Sayuri I.

description:
