I could go here once a week and never tire of this delicious Thai fare. Hands down, this is the best Thai food I have had in the City. From the tom yum soup to the kabocha squash chicken curry to the heavenly mango and sticky rice, each dish is a divine adventure. 

I really appreciate the warm friendliness of the matriarch who often takes our order when we dine here. She has wonderful suggestions (like last night's corn cake- which turned out to be SO good!) 

Also, I think they put magic in the iced tea- keeps me up all night.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Marnee Thai, how I love thee.

I surprised I have yet to write a review about Marnee Thai considering it is one of my favorite restaurants. I really do love this place. I've brought friends, family and even dates here and they have all been impressed and satisfied. Like one Yelper mentioned before, consistency is what does it for this restaurant. I have never had a bad experience with the employees or a problem with the food. 

First of all, the employees are very very nice and I think the service is good, especially since they are always busy. (They were even really nice to me when I was there on a date with a guy whose behavior was beyond embarrassing and inappropriate. If I were our waitress I would have thrown his dinner all over him.) Surprisingly, the restaurant is really large. You wouldn't thinks so at first because when you walk in all you can see is the kitchen and a small dining area but once you head towards the back you will encounter a really large dining area that is also bustling. 

The food of course is delicious. I always try to order something new and always leave with a new favorite dish. But favorites are: Kang Ka Ree with Lamb, Mussamun Chicken Curry and Pad Ma Kuer. And of course, all of their desserts. They offer a generous portions of rice and all their dishes really are great for mixing and sharing with others. They also have a good selection of beer and wine and their Thai Iced Tea is yummy. 

Like I mentioned earlier in my review, this is a busy restaurant so you may have to wait but it's worth it. I recommend this restaurant.

They have a fan for life.
author: Denise S.

description:
After visiting the van Gogh exhibit at the de Young, we were hungry and decided to head over to this nearby Thai restaurant.

Tom Yum- standard and I liked that they poured the first serving for us
Pad See Ew- always a satisfying dish
Chicken Massuman curry- the potatoes were a little undercooked and I didn't care for all the half peanuts in this dish

I think Marnee was a good Thai spot, but not something I'd hype up or recommend to my friends.
author: Agent X.

description:
My boyfriend and I get Marnee Thai almost every week for takeout. Occasionally, we will go to the restaurant and eat there, but either way we love the food!

My favorites are the #33 (the eggplant with your choice of meat), crab fired rice, pad see ew, and almost all the other noodles are delicious. 

This is another one of my neighborhood favorites and I am a loyal customer at Marnee when it comes to thai food! 

I give it 5 starts for sure!
author: Magdalena Z.

description:
+ Spicy Angel Wings
+ Any Chicken Curry (Red Curry is my favorite)
+ Roti (So Good, but so wrong)
- Miang Kum (Ok, wouldn't order again. I think I just liked the peanuts)

That was for my Mobile Users who don't want to scroll and just order, What up iPhoners! Anyways I am from the South Bay and didn't think SF could do much better than the favs in SJ. 
However I have to say it, Marnee "Pad Kaprowed" all south bay Thai food. 
(Yes I like to take Thai words and use them out of context in English. You have a problem with that "Prik King"?!!)
author: Donny X.

description: This was the best pad see ewe I have ever had. And I have had a lot of pad see ewe. Delicious!
author: Melissa R.

description: Yum! Finally found good Thai food in SF after what feels like a ridiculously long quest. We had the the tom yum soup, fresh spring rolls and the pad Thai, and it was all super delish! I had to take off one star for them forgetting to include forks or chop sticks/napkins, but I would definitely eat here again!
author: Jen R.

description:
I've only been to this restaurant twice and in between that time was a span of almost two years. The food was very good and up to my expectations last time I was here (and a little worried after reading other reviews here on Yelp). It seems they are (a little) slow so I recommend ordering an appetizer--we waited almost 45mins for our entrées, with all the tables being occupied and most of them ordering near the time we did, it is understandable. We ordered the golden triangles/Thai samosas for an appetizer, which were nothing special really--loaded with kabocha but very subtle, almost bland in flavor; the dipping sauce really helped it. The service here seems okay. They are very attentive to refilling water glasses (love citrus water) but abrupt almost to a fault as in taking the appetizer dishes and anything else empty away; more like snatching away, haha. We forgot to mention the level of spiciness we wanted (they should have asked) and got our red curry mild (which should be very spicy anyways?) by default but it was still great. When it comes to Thai food, I adore pad see ew and most restaurants fail at attaining that balance of sweet and savory. They ran out of the flat noodle and it was satisfactory with the stick noodles, like used with pad Thai--which is one of the biggest mistakes a business can make, it's quite simple to pay attention to inventory and be stocked at all times. One of the best restaurants I have been to for pad see ew, though I admit to only trying about two dozen Thai restaurants in the Bay Area--not enough to be in the  know, really. It should be noted that the restaurant is very small and tight, loud/noisy as well. Not recommended for groups really, they have a section room in the back but again, it is very small and can almost be claustrophobic for some people.

I absolutely love the vegetarian friendly and adaptable menu--sometimes it's hard to find a restaurant that has such vegetarian options.
author: Aaron G.

description:
Marnee Thai has thee BEST veggie pad thai I've had in San Francisco and the green beans and chicken were also delicious. 

The place is packed but stick around because new tables open up quickly.
author: Murphy O.

description: Great thai food! We had a group lunch in the back room, but we were on a tight schedule, so they were kind enough to help us go quickly. The angel wings, thai salad, summer rolls, chan pad poo, duck curry, and duck noodle soup were all hits.
author: Caitlin C.

description: Epic. Amazing. Pad thai and chicken wraps!! Ask for the chili sauce. Come early gets busy
author: Romeo A.

description: I love this restaurant. The food are so great. I would recommend Tom kha, tom yum, yellow curry (since i do not eat that much spicy so this curry suits me best), grilled duck, their brown rice is very good also... For desert, sweet rice with ice cream is something nice to try. However, the place is a little bit small so if you come with lots of friends, better to make a reservation.
author: Helen P.

description: I had family visiting from out east. My wife and I had been to this restaurant once before. The service, food was outstanding then and did not let us down the second time. My family said it was the best Thai food they have had and was very impressed with the servings. Not much on ambiance but nevertheless, they more than make up for it in service and being attentive to the customer. I highly recommend them.
author: H A.

description:
I honestly forgot this place was still here after moving out of the neighborhood a few years back, but a friend reminded me and we stopped in for an early dinner today.

They have a diverse menu, several specials and decent service.  The noodle dishes are the best I've had in the Sunset, and the curries and rice dishes are great too.  It's one of the few places around where I would actually order pad thai.  I need to branch out a bit more next time I am there, because we saw some dishes on other tables that were totally unidentifiable but looked amazing. 

It would be nice if the servers were a little quicker and more attentive, but otherwise, it's great.
author: Quinn S.

description: I'm obsessed with pad Thai, and I can say that this is one of the best pad Thais I have ever had! And the food came out really quick! Their coconut rice noodle dish was amazing as well.
author: Lexi L.

description:
Some of the best Thai I've ever tasted!

Pad See Ew was perfect! the noodles were so soft, but not soggy or improperly cooked.  Seasoning was perfect, and the chicken, like the noddles, were tender and full of flavor.  Perfectly cooked and balanced. The Tom Yum (or was it Tom Ka) soup was delicious! (It's the one without coconut milk).  It was great.   Satay wrap appetizer was also amazing!  Pad see ew was definitely my favorite of the night though......except for the DESSERT!  The roti with coconut ice cream (recommended by our super friendly server) was amazing!! 

Cons:
-parking can be difficult though we got lucky and found one immediately
-space is limited.  It's a small restaurant.
-They don't seat until your group is complete
-Service can be inconsistent because they are so busy
author: Denise A.

description:
Where do you grab tasty bite
after an Academy of Sci Night?
We asked four people passing by,
and every one said Marnee Thai.

Well actually, we only asked three,
but we overheard a guy extolling the pad see [ew].
So we arrived, a group of four
with a long line out the door.

Somehow we were seated with haste
Not a moment too soon - no time to waste.
Pad ke mow, avocado salad
All of the flavors were totally valid

We delected in the spicy fish fry
And a spicy red curry typically Thai
It was all so tasty  - we loved every bite
But there were no leftovers... 'cause no one's polite.
author: Mari C.

description:
WTF why is this place rated so highly!! Between the Zagat and the Yelp and the reviews on their wall, I didn't think we could go wrong, despite having a feeling...I never was crazy about that Marnee up on Irving...

Anyways. Got three things. Vegetarian gluten something salad. Pumpkin curry. And spicy green beans. Oh, and a Thai iced tea. None of it was good other than the Thai iced tea. I almost have to wonder if something was wrong today, since my experience seems so contrary to popular opinion.

Soo pumpkin curry...floating puddles of oil, super thin and bland curry sauce.

Green beans...again, pretty flavorless and too saucy. Mushrooms weren't cooked through.

Salad....wayyyy too salty. And I LOVE salt. If it weren't for my genetically low blood pressure my veins would be thumping. But this salad was too salty. Liked the texture of the gluten in it, I suppose.

I don't think any Thai around here is amazing or anything, but I think this might be the worst in the general vicinity. Soi Gow and Baan Thai are both better. Even the service didn't seem that great here. At least they refilled the water frequently.

Just go to Soi Gow. The food is better, and they're so sweet and nice. And they serve mitchell's ice cream. Yum!
author: Ambika C.

description:
I found this place flipping through the yellow book in our hotel room (I noticed all the awards on the ad- usually a good sign). We almost went to another place  that was close to our hotel and after that fell through, we came here. We had to park across the street at Golden Gate Park, but it wasn't too far for us to walk. 

It was a packed house, yet people kept coming in (even when we were seated, I noticed that). Since we were a large party (my sister, brother-in-law and family- three nephews), we had a bit of a wait. One of my nephews and I counted all the awards/recognition plaques on the wall, across from the waiting area (seats along the wall)- there were 24 in all! The smells were intoxicating (I love Thai food!), the crowded restaurant reassuring, and the accolades added to my expectation of good Thai food.

Though they were busy, the staff was extremely nice and quick at times- it was a team effort, as different people took the empty platters (ok ,a couple of things were forgotten, but that's ok). The ladies were wearing beautiful richly colored costumes in jewel-toned hues, complete in gold trim (sapphire, fuschia, purple); guessing they were brocade silks? It's funny, I don't really remember what the men were wearing, maybe the standard black pants and white shirts. The walls were adorned with framed prints. There were a set of clear glass large vases with tall flowers (fake), which kind of reminded me of Pottery Barn- it was elegant and simple, but still very pretty. (Sometimes Thai restaurants' decor seems gawdy and awkward.) Our seats we're half booth and half chairs. The front door is left open but your clothes are still going to smell like food. 

We ordered summer rolls (perfect, but I knew my husband wouldn't like it; it's probably the mint that he doesn't like), spicy angel wings (don't normally eat wings but I tried one, pretty good), thai style fried rice (has cucumbers, tomatoes, and extra cilantro), beef salad (excellent!!! really enjoyed it since I never order it when it's just me and my husband), chan pad poo (spicy rice noodles with crab meat and egg in chili garlic sauce- 1st time I ever had it- and it was excellent! but my brother-in-law didn't really like it), and panang (potatoes, curry, coconut and basil- pretty good). The food is served on square platters and is in good sized portions, except the summer rolls (might be an appetizer M.O. thing, though). It's a good thing that the food didn't come out at the same time since we were running out of room on the table! Our oldest nephew probably didn't eat as much compared to us adults (but then again he isn't fond of chinese food, either). Three of us ordered diet soda and thai iced tea. The bill was $82.79.   

All in all, I'm a fan and would come here again when we visit the Bay Area. And I'm not surprised at all that there are nearly 800 reviews on this restaurant.
author: Margret C.

description:
This review will be short as this was my first stop after getting off the plane and I was disoriented...

Drunken noodles with prawn were delicious! (Although I prefer calling them shrimp). I think I had yellow curry or something that was OK, nothing outstanding. 

But the mango with sticky rice had me hooked. Marnee Thai, you have blown my mind with this simple little dessert dish. I haven't been able to find a place that does it as beautifully as you do. For this, you get 5 stars.
author: Angelina K.

description:
I usually like the food here. 

However, last time I went there with my group, it was a complete disaster because of the service. The first waiter (male, didn't speak English I assume) did not reply anything to what we asked, and ignored us the whole time. For example, my glass of water had a floating/swimming spider which I gently asked him to bring me a new one. The waiter conveniently took it away and did not say anything. Is it that hard to say sorry? He came back with one - still didn't say anything as if nothing was wrong - at this point, I suspected that he had some problem w speaking, and possibly it was the same water that he scooped out the spider. I didn't drink it anyway since things became worse. 
 
We had a large group and asked for additional table that was next to ours because the space they gave us was too small to eat - you know, elbows touching small. The tiny table we asked for was not under reservation at the time of our sitting. It was actually attached to the other party next to us, and the waiter asked the customers at the table so we could have it. But after some time the waiter came back with a reservation plaque and placed it on the table we added (what a convenient way to refuse without getting an argument), and this was declaration to us "I don't want to give you that extra table, so don't talk to me". 
Now the whole group was pissed, since the first waiter did reply back when we repeatedly asked for space so we could actually eat without knocking spoons or water glass of your neighbor.

Next, the second waitress, pretty one, came and tried to ignore us while we were asking for more space. This waitress spoke English, and told us to consider OTHER customers. WTF????? Well, of course our reply was that we'll consider when we have the space to order the dishes from your kitchen and eat. Until then, it's simply the problem of the restaurant, isn't it? If you don't think you could fit a group, don't take a large party and ask for understanding. If you take one, be courteous to take care. Is it that hard?

They added table, removed table, added again and removed again. We tried to stay calm but the moment is already ruined. The waitress kept saying the owner doesn't want that way, and we were keep asking for the tiny table. 

We stopped arguing and came out. There was no point getting uglier, and I think they should thank us for it. On my way out, I asked the receptionist, prettiest one, for that I wanted to talk to the manager or the owner. She tried to listen to the situation and apologized (first time from the restaurant) and she said, neither of the manager or owner was there. WHAT??? So simply water/waitress were telling a lie??? Just to safeguard that tiny two-ppl table to sell two more dishes???? They just didn't want to give the table to us and try to squeeze a bunch of ppl in a very small space. 

They are greedy. They ignore you. They tell lies to reject your request. It is just wrong service.

Our day was almost ruined, until Hotei, the Japanese restaurant across the street welcomed us and gave three tables despite their busy and inconvenient route of service. Five stars to Hotei, shame on Marnee Thai. 

Like I said, I'm calling better business bureau for this.
author: J B.

description: Best Thai food outside of Thailand. I went to Thailand last fall and this is the closest thing to authentic Thai I've had. Service was average but the food was top-notch.
author: Michael S.

description:
I went her last night for my friends' birthday. We were greeted by May and she made us feel welcomed. As we began ordering, we were just going to order appetizers for the moment; however, we realized the rarity of seeing May so we decided to order all at once even though we didn't quite know what we were ordering. We ordered the appetizers and a couple of entrées. We asked if she could come back so we could keep looking and give her the rest of our order in a short while. She said that it would be better if we ordered now so the kitchen wouldn't be confused. So she stood there as we tried to figure it out (awkward and uncomfortable). We finished ordering...two people of our party arrived late and we ordered again. It's like she was half there, talking to another waitress in thai as we were ordering/ asking us to repeat our order. At some point she left and we yelled for her because we weren't done talking to her and didn't know if she understood our order. In the end, she did get it. 


Appetizer: 
Spicy Angel Wings- alright, super greasy, good flavor
Tom Yum & Tom Ka soups- both really tasty. 
Thai Potstickers- It never came so we had to reorder. It wasn't worth it. 

Entree
Thai Fried Rice- tasted really good, not spicy enough. 
Prawns & Scallops Pad Phong Karee- Scallops weren't fresh, shrimps good size, but dish as a whole, I say pass.
Some 2 other dishes: don't know what they were.

The best part was the wine- Ravenwood Old Vine Zinfandel. 

Anyways, the food was a mediocre experience. I'd rather go to another Thai food restaurant. (I wish I was better at describing food... oh well.) Point is that the experience was not great and I was listening to the other party of 9 next to us argue about added charges that they were unaware of/didn't get. They left unhappy. I suggest they have more servers. May had a great personality and put a smile on our face; however, communication on food needs improvement.
author: Wendy C.

description: The food is okay, it's good Thai food but doesn't blow me away. 3/3 times I have come here and ordered curry and requested it significantly spicier than usual. Each time I stress a little more how I love spice and can handle it. It always comes back bland enough to feed a baby. I'm not exaggerating either, it has not a trace of spice. I am not one of those people who usually sends food back I just suck it up and eat it, but I think I may do so if I ever eat here again.
author: Amanda G.

description: If you are looking to satisfy a craving for some thai food, this restaurant will do it. WE ordered the tom yum chicken, pad prikao (spelling is off), pad prik king, and the pad kee mao. It was all mediocre and will probably more than satisfy an undeveloped thai palate.
author: May Y.

description: THE BEST THAI FOOD I'VE HAD IN THE CITY. I love Marnee Thai! I'm always lucky when I go here, and never have to wait very long at all. I am addicted to the KANG KEAW (Green Curry), no one makes eggplant like they do! PRIG KHING J. is another one of my favorites. This place is one of my favorite places to eat in the city, they never let me down.
author: Jessica G.

description: Sawadeeka! Best Thai food I've had since Thailand!  I love the green curry, and the papaya salad is delicious if u like spicy food!
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Upon entering this low ceiling joint and watching the busy kitchen staff to my left and the extensive awards plastered on the wall to my right, I had high hopes for the food here. 

We shared the tom yum soup, the pumpkin pork curry, and some spicy chicken dish (can't for the life of me remember its name), all accompanied by brown rice. The tom yum soup was delicious and very well balanced between the lemon and the spicy. The chicken dish was really tasty, and packed a good amount of heat, which is a huge plus in my book, since most places put a pepper sign next to their dishes on the menu as a warning, but then don't deliver the promised kick.  

The pumpkin curry was super disappointing. The meat was cooked to perfection, but the curry was presented to us on a plate. Do you see the issue with this ?? Where is the sauce? Curry must be a saucy dish only brought out in a bowl because it is filled with meat, veggies, and of course, lots and lots of sauce. This seriously killed the dish. It was just a bunch of dry meat.

Overall, I'm not itching to go back to Marnee.  No food items really stood out in my mind, portions were small, and service was nothing above par.
author: Roxane W.

description: So delicious. So authentic. Everything we had was spot on. My pork curry, tom kha soup, roti - mmmm. When can I return?
author: Andrew K.

description: Best Thai food in the city so far
author: Jamel I.

description:
Back in '02 a good friend learned I was moving here to his home town and suggested we meet for dinner at "the city's best Thai place".  I would've gone just for the companionship, but the prospect of good Thai food made me even more eager to accept.  I'm a bit spoiled, having vacationed in Thailand twice, but Marnee Thai was impressive enough that I returned at least a couple dozen times in the ensuing eight years -- most recently last night for take-out from the Ninth Avenue location.

Some of the dishes I've tried here are

      Summer rolls
      Green papaya salad
      Tom yum koong
      Yum woon sen
      Pad siew
      Kang Keaw
      Pad thai
      Roasted duck
      Pad cha talay
      
I've never been disappointed with anything at Marnee Thai -- neither in the food nor the service departments.

Those who're stuck in a Thai food rut (you know who you are -- ordering Pad Thai at every outing, for crying out loud!) should get their buns into Marnee Thai and try something new and unfamiliar, 'cause this is one place where you can count on every single menu item being expertly turned out.
author: Francisco G.

description:
Usually, I order all of my safe, comfort-zone dishes when I go to a Thai restaurant (the same three things for years!!).  However, on this visit, I was lucky enough to go with someone who seems to know what my palate should like and it was amazing.

We had the Miang Kum to start out.  Growing up in a Chinese household you'd think I wouldn't mind a big chunk of ginger but, it seemed, I was always the one who got that big hunk of ginger . . . Anyway, when the Miang Kum came, I first looked at the ginger and a little pile of dried shrimp (by it itself, not a fan), and thought, hmm, how good could this be?

Amazing is all I'll say.  That first dish and what followed were all things I'd never ordered and I'm greatful for the experience.

Service is always very attentive here.  An excellent experience!
author: Kent H.

description: Great Thai and I'm looking forward to my next visit. I really loved the barbecued chicken and the pork with ginger. The space is small, but homey and the wait staff was friendly.
author: Sheila T.

description:
one of the best thai joints in SF.

would come here at least once a month in college. ANGEL WINGS forever!!! 

pad thai was pretty good. once i got an order of the special fish cooked in a banana leaf, i believe it was halibut? that was pretty good.

the staff is one giant family which is great to see. during prime time, there sometimes was a wait but not too terrible.
author: jaclyn g.

description: Came here for a group dinner with some friends. The place is so crowded you can't even enjoy your dinner. And don't even get me started on the owner/manager lady. She was so pushy the entire night trying to get us to try this and try that and telling us how and what to order. I get that she was trying to promote business but she was just overdoing it. We were all so turned off by the experience, I highly doubt any of us will be returning. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad but the service killed it for us.
author: Sarah L.

description: I love Thai food. We were going to the de Young/Academy of Sciences and several people had recommended this place. It is close to the museums. The photos above do not reflect the appearance of the restaurant. It was cold and drafty, but more troubling, there was a bad smell. The bathroom was not clean. The restaurant was not clean. I was really disappointed in the food, as well. The tom ka was bitter and the chicken in it was rubbery. The beef fried rice tasted off. The pad thai was bland and seemed lacking in ingredients, The yellow chicken curry was tasty but mostly sauce, not substance. The Thai iced tea was good. The service was fine. For 4 people, 2 drinks, and 4 dished, the bill was $62 which is a good value. Maybe it was an off day. Based on my experience I would not return nor recommend it. If you are a museum visitor, you can eat fresher food in the museum and if not, there are plenty of other choices nearby.
author: Lisa S.

description:
I can see why so many love this place since it offers a great ambiance, friendly staff/owner and loyal following.  However, I'm with those that feel this place is overrated.  

Great place if you're entertaining, but if you just want some good Thai food, you'd do a star or 2 better going to Chabaa on Irving.
author: Ray R.

description:
Angel wings, pad se eew , and Fried banana with ice cream.

I'm not big on Thai food, but had those today and they were good, as well as the eggplant dish, with a dash of that spicy sauce at the table.
author: Lyna K.

description: My favorite Thai place in the city. The green curry beef is amazing. The chicken wings are OK.
author: Thomas S.

description:
Marnee Thai did our rehearsal linner at 3pm the day before our wedding in the private room at the back. Everyone raved about the food, including my picky grandfather! Chai was great in helping me plan the menu, and the service was exceptional.

My only criticism is that we were unable to have the dinner at the time that we really wanted, but I guess 7pm on a Friday night is out of the question for most SF restaurants.
author: Holli K.

description:
I cam here for a birthday dinner, and it was nice that they have a small room for big parties.

Angel wings  - wonderful
coconut juice - nice and refreshing
Fish with special sauce - this was ok
Pad thai - decent
egg roll  - ok

There were other dishes, but I can't remember already ;)  

Over all, the food is ok and mostly on petite portion size.  We did have a large party, so service was quite slow....
author: Coco L.

description:
I heard this was the best thai in SF.  if that is true i feel pretty bad for SF.

really hot guys were sitting at the table next to us, so there's that i guess
author: Alison C.

description:
I went to Marnee Thai for the first time last week in celebration of my friend's 28th birthday. There's an intimate room in the back which housed our group of 25 nicely, a passerby wouldn't even realize it exists. 

The wall to the right of the entryway is decorated with an array of certificates from respectable organizations that were given to both the restaurant and executive chef. Our host - the birthday girl - worked with the main chef to preselect dishes for us. We had the green papaya salad to start, followed by the beef pad se-ew, the roasted duck, and a vegetable curry (which looked to be a combination of yellow & red). 

There was plenty of food for all and everything I tasted was excellent. Mind you, I picked around the beef and roasted duck, but what was left - curry, salad, and pad se-ew noodles - was superb. I will definitely return to again order the vegetable curry and to try something new. 

Minus one because the hostess does have an attitude like other reviewers have described. I even went wearing my Sunday best!
author: Tina A.

description: WOW! This place is incredible!  I love that what we ordered weren't oozing in a puddle of oil - I felt great about my cheat day. HAHA! I even tried the Thai Ice Coffee and omg... that was amazing. I can't remember what food dishes we had - I know it was some kind of thick noodle and one in yellow curry with mango rice. I will make my way back someday!
author: Marevie T.

description:
I love it when friends call me out to eat. Especially out to places I havent been before. Unfortunately for me, neither of us bothered to check what hours LimeTree is open. Guess those corn fritters will have to wait. 

Since we were still in the mood for asian food, I busted out the iTouch and leached off someones wifi outside so I could mobile-Yelp (iphone app) us some grub. Saw that marnee was around the corner and decided to go there.

Food:
Thai Fried Rice with chicken, egg, tomatoes and onion, Thai Style Sausage (one of the specials), and the BBQ Chicken

The fried rice and bbq chicken were the highlights. nice big portions for 2 starving students. the chicken was served with sweet chili sauce, cooked just right over the grill. the sausage however was under par, i guess we were expecting something, not so ordinary. 

anyways overall the food was great, good sized portions for the price, especially the chicken. i was even able to take a few pieces home. 

also, they have this awesome-sauce, fish sauce with chilis,  that reminded me of vietnamese nuoc cham, but spicier. put a lil bit of that over your rice, yummm

the waitresses are very nice. parking can be a pain in this part of town
author: David D.

description:
San Francisco's Sunset district. Insiders laugh at the name as it is a quintessential misnomer. West Bay natives know that this neighborhood is known for fog. Much like it's cousin Daly City, sunsets can sometimes be a rarity. Fortunately, the sunset district is also know for its family atmosphere and it's food. Placed away from  maddening crowds of tourists & just south of Golden Gate Park, the neighborhood is a haven for SF foodies. 

It is no surprise that this is where Marnee Thai calls home. Located on 9th Avenue between Lincoln & Irvine streets, it's a stones throw away from many Golden Gate Park attractions. 

Marnee Thai is know around the city for its great Thai Food, and they have even received a honorable mention from the famous/infamous Michelin Award critics. However, being the skeptic that I am, I like to let the food do the talking. Fortunately I had the pleasure of going to this restaurant with a large group of friends, and I was able to try a number of dishes. 

Let me digress. There are certain restaurants that are good to experience in groups. Marnee Thai is one of these restaurants for two reasons. 

The first is the ability to eat in a family style setting let's you sample a lot more of the menu than you would if it were just two of you. Second, if you go in a large group, you have to request the back room. The restaurant is divided into essentially two dining rooms; the larger front room, and the back room. Though this may not bode well for people who need to be "seen", the back room is a more intimate setting for a large group and I think it gives you an insider feel as you walk past those in the front. How is that for reverse psychology? 

Back to the food. I started things out with their corn fritter appetizer. This was something that I have never seen in a Thai restaurant. This corn based dough fritter is served with traditional Thai vegetables. Simply put, its corn & its deep fried, its good! 

Next came the noodles. Samplings included Pad Thai  & Pad Se Lew. Both dishes were served with tofu. While I found the Pad Thai to be very flavorful, the Pad Se Lew was lacking. Overall the noodle dishes are not bad, but this really isn't their strong point. Though they are not bad by any stretch of the imagination, I've had better. For pan fried Thai noodles I would still recommend the aptly named King of Thai Noodle House in San Francisco's Richmond district.

Where Marnee Thai really  excels is in their curries. Here is where you begin to understand why they are so popular. I ordered the Green Pumpkin Curry with tofu.  This dish was presented well and looks very appetizing. I'm a big fan of spice and they definitely hit the mark on this. The dish had a stout kick to it! The spice didn't overwhelm the dish or destroy the flavor; it enhanced it as it should. Not to worry though, all their curries can be tuned down with no sacrifice to flavor for those who don't like so much spice. All things aside, this is one of the best curry dishes that I've had to date.

Other samplings included their red chicken curry as well as another yellow vegetable curry. All underscored their masterful ability to balance spice & curry into dishes that  would cure the worse case of Thai homesickness. 

This overall was a wonderful experience and I definitely can say that I'm a fan. If you are in the city, planning a trip to Golden Gate Park, or someone who doesn't mind driving for food, give Marnee Thai a try. You'll uncover great Thai food in one of San Francisco's finest neighborhoods.
author: Galen M.

description:
I am pretty bad at ordering thai food. Fortunately, every single thing on the menu here is awesome. I'm sure the pad thai is good too, but I have more fun ordering stuff I have never seen before and discovering how it is my new favorite. 

Although I do get the angel wings every time. 

Apparently it can sometimes be tough to get a table at dinner because lots of people like awesome food. I've never had much trouble. 

Also - they do take out.
author: Ian P.

description:
Oh man.

Just MAKE SURE you get the Chicken Panang. Extra spicy so your nose runs and your face gets red. 

It's quite the experience.
author: Samantha P.

description:
The food is good.

I'd go to Chabaa, though. I feel that Marnee is a bit overrated.
author: Forest S.

description:
Solid Thai Restaurant. I really enjoyed their Rice Cake Appetizer. I think their Wings are a bit too sweet though and I wouldn't get it again. I'd rather go down the road and go to San Tung.

Service wasn't as quick as I had hoped though
author: Eric A.

description:
Thai is pretty important in my food pyramid... for some reason I can never get enough of the curry and noodles. :) This is fortunate for me, since SF has some of the best thai around- and Marnee Thai is no exception.

It's a 45 minute hour bus ride and a $15 cab ride away from my apartment in the middle of the Nob and Russian Hills, however extremely worth the trip. I met a friend to catch up here, where I had a shrimp pad thai. Delicious! It was just spicy enough and the noodles were saucy, as I like it. I've had some pretty bad, dry thai in the city to my surprise, and this was some of the best.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Despite having lived in the neighborhood for a long time and having been to Marnee Thai quite a few times, my husband and I never had much enthusiasm for it.  I never saw it as something special and different from other Thai restaurants in sf.  That is, until we caught an episode of check please! And apparently, we weren't the only people who drooled over the hot cakes and panang curry described on the show.  Suddenly this very old and already popular joint shows up on yelp's hot list and got even more crowded than before.  Well, we joined the hype and ordered take outs from them twice since the show.

Yes, the hot cakes are awfully delicious!  It's a great combo of something savory and something sweet.  The coconut flavor and the subtle sweetness of the squash and the corn mix really well.  The panang pork curry is less liquidy than normal Thai curry dishes, but the meat is more tender than your average Thai restaurant meat, and the flavor is great.  We have also ordered papaya salad, pad Thai, and pumpkin curry, but they weren't quite as special as the aforementioned two dishes.

 Take out is easy and fast-sure beats waiting for a table for a long time.
author: Candice B.

description: If I could I would give more stars I would! Why haven't I been to this place more? Came here for dinner to catch up with one of my amazing friends I haven't seen in a long time. Thank goodness she made reservations because it was extremely busy. I know why! The food is damn good!!! I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with chicken extra spicy! I gobbled it up. It was definitely spicy just the way I like it! :) We also shared the crispy tofu. OMG. It was delicious. The sauce was saucy and tangy. Affordable and great staff. LOVE.
author: Mel P.

description:
This place is pretty good. The food is tasty, full of flavor, and the service is exceptional. The only complaint I have is about the prices... A little too high for me, and the portions are small. But for the quality of the food, it isn't outrageous. Definitely worth a try.

EDIT:
I went back with my family because the food is good... Well, when we went, there was a small wait for a table for five. Fine. So while we waited, three of us went grocery shopping next door and when we came back, not only did they give away our table, but they put us at the bottom of the list.

WHO DOES THAT?

I understand if you need to give away my table because my entire party isn't there. BUT... You should NOT put us at the end of the line. That's ridiculous!

I don't care how great their food is... Service like that is crappy to say the least. They try to make up for it with good service once you've sat down. Sorry. Service starts the moment I walk into the resturant. I'm never going back again.
author: Sara K.

description:
My friends and I wanted Thai one night. We threw a proverbial rock in the air and it landed in front of Marnee Thai.

Thank you proverbial rock, thank you.

The Angel wings?  HUGE portion for $8.  Probably 8 wings at least.  And they weren't little anorexic wings either! A little bit of a crunch, a sweet and slightly spicy glaze, it's an appetizer but with a little bowl of rice on the side it could easily make a meal.  

Pad thai: One of the best pad thai's I've ever had.  The noodles had body, were cooked perfectly, didn't fall apart, and had lots of flavor.  Sometimes i feel like restaurants rely on the little pad thai goodies (egg, bean sprouts, peanuts, carrots, whatever protein you choose) to bring the flavor to the dish, but not here! Marnee's pad thai noodles had a perfect amount of sauce not dry at all.

Pad see ew: Good but pretty standard.

Yellow chicken curry: very nice! Lots of potatoes and chicken. It had a smokiness to it which made it stand out a little more as if the chef was like "how can i tweak this really common dish?" I could be completely wrong but hey whateves!

We should have known we were in for a good meal when we saw their numerous awards on the wall. Or the pictures of the chef with other respected figures in the culinary world. Or maybe by it's Michelin recommended poster. Iono.

Minus a star tho for the hostess who wouldn't acknowledge our presence for a good 10 minutes. Oh plus they don't deliver which suckssss!! All good though! :)
author: Jammir G.

description:
This was also a good Marnee Thai, I decided to switch it up and order some Pad Thai. The portion felt less, maybe I was just hungrier.
I had a spicy Pad Thai and it was tasty. Wished they gave me more!
It was crowded at night, waited for 5 minutes because no one wanted to sit on the tall stools, lucky!
It's not really good for groups because the restaurant is so small.
author: James T.

description:
Marnee Thai has been my #1 choice whenever craving Thai food.  It is my go to place when at work - and we've had several birthday parties and other special occasions hosted at this venue.

Appetizers:
Imperial rolls are deep fried crispy golden goodness with a sweet spicy sauce to accompany them.

Spicy Angel Wings:  deep fried chicken wings that are topped with a garlic chili - sweet and spicy sauce - very delicious

Be adventurous and try some of their specials like pumpkin stuffed samosas or corn cakes- you won't be disappointed

Pad Thai - is always delicious with your choice of chicken, prawns - or you can ask for both!

Tom Kha is the perfect sweetness, saltiness, and sour with the creaminess of the coconut.  

 
They have a private room in the back for bigger parties or private events.
+++ they also let you specify the degree of spicyness.

This place is great!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the City.  

This place has won several dining awards for good reason!  Just look at all the reviews and awards on the wall right as you enter if you need more proof.  The dishes here are freshly prepared and full of flavor.  Everything from the starters, to Pad Thai, and the specials are well-prepared and with just the right portions.  This place gets packed during dinner time and you may have to wait a bit once the clock strikes 6pm - a testament to how good the food is.  Also, the one on 9th street has a very limited amount of seating, another reason why it fills quickly.

I normally have the papaya salad to start off with, then the chicken with basil and peppers, and pad thai - the pad thai here is awesome!  I love the fact that they also offer brown rice. Nice.  The only thing I wish they would do is provide complimentary re-fills on the thai ice tea, because, well I love thai ice tea and they only provide a tall glass cup full of ice, which doesnt leave alot of room for the tea.  Marnee staff: are you reading this review?

For some of the best (if not thee best) Thai food in San Francisco, look no further.  Prices are fair and the food is outstanding.
author: M P.

description:
This was, hands down, the best Pad Thai I've had in the Bay Area. The texture of the noodle was perfect (some elasticity, some toasting), and the egg was fresh. The flavor balance was good (not cloyingly sweet, not overly salty, not overly spiced), but it was the texture that was absolutely perfect.

They lose one star for having the absolute worst ice:tea ratio ever in their Thai iced tea. It was mostly ice with a suggestion of tea.
author: Adriana V.

description:
I was really looking forward to going here based on the reviews and it being on Check Please. 

Maybe it was over hyped because I came in expecting my mouth to explode with flavors reminiscent of my trip to Thailand a few years ago. I read and heard that this was as good as being there. But unfortunately, everything was underwhelming. 

We ordered the special appetizer that is a coconut dumpling of some sort. It's brought out in a cast iron skillet like the ones they use in takonyaki. It was good but a little too sweet for my taste. 

Also had a pork curry from their special menu and it was really tasty but the portion was too small for the price. The chan pad poo did not have enough crab meat. I've had it at other restaurants, particularly in San Jose that make it better. The hor mook fish lacked flavor and again, I've had it better in San Jose. 

The desserts were super small though tasty. The mango and sticky rice was really good because the mango was ripe and fresh. The roti was a little thicker than the street version in Thailand but the flavor was there. 

It was ok but I would not drive all the way to SF to go eat here again. There is better Thai food in the South Bay. I was underwhelmed and it was probably my fault for believing the reviews.
author: Margo G.

description:
Imperial rolls 
Pad phed sliced pork medium spice 
Gang Jued silver noodles

all were delicious and so reasonably priced!
author: Sarah Louise D.

description:
So i had the Pad Thai here yesterday.  It was only ok.  I was actually surprised since Pad Thai is almost the staple dish for more thai restaurants.  It's not bad, but i just expected a little bit more for a restaurant with such revered food.

The angel wings on the other hand were awesome.  Garlicky breathe for the entire rest of the night.  I also like how they used large wings instead of itty bitty ones.  Definitely recommend this as an appetizer.
author: Lawrence C.

description: Delicious duck curry and papaya salad.   Very clean interior and fast service. Marnee is located near the UCSF Irving corridor so there is much to do before or after the meal.   Golden Gate Park is less than a block away.
author: Harry P.

description:
For the three years I lived in San Francisco, Marnee Thai quickly became a staple to my diet. With the plethora of typical Thai dishes that you'll find at any other restaurant, what sets Marnee Thai apart is the flavor. Their dishes are always a perfect combination of being very tasty, but at the same time not being drowned in sauces, salts, or oil. This delicate balance is why I come back and leave with a smile on my face.

My two stellar recommendations are the tofu spicy angel wings (this also comes in a chicken wings version, but the fried tofu is my favorite), and the basa fillet with fresh garlic. But many other things on the menu such as the pad Thai, lard na, and even roasted duck are great.

Having moved back to L.A., whenever I frequent the Bay Area I usually try to make a stop at my favorite Thai restaurant in S.F. And typically I end up having to bring back an order of the tofu spicy angel wings for my mother.
author: Mike S.

description:
Hands down one of the best Thai restaurants I've been in, in the Bay Area!!

My friends and I had just finished touring the DeYoung Museum's art exhibits and starving for some food. After putting our names down at Pacific Fish Grill (and it's packed wait list of 20 min), we decided to walk around the neighborhood to kill time. Long and behold, we walk by Marnee Thai. 

No judging a book by it's cover. From the outside, Marnee Thai looks like a ghetto, hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Not really my thang but hey, what do we see? A Yelp-approval sticker, a MICHELIN award, and many 5-star award this, another customer-satisfaction award here.... all three of us being huge fans of Yelp decided we just HAD to try this place out. 

To our favor, the appearance of the restaurant proved itself wrong. It's a very narrowly shaped place with seats lining across the wall and not that much room to walk around. The place was packed on a Friday evening so the service was somewhat on the slow side and we had to keep asking the workers, "can we order??"

I love that the food came in a family-style setting so the three of us could share and try the dishes we ordered. They were:

- shrimp spring rolls (had pieces of mint leaves which was a nice, refreshing addition to the roll)

- Chef Specials GAI SAMOON PRAI (sautéed sliced chicken with onions & fresh herbs, lemongrass, wild ginger, peppercorns 
and Thai basil)

- PAD NOR MAI (Ground sliced chicken sautéed with chili, garlic, bamboo shoots, egg, and Thai basil)

& my personal FAVORITEEEEE PAD MA KUER (Sautéed eggplant with sliced beef, bell peppers, and Thai basil in soy bean sauce)

Most of the entrees allow you to choose between beef or chicken. The portions are hefty as well. The rice doesn't come in individual bowls rather in this huge silver JAR that you can serve yourself. You can taste the quality because the food did not taste like a block of MSG. No dish was very salty and harmonized really well with the herbs. 

Beware: they offer you this pepper sauce to add spiciness to your dish. DONT UNDERESTIMATE IT. My friend and I have pretty high tolerances of spiciness and this sauce was no joke--especially if you get one of the pepper seeds on your food. I remember pouring a shitton on my spring roll and basically died.

When you're in the area, check this place out! A cute, hole-in-the-wall Thai place with moderate prices ($9.50~$13) near all those museums?? It's the ultimate date.
author: D S.

description:
Does this look like it's 98% noodles and about 1% meat/veg to you? Because it sure does to me... and so does this dish we ordered, and this dish, and this one...

Love the service and management, though.
author: Andy A.

description:
Ok, now I have to start off by saying, I know what it's like to be "on the other side" as I work in the hospitality industry as well. This gives me more patience to certain situations, but it also makes me more impatient when I see it could have been different.

My friend and I just got our weekly nail fix down the street (Sensi Nails) and were extremely hungry. We both like good food, so we were not just going to walk into any place. Of course we researched on Yelp and decided to go for this Thai place. 

I love Thai food & I think it's hard to actually go wrong with Thai food. I mean, noodles & veggies are hard to mess up. And my 3 stars are not about the food, but more about the service (the food is good!). 

We walked in (no reservation), but they had only 2 parties (one of 4 and one of 3) in the restaurant at the time we walked in, and the rest of the tables were empty. I'm sure there were some reservations made, but this is not a restaurant based on reservations, it's probably mostly walk ins. So when you then seat 2 people at the bar instead of at a regular table I think this is poor customer service. Anyway, we are not picky and we were just extremely hungry so we went with it (mind you, the bar seats are extremely uncomfortable). 
We immediately got our water (thanks, I love when you get water right away) and our menus. But then, for some odd reason, it literally took us to raise our hand to get a server to take our order (it didn't seem like any server was assigned to the bar area, and there were at least 5 servers just running around for now 3 parties seated).
Then, when we ordered I had a feeling our server didn't really care and was looking at something else while just saying "aha, ok." "Surprisingly" we got a wrong appetizer. When I mentioned it they took it away without saying anything. We got our right order later on, but again, no one mentioned anything about the wrong appetizer (a "sorry" would have been nice).
Then for the entree, my friend already receives her entree while we're still eating our appetizers (probably because it wasn't communicated with the kitchen that we had a delay with our appetizers, they probably just screamed "another order of this please"). I didn't get my entree until 7 minutes after she got her entree. 

When we had leftovers, we asked for boxes. I had about half of the food left (portions are huge), but when they boxed it, all of a sudden only 1 bite was left. Not sure what happened with the rest of my food, but it wasn't with me anymore. I specifically remember leaving some protein in my bowl, but when I got home I only had 2pieces of veggies in my box left). Food apparently just disappears. 

If it wasn't for the poor service, I would have given this place 4 stars. I mean, the food is good (like I said before, can't really go wrong with Thai food). But the service is just poor. I probably won't come back, I mean, there's plenty of GOOD Thai places with GOOD customer service.
author: Helen D.

description:
3.5 stars. The food was actually 4 stars but the place is so crowded that it was unpleasant at the end. Pretty good food, but the portions were on the small side.  In fact the tables were so packed together that we could barely get to our seats, which were right against the wall. The noise level was super high so our table of 7 could only talk to people right to or across from each other.

Verdict: will go for the food, but make sure to go off hours so at least you can eat in peace.
author: L S.

description:
The most consistently good Thai place in SF I know.  Lacks some of the flair the owners gave to their Outer Sunset establishment, but the food is as good as ever, and their soups are the most addicting thai soups I've ever had, esp the Tom Ka. 

One note is that if you sit by the door, you're close to the kitchen as well and they have an industrial strength fan in there.  It's so powerful that it's loud and you can feel the barometric pressure change when it goes on.  Just ask for a table in back and this won't be a problem.
author: Zack S.

description: Tasty, plenty of options, great service, good pricing.  What isn't to like about this place?  I ask them to make the thai food spicy, and guess what?  It comes out spicy!  I had mango curry which was stellar.  So flavorful, and a very large portion!  My only critique about this place is that you have to pay for rice separately.  This is stupid.  What other Thai restaurant doesn't provide complimentary rice with your curry dish? It's said that I can't give this place 5 stars, because I would.  Check it out.
author: Kavi D.

description: Marnee Thai is one of my favorite restaurants. It's a pretty small restaurant, but I've never had to wait for more than 10 minutes for a table. I order the same thing every time I visit and they've never disappointed. I always leave happy and super stuffed.
author: Christy Y.

description:
Consistently great food and great service - one of my favorites for thai food! 

They're open pretty late until 10pm and one time we went, we rushed in at 9:45, hoping the kitchen was still open. They cheerfully told us to come on in... awesome! At 9:55, I noticed two guys attempting the same thing as us, but they were told it was too late I guess, because they turned around and left. But one of the chefs then spoke to a server, who then chased them down I think, and let them in to dine! Sooo nice of them. 

The food always impresses me! Stuff I always order: 

Homemade hotcakes - on the specials menu, these are little grilled rice coconut cakes topped with a great combo of coconut cream, corn and pumpkin. I think they take coconut cream, pour it into a griddle, and out pops these little babies. I don't think I've seen this at other thai restaurants and they are wonderful tasting and unique! 

Guay tiew koor with roasted duck- fried rice noodles with duck, egg, and peanuts. Sounds pretty unassuming, but it packs a huge flavor punch with the roasted duck. So fatty and duck-ish... SO GOOD!!! 

Also tried a number of other dishes and all of them are consistently good... I don't think I've been disappointed with anything thus far? The pad prik king (sauteed green beans w/ your choice of meat) is also yummy. Come here!!
author: Janey L.

description:
The show, Check Please Bay Area, followed by raving Yelpers, led me to try this place. It's on Irving and 9th where we often like to dine at Hotei/Ebisu and wonder why we never noticed it before! Apparently there's always a crowd outside, which is a definite good sign. It was about 8pm on Saturday and the hostess told me it could be over an hour wait for two. I cringed a bit but the other people waiting in the small hall reassured it was worth the damn wait! 

So we got our name down and walked around for about 15 minutes and were seated about half an hour later, not bad. The main room was nice and lively while their little hidden back room sounded more quiet and intimate. 

As for food, we ordered a green curry with chicken and eggplant which was ok, the Basa Fillet was perfectly cooked with great texture and flavor, and their pad-thai was so damn good! Their dessert, mango with sticky rice topped with coconut milk, was a wonder on it's own (whatever you do, make sure you try that!) Their serving was nicely portioned so three entrees for two is plenty. I would love to come back and try more dishes, based on what I hear, you will not be disappointed each and every time. 

Quick tip: Make reservations and arrive early enough to find parking! Order their mango and sticky rice dessert, you will not regret it.
author: Johanna P.

description:
Pleasantly Surprised by Marnee Thai- I have lived in Cole Valley for over 4 years and just recently heard of Marnee Thai from a friend. I have been dying for a replacement Thai Restaurant ever since my Fiancée decided all of the sudden that Best of Thai on Haight was too greasy for her.... Well Marnee Thai delivered - not literally (thats actually the reason they don't get the 5th star - No delivery... at a Thai Place! Really?!?!?)  But definitely figuratively! Going to pick it up was well worth it! Excellent Thai flavors, not greasy at all, and generous portions.

I ordered my staple Thai Spicy Chicken with Peppers and Thai Basil over brown rice and loved every single delicious bite.. 

We will definitely be going back!
author: Joseph M.

description:
So we went here after we left shamrock and my buddy Noah recommended the place...he is right alot about food and he wasnt kidding when he hyped this place up!

Awesome Angel wings!
Pad Thai was delecious
Garlic Pad was off the hook!

And it is all very affordable. Hands down one of the best Thai places in SF and a very nice place to eat....was really digging the environment!
Go without fear!
author: Eric S.

description: Delicious!  I came here with a friend who had been there several times.  We shared the coconut [cake] appetizer that was on special.  Completely amazing.  Yum yum yum.  I had the fish steamed in a banana leaf, that's only available on fri/sat.  Wow, such a great amount of spice and tons of food.  The atmosphere is lively, but nothing special as it is a bit of a whole in the wall.  Completely enjoyed my experience and I will be sure to go back next time I'm in Inner Sunset!  I may even just make the haul to get there from Pac Heights!
author: Tami S.

description:
Oh yeah...the last time I was here, it was with the great Dr. Glenn Langit. I pass it by all the time heading to Gordo for burritos (I need to bookmark that place). I always thought that in order for me to go to Marnee Thai, it'll have to be for a special occasion. Today was the day...

I needed a place to come down from our high after interviewing for teaching positions at a local pre-school...I had the Spicy angel wings, Pad Thai w/ shrimp, and Tom Yum with prawns. This was a test of the staple Thai foods and it worked out well...a restaurant should be able to work magic on their staple foods!

It's settled, a 4 it is! I may not go back too often for myself but when its about friends and conversation, I'm there.
author: Michael G.

description:
I eat a lot of Thai food, as you can tell from all of my reviews, but Marnee Thai is one of the best.

The restaurant is small and cozy.  Decorations make you feel like you're sitting in a tiny hut.

I tried the samosas because I am a huge fan of Indian samosas, but I would say they were a little sweet, and I am more for salty and savory.

The reason I come here is  MIANG KUM.  The appetizer is amazing.  I have never found it at any other Thai restaurant before!  It is like making tiny lettuce wraps with nuts, lime, onions, ginger (personally, I omit the ginger), and a special sauce and it comes together beautifully in my mouth.  So worth it.

I also enjoy their mango and coconut rice dessert.  Delicious.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I've only ever had their food as take out and it's really good and the portion is great. My favorite is the thai fried rice and pad Kee Mao and it comes with this really spicy garlic pepper sauce that is so badass. The only thing is that their wait staff is kind of really rude. Maybe they're nicer to dine-in customers?
author: Christy L.

description: Despite what people have said about the hygiene, I've never had a problem with this restaurant.  I've come here with family and friends, and tried a good variety of the menu.  In particular, I like the Thai Samosas, Spicy wings, corn cakes, hot cakes, and pad see ew.  The panang pork curry and green curry are also pretty tasty.  I still mostly come for the pad see ew though, since I dont have to buy extra rice with that.
author: Max L.

description:
My favorite thai place in town. Great service and they even dress up for work in traditional thai clothing! 

The place is a bit small, but cute. All that matters is that the food tastes good, right?

Angel wings are like heaven, the noodles are good, and so are the golden triangles (samosas). Scallops were good too. What else can I say... I'm a fan :)

P.S. Parking sucks sometimes though.
author: Deb E.

description: Good food and the service was great. We always try and find good authentic Thai food restaurants and if your in the area try this place out. Had the Chicken Thai fried rice, Thai tea, drunken noodles (or something similar) and Green Papaya Salad. All great selections.
author: Foodie S.

description:
I have to admit, I found this restaurant thru Yelp. Thanks! 

The place is small and quaint. The host/hostesses were pretty nice. After a few sips of water, because of the ohh so spicy curry, the water guy was refilling my glass. I freakin' wish I had that at home. Point is, they never let my glass get past half empty....plus. The curry I had was nice and spicy, just like I wanted it. If your claustrophobic or don't want to be too close to people when you eat, then you probably will have a bit of a problem eating here. Oh yeah, parking....forget about it.
author: Mike F.

description:
Really good food. My 2 favorite items are the Panang Pork Curry and the Spicy Angel Wings -- the sauce on those is really, really good.

This place even has their own cookbook for sale that a friend got me as a gift.  I've made the Spicy Angel Wings at home and they came out just like those at the restaurant.
author: Paul L.

description: Food was alright after she took back the mushy green but more like yellow mango salad! WTF?! I ordered a TOM KA my favorite soup ever but it never did end up in my table oh because she never added it? It's the first thing I ordered?! So again another WTF moment. This is by far the most disappointing lunch ever. Neung maybe you need to brush up on your serving skills/order taking skills.
author: Ocho B.

description: Our first time to Marnee, because Nopalito was closed. Everything we ordered tasted good - #25 Kang Keow (green curry with eggplant), Thai-style potstickers and a coconut fried rice dish. We will likely return when in the mood for Thai!
author: D Q.

description: Delicious!  The food is soooo good! the flavors are to die for, service is on point and the atmosphere is wonderful at both locations.  Out of the 3 immediate Thai restraunts by my work this is my first choice.  I highly reccomend it!
author: Katie G.

description:
maybe it's b/c i've eaten food in thailand, maybe it's b/c i didn't order the right thing, but i thought this place was very average. 

got the red curry chicken which was labeled as "medium spice". i thought it wasn't spicy at all (coming from a korean person this might not mean much to you). also the curry was kinda runny/watery, taste was okay.
author: sharon s.

description: Always enjoy the food, but frankly the place needs a good scrubbing...light switches dirty, doors dirty, floor is gross, kinda smells. Just hire a cleaning crew some day when you are closed so we can recommend without hesitation.
author: Liesl R.

description:
Great authentic Thai foods. Service is friendly. Came here late night in group of 6 and got table right away. 4 of 6 dishes were delicious, while the other 2 are quite okay.

Good overall for traditional Thai
author: Randy L.

description: So, since I haven't been on yelp in awhile I thought I'd leave a comment about this restaurant. Anyways, I went here for Jason&I birthday dinner. It was affordable which is good. The food was good, I ordered pad thai although I kind of wished I ordered something else instead since every time I go to a Thai restaurant, I always end up ordering pad thai for some reason haha. But yeah, overall the wait wasn't too bad since we had reservation but it seem like since we had a big party, they didn't want us to stay there that long so they kind of kicked us out after we finished paying which was kind of rude. :( But yeah, I liked the food there and I'm hoping I can try something else next time! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
I am Thai and am pretty picky with my Thai food because the best is from Mom and Grams of course.  I went on to Yelp and found this gem.  All the awards and articles written about them they full deserve because they are so good.  My friends and I walked in at about 6pm and the place was bumpin!  We still only waited about 10 minutes for a table which was great.  They were really speedy with their service most likely so they can get you in and out and I was not mad at them!  This is what we ordered:

- Tom Ka with chicken (soup is so flavorful- just the right amount of spicyness)
-  Thai Ice Tea (you have to have this when you go to a Thai restaurant) 
- Hoa Mok (fish dish that is only offered on weekends apparently- so amazing. Most places don't serve this but it is fish with vegetables in a tea leaf) 
- Yellow Curry 
- Pad Thai (they won awards for this!)
- Spicy Angel wings (as recommended by Yelpers- it was yummy) 
- and of course white rice to eat everything with

All this came out to be 70 bucks. Not bad at all!  I am def coming back if I am in the area! 

The website is nice!
author: Anya R.

description: What a treat!  Walking hungry with family, and was able to walk in early - 5:00ish. Bad moods all around until the food started coming and slow smiles spread across everyone's face. Delicious variety of foods. Duck dish a little fatty but the rest, the service, the price the flavorful food - excellent!
author: Karen M.

description:
Take careful note - this is Marnee 2 (two), aye aye.

The food is pretty good, just a notch below the other Marnee a few blocks away, but the space feels far less cozy.  This is a good thing if you're claustrophobic or prefer a more open space, but it doesn't have the ambiance of the main location.

I say walk the few blocks up to Irving and 21st (I think that's where it is).  You'll be able to walk off that extra Singha beer and/or dessert on the way home!
author: dan s.

description:
Yum.
Yum.
Yum.

My boyfriend has Celiac, so Thai is a staple "go-out" meal for us. Yelp brought us here, and yelp did not fail. It's really really good. The flavors were perfectly balanced, and they have FRESH spring rolls, which *always* gets the A+ in my book. 

Speaking of books, their chef signed the cookbook we bought on our way out the door. 
Fantastic prawn salad. Excellent Tom Yum (saved me from my horribly pounding self-induced hangover), and a delicious red curry.

They have brown rice, too, which I really appreciate.
I will be back, that is, once I've practiced some of the recipes in the new cookbook I have...
author: Nicole L.

description: I used to go to Marnee Thai on Irving but tried the 9th Avenue location and found it to be consistent. Whenever my best friend comes from San Diego we go there and have their angel wings...there are amazing! Tried the pumpkin soup and was pleasantly surprised.
author: Cindi R.

description: One of the best Thai Restaurants in SF. I have yet to have a dish that I disliked from here. The pad thai is the best I have had. Service could be a little better. I have never had to wait more than a few minutes for a table which is great
author: Stephen A.

description:
The Coconut Cakes were wonderful and almost worth the trip and wait time...the entrees were solid, but nothing special. This place was touted as the truly authentic Thai joint in town, but the food wasn't different than other thai places.

We would have enjoyed the dinner more, but the place was sooooo busy and cramped that we honestly hurried ourselves out because of the noise and claustrophobia factor.  Not a place to enjoy dinner and conversation together. 

Overall, the food was OK, but we will stick with our favorite thai spot in SOMA instead.
author: Guinnivere B.

description: Spicy Soft shell mango avocado salad is excellent, as was everything else we had there
author: Sp S.

description:
Came to eat here a few weeks ago for my BFF's birthday dinner... It was GREAT!!!!! I have tried numerous Thai restaurants, all of them being very yummy... But this place tops all of 'em! The only downfall is that the restaurant is a bit small, so you work with little space to enjoy your wonderful meal. Other than that, everything was great. I brought a cake for our dessert and they spooked us for a second by turning off the lights (we were seated in the tiny room in the rear) and brought the cake in as we started singing. The staff was super friendly and I love how they kept up with our water refills! 

Oh, forgot to mention parking definitely sucks in this area but it is definitely worth it!!
author: Dijonne M.

description:
I love this restaurant- great thai food at a moderate price.
I've been going here for years, and the food is consistent, always delicious, and they give away these great tamarind candies with the bill.  I recommend the calamari salad and the corn cakes!
author: claire l.

description: Ive been going here since they opened and in my 8 year absence in SF, I missed this place. Do yourself a favor and try it, You'll like it.
author: Mario A.

description:
My friend told me this was the best Thai food that he had and was willing to travel from any part of the city to go to this place - so I had to try it out! 

It's a cute little restaurant filled with thai decor and the staff here is friendly.  The food here is amazing and the portions are generous.  I really liked the yellow curry with chicken and the pad thai (typical I know, but it's worth getting here because it's just that GOOD!).  

Travel over to this lovely little gem of a restaurant, you won't be disappointed.
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
Marnee Thai is THE BEST Thai food in ALL of CALIFORNIA. And trust me, I have REALLY high standards and expectations about the quality of food for EVERY cuisine. If I wasn't a school administrator, I'd honestly be a food critic or personal shopper. Being born and raised in a Chinese-Thai family, good food and restaurants were ALWAYS a priority for my family and we would drive an hour or two away to eat good food. That's just the Chinese way...with that said, here's my bottom of the line, no nonsense review:

Every SINGLE time I visit SF, I always have to stop by Marnee Thai. This is the newer location and has a more contemporary feel to it. The employees work hard to make the dishes authentic and provide outstanding customer service. From what I hear, they wake up at 3am to prepare special sauces that would not be found anywhere. The chef has received several accolades for his desserts (coconut hot cakes and roti), pad-thai (#1 in all of California), and has guest lectured at some of the BEST culinary institutions in the country. I've been to Thailand about a dozen times and truly and genuinely believe the food tastes way better than food in Thailand! In regards to cleanliness, if you compare it to the streets of Bangkok, I would have to say it's 100 million times cleaner and healthier than those street vendors. 

SO yelper HATERS of Marnee Thai 9th Ave, STOP THIS NONSENSE about the bad press. I understand freedom of speech but if you go to a "good" Chinese restaurant or even Italian restaurant, you are going to find that restaurants aren't perfect. I firmly believe that Health Department inspector EXAGGERATED information in his report in order try bust several restaurants to prove himself and trying to use the restaurant as leverage to move up in his position. Totally unfair. 

Let me give you my top 5 must haves: 

1. Their Hor Mok (for all you seafood lovers) is my husband's FAVORITE dish. If you are feeling daring, I'd recommend this dish especially if you like a little spice in your food. (Score: 10/10)

2. I'm an avocado lover. I LOVE their avocado salad. This is a fusion dish, not authentic Thai--just FYI. (Score: 9/10)

3. Roti Dessert. I love carbs and dessert. The fresh dough with condensed milk makes my mouth water! (Score: 8.5/10) No Thai restaurant in LA makes it the way they do. Note: This is the Thai version of crepes without the nutella and fruit. 

4. I always compare the same types of food at every restaurant. My friends make fun of me because I'm a creature of habit. Therefore, I always order Pad-Thai. If a restaurant can make good Pad-Thai with the right sweetness, spiciness, and other flavoring I guarantee they can make other dishes just as well. Pad-Thai is a safe choice for all of you newbies who are conservative. You can't go wrong with the Pad-Thai at Marnee Thai! (Score: 9.5/10)

5. The last classic Thai dish I love is "Tom Yum" with shrimp. At Marnee Thai, it's steaming hot, spicy, and sour. (Score: 9/10)

I'D HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT TO ANYONE WHO WANTS GOOD THAI FOOD. :)
author: rosalyn v.

description:
parking can be difficult in this part of the sunset.

okay the food is really a 4 or 5.  It really is good...but I ordered the curry and they charged me 4 dollars extra for adding onions to my curry.

thats way too much and crazy.  guess i'm gonna have to rethink how much i love their food.  i don't really want to pay 4 dollars extra and not even get a full onion, or less of anything else.
author: Bing D.

description:
This is the best Thai food I have ever had! I tried Thai food for the first time when I lived in Sacramento and had a favorite place there but on a whim, my boyfriend and I had dinner at Marnee Thai one night while in Inner Sunset. Everything about this place is splendid. The waiters and the hostess are always sweet and hospitable. Sometimes the wait can be long, but you can always call and make a reservation if you don't feel like waiting. Either way, this place is worth waiting for! 

I love:
-beef pad se'ew
-angel wings
-thai fried rice or the mango fried rice
-thai iced tea
-mango salad (seasonal) 
-shrimp and chicken pad thai 

The list could probably go on and on. My boyfriend and I go about once a month because the food is so good! We love the service, ambience, and of course the food. Marnee Thai is a great example of the hole in the wall places that San Francisco is all about!
author: Khanh C.

description: We tried the coconut hotcakes and pad praram, both of which were excellent. The restaurant was very busy on a Saturday night but we found a table and enjoyed good service. The only disappointment was they served the Coke semi-chilled in a warm glass filled with ice - the result was a watered down Coke. The quality of the food will draw us back in again.
author: Jim H.

description: This is one of the best restaurants in the Sunset, period. It is a must if you are in the area and enjoy Thai cuisine. Yummmmm!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Been meaning to try this place for a while. The verdict? I'd say it's a good option if you live nearby and/or are looking for Thai in the area. Clean, good service, food was as expected--didn't even have to wait. 

The tom ka was a little on the salty side, but still had a nice combination of sweet, savory, and spicy. My friend ordered yellow curry and, wow, I gotta say, it had a lot of peanuts in it. It was good, but I don't think the peanut-bonanza was doing anything for it.
author: Amy W.

description:
This is one of my go-to Thai restaurants for their service and quality of food.  Space can be tight, where you can literally pick up your neighbor's conversation, but overall, the place is worth checking out. 

For two people, we shared the Pad Prew Wharn- beef, pineapple, tomato, and bell peppers in a sweet and sour sauce. There were plenty of beef and pineapple chunks in the dish. I think I can pass up the yellow chicken with potatoes the next time around. There were massive pieces of both the chicken and potato, but the curry was sorta greasy.  

Save room for dessert because the black sticky rice with coconut ice cream is a must try.  

Service was great, as the hot tea kept coming. Don't confuse this location with their other location on Irving, between 23rd and 24th.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Hubby and I were famished after bike riding and attending "Tour de Fat".  We had seen the episode of "Check Please" which had talked about Marnee.   I guess many others watch that show- so busy!

The praise given on the show was well deserved.  The food was really very good.  However, we tried to exclusively order off the specials menu.   Everyone on the show raved about the fish steamed in a banana leaf.  The server said it was too busy/sold out and we should order something else.   Not a total buzz kill, but a little bit of a disappointment.  We ordered the Basa fillet with garlic sauce.  Added the stir fried morning glory greens and thai potstickers.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  Next time, I will order more traditional items from the regular menu.

It was 4:30 and there was a line forming!!  So, the kitchen was rocking and rolling.   Service was slow in the beginning- took awhile to get water and the order taken, but once a few more staff came for the dinner shift, all was well again.

I think this is going to be my go-to neighborhood from now on- Ebisu is always a favorite and the place across the street looked very charming.   There's a Chinese place around the corner that had a huge crowd the last time we drove by.   Because of the options, I do not think I would wait for hour(s) for a table here.
author: E T.

description: One of the best overall meals I've had in a long, long time. The hotcakes were the most original appetizer I've had at an Asian restaurant and were totally delicious. The spicy angel wings were also great, as was the Pad Thai. For dessert we had the roti with coconut ice cream AND the sticky rice and mango and both were superb. Highly recommended!!!
author: Katherine S.

description: When it's spicy, it's spicy inside out. I'm very partial to tofu. Theirs is one of the best! And Pad Cha Talay! Pad Cha Talay!!
author: Kara Y.

description:
I eat a lot more than I yelp, especially of Thai food.  But sometimes I get cravings for their specials.
