My favorite is the miang kum appetizer.  You wrap a variety of small things, like dried shrimp, lime, coconut, peanuts, and herbs, and it is just a delightful and surprising combination.

It gets busy, but somehow feels intimate.  You're probably going to want to make a reservation though.
author: Anda K.

description: The crab fried rice here is unbelievable!  Try this if you visit this place.
author: Dee L.

description:
This was my second time at this Marnee and I think it was even better this time! Last time I went with my vegetarian uncle, mom, and 100 year old grandma and everyone loved their dishes.
 
This time it was a Saturday night. A girl friend and I went before the movies, early, at about 5pm and we didn't have to wait, which was great. It almost immediately filled up after that. I ate more than I should have of the amazing fresh egg rolls, cuz they were literally the best I've ever had! And the PAD PREW WHARN (chicken with pineapple and tomato, cucumber, onions in sweet & sour sauce) was fantastic. We also loved the corn cakes, which I chose based on someone's review here. The best I've ever had. And the other reviews that rave about the water glasses being filled constantly are right; you never have to wish you had more water, it's always there, and the waiters pouring it are not distracting, as they can be at some places.

I really wish I lived closer so I could go all the time. One of the best restaurants, of any kind, around.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Marnee Thai is top notch thai food. Their first location has very cute decor but the 9th Ave is closer to my home.

Angel Wings, Pineapple Fried Rice, Green Curry, Pad Thai, Soft Shell Crab, Papaya salad... ALL GOOD.

I bought their cookbook to try at home!

They put an orchid as garnish on many of their dishes. The servers are dressed in traditional Thai attire. Great ambiance.
author: C. T.

description:
For thai, as good as it gets.

Went with my boyfriend who is not a fan of thai food--although he likes hot and spicy generally finds that hot/spicy thai overwhelms the food.

Now he is a believer--Marnee Thai has converted him.

We ordered the specials, and can't wait to go again. On weekend, they have a fish special--snapper over basil and fennel baked in banana leaf--FANTASTIC--if you go you must order this dish. very complex, very lovely flavors, unique taste.  We accompanied it by the chili green beans which were perfectly cooked and perfectly spiced.

the starter was very interesting (also a special) coconut pancakes--very addicting little dumplings (more of a half cupcake than pancake). You must love the taste of coconut milk though--they are essentially gelled coconut milk topped with a few things.

So we had none of the 'typical' dishes but had a most memorable meal. i had previously dined with a friend and had my usual, green curry chicken, and was glad to have an opportunity to go back-as the only 'food with flavor' in the neighborhood the boyfriend finally agreed (it was post the museum so needed lunch), and now he is a convert. Thank you Marnee Thai.
author: Colleen C.

description:
I used to go to Marnee Thai's back in early 2000 and it was really incredible.  Tonight I got take out after a few years of being away from San Francisco, I was pretty disappointed in what used to be the best Thai place.  I went to the new one on 9th and Irving.  Maybe their old one is still the place to go.  I got:
Angel wings: soggy
Pad Thai: Pretty good but not award winning
Yellow curry: Good, balanced taste.

I would have liked to give them a 3.5 stars but I have to say their service over the phone needs improvement.  I asked for my total bill amount and she said she couldn't give it to me because she had to enter it into system.  It seems weird that wouldn't just offer to call me back.
author: Sam S.

description:
I am a big fan of this restaurant.  The one on Irving or 9th.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is delicious.

I would suggest the panang beef and tom ka (?) soup.  It is the one with coconut milk. It's a great combination of sweet and sour.

The service is super friendly and if you are lucky enough one of the waitresses (may be an owner) will read your signs.

If your in the area, check this place out!
author: Casey B.

description:
Marnee is A-OK. Maybe I need to try their specialty items. What I ordered

Tom Yum Soup- Great but the temperature should have been hotter... it was a very cold day.

Imperial Rolls- its ok, nothing special

Pad See Ew- Very good.

What I didn't like about Marnee was the seating for me was uncomfortable. And they gave me steamed rice instead of my brown rice that I ordered but I was too hungry so i didn;t bother. The steam rice came out luke warm... not sure was it freshly scooped but yea got me thinking for a minute... 

Overall I still think Osha on Geary serves the yummiest thai food but Marnee gave really good service. I will be back! Prices are reasonable too.
author: A L.

description:
This is the first time that I have been here and I have been living in San Francisco for approx 5 years and whenever I pass by there is always a line so I was always afraid to go in and dine in there. But my colleague told me that we NEEDED to go there because their Angel Wings are like awesome! And Oh yes were they awesome! I really loved the food there and just me and my colleague ordered two dishes and we were pretty full already. 
Besides that all the food and atmosphere was really nice but I really hated how they kind of rushed us. Me and my colleague was obviously not done with our meal but the waiter just tried to take my plate away thinking I was done but I was not even close to being done! Besides this part that ticked me off everything else was great! =)
author: Jackie L.

description:
I have been going to the two Marnee Thai restaurants for many years. Always have had good food. Have impressed friends and family. 

Ive often had Pad Thai, it has become my standard Thai food for comparison. Like everything I have tried particularly the soups.
author: Brian C.

description: What a treat! Deeeee-licious! The corn cakes are truly inspirational. I adore the little cast iron pan that they are presented in.The mango salad with avocado blew me away, I want it again right now! Right. Now. The angel wings are a meat eater's guilty pleasure.There is a simplicity yet divine touch to every dish at Marnee, I can't explain it in any way other than authentically beautiful Thai cuisine.The service is so sweet and the prices are beyond reasonable. I can see why this place is so popular, it is a true gem. If you are a fan of Thai, this place is one for the bucket list. Trust me!
author: Steenie K.

description: I love Marnee Thai, which I think is one of the best Thai restaurants in San Francisco.   Everything they make tastes really fresh and not mass produced or pre-made and then heated like some other Thai restaurants.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but my favorites are the green curry, sea bass, summer rolls, and pad kaprow.  WIsh the tables were a little bit farther apart because I could hear the diners at the tables next to us better than I could hear my husband who was sitting across from me.
author: Julie P.

description:
The only reason this location of Marnee Thai is getting 2 stars instead of 1 is that the food is very good. However, the treatment my dining companion received last week was inexcusable. We were a party of 4, and one had already eaten dinner and was just joining us for company. She wanted to order the mango with sticky rice, which is seasonal. The waitress confirmed that they had it, and upon noticing our neighbor had substituted the rice for ice cream, she asked how much it would be for the same substitution. The waitress told us $5.25, and so she ordered it. 

About 5 minutes later, the mango+ice cream comes out, as well as the waitress. She announces that the price of the dish will be $9, not $5.25 as originally stated and confirmed. WTH?? How can the price change all of a sudden AFTER you bring out the dish? Totally unacceptable. After some very polite arguing on the part of my dining companion, the waitress goes to talk to the manager. The solution: $5.95. Not the original price, and the restaurant tries to say that the reason is that mango is expensive. OOOOOOOOK. I will probably not return to Marnee Thai because of this experience.
author: Amaranta C.

description:
Tom kha gai here is outstanding! Everything here is made with very fresh ingredients, experience, spice, and assertiveness that is associated with thai cuisine. This is not home style thai food but rather traditional thai cuisine as in the chef was trained in a thai culinary program (tip: you can also discern this about a chef when your fruits or vegetables are intricately carved as that is a part of the foundations of thai cookery education). 
Food is delicious, atmosphere is...like southeast Asian cities, tight, congested, loud, noisy, casual, and slightly chaotic, but I never felt rushed. 
I have to admit that in compliance with another review, the ice water served is very warm and full of soggy limes. Could be fresher on that front... Especially because they are so busy! 
I imagine the outer sunset location in better. 
I probably won't come back here but look forward to dining in the more low key sow goi up the street. 
My dining partner is from New Jersey and thought it was hilarious that our waitress' name was Wawa. 
But I didn't.
author: Libra J.

description:
I am only writing about the food since I didn't actually eat in the restaurant and can't speak about the service or ambience.  I ordered food to go from Marnee Thai on Irving, which I did not enjoy at all. 

 First of all, the shrimp pad thai was only mediocre.  The flavor was ok but the chef was very stingy with the ingredients.  The dish had mostly noodles, very few bean sprouts, very little egg and tofu and only four shrimps (that's one shrimp per person if four of you are eating - ridiculous!)

Secondly, I ordered chicken with green curry.  The sauce was just ok but once again the ingredients were skimpy.  There were some huge chunks of eggplant, which I suppose was the chef's way to disguise the fact that the dish didn't have a lot of chicken.  

Thirdly, I ordered string beans with tofu and baby corn because I wanted to lighten up the meal by having more vegetables. Well, the dish turned out to have this cloying, overly oiled sauce that made it a lot heavier than it should have been.

I definitely was not satisfied by the food I ordered from Marnee Thai on Irving.  Now I'm craving some really good Thai food, which I know you can find in San Francisco, maybe just not at this restaurant.
author: Anita P.

description:
I went here with a group of seven friends, and we were all very impressed with the place. Since we had so many people, we had the chance to order a large number of dishes, including green eggplant curry, pad thai, pad see ew,  bbq pork, and an array of appetizers (angel wings, fried egg rolls, and this interesting corn cake) 

everything was great and not repetitive, as each dish had its own special flavor unlike some other thai restaurants who use the same seasonings over and over again. i would highly recommend the pad thai and the curry 

the dishes also came VERY quickly, which was impressive considering our big table and the fact that the store was packed at the time. we barely had time to keep up with all the oncoming food! 

last, the waiters were friendly and responsive. we never had to deal with cluttered dirty dishes and empty cups of water. 

this restaurant's definitely on my top 3 for best thai restaurants i've been to (and i've been to many), and i would suggest this place to anyone who's into thai food. my only caveat is to bring lots of friends so you can try more dishes =)
author: Brian C.

description:
Had dinner at Marnee this weekend. Was my 2nd time and, again, excellent.

Our order (Note: We always request 5-alarm fire, spicy level, to all our dishes whenever having Thai):

* Angel Wings appetizer (5 stars) - OMG, how do they do that??! Deeelish!!! Yumm-o! Tip: Bring a wet wipe because your fingers are gonna be super glue sticky afterward.

* Tom Yum soup (4 stars) - Ordered it with prawns. Very good, generous bowl for 2. Flavorful. Nice and spicy.

Panang Curry Pork special (3.5 stars)  - Served with steamed broccoli. Was tender and good. Although, I wish it was a bit more flavorful and that they were more generous with the curry sauce - there wasn't enough to spoon onto our rice. Dish didn't come out a bit spicy to our disappointment.

Pad Kee Mau wide noodles (5 stars)  - We ordered with beef. OMG, I could eat this dish all day long!!! Fabulous flavor. 

Bottle of the Gewurztraminer from Monterrey  (4 stars) - Great accompaniment, relatively reasonable at $23/bottle.

Service: 5-stars. Attentive and friendly.
Ambiance: 5-stars. Cozy and warm.
author: Kimbalee W.

description: Every dish is delicious! They do everything from tom yum soup to pad thai to curry potstickers with an authentic flair and tons of savory, pungent flavor. It's constantly packed (make a reservation) and there's not much room to maneuver, but they accommodate groups and parking nearby is a breeze. The best part...the pyschic owner/manager May! She's a riot and will read your fortune (just know that the whole restaurant may be privy to her intimate and vocal predictions).
author: Sara C.

description: Excellent authentic Thai restaurant.  The Spicy Pad Nor Mai was delicious!  We added the brown rice on the side.  I've also heard the chicken wings are tasty too.  The overall atmosphere was casual, not too loud, and made for an enjoyable evening.
author: Kim K.

description: Wow, I'm actually surprised at how underwhelming this place was. Came here with a friend for lunch after hearing about it from others and reading about it on here. Got the Tom Yum soup, which pretty much tasted like hot lemon juice. This is the second time in my life I have had such a version. The first time was a major surprise. The recipe says lemon grass not lemon juice, silly. Also, way to much galangal. very distinct flavor. My friend's pad see eww was reportedly not very good and used regular broccoli rather than the Chinese version, which apparently is a red flag. Good prices though, under $8 each. Just bad food. Oh well.
author: Miguel V.

description:
I was pretty uninterested in going to Marnee because a friend said it was only so-so, and I have a favorite Thai place close by. I'm certainly glad I went; the Prig Khing was as good as any I've had, and those little coconut pancakes were scrumptious. My friends had a red curry, a green mango salad and both were fab. I'm not a pad thai fan, so i can't comment on that, but the roti with coconut ice cream was yummy. 

The service and atmosphere were unremarkable but fine, and yes, it's small. We went at 5:30 and had no trouble getting a seat, but it filled up very quickly.
author: Elle C.

description:
Really, REALLY surprisingly good garlic chicken wings...

But...that's all I really liked.  I'm not a spicy food person, and I just enjoyed the spot in the back with our good company...  

Would definitely come back to try different dishes and more of those wings =)
author: Meesh K.

description:
Probably the best Thai food I've had in this area.

Servers are very nice and patient, setting is clean and intimate (not great for groups  larger than 5-6).  Perfect for groups of 3-5.  Parking around there is do-able.  

We took a couple of Thai-food virgins here, and turned them on to it.  I just hope it didn't turn them on to Thai virgins...
author: Ryan S.

description:
Last weekend, as I perused through my TV channels, I paused at KQED's show "Check Please." I caught a viewer touting Marnee Thai with such praise that I had to check it out.  Tonight, I will confirm the awesomeness of this restaurant.

The wait staff is kind and courteous. The food is out of this world. If you go there, these would be my recommendations:

1.) We started off with the chicken satay wrappers. The chicken is cooked perfectly.  The accoutrements for the wraps include cellophane noodles, Thai basil leaves, cilantro, fried coconut crips, and the best peanut sauce I've ever had.

2.) We also tried the Spicy Chicken Wings. It comes with this sweet but garlicky sauce, just oozing with goodness.

3.) We also had the Pad Thai, a reliable staple.

All in all, I would drive into the city, the Inner Sunset, in fact, just to have Marnee Thai, again.
author: Van L.

description:
Would've almost missed trying this place if it weren't for the fact that I'm an idiot and forgot to check if, you know, San Tung was even open on Wednesdays (it's not). HOWEVER, this was a GREAT alternative.

Had:
1. Beef Salad (they do not skimp on the tasty beef)
2. Yellow curry (potatoes were soft [thank the Lord])
3. Spicy Angel Wings (ordered in bitterness, but it's SO good. Crunchy yet saucy. 8 wings)
4. Roast Duck (special sauce is pretty bomb)
5. Tom Yum Soup (my ears felt the spice, I'm not gonna lie. It tastes kind of like Mama instant ramen. Nevertheless, good.)
6. Roti (Fried dough + condensed milk + sugar.........)

It's a great, homey feeling, and unassuming little place. 

The service is top notch, the waiter made sure to remember my friend's name after we told him it was her birthday, and when our dinner was almost over, he turned the lights off, and came out with a little gong (rang it a few times) and dessert + candle, and announced to the whole restaurant that it was her birthday. They then proceeded, to get the restaurant to sing her Happy Birthday.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Food was above average for a Thai restaurant, tasty and rich flavors, a sold 3+ though it was not as fresh and warm as Bangkok Noodle on Powell.  Seating was way too intimate with other patrons and service sub par.
author: Jay M.

description:
YUMMY!!!  I have never had a bad experience here.  I love the Chicken Yellow Curry with brown rice.  My boyfriend always tries something new and everything is just delicious.  

I have never dined in, so I can't review the service, but the food is first class!!!
author: Jacqui R.

description:
This place is incredible--*almost* worth driving up from the south bay. I've had several curries and the pad thai, and everything is always delicious. The pad thai especially stands out as one of the best I've ever had. 

I also highly recommend their dessert roti. I'm used to thinking of roti more as an appetizer, with a savory sauce, but Marnee serves it with powdered sugar and coconut ice cream and the result is absolutely divine.

Portions are pretty good and prices are reasonable. The restaurant isn't that big, so sometimes you have to wait outside for awhile, but it's totally worth it!
author: Laura K.

description:
UPDATE: Came back again. I think I was being a little harsh the first time. The food here is really excellent. Definitely some of the best Thai in the City. Space is a little cramped and (consequently) it can be a little noisy, but good food comes first, I think.

Had the red curry with duck & pineapple. Was pretty tasty, but not the best Thai I've had in the city. I especially liked that the duck meat was quite tender and not as fatty as some I've had in curries. The decor wasn't as good. It's a pretty crowded place and was pretty loud while I was there. Not as good a place for a date or dinner for two in general. Better, I think, for a larger group, even though getting a table will be harder.
author: jim o.

description: Best Thai food in the Inner Sunset, you can find cheaper, but the service is great and food is the best I have had in a while.  The place is very clean and walking distance from many other places.  If you are in the inner sunset, this is one of my favorite places!
author: D R.

description:
My friends and I just happened to wander into this place because we wanted to try something new. Are we sure glad we did!

The Thai food here is one of the best places I've eaten at. We ordered the pad thai, yellow curry, and some other noodle dish, which i forgot. All i can remember was the pad thai was to die for. I just wish we could have asked for it to be spicier. All the ingredients tasted really fresh and the entrees came out in nicely designed dishes and bowls. It really made the place seem a bit above the average Thai cuisine. The service was also pretty good.
author: robin w.

description:
I came to Marnee Thai once and that was when a friend of mine took me out for my birthday. The restaurant itself is quite small but they really take each inch of space to use. The tables are all pretty close to each other. We had to hear the entire conversation next to us and I'm sure they heard us too.

I dont remember what it was called, but we ordered an appetizer that was in a very hot pan shaped like small little circles- whatever was in that sucker was delicious! I ordered a chicken dish and my friend ordered some noodles- both were really good.

I will definitely be back.
author: M W.

description:
The food was great.  The coconut pancakes really are delicious and unique, and the green curry was surprisingly spicy (a good thing), if a bit thin.  The mango w. black sticky rice?  So. damn. good.

So why only three stars?  We had a reservation and had to wait over 30 minutes for our table.  I'm sorry, that's not okay.  Yes, places get backed up (especially after being featured on TV), but geez, you've got to learn to manage your traffic a little better!  Even worse, she lied to my friend about the wait.  Missed reservation: - 1 star 

We walk up to crowded door and check in:
Hostess: "Oh, it'll be about 5-10 minutes."  
Friend: "Really?  There're a lot of people waiting.  It looks like a longer wait."
Hostess: "Well, it might be 20-25 minutes."
Us: puzzled looks...Why lie about the wait time?  That'll just annoy people more.

The good: we left our cell phone number with the hostess and were able to go catch a drink at the Shamrock while we waited.  She called about 25 minutes later...and we STILL had to wait another 6-7 minutes to be seated.  I don't normally indulge in acronyms, but WTF.  - second star.

The moral of the story: Be honest about wait times, continue to take phone numbers a la Burma Superstar and you will have much happier customers!
author: Jen D.

description: One of my favorite places to go in the city. Consistently amazing food. Angel wings are the best!
author: Jack S.

description: Visiting SF, I've got the impression that most SF restaurants are small and loud, and Marnee Thai is one of them. When we came, the line was out of the door, but lucky for us we had a reservation. The restaurant is long and narrow with tables very close to each other, which gave me the feeling that I am sitting in the long hallway. The food (Pad Thai and vegetarian curry dish that my daughter ordered) was good. Be careful with their spice rack, they are serious about their spices there.
author: Yelena Z.

description:
I have been going to both locations for decades now. I like the Inner Sunset the best. Indeed, excellent true Thai dishes. I have not had a below par dish yet and try something different almost every time. So I would give them 4 stars, but the last couple of times the service has been uncharacteristically slow, cold and inattentive. I don't know why and when I inquired why I got brushed off with out a reply???
I do recommend it beyond that and hope it is just an anomyly or blip with the staff. 
Do go on a slower time (just at the start of dinner service) for a better experience!
author: Joe Bob J.

description:
Spicy Angel wings rock. It is what we keep on going back for. I have a picky eatter and he just loves those wings. 

The service is not what it use to be. 10 years we have been going and the service has just gotten worst. 

Hey but I go for the food not the service.
author: Angela W.

description:
Jumping on the band wagon with this one. Pad Thai was good and the green curry was very good, but still on the hunt for the best Thai in the city.

Food: * * * * 
Service: * * * * 
Space/Atmosphere: * * * 
Value: * * * *
author: Saul E.

description:
Not amazing, not terrible, it hit the spot. The waiters will likely suggest substitutions and dishes that are better than others for you, which was a nice touch, and the tea is great. 

It's easy to get in and the food comes up quickly. Next time though I think I'd stick with pad thai rather than the suggestions that were presented to me last time. I do like that they offer brown rice, which is great. The food comes in large portions, so there's more than enough to share and extra for leftovers too.
author: Ash S.

description: This is a great little neighborhood, and Marnee is it's thai food crown jewel. The sea bass was great, they had some fun appetizers, friendly service, quick seating if you're fine with the counter. If you're in this area and feel like thai, this is a good option.
author: Mike G.

description:
Went for a late lunch.  We started with the imperial roll - like an egg roll.  Good with the typical sweet chilli sauce.  

We split the chicken yellow curry and pad thai.  Pad thai was real good.  Mixed with the red pasty hot sauce...real good.  The yellow curry was mild in flavor.  I prefer mine a bit thicker and sweeter, but still very good.  The place is on the fancier side but has a great entry that feels....authentic.  and the prices are moderate.  

The hot tea was my favorite.  Maybe, a hint of vanilla?  Whoa
author: Kris O.

description: Hot cakes, angel wings and hormok.  That's what you need to order.  Fanfreakintabulous.  Best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand.
author: Ottis M.

description: After catching the Jean Paul Gaultier exhibit at deYoung last night with my friend visiting from Japan, we took a nice leisurely walk from Golden Gate Park to Marnee Thai and had the papaya salad, green veggie curry with brown rice, and pad thai..... medium spicy---- enough to wake up the senses and keep you warm in the foggy chill of the sunset. She had the coconut juice and I took the lychee iced tea (which was already sweet and tempered the heat of the curry and salad).  We were seated right away because we beat the crowd at 7:30 and their staff is so friendly and attentive.
author: Patricia M.

description:
We have been going to Marnee Thai for over 10 years. It is consistently the best thai food, bar none. The angel wings are perfect - I could lick the plate to get every bit of sauce! The green curry with chicken is flavorful and the right amount of spice. The pad thai is yummy and the veggies in it are always crispy, never overdone. The green beans with prawns is soooo good especially when they add pineapple which was recommended by the owner to us. The owner is a delight, a real treasure. The first time my husband and I ate there we tried to order pad thai and another noodle dish and she told us, "No! You can't order 2 noodle dishes!" She steered us toward the prawns and green beans and has been giving us good suggestions ever since.

This is not a romantic sort of restaurant. You don't really linger over your dinner in some sort of chic ambiance. This is a place to go to if you want incredible thai in a decent, clean atmosphere. The wait staff is attentive and very nice.
author: Hillary W.

description:
I love this place!  I have turned a couple people at work on to it and they have said its the best Thai food they have had.

The Angel Wings are my all time favorite.  I order them every time I go here and they are always the reason I keep coming back.  A friend of mine can't get enough of the Pad Thai or the Imperial Rolls.  I've yet to try either of them since I have this crack like addiction to the Angel Wings.

The people who work here will make you want to be their best friend.  They are very nice and treat you like family.

If Marnee is actually there when you go, you will fall in love with her.  She is very sweet and I've heard rumors that she reads palms.

Best Thai in SF that I have had yet.
author: Stacy Y.

description: I've only been here on weekends for lunch a couple times, but boy is it busy then. The long narrow space feels cramped, the sound volume makes it hard to talk, and there's a line for the bathroom. The food is good, but not enough to raise the experience above 3 stars for me. The sauces are a bit too rich and heavy for my taste. That said, some of the dishes, like the vegetarian rice cake appetizer, are excellent.
author: Max P.

description:
I think Marnee Thai is a really good restaurant. Good ambiance, the atmosphere is and warm and inviting, and best of all the food is super duper ultra mega delicious!^^ 

My favorite dishes so far is the Eggplant with ground meat, Pad Kee Mao, and the Pad Thai. It's very flavorful and fulfilling.

For dessert, the warm sticky rice with a dollop of coconut milk on top, garnished with thin slices of mango surrounding the mound is perfect on a cold and rainy day.

Thank you, May, for your insights and compassion for everyone that visit your restaurant.
author: Jazzy L.

description: This place is pretty darn good.  The service can be pretty slow, even when it's not crowded inside (which it almost always is).  They also only serve beer and wine, not a full bar which I guess if you're just going for the food is alright but I can't give them a fifth star until they're able to serve me alcoholic Thai Iced Tea with my meal, thank you very much.  I don't know anything about authentic Thai food and how this stacks up, but for Americanized Thai food it really is good for the price.  The fact that there's always a line for a table speaks volumes, at least.
author: Leith M.

description: This place is incredible.  I love Thai food and this is that great "hole in the wall" done right kind of place.  The food is spicy and tastes very authentic.  The Thai fried rice and pad Thai were excellent.  Only downside was there was a wait to get seated, but what do you expect.
author: Jose P.

description:
My favorite place for Thai of all time! I've been to both locations. I adore their angel wings!

Service is better on the 9th ave location. The guy manager is very nice, and friendly.

Cocktails are great too! 

Will definitely come back for more Thai food!!
author: Care B.

description: Lovely little place on 9th Ave in the Sunset. Place is small but it brings some charm too it. My group was seated right away, which was amazing since it was 7 pm. Definitely recommend angel wings and their pad thai. The wings were fried and had this amazing sauce. Since I was in the bay area for a month, I don't know if I will ever get to try this place again since I'm the type of person that likes to try different restaurants, rather than going to one and sticking with it.
author: Tam V.

description:
This has got to be the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to.
The angel wings were amazing, spicy but also flavorful with basil and some sweetness.
The pad thai and thai style fried rice were ordinary, but good.
We had some vegetarian dish that was a twee bit too spicy, but nothing that a bit of plain rice doesn't fix.
Now the taste of heaven for me was the most tender and flavorful beef I've had in my sentient life.  I think the dish was called panang beef, but it was chunks of RIDICULOUSLY tender, but thoroughly cooked beef in curry and coconut milk and basil, all with a tender side of broccoli.
And there was some coconut sticky rice for dessert, with really nice fresh mango on the side.
Price-wise, it's about 10 bucks per dish, somewhat small portions.  However, that's not that much more expensive than your average Thai restaurant, and the flavor is about 10 times better
author: Kimi T.

description: Marnee Thai is a very authentic and quite tasty Thai restaurant.  I've been going regularly to Thai restaurants since 1973 when most of the menus were not in English and I'd be the only non-Asian in the restaurant.  I had Thai friend write down on a piece of paper my favorite dishes so I could show it to the waitress and order.  In the 1980s or so Thai food caught on and you could then find restaurants outside Thai areas that had menus in English.  If you have been to Thailand or eaten at real Thai restaurants you will know that many American-Thai restaurants have popped up and you can no longer go to just any Thai restaurant and expect great food.  You can, however, go to Marnee Thai and have really good, authentic Thai food.  Three of us went there and the food was very good.  Try it.  If you love Thai food, you should really like the food here.
author: TJ J.

description: Love this place. The experience I had here was amazing.....the food the atmosphere. Just wow. We are going back on Thursday and taking a friend. So excited. The food has real flavor. And you can see the chefs cooking so it makes you feel like you really know what's going on. :) love you Marnee !!!!
author: Rose G.

description:
I had some lovely food from this place - a beef dish that was so tasty, the meat was literally melting in the mouth; and a vegetarian meal that was so balanced in flavor, absolutely delicious! 

 I would definitely recommend going there.
author: Arno H.

description: I can't say enough good things about Marnee Thai's food. We've had about everything on the menu. If pad thai is your thing, the pad thai is a bit too sweet but they'll tailor spice to your liking by request. The curries and soups are amazing. All of my friends and relatives that come into town demand we go here, often straight from the airport! It is our favorite in the city and we eat a LOT of Thai food! Highly recommended.
author: McKay G.

description: Marnee Thai has been shut down by the SF Health Dept for multiple infractions dating back quite a ways. Where is the Health Code rating that Yelp promised to post for SF restaurants beginning in January/2013?
author: Mike F.

description:
Foodwise, Marnee lived up to all the hype. The hotcakes (delicious bite-size coconut cream treats) were amazing, and our entrees (pumpkin curry, pad kee mao) were very good. And all reasonably priced. 

Servicewise, I was very disappointed. We were seated nearly 10 minutes before a server arrived with water. When we ordered, they asked if we wanted brown or white rice. Brown, we said. Then they manager/owner lady (she limps a bit) came back to confirm brown rice. Since we were never asked "Do you want rice?" we assumed it came with the meal. But instead, two orders of rice were deceptively added to our check. Not cool. We had plenty of food, and could have done without the rice (although admittedly, it was possibly the best brown rice I've had at a restaurant). Still, I didn't appreciate the stealth upsell.
author: David Z.

description:
I first saw this on Bay Area Check Please. One of the critics raved about this restaurant so I decided to give it a shot.

My friend and I arrived there around 8:30pm on a Weds night and it was packed! 

We walked right in and there were awards everywhere. So I thought to myself, wow, this must place MUST be good.

We ordered the house special: homemade hot cakes, Pad Cha Talay, Thai Style Fried Rice with Duck, and Thai iced tea.

The homemade hot cakes were unique indeed, but I didn't like the taste of the coconut mixed with vegetables. I didnt feel as if the two were very complementary. 

The Thai style fried rice was dry and it didn't live up to my expectations.

The Thai iced tea was perfectly made though.

The Pad Cha Talay was my favorite dish. I love the combination of seafood with the herbs.

The service was pretty good and the male waiter was very friendly. 

Overall, I had high expectations of this restaurant as being one of the best due to the plethora of awards and raves, but it didnt win my heart.
author: Nance H.

description:
Don't understand the hype here.

The angel wings - the sauce was rich and garlicky, but the wings were definitely overcooked since they are a bit dry and tough.  Maybe it is better to substitute with tofu.

Green curry with chicken is definitely not as good as Thai stick (Millbrae). The green curry has too much coconut milk for my taste; it lacks the sharp favor that I was looking for.  But I do like the big piece of eggplant.

Roti with ice cream, it is more like funnel cake since it was fried dough on condensed milk and top with ice cream.  It was very decadent indeed but a bit too rich and sweet as a finishing touch.

Over all, have had better elsewhere and with the parking situation on Irving Street during lunch hour, guess won't be coming back any time soon.
author: Prascilla L.

description:
This place kicks all the Thai restaurants cluttered around Hells Kitchen in New York's ass! Trust me, San Francisco, Marnee Thai is a gem you OWN over New York. Be proud.

I miss home now.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Don't have a bad thing to say about this restaurant.  
Best Vegetarian Pad Thai I've ever had and ever will.  Everyone who works there is really awesome too.  I guess I would call myself a regular there because they already know what I want when I walk through the door.
In love with this little independent neighborhood restaurant.
author: Julie T.

description: Thai food! It's pretty good - the tom yum soup was a tease (in a good way) - I had one little bowl but it was flavored very well. It left me wanting more... Angel wings were also pretty good. The green curry with chicken and the beef Pad see ew were also a delight. Nice place for Thai food!
author: Jamie T.

description:
Now that Suriya (in the Mission) has closed, I'm not sure there is much of a contest for the title of Best Thai Food in San Francisco.  Marnee is phenomenal.  

The food here, from the spicy green beans, to the pumpkin curry, to the sitr fried morning glory, was just so so tasty.  Also, it seems like this place is run by a bunch of foodies.  It's not every day that your waiter at a Thai restaurant will recommend the stir fried morning glory because of it's gentle but slightly crunch texture and delicious flavor.  Nor is it common for your server to gently stir the peanut sauce prior to you eating it, so that that the wonderful flavors within are well-balanced.  The staff here really seem to care about creating a quality dining experience with quality food.

Definitely recommended.
author: jeremy f.

description:
Yea yea for marneeeeee! 

All the food is sublimely delicious. The cooks are actually from Thailand so you know (they know) their food and how to make your tastebuds happy...intensely flavored with high quality ingredients. 

We had the spring rolls, yummy! the angel wings, delicious! the red curry with perfectly steamy hot rice, oh yes! And the tom yum soup had all fresh lemongrass, bamboo, and ginger goodness just as they promised. 

While we were waiting for our food, a sweetheart brought us two 'hot and tall' glasses of honeyed Thai tea, and delicately said "to keep you warm while you wait" - Needless to say the service is wonderfully attentive and friendly.  

The decor was easy on the eyes. Large vases of petals in water, freshly cut orchids on the table, elephants n buddas abound. 

Yes, Yea marnEA+!
author: Daniella B.

description:
I came here with high expectations - I had to forget those immediately to give this place a fair shot.

I heard this place has "the best Thai food in the US." 
With those kind of expectations Marnee came way short. Sure it was good, nut surely not the best I've ever had and not the best in the US. Actually, I like Osha better.

The pad thai was good - the tofu in it was wonderful.
The Thai basil fat noodles (forget the name) was very flavorful and  delicious.
The chicken with peanut sauce and spinach was interesting, pretty good- I would have preferred the sauce to be a bit sweeter.

Overall, this place is great: good food, good service - and we'll leave it at that.
author: Chili B.

description:
after claiming that my friend doesnt hang out anymore, i am currently in an attritious battle for his affection with his gf.  to win him over, i took him to marnee thai.

the bro date was wonderful and i got to second base.  we got the yelp recommended specials and everything was exceptional.

the waitresses were attractive.  and yes, it matters.
author: Paran Y.

description:
Marnee Thai is another one of the restaurants that has been hyped up and got me excited, only to be disappointed. I had such high hopes after all the things I've heard about this place. The atmosphere is pleasant and the prices are affordable, but to the service and food... it's only okay.

My cousin and I had another lunch date today and we ordered the papaya salad with the soft shell crab, the pad see ew with chicken, and the angel wings. The angel wings were yummy, but a tad too garlicky for my taste. The papaya salad was okay, but I've had better. I appreciate the fact that it was a little spicy, but the spicy-ness alone wasn't enough to win me over. As for the pad see ew, it was okay, too.

The service was horrible! There was only three tables of people that the servers had to attend to, and they still couldn't entertain us, at least my table. I didn't get my first refill of water until after I was done with my meal and they didn't come over to see if we needed extra napkins for the messy wings we were eating.

Overall, Marnee Thai was alright, just average. I don't think I'd come back here in the future though. Total disappointment! :(
author: Anne Y.

description:
This place it s amazing.  Best Thai in SF period.

As soon as I walked into the restaurant we were blessed with a very warm welcome. 

This was my first visit to Marnee Thai and I'll be coming back fo sho!

5 points to point out:

1. Food was amazing and unique.  
2. Service was excellent
3. Very cozy place to share with friends and family
4. Prices are very reasonable for the quality
5. May is AMAZING

Can't wait to come back again!
author: Meinoh K.

description:
This place has really amazing Thai food.  Usually I leave stuffed and happy with what I ordered.  Their wings are great like everyone said and the chef suggestions are good too. 

But... there are couple things I don't enjoy.  Its a really small place and is always packed.  I am 6 feet 1 and a big guy and the dining space feels claustrophobic. I always hit the seat behind me when I stand up from my chair and everyone can hear my conversation because you are usually a foot away from other people.  They really need to invest in some square footage and renovation.  Also, the last time i was there i got take out and waited for my food, the staff seemed rude and understaffed.  The staff was not friendly and seemed to be angry and stressed out.  i guess I would recommend going at times when they are not too busy.
author: Mike L.

description: My favorite Thai resturant in the Bay Area. Well worth going to the city for. Nice to finish off a fun day in the park or at the coast. Have never had a dish I didnt like. I really like the lack of Americanized-Thai dishes, keeping it mostly traditional Thai food. Reminds me of being back in Thailand!
author: Ben M.

description: Any place that has Miang Kum on the menu has my vote. The home-made hot cakes and pot stickers in curry rocked. Located right across from the Golden Gate Park entrance, I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for great Thai in the area.
author: Jon W.

description:
SF has a lot of Thai restaurants and this one is just another blip in a saturated market.  Yea its decent, but nothing to trek across the city for.  If you work or live near, come in because Marnee is a safe bet.

Portions here are a little smaller then I'm use to, and I didn't like how they don't have sticky rice.  But it's reasonably priced and the service is friendly.  Although the waitress was kind of pushy and tried to get us to try other things but we stood our ground.  I know what I like.

Be careful not to sit by the kitchen door, because if there's a birthday that guy is going to come out with the gong right next to your ear.  He isn't Dr. Dre, so please don't make my ear keep ringing. Ring ding dong, ring a ding ding dong.
author: Donsta L.

description:
From the beef to the spice on the wings there were a lot of vietnamese flavors in all dishes.  

Angel wings are heavenly.  

Phad Thai very tasty.  I'm a very picky Phad Thai guy and this one has my approval.  Very different than standard, but very good.

#37 was good too, nice sauce.  Just wish they hadn't fried the tofu.
author: Jon G.

description: Oh sh***t,, this place!! Ok, so menu was quite tasty! I loved that the service was fairly fast considering I came here with a group of about 9 people.  I would have liked to give it 5 stars if the venue had a better ambience.  Wait staff were friendly, although they were.always pretty rushed. I guess that's why the service was pretty fast ;) . Over all it was pretty good experience. If you like Thai Food, this place is a must... :)
author: Melanie D.

description: i came here kind of a lot because they are good and open late. i like their chan pad poo, which is basically a variation of pad thai with crab meat in it. the flavor was very balanced and they were quite generous with the crab meat. i've come and tried their pad cha talay (seafood with various thai wild herbs), papaya salad, drunk noodle, and they were pretty good and authentic. i was here enough that some of the servers recognized me and knew what i would order. the service is good. but the kitchen is right next to the dining area so it was very loud all the time. when i was very tired, i would get a take-out because i couldn't stand the noise. they get pretty busy until late too. they are a little bit pricey and you have to order rice separately, which is... not really acceptable from where i'm from. but other than that, solid thai place.
author: Te R.

description:
Consistently good, even though I only come here sporadically.  I love the Pad Se Yu, wide noodles with black sauce, the Chilean Sea Bass (sadly, my niece's fave since she was 3 years old - what a princess!) and various sautees of greens and seafoods.   The food is high quality and always ready when they say. 

It gets crowded and the street parking can get crazy but the service is good here.  Enjoy!
author: Sandy C.

description:
I really liked the food at this popular Thai restaurant.
The staff is super friendly and attentive.
The group I was with ordered lots of dishes to share, but I think if I were to order one of the entree dishes for myself, I'd still be hungry, since they're kind of small plates with not a lot of food.
The entree plates are around $11, which is great for the tasty dish, but I kind of wanted more.
And I didn't leave too full even after splitting up the bill and paying $50 a couple.
author: Kev M.

description: First time at Marnee, but definitely not the last. We arrived around 8pm and the place was bustling. We settled for two seats at the bar and promptly browsed the menu. First was the Green Mango Salad which had great texture and freshness. Delicious. (We opted for the vegetarian option (tofu) over prawns.) Then came the Thai Style Potstickers which consists of the usual potsticker doused in a green sauce with coco milk on them and basil leaves. Not crazy original, but very delicious. When the Tom Ka soup arrived, we already had a warm fuzzy feeling about our dinner. The broth had the perfect balance of spices and heat. Our last shared dish was the Pad Nor Mai with minced chicken. The dish was great, but my girlfriend wanted more heat so she reached over for the hot sauce. The manager quickly intervened with a cup of chili saying that it would taste much better with this and that this chili batched was made today. Awesome, thanks?! We quickly depleted our rice supply and ordered another small bowl. The waitress came over with this huge silver bowl of rice. Seeing my confusion, she reassured me that they would charge me the same price as the small one. We devoured this double serving of rice without a problem. Stuffed and satisfied, we stumbled out happy customers.
author: David Minh N.

description:
I came here with my friend and his dad, and the food is great!
Parking is almost impossible to find, you'll most likely have to park in the mini-parking lot next to the restaurant, it's $8!! 
Ridiculous, right? and to top it off, when you get inside the restaurant, ..er, it doesn't really look as big as in the pictures you see on the uploaded pics here, it kinda looks like you're eating in my bathroom without the toilet.  It still looks nice, but it's a bit crowded.  You can see them cooking on the spot, whereas usually there's a completely different room for the kitchen.

We ordered one of their salads (which, by the way, you must try.. I've never had anything like it..) or else maybe all the salads I've ever tried tasted like crap.
We also ordered pad thai with chicken and  some fried rice meal with mix chicken and shrimp.  
Actually, my friend's dad asked me what topping I wanted, and I kept saying chicken, and they thought i didn't like shrimp. So they kept taking all the shrimp and feeding me all the chicken.
And my friend shoved a shrimp on my plate as a joke, and I accepted it. And he said, wait, what? I was just kidding.. because you don't like shrimp.. but okay, fine take it.

What!!! I love shrimp... The only reason I didn't ask for it was to save you guys a dollar for the bill...  (I didn't pay).
Ehh, I grew up learning to be cheap and ordering cheap alternatives. Actually, I just learned it from my dad. Hahaha.

Anyway, back to the review..
I think everyone needs to try to this place at least once.  It's quite a popular restaurant, despite the small size. 

And I think it is OKAY for groups, as long as you don't have any more than 4 in your group.  As for bringing kids, eh.. Please don't make the atmosphere anymore annoying than it already is.

Service is very nice, We got candy at the end :)  Candy? Okay, you're on my good side hehe
author: Frankie W.

description:
Marnee Thai is a diamond in the rough.  A needle in a haystack.  An onion ring.. in a basket of fries.  It's just a tiny little place in the Sunset with the best Thai food I've had.. in America at least.  

Can't believe I haven't reviewed Marnee Thai yet.  This place is serious.  Seriously good.  Everything I've had here has been delicious, with the exception of the spring rolls that I got at lunch one time.  I have nothing much to add to the other rave reviews but I must say as a Thai food lover it's tough to find Thai restaurants that are as authentic and delicious and relatively inexpensive as Marnee.  Do yourself a flavor and go here if you haven't already.  

Faves: angel chicken wings (also available in tofu, also very good), beef pad see ew, panang curry, tofu in peanut sauce.
author: William S.

description:
Yeah, it's not as good as its older sister store on Irving.  It's more conveniently located to me, though, and it doesn't come with that annoying hostess lady that the original location has--you know the one--so I'll probably end up coming here more in the future.

It can be kinda packed at lunchtime, and the tables aren't the most convenient in terms of comfort or privacy.

But why am I being so negative?  The food is delicious, and they get it to you fast.
author: John S.

description:
On the nights I am too lazy to cook,  or when it's a girl's night out, or when out of town friends visit, or maybe even just when the N stops near UCSF and makes us all get off the train, I go to Marnee Thai.  It has all my living-on-loans requirements: reasonable, for the amount of food, pleasant atmosphere, and good service.

I always order the Pad Pra Ram and the Chicken Satay, with their hot tea (I'm thinking some sort of jasmine blend?).  My guests usually order something else (there was some chicken with lemongrass-and-peppercorn dish that was amazing), but inevitably someone tells me that what I ordered is so much better than what they chose.  True that.  

I like being right, and I like Marnee Thai.
author: Jennie K.

description:
The food was delicious but the service was grotesque.  The place wasn't even half filled and we had to pracically go around tapping people to come serve us. Seriously? The woman who served us acted like she had better things to do and didn't want to be there. Although she tried to cover up the annoyance in ther voice, her attitude shone through. 
When we asked for another bag for our to go items, she got very punchy with us as well. 
Might go to Marnee again but next time definetly at a different location.
author: Jeanette P.

description:
Having lived in China, and therefore having traveled through numerous South East Asian countries, I find myself very particular about any sort of Asian food. In fact, I rarely eat Asian while eating out- because its always much too greasy, heavy, or fried and doesn't ring true to the regions cuisine.

As with everyone else, I find Marnee Thai to be a tasty, well priced, exception to this fact. Its ingredients are fresh, fried only to the point of necessity (not to the point of attempting to satisfy the American palet), and bursting with flavor! As a post NYE linner (that's lunch and dinner, if you didn't know), Marnee was comfort food for a rainy day, but done just right so I didn't feel like I was weighing my hung-over self down in fatty fare (not the feeling you want after a night of shot and champagne pounding).

The Spicy Angel Wings were crunchy, sweet, hot, and topped off with basil leaves cooked so well they were an edible snack on their own. The Pad Thai was also great- not dripping in oil and paired with the perfect ratio of shrimp and sprouts. And the Chicken Yellow Curry?! 
Packed full of flavor topped over brown rice of just the right consistency (not too cooked, but not mush either).

The intimacy of the restaurant is another reason worth venturing to the Richmond. Its warm punchy colors make the small space so cozy, and the staff appears genuinely sweet. Given my penchant for being picky over Thai food, its a safe bet that this is the only place I'll go to when I crave it from now on.
author: Raquel C.

description: Yes!  Excellent!  One complaint was that we were the first table of the evening to sit in the "spill-over" section of the restaurant that is in the far back.  I liked it because it was quiet, but it was freaking COLD back there!  When we come back, hopefully soon, we will opt out of seating back there unless it's a warmer day.  It was like eating inside a refrigerator (seriously)!
author: David H.

description: Delicious food and an extremely attentive and gracious staff! Believe what you read, this place is amazing!
author: Anne W.

description:
Originally heard of this place through co-workers who raved about how good Marnee's was.  Came here recently for the second time - this time around with some friends who have never been here and all of us enjoyed what we ordered.  

Friends ordered curries and they liked how the beef was tender and not tough like other places.  I ordered the Pad Thai and it's definitely one of the best in The City - highly recommended!!!  Made reservations and when we got there it was just about 1/2 full.  Restaurant is long and narrow, as stated in previous reviews, so probably not the best place to go to for large groups - smaller parties of 2-6 are the best at a place like this.  After eating here, you can either go to GGP, walk around 9th Ave/Irving St area, or stop by one of the many other places for some dessert:)
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Morning Glory, Pad Thai, Duck stir fry dish was delicious Oishi@!! but as for the number 4 appetizer wasn't really good. Parking can be a pain, so plan ahead.
author: Aniko N.

description:
I came here during lunch around 11am during the weekday and the restaurant was almost empty. When you look at empty restaurants, it's really not a good sign, but by the time we left around 12pm, there were people lining up near the door. 

The place looks very Thai, like most Thai restaurants, and the waitress was nice too. I ordered pad thai and pumpkin curry which were amazing. The portions were moderate so my husband and I were able to finish both without having to pack the leftovers.  I would definitely come here again if I lived nearby. Parking sucks, but the food is worth it.
author: Grace R.

description: What took me so long to come here! Great food, average interior. Been back twice in the past month.
author: Ken L.

description: Food is good but a bit pricey. The place is usually really packed, overly loud, tables are closely arranged. I feel bad for the waiters who always have to force their way around to get to the customers.
author: Misc S.

description:
Marnee Thai is one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Been to both of the Marnee Thais and it is good. The angel wings are so good its literally finger licking good. lol.  The Tom ka soup was great it was spicy and sour made with coconut milk yummy well thats if you're a fan of coconut milk then i suggest you try it. The red curry is good and i'm not a big fan of curry but it was good. 
So if your ever out in the city go to either the hut marnee thai or to the one off 9th street. I assure you'll love their food.
author: Junel L.

description:
Amazing place, you really must go soon!
We had the hot cakes... so unusual and so good, a must try!
Then we ordered a pork curry that was OK, but the Basa fillet with garlic and black pepper sauce was so fresh and tender, a lot of flavors!
For desserts we had the Roti with ice cream and the mango sticky rice, delicious!
The service was pretty good
Can't wait to go again, the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco!
author: Veronica M.

description:
4.75!!!!
Great Place one of my fav thai places in the city
The must gets...in order (but ALL are good....) are:
Spicy Angel wings 
Red duck curry
Basa fillet with fresh garlic and black pepper sauce
Pra Ram Chicken (peanut sauce)
Pad Se ew
Mango Fried Rice
Pad Thai


I was lucky enough to try this place 2 years ago (both locations), and living out in the east bay now, i still frequent this place and always send my friends over here if they want to raise the bar on their thai food experience. 

Just recently i was able to come back to marnee thai with a big group so i got to order alot more dishes than i usually get, a now on par with the best dish they have (spicy angel wings)fav is the basa fillet with fresh garlic and black pepper sauce. 

Ive pitted multiple recommendations of "best thai places in the city" against my own fav marnee thai, and each time the dishes are on par but mostly better at MT. 

All the food is great,
One thing i wish is more quantity, having the food tasting so good leaves you wanting more.
Prices are decent but not hole in the wall cheap

Atmosphere
Both locations are great,
I do like the location at 23rd and irving because of the decor inside but the place is small,
The head lady there is always super nice and makes you feel at home. 
This place is a staple for thai food!

Enjoy!!
author: Alan C.

description:
Really good thai food here (and at its sister restaurant). Love almost everything they make. And they make it really well.

Their Thai iced tea is one of the best I've ever had. Their eggplant dish is delicious. Their Thai style fried rice with duck, although it sounds very average, is incredibly well-flavored and well-balanced. 

Heck, if only they were located closer to where I work, I'd go there every day for lunch!
author: Vien N.

description: I was excited to get some tasty thai but i have to say i was a little disappointed when i got my order of Chan Pad Poo (spicy fried rice stick noodles with crab meat, egg and green onions).  It was kinda flat in flavor and just OK.  Oh well, I will probably try something else since this place has got some good reviews by folks I trust.  Perhaps I was just unlucky or picked the wrong dish - doh!
author: Gene X.

description:
The food is amazing. :) Period. 
Might not be the cheapest Thai food, but it's amazing. 
I love the angel wings. :)) And the corn cake is delicious. Just crunchy enough. 
Portions are just right, not too big but not too small.
My favorite restaurant for Thai food. Hands down, the best of the best!
author: Susan Y.

description:
My husband is Thai and grew up visiting Thailand every year. When we had Marnee Thai he said this was the best Thai food he has had Stateside. The entire staff is Thai which is obvious by their warm, sweet demeanor and accents :) 

Angel wings are great, the pad thai is incredible.
author: Leslie C.

description:
Angel Wings!  Angel Wings!  Angel Wings!

No, seriously, Marnee Thai is a wonderful departure from your weeknight-too-lazy-to-cook-let's-get-curry-and-pad-thai-take-out.  

Plus, the angel wings are fabuloso.

We've had many different dishes, none of them curries or pad-thai, all of them delicious.
author: .caroline. ..

description: Reliably good. And they have interesting dishes I haven't seen in other Thai restaurants like the coconut griddle cakes.
author: J P.

description:
I came here last night with a group of 7 friends to celebrate a birthday.  Our party was seated, but waited almost a half hour before the entire party arrived.  I'm sure the servers weren't very happy with that, but they seemed to hide it pretty well.  They were very friendly and actually moved us to a private room by request.  It seemed like they were going above and beyond to make sure that our dinner went well.

I ordered the Chan Pad Poo this time around, which is a rice noodle dish with crab meat in it.  While it wasn't the best Thai food I've experienced, I loved the flavor of it, and the portion size was perfect for me.

Birthday girl got coconut ice cream on the house :)
author: M M.

description:
The last time I ate at Marnee was at the outer Sunset location 8-9 years ago, and after the Thai nazi owner read my palm and told me NOT to put hot sauce in my food I was livid and never returned.  I've aged and mellowed out since then and my Thai palette has grown, so we decided to try out the inner Sunset location in search of the elusive "Thai Spicy."  We ordered the shrimp Tom Yum, the beef pannang curry, and the crab noodles.  To our delight the Tom Yum was insanely spicy (and the peasants rejoiced!), the curry was not as spicy but worked for us, and even the noodles had a kick to it.  Good flavor all around.  We will definitely re-visit to try out more dishes at the 9th Ave location but the outer sunset spot is permanently on my black list.

$.02
author: Ken W.

description:
Sigh..

Sigh..because customer service was disorganized, misleading and slow.  
Sigh..because we waited pretty long for three people and they squeezed us in a small table for two.
Sigh..because we went on a busy night and it was very crowded since it was a small restaurant.

Awesome...
Awesome...because the manager was really cool.
Awesome...because after asking we got a larger table for us three.

Went here for dinner. 
Food was good. Imperial rolls, angel wings,red curry, pad thai, bbq chicken and mango with sticky rice.

Imperial rolls were pretty small for 7 bucks, but they were still good. 
Angel wings were delicious with that garlic sauce.
Mild red curry tasted good with the brown rice. It was very fresh. But they should offer more rice..
Pad thai was great with chicken.
The dessert, mango with sticky rice, was...unique. Enjoyed that as well.

I ordered bbq chicken to go.  For 11 bucks, for a few pieces of small chicken..hm was not worth it.

If only the service lived up to its expensive food! 

Sigh
author: Nicholas L.

description:
Had the pad thai and the #45, some sort of spicy seafood mix. The food's fantastic, possibly the best Thai in the City, certainly better than anything they had in Ithaca, NY.

Also -- the staff are friendly, service is quick and it's no strain on the wallet.
author: Angela N.

description:
Hospital visit.  

My husband is allergic to peanuts so we usually don't do Thai but we'd gotten a strong recommendation for Marnee Thai.  (the one on 9th Ave at Irving)

We looked the menu over and it was not overly peanutty and when we asked the waitress she assured us that there were no peanuts in the two dishes we ordered.  

One bite into the first dish and it was clear it had been contaminated by peanuts.  We asked the waitress and the water person and both said, "no, no peanuts."  We said he was allergic to _something_ in the dish (that something being peanuts) and we needed to pay and leave immediately.  They boxed it up and we paid and left.   

Since the dish didn't call for peanuts, it must have gotten cross-contaminated by something in the kitchen.
author: Nat L.

description:
Excellent Thai food, and we consider ourselves lucky that Marnee is just a couple of blocks away.

A recent order:

- Pad Se-Ew - exceptionally well executed rice noodles - not sticky, not clumpy, not mushy, and full. of. flavour!  A small  nit -- the broccoli that accompanied the dish seems to have been cooked separately (e.g., parboiled and plunged in cold water) and added at the last minute.  This made for slightly bland and lukewarm-to-cool broccoli atop our steaming Pad Se-Ew.

- Kang Dang - Red Curry with Duck.  Spicysweet, complex - will leave you craving thai iced tea.

- Pad Ma Kuer with Pork --rich eggplant, tasty bits of pork - fantastic and savoury -- a nice accompaniment to the Pad Se-Ew.

- Param Phak -- assorted curry veggies with peanut sauce and fried tofu;  coconut milk -- a tad spicy but a great way to take your vegetables.

We've only ever had take-out here, but the staff we've come across are pleasant and kind.
author: Claudine C.

description: well, its been a long time... too long - anyway.. this place is off the hook! love it!! the owner is great and as well as the staff! words cant explain how happy my family was to come here and enjoy!
author: Stan R.

description:
I concur with other yelpers.  This is the best Thai restaurants I've been to in SF.......and believe me, because I love Thai foods and have been to plenty.  So far, I have not been let down by any of their dishes.  The chan pad poo (pad thai with crab meat), spicy angel wings, curry with noodles, basa fillet with garlic sauce, mango and avocado salad, and ginger fish are my favorite.  The staffs are attentive without being fake or in your face, which is very rare at an asian place.  

Love this place!!!!!
author: Mai-Tam N.

description: Marnee!  Been here ~20+ times - best Thai food ever.  Try the pumpkin curry, chicken larb, pad-se-ew(?), avocado salad...  The take out is fast.  The people are always nice.  Solid spot.
author: Kari F.

description: Best Authentic Thai Cuisine I've tried in the City.  Nice busy, cozy ambiance and friendly staff.  Their ingredients are fresh and consistent.
author: Carlos S.

description: My dinner last night was kind of like a a long-term relationship.  The restaurant made us wait for over an hour when they said 20 min, but then we stayed for over 2 hours and closed out the place.  The tofu pad Thai and tofu pad see yue (sp?) were delicious.
author: Julia D.

description:
Came here last night with the boyfriend. We've been to the other location a few time but the one on 9th and irving is our first since the parking is terrible. 

Normally we always get the angle wings and a few other common dishes but this time we tried something new. We had the hotcakes and avocado salad for appetizer. The avocado salad was the amazing, but beware it's spicy! Althought it a bit too spicy for me, I can't help but keep wanting more and more. We also had pumpkin curry with chicken and  noodles ( I can't remember the name of the dish but i remember it was amazing)! 

The servers were friendly and attentive. Refilling our waters and wine. Tables were spaced out just right. Not too close to other where to you can hear other people's conservation, but close enough where you dont feel like you are in the middle of the desert.  What a way to spend our one year anniversary together.
author: Sabrina K.

description:
After an amazing Sunday at Hardly Strictly Bluegrass, the hubby and I were walking home and decided to stop in here for a little dinner. Well, we don't have a TV so we didn't see Check Please but the menu looked good and the smells were warm and welcoming and we decided to give it a try and I'm super happy that we did!
The staff was pleasant and well dressed and the food was really great! We started with the pot-stickers - soft and crispy with a great sauce.
I had the Pad Phed w/ pork - spicy and flavorful, mushrooms, peppers, bamboo and thai basil - YUM
Hubby had the Pad Prig Khing w/ pork - fresh crunchy green beans with chili sauce - not overpowering.
No room for dessert and leftovers - which we eat later the same night because I personally could not wait and it was that good!
author: Moe L.

description:
I haven't Yelped in a while... School, work, blah blah blah... Been thinking about yelping and haven't really gotten around to it... until last night, I went to Marnee Thai and had the most amazing dinner there ever! And now I just have to Yelp it! 

Was in the mood for Thai - thought about trying out a new place but then remembered we haven't been to Marnee Thai for a while... so Ryry and I stopped by. 

The owner =) is very knowledgeable about the dishes on the menu and suggested we try the Hor Mok - swordfish with basil and cabbage steamed in banana leaves and married with a curry mousse. Definitely something I had never tried before, sounded tasty and it is only offered on weekends... we decided to go with that. 

We also had a spicy version of prawn padseeyew. Had their droolworthy corncakes and tender satay, too. 

When the swordfish arrived, it was so beautiful! (I kicked myself for not bringing my camera with me!) And it tasted even better than it looked. The flavors melded together so harmoniously... the sweet basil and cabbage, the creamy curry mouse... it's been a while since I've had a dish that was so well made and so delicious. 

The owner informed us that his grandmother used to make this dish in Thailand and sell it for many to enjoy. It was her signature dish and now it's a Marnee Thai staple. (I really am a sucker for true stories like this but they are why I come back again and again! Knowing the food or restaurant's history makes the trip there and the food that much more worthwhile.)

You may want to stick with traditional Thai dishes like padseeyew, basil chicken, satay, yellow curry... which are all fine and dandy. But if you want something home-y, really sticks to your stomach and dances in your mouth, you're going to want to order the swordfish.  It's elegant, simple and effortlessly delicious. THANK YOU! 

*Side note: Marnee Thai has a back room seating area for small parties. If you want to have a get-together, let them know and they'll accommodate you! 

And remember, the swordfish is only offered on the weekends. =)
author: Christine C.

description:
Quaint restaurant that can probably seat, at most, 20 people. It's great, and it has that relaxing atmosphere, especially on a nice sunny day. The food is great; I ordered the Tha Style Fried Rice w/ Chicken and I had some of my friend's Pad Pra Ram. I'm a fan of fried rice in general, but I feel like most places I've been to recently make it too salty, with soggy rice and sparse ingredients. Not Marnee Thai's. And the Pra Ram sauce was excellent, even down to the shredded peanut topping. I will definitely come here again when I'm in the area.

Oh, and I just checked out their website...I gotta say, it's pretty cool.
author: Grotius H.

description: Best Thai food I've had in a long time, hands down!  I can see why they are Michelin & Zagat rated.  I had the pad nor mai (ground pork w/ chili, garlic, basil, onions, bellpeppers) and the mango fried rice w/ beef... both were delicious and the perfect amount for 2 people to share.  My guy and I also shared the papaya salad which was delicious - I feel it's often too sweet at many places and not spicy enough but this was not the case here.  It was a little light on the papaya and heavy on the lettuce but I realize the economy sucks right now.  The service was lightening fast & super friendly & attentive, I'm already craving another visit!  PS the fish sauce they have at the table doctored up w/ chilies, garlic & who knows what else is totally addictive!
author: Suzanne V.

description: So good! Our favorite Thai spot in SF. The Pad Se-Ew and Pad Kee Mao are excellent!
author: Mark W.

description:
This place is pretty tiny, with two rooms, the front room being with only one row of tables, but they also have a back room which is a little bigger. But either area, they both get super noisy with everyone in there, and you do feel a little squished walking in and out, while avoiding waiters/waitresses flying past you with plates of food in their hands. 

The service is pretty good for how business it was on a Saturday night when I went, there's constantly always one or two waiters/waitresses walking in and out of the room every few minutes, so it's not hard to flag one down to get something. 

So food wise --- my boyfriend and I got the Angel Wings for an appetizer, which wasn't what I expected after having some at other Thai restaurants. These angel wings weren't stuffed, they were just deep fried chicken wings in a thick spicy sauce. They were still yummy, just not what I was used to. 

We also got Thai coffee and Thai iced tea which were pretty good. But the Thai Iced Tea was super sweet, but isn't it always? I prefer the Thai Coffee though, it had a nutty flavor to it, but it's also sweet, just not as sweet as the Thai Iced Tea. So be forewarned if you don't like overly-sweet drinks. 

As for our entrees, my boyfriend got the Mango & Pork Fried Rice, which was really good surprisingly. I'm not a fan of fruit in dishes, but it was pretty good in the fried rice. The fried rice overall was very flavorful and yummy! I'd definitely get this one again. However, the pork used in the dish, is the Chinese-style Cha-Siu used in the Pork Buns in dim sum. So that was a little odd, since it was more chinese-style than "thai" style. 

My entree was the Pad Kee Mao, being a fanatic of that dish in my college days. I chose to get it "very spicy", which might've been too spicy for me, but other than that blunder the noodles were yummy! Of course it has basil in it, which I usually ask them not to put in, but I decided to try it Marnee's way before altering it myself, and they chopped up the basil to smaller pieces so they were edible in my opinion. 

The Pad Kee Mao was good, but I think I would try some other dishes next time I come. I think the Fried Rice was delicious enough to get it again next time. But I think I'll try some of their curry dishes next time I go there! Can't wait!
author: Grace L.

description: 5 star for the best coconut soup in the city !
author: Andrew A.

description: Went to Marnee Thai last night. Been there before and found it okay, but last night it was terrible. The quality of the food has really gone down. The papaya salad tasted overipe and sour. The green beans with chili sauce were heavy, the sauce too thick, and the flavors were unrefined. The sea bass for 18.00 was a small fillet with heavy garlic sauce, masking that the fish wasn't fresh. The owner is a a controlling, falsely friendly person, who won't even let you ask for less sauce on a dish. "This is the way we make it." I think this restaurant is riding on its reputation and needs the customers to demand more -- if we can get through the line of defense with the owner who takes all the orders and makes people wait forever. We walked out of there feel unsatisfied and cheated. Don't go! Find a new place.
author: colette l.

description: Love this place and can't wait to go back! I went with 3 friends for Friday dinner after an evening at DeYoung Museum. I don't even remember specifically what we all ordered, but I tasted everyone's dish and it was all delicious. You just can't go wrong here. This place is packed for a reason. Very inexpensive, über satisfying.
author: Simone P.

description: Pretty decent Thai food, which was just what I was craving in between walking the botanical gardens and getting some ice cream at twirl and dip. I heartily recommend the hot cakes, which we got as an appetizer. I don't know why I always get fried rice and think it will be anything special, but I did and it wasn't. The roast duck with pineapple that they added to the rice was decent enough so if you see anything with that it might be worth it. My friend got the pork belly special, which proved to be good as well (we shared). Service was attentive and plenty friendly.
author: Nik K.

description: Amazing hot cakes made from flour and coconut milk - they taste awesome! I never tried anything like this before in other thai restaurants, Service is great! Menu is good too - everything we ordered came out great. I liked their coconut milk soup and pad see ew. Also tried bbq chciken - and its a whole small chicken bbqd with thai spices - nice!
author: Try E.

description:
It is my humble opinion that Marnee Thai is among those Thai restaurants that not only set the standard but support and maintain the standard. 

My wife and I ate there Saturday late afternoon and all I can say is...WOW!!

Fantastic! If you're not eating at Marnee, than Phuket!! No, no, no silly..I mean the beer of course.
author: Wayne B.

description:
UPDATE, without it being all yelpy update-y (this is OLD SCHOOL!):

5 stars.  Not 4.  Yay!  I am addicted to their silver noodle salad right now.. with yummy yummy pork (view this picture to understand my opinion: http://commercialappeal-web.com/blake/wp-content/uploads/2008/07/slobbering-homer.thumbnail.jpg)

This has quickly become my fave thai place in the city:

1)  the lady that owns it with her husband literally tricks people off the street, and is a three ring circus unto herself.... I mean that with high marks.. she is a gem, a hoot, and a class act all at once.

2)  The Tom Yum Gai is perhaps my favourite around.

3)  The Laarb Gai isn't the best, but it is way up there

4)  They do GREAT take out

5)  It is a couple blocks from my home.. a real treat!

6)  cheap enough to eat there like an addict.

boring review... but straight forward!!!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: I've eaten here several times. First at their location on Irving in the Outer Sunset, and now the one on 9th. I'm usually a curry fan, but decided to try something new. The corn pancakes are THE BOMB! Best I've ever had at a Thai place. All the vegi dishes are great & I'm a meat eater - my friends are not, so I went with the crowd. The eggplant basil dish is my favorite as well as the pumpkin curry. I'm sure everything is great as well. My go to Thai place in the Sunset!
author: Kelly I.

description:
It wasn't until I visited Marnee thai that I realized I had never had really exceptional Thai food.  We had the banana blossom and artichoke salad along with the pad cha talay, which were both exceptional.  The pad ma kuer with chicken was also really tasty (especially the next day).  You could tell the chicken was of higher quality and better cooked than your normal run-of-the-mill thai place.  

It can get a bit loud when it's busy, but we didn't have a whole lot to say because we were stuffing our faces with scrum-didely-umptious thai food.
author: James M.

description:
