It took some time for us to get our menu and to order the food. My friend got the pad kee mao with extra spicy and I got the pad thai with a wimpy mild. The food took about 25 minutes to arrive and when I got the food, I dug right in. My friend said that they usually don't overdo the spiciness but this time it was over the top and I had to agree because my pad thai was overly flavorful. That doesn't sound like a bad thing right? Well.. its like there are too many spices and flavors that its overwhelming and its no longer savory.
I wouldn't mind coming back here again since the price is reasonable but I wouldn't want to wait in line to get a seat if I know that the quality of the food will decrease as well. If I were to come back, it would probably be during lunch or a weekday.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I've only been here once but the roasted duck in red curry was revelatory.  I probably ordered red curry at every Thai place for the next couple months following.  I also remember the seafood sautee being well prepared, the basil flavor was greatly infused into the dish, without being wilted.  Now that I'm taking a Thai cooking class, I appreciate these little details!  The open kitchen is a cool way to sneak in some tips!

Update: I went again recently and wasn't as impressed with the Gra Prow as I originally thought.  This time, there wasn't any flavors from kaffir lime leaves, thai chilis, or fish sauce.  It was very oily as well.  I thnk my standard has gone up since then though. The papaya salad was decent, but I like Thai House Express' version better.  I did like the beef salad though.
author: Derrick V.

description:
We were inspired.  Jessica T and I were motivated by Marnee Thai and a decent plate of Pad Thai to have a moment of domesticity.

We made an attempt to make Mango and Sticky Rice.

It was so good at Marnee Thai that we had to try to make it on our own! 

Our mangoes weren't as sweet and juicy as theirs were...don't know where they got them....but it was still yummy. 

Totally easy to make!! You just need the right stuff.  

Mmm.....too bad I don't know how to make Pad Thai though.  Maybe that'll be our next domestic culinary attempt.
author: Jay H.

description:
EDIT: i'm new to yelp, but it doesn't look like there's a way to comment after a comment like facebook style. only owners can comment.

anyway, it is what it is. Yelp is a public forum where you can comment about whether you liked something or you did not.  I personally did not. it's just a matter of preference. maybe you'll like it. and i know not every review has been positive. i remember reading 1 reviewer saying "if this is the best thai food SF has to offer, i feel sorry for SF." that's how i feel.  so i'm not the only 1.

--like i said, the waitress was polite. she did what she was supposed to do and asked how the food was, but she did not do any more than ask. and yes, you're right, i did not do any more than stay quiet and not touch my food.  maybe it's an asian thing, but we were both trying to be polite? i am not good at hiding my feelings, and although i didn't express my disgust, i noticeably was not enjoying my food as the table next to me who were watching and eavesdropping even observed (i did not pay attention to their private conversation although they were sitting closely next to me, but apparently they make an effort to stare and listen).
i did not take any of the food home, and that was the only reason the manager gave in and decided to take off the yellow curry. i had it all packed up to give to my roomie b/c i didn't wanna waste it and it seems for some reason many do seem to like it. i don't know why i got such a hard time when 1 out of a bustling, profit-making restaurant full of ppl speak up and say, "i don't really like the food here. i ordered all this, but it's kind of a waste for me to pay $30 for a meal i was not satisfied with at all. i ate almost none of it."(in fact, i went to starbucks and spent another $10 to eat for dinner afterwards!) i should've spoken up beforehand, i guess. maybe i can learn from this, and i should just be more willing to say i plainly disliked the food in a more effective manner, but i kept on ordering thinking i'd like SOMEthing and i did not want to make a scene. i figured it had to be good with all the awards on the walls and awesome yelp reviews..unfortunately, this is the 1 time yelp has let me down...the waitress said to me the rice was "day old" (i am not a liar or making this up as the lady below seems to think. although they were eavesdropping, i was right there being spoken to, and i know what i heard.) and that was the only reason the manager relented and took it off the 1st time i the waitress went to the manager. the rice was an extra $1 with the curry.(since when do restaurants charge extra for the rice that goes with the curry?) that's all the manager was willing to take off! to take off a $1 is almost an insult! lol. at least i was polite enough and tipped over 15%. regardless, the main point is. i didn't like the thai food here, but maybe others will!  it's all good.

_______________________________

i really wanted to like this place after reading all the rave reviews.  

i ordered the pumpkin hotcakes and papaya salad.  the pumpkin hotcakes were okay. interesting and creative. worth trying if you like inventive food, but nothing divinely tasty. the papaya salad was refreshing and alright if you like fish sauce and spiciness, but it was nothing special or worth raving about, either.

so after trying the most talked about foods, i decided to order what is usually always good, 1 of my favorite thai entrees--yellow curry. it was watery and a bit oily. not creamy at all. plus, the most disappointing part about it was that it was filled with HUGE vegetables, very americanized, and not enough curry sauce. it was almost like an indian curry, rather than thai curry that i'm used to. the vegetable:curry ratio was about 10:1.  =( it was not even very flavorful!

and although the waitress was nice and polite, she failed to notice that i barely touched my food. she asked how it was, and i was obviously not happy with it, but she did not do anything about it until i spoke up when i received my $30 check. i said "um...i don't know what your policy is here, but i didn't really enjoy my food and paying this much for 3 orders i did not enjoy is a bit steep." she went and asked her manager, and her manager took off the cheapest thing, $1 jasmine rice!! ha. and the waitress said he took it off only b/c he admitted it was DAY-OLD jasmine rice!!  finally, he came over to the table after i expressed my solemn regret for ordering so much and trying to keep ordering and like the place. he finally took off the curry, and that was all...=/hmm oh well. you may like it. i did not. i've had better thai food in chicago.
author: gookgette c.

description: Being a loyal Marnee Thai fan, everything here is amazing. I've been to a lot of Thai restaurants in San Francisco and I can say that this is the best one in the city. This location is my favorite for it is more spacious and the service is pretty on point. The tom yum soup, angel wings, pad thai, and pad kee mao are essentials that you must try but everything else on the menu is just as good. The flavors are just impeccable, nothing about Marnee is underwhelming.
author: Mirabella C.

description:
Marnee Thai is my MOST FAVORITE restaurant in SF.  I LOVE LOVE LOVE Marnee Thai.  They have two locations, one on 9th and the original one on 22nd and Irving.  Some people say that the original one is the best, but what some people fail to acknowledge is that the REAL original chef... the one that won ten thousand cooking awards... is the chef at the 9th and Irving restaurant.  I've never been to the one on 22nd, but all i know is that the one on 9th ROCKS MY SOCKS! 

The restaurant seems small when you first walk in, but they also have a back room with some tables back there.  So, the restaurant actually seats quite a lot of people.  The waitresses are all thai, and you know how I know?  Because I've been to Thailand, and I've heard their language, and they also write all the orders in Thai.  You can't say that this place is not authentic.  The waitresses are really attentive, and offer great service.

Everything on the menu is pretty much SUPERB!  My favorites are Angel Wings or Angel Tofu.  They have a sauce that they use on the wings or tofu, just like the San Tung wings, but with a different twist and just as good, or better!!  did I really just say it was better than San Tung chicken wings??  Yes, I did.  When I tried the angel tofu, it made me a bigger fan of tofu... so now I always get the angel tofu when I'm with friends because I want people to know how good tofu can be! 

My 2nd favorite dish would be their Hor Mok.  It is Sea Bass (I think) in curry mousse, with cabbage and some other veggies.  The fish is cooked in a leaf, and is just really... one of the best things I have ever had!  When they don't have this, I get their other fish--BASA FILLET ................................................................................................................................12.50
  ....Basa fillet pan-seared topped with you choice of sauce
  ....* Pork, ginger, mushrooms and onions
  ....* Spicy mushroom and Thai herb in curry sauce. (with coconut milk)
  ....* Fresh garlic and black pepper sauce

It's really good.  Its the closest thing they have to the 3-flavored fish in other restaurants.

My 3rd favorite is their Pad Kee Mao.  Their spicy noodle sauce is sooo good.  It's not dry, instead, it's very flavorful!  I absolutely love it.  

Marnee Thai is so good that we always order it for catering for UCSF school events.  

You can't really go wrong with anything at Marnee Thai!!  If you haven't ever tried this place, put it on your places-to-eat-list.  You won't regret it.
author: Diane L.

description:
Mmmm...Marnee Thai...mmm.

The first couple times I went, I fell in love with the green mango salad. I once surprised a friend of mine with it by delivering it to her apartment. I was quickly bumped up to her #1 spot on myspace for that. Kidding. It was actually #2...

Anyhow, while I don't venture out to the Sunset too often, I'm excited that my last visit included another stop to Marnee. This time, my fav dishes have to have been the pumpkin curry and the beef and spinach with peanut curry sauce...my thai is a little rusty so the english translations will have to suffice for now.
author: Dalia K.

description:
I can't believe this was my 1st time here.  I think I dined at the one on Irving before.  Well with the line tonight, you know its always busy.  People even take out to go.  2 stars for fast friendly service and 2 for the food.
The chicken wings remind me of a chinese style I've had before.  The beef and pad see yeuw was good as well.  My only minus is the layout of the restaurant -- very narrow dining hall and you may feel cramp at the small tables.
author: Eric Y.

description:
This is good thai food!  We (party of 9) came here for a birthday dinner and everything  (~12 dishes) was delicious!  Most memorable were the spicy angel wings (watch out San Tung), pumpkin curry with chicken, stir-fry beef with eggplant, stir-fry beef with bamboo and baby corn, and the corn fritters.  Everything was flavored just right!!! Well...maybe I thought the beef with the bamboo was WAYYY too salty...but I think it mightve been just me.  I asked the whole table and they said it tasted fine...I don't know.  It was good anyway.  

One complaint:  why is rice so expensive???
author: LiveToEat F.

description: A good friend recommended this place and this place has awesome food!  Definitely would come back if I have the opportunity.  Reservations is a must because from the looks of it, it looks like they are always packed.
author: Thanh N.

description:
I love their selection of lunch specials here, which include noodle dishes and rice plates for under $7.50.  We ordered three to share:  pad se-ew with chicken ($6.95), Pad nor mai with ground pork (sauteed ground pork with chili, garlic, bamboo shoots, egg and Thai basil, $6.95), and thai style fried rice with crabmeat ($7.50).  All of the dishes were delicious.  Portion size was not too large, but decent considering that the prices are pretty low.  I like that there are meat choices that are normally available at other Thai restaurants, such as crabmeat or roasted duck.  

Bottom Line:  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here.  Highly recommended.
author: David L.

description: What a great place to take a group of people!!!  My friends assisted me in opening up our first store for Sparky's Balloons in the inner richmond.  As a treat, my business partner and I found a local place to thank them.  Marnee Thai was the perfect spot.  Everyone had a large appetite and they also wanted to get their drink on!!!  We were able to feed a group of 8 people at a reasonable price!  The food was great too!!!
author: Salvador T.

description:
Absolutely my favorite restaurant.  Servers are nice, ambiance is nice.  But the food is the best thing ever.  My absolute favorite Thai restaurant, although its more like Thai food with a twist.  All the sauces are incredible.

Must eat:  Miang kum - very creative, the pine nuts really make it pop.

Pumpkin samosas - just a little bit spicy, perfectly crispy outside.

Corncake fritters - unbelievable.

Avocado and shrimp salad - comes with green unripened (and therefore crunchy) mango, and its a perfect mix of spicy and sweet, ever thing is fresh.  Maybe a bit too much lettuce.

Try the seasonal dishes (special menu) in general, they're just about always awesome like the Mango Fried Rice.  

Curries are all fabulous, I prefer the green for some reason.

The roast duck over spinach is always a pleasant treat.  You think for a second that it might be too salty, then its not.  Perfectly cooked, well balanced with the spinach.

If I get noodles, its generally Pad-see-ew, as that's my favorite in general, and my favorite at Marnee Thai.  There's a hint of smokey flavour that is just very enticing.

You can't go wrong with coconut ice cream in fried roti with condensed milk for dessert.  It for some reason reminds me of an Asian pazookie.  

All in all, I love it.  My dad is Thai, he loves it.  Everyone I've brought here loves it.
author: T C.

description:
09.01.08 Update, from 3 to 2 stars
Ordered two dishes to go (Eggplant w/pork and Pad Se-Ew) and will not eat here again.  I'll stick to the original Marnee Thai on Irving.

Both dishes were not nearly as good as Irving St. and the Pad Se-Ew was bad: bland and the chicken was dry and flavorless.

=====

Gave this place a second try upon a friend's urging.  My first try (gross) was based on the awesome food at their original location.  They had just opened and a basic curry + pad thai was remarkably not-tasty, and I never returned.

So I went for lunch since my girlfriend was in the mood for Thai, and we were on Irving + 9th.  Her wise words were, "Give it another try and if it's bad again, then never go back."  So, I gave it another try after years of shunning this "#2 " location.  

I had the spicy chicken lunch special and it was really good!  My friend had the Pad Se-Ew and it looked yummy and she was really happy with it as well.

I'll now return on my own without reluctance and I am glad this place is redeemed in my book.  Not sure if it's as good as their "#1" location, but since it's closer to my place I'll find out.  Inner Sunset has great eats!!!
author: TC C.

description: Oh MY GOSH! This is one of my favorite desserts in SF! You have to order a ROTI with coconut ice cream! A ROTI is specialized kind of asian bread containing condensed milk within the center of this dessert.  Oh my gosh I love this dessert! The food is really good too and mixed with innovative ideas, I love the MANGO SALAD, PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE, well actually if you order anything from here, pretty much everything is good! The only problem is when they are busy--they don't give the best of service when they are busy, but jeeezzz it's worth it because this food is so deng good! So try to come early in the day when they are not busy, they give excellent service, but personally I don't care I just care about the food and getting my ROTI WITH ICE CREAM!
author: Carina L.

description: This spot was good.  I went for Sunday lunch.  I was sad to see the lunch specials are only good during the week, but the presentation is pretty good and their veggie Pad Thai was really tasty.  The ambiance is nice, I like being able to see into the kitchen and watch the cooks do their thing.  The service was surprisingly quick for how many customers they had and their hot Thai tea was great.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
A relative of mine took me here after a visit to the museums near Golden Gate park and, wow, I know now why this is her favorite restaurant.

We split our dishes family-style: a delicate ginger chicken, a mild (meaning very spicy) curry dappled with fresh vegetables, and the pork special of the day whose flavor was equal parts grilled meat and subtle, searing pepper. 

Marnee is probably the most authentic Thai food I've had -- the food tastes fresh and the place settings are culturally accurate. At the table are one spoon and one fork per setting -- no knives. You eat with the spoon and use the fork to move it on to the spoon.

Overall our lunch was a pleasurable experience, and it makes me yearn to move West. Go now!
author: Angelina C.

description: DELICIOUS! I was recommended this place by a friend and I am definitely a fan! The Pad Se- Ew was my favorite, but that is because I love noodle type dishes, but everything was good. I would absolutely visit this place again when I am in the city!
author: Anne B.

description:
5 months ago, I went on a trip with my uncle and his friends. On the long road trip, everyone in the group got to know each other. One lady became close to me. We talked about everything on the journey until we stumped on the topic of "The best Thai Restaurant in town", She insisted that "Marnee Thai was her picked for the best Thai Restaurant in the whole Bay Area". She discovered this place years ago when her daughter took her here, she got hooked with the food and have traveled all the way across the bay just to have the food here all the time. 
    Her passion about this place convinced me that I had to try the food here sometimes. And that time finally came.
   The other day, I finally had a chance to drove across the town to come to Marnee Thai. I found the decoration is decent, nice - cozy and the service was wonderful. I found their service to be very accommodate and very helpful. They were very fast when I asked for anything. The food came out in order and nicely timing. So what makes me give Marnee Thai only 3 stars. well... it's food itself. 

  
   Sorry, Francis (the one who said Marnee Thai got best Thai food ever!). But I am Thai and would like to think that I know what 's the best Thai food should test like and Marnee Thai does NOT LIVE UP TO MY HIGH STANDARD. There was nothing wrong with Marnee Thai's food just not that great as Francis claimed.  

   We ordered so many dishes, just to make sure we tried many things. As we came a long way and intended to take some leftover home for later on. 

   We ordered Satay both chicken and Beef - Chicken Satay was O.K. but Beef Satay was too salty in my book. Then we ordered the corn cake and Shimp Roll which were O.K. Then we ordered Mango Salad with Soft shell crab and Jan Pad Phoo ( just like Pad Thai but with crab meat which were the best dishes from this place but Mix seafood dish and Barbeque pork disappointed me again, they were just O.K. 
    So I totally understand Francis why love this place so much- they offer a decent food in a very nice and friendly atmosphere but now that  I have tried this place So I claim that SHE WAS WRONG. 

    So now it's my turn to invite Francis to my favorite Thai restaurant here in Bay Area and we will shall see... what she would say.
author: Dom G.

description: smaller restaurant so make sure you ask for the table you want, if you haven't learned yet, SF restaurants are competitive eateries. The spring rolls have been known to be to die for. Sometimes better then others, but when they are good, they are amazing, over priced compared to most, but well worth it...lots of meat, veggies, glass noodles, mushrooms, crispy and 2 dipping sauce, one more like fish sauce, one sweeter spicy...all the food here is good though, they are popular for a reason.
author: Lily G.

description:
It's a very small place and the parking is horrible, even by SF standards.  However I heard good things so I brough two out-of-town friends.  My friends love Thai food.  However they did not like the food here.  They ordered their dishes spicy but it was not even mild-spicy (I tasted to confirm this).  My mild yellow curry was even spicier than the salad that was ordered spicy.

The food was just average for a Thai place.  Given the terrible parking, I won't be coming back here.  It's just not worth it
author: Todd J.

description:
Forget King of Thai! Marnee Thai has some of the best Thai food in San Francisco!! It's a block away from where I work at so sometimes my coworkers and I would go there for lunch, or order food to go and eat it at work. 

My favorite is their crab fried rice. mmmm!! and they're not greedy with the crab meat. 

My coworker always order their corn cakes and its darn tasty! 

If you ever find yourself on 9th ave and Irving....why not treat your tummy to some good thai food?
author: Jenny K.

description: Everytime we go to Marnee we leave so happy not just becuase of the food but because the staff is so fun and friendly. The food here is the best Thai food I have had hands down. It's superb every time. The ambience is really cool, it's like your in a real thatch hut. I love it!
author: Mark S.

description:
My friends and I went there last night for birthday dinner celebration. The environment was nice and calming.

The food tasted pretty good but I highly believe that the food contains a lot of MSG. I felt so thirsty even when I drank a few cups of water during the meal.

Another thing, one of our servers (this guy) spoke so softly that we were hardly able to hear him. He might also have hearing problems. I asked him for lemons. Instead of getting us lemon wedges, he took out lemon SLICES. How are we supposed to squeeze the juice of lemon SLICES on foods? I guess you'll just have to ask for LEMON WEDGES instead of just LEMON even though I think asking for LEMONS is pretty self explanatory. Plus, we were unable to finish the cake we bought for our friend's birthday celebration so we asked them for boxes. Instead of giving us regular small boxes, they gave us extra small boxes. That was totally uncool. Come on now, the cake didn't even fit in the box. I'm sure they can afford to give customers bigger boxes! 

Good luck and I hope you won't be served by the same guy!
author: Forest T.

description:
I always enjoy their spicy noodle, yummy thai iced tea and the service is great.  I'm a sucker for cilantro.
Their chicken curry is delectable as well. Mmph! Makes me hungry just thinking about it.
author: Jessica P.

description: Go on a weekday to avoid the crowds or get take -out!  .. don't think the one down the street won't have a line out the door... it WILL!  Thai Ice Tea & Chan Pad Poo.. (spicy noodles with crab and egg and chili sauce).  are my favorite dishes the BEST! good apps too including fresh summer and spring rolls! lunch specials are a much better deal and get practically the same amount.  other good things to try are the spicy angel wings, pumpkin curry and green curries with coconut milk.
author: Margie C.

description:
Marnee Thai! I always get the Pad Nor Mai..I've never had a better combination of eggs, onions, basil, bamboo, and chicken in a spicy garlic chili sauce. Oh heaven! The lunch specials are a pretty good deal, dinner prices are a little higher. (Their prices are similar to most other Thai places, though.)

If you're feeling noodle-y, try the Pad See Ew (broccoli, eggs, your choice of meat/tofu, and rice noodles). Yes, I love oeufs.

The Pad Thai was disappointing (I prefer Sukhothai's Pad Thai, but Marnee Thai's Pad Nor Mai). The noodle-meat-egg-bean sprout ratio was off balance. Too many noodles, not enough of the other stuff.

Lovely cozy atmosphere (this goes for both the Irving location and the 9th avenue location), service is friendly and fast. It seems like for the most part, you can't go wrong with Marnee Thai.

Note: $15 minimum for credit cards!
author: Liz L.

description:
This is the more "posh" Sunset branch which pretty much means they charge a few dollars more and give you a few dollars less of food, but hey you know how it works. 

I really think this is the best Pad Thai in the city.  I normally come here just to eat Pad Thai....it's that good. 

It's not overloaded with MSG, or so my stomach tells me. The noodles which are key are just the right chewiness and aren't soggy and mushy which I can't stand. Sorry Mom, I'm talking to you with the "overcook everything" syndrome.  And the sweet/spicy/sour/crunchy Thai flavors are all dead on. The prawns are also good and meaty and not those impostor shrimp they try to pass off as their bigger brothers.

I wish I could say I remember the other dishes, but I can't because I'm such a Pad Thai whore, and thats all I ever order here. So thats all I'm going to rate this place on, so sue me!!!!
author: clint t.

description:
This is probably my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.  The food is so good that after I got back from Thailand and was craving food, I went here.  The Papaya salad is really good, as well as my number 1 favorite dish, the "CHAN PAD POO"  its like a pad Thai but with crab and some other stuff.  My favorite.  

Also really good, is the mango fried rice, or the pineapple fried rice.  

The food is pretty affordable and the workers are really nice, and they recognize me when i go inside and order the usual.  

The atmosphere is pretty nice as well, with local Thai designs and its relatively cozy also.  Right next to Golden Gate Park, so if you spend the day there, you can walk over and get some good Thai food.
author: Terence P.

description:
yum yum yum!
Small Thai restaurant that offers delicious and cheap food.
author: Evelina A.

description:
This place served up some yummy Thai food. Thanks yelp - the spicy angel wings are a winner...get those! I got a noodle dish with crab. It was also tasty, but not quite as crabby as I was expecting. My dining partner got a chicken and spinach dish with peanut sauce...also tasty, but maybe a tad too peanutty. Dishes were solid, but nothing caught my eye as crazy innovative on the menu (and the help didn't have any out of the ordinary suggestion either).

Decor was comfortable, and restaurant size was cozy. Cool, nice, efficient wait staff. 

I also loved having the following conversation (which appears to replicate itself every time I go out for Thai in San Francisco):

Waitress: "Anything to drink?"
Me: "Yup...A Singha"
Waitress: "Thai Beer?"
Me: "........yes. Thai Beer."

Seriously, aren't there any other brewing companies in all of Thailand? Or is this like how people in the south call every soft drink a "coke"?

I don't know a lot about the inner sunset, so I'll be keeping the place on my list of sure bets in the area.
author: Sean C.

description:
I've lived in this neighborhood for a a few years and this is my go-to place for take out.

Pumpkin Curry is the best I've had - even better than Thai House on Geary which also has solid PC.

Pad Thai is good/ very good.

Green papaya salad has some nice kick too.

All of their curries rock- I usually go green for the spice but all of them are good.

This is the only place that when I order form them that my wife says- 'order whatever- everything is good'. That says a lot...
author: Gary G.

description: This place is great. We recently had a family gathering here with 11 people. They have a back room which is great for big gatherings. The service was really accomodating. We had a baby with us and so the back room and the high chair worked really well. The food was so good. We had a special fish dish wrapped in banana leaf - I think it was called something like Hor Moc. It was the most delicious thing ever! But seriously all the food was really really good. The Thai Samosas - I think they're called Golden Pillows on the menu were yummy. The bbq pork was delicious. Everything - very very good.
author: Kelly S.

description:
I love the little old man that works here.  I've been coming for years with the old work crew.  Our office is down by the ballpark but we'll make the drive just to get good Thai food.  He always remembers me, my orders (I have three that I rotate through), and that I want extra chinese brocoli.

It's relatively cheap, the food is consistent, and there's usually parking except on Friday evenings.  Lunch and dinner hours during the week are pretty standard.  Not sure about weekends since it never seems to be open when I swing by.  Call before heading over.

Recommendations: good lunch specials, pad see yew (only during the week), angel wings, spicy shrimp, and the yellow curry.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
Ever since I came back from Thailand, I haven't been able to find a more authentic thai restaurant than Marnee Thai.  And I love the owner's wife and her enthusiasm for her own food! 
Also amazingly, their noodle soup in the lunch menu...  seriously... so good!
author: N. C.

description:
I crave marnee thai at least once a week. i love this place.

top 3 dishes: green curry with coconut milk and prawns, angel wings, and sticky rice with mango

yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmm : )
author: Geraldine S.

description:
I've never been to the first one, but I probably should go. I hear that if Marnee doesn't like your order, she'll change it for you. AND it's always better than what you would have ordered.

Well, I haven't had the luck of having Marnee attack my order in person, but I do hope that happens soon. Still, this is absolutely stunning thai food and she deserves an award. Oh wait, she has tons....

Watch the tea intake tho. Lots of it will make you jittery! heh
author: Michael L.

description:
Hey I'm writing from the UCSF Library!  Coool.  Well anyway.  

I ate here for dinner tonite as a break from studying.  It's very tasty!  It's long and narrow, and cute decorations.  The service is great.  They kept refilling my water right away.  And they served the soup and rice to us and everything.  The waitresses were really cute too!  They were wearing traditional thai dresses.  

It was kindof noisy though.  There was a baby screaming.  There is nothing good about babies screaming.  Nothing.
author: Labonee M.

description:
Found this place on Yelp while searching for mango sticky rice -- it surely did not disappoint!

Came here for the first time on a Sunday afternoon.  Street parking can be difficult depending on the day & time but that's given in San Francisco.  After viewing the board of photos outside, we decided to try their noodle soups -- roasted duck & tom yum.  The duck was good but the tom yum soup was exceptional tasty!  While enjoying my lunch and anticipating my dessert-to-come, several patrons stopped by to order the mango sticky rice to-go.  Yes, it's that good!  The rice was perfectly cooked and the mango was just ripe, thinly-sliced and presented beautifully!  No better way to finish off such a delectable meal! 

I will definitely drive the distance and come back soon to try other dishes yelpers are raving about.
author: Amy T.

description:
"What do you feel like having for dinner tonight?" I asked my guy. 

"Thai, maybe?" He said. 

So I went to Yelp and looked for top-rated Thai places along good Muni routes from us, and was happy to discover Marnee's high marks, even though we'd once been in the Irving St. location and walked out after 10 minutes because we were ignored rather than seated. 

Anyhow, I figured it was worth a second shot -- especially if we scoped out the 9th Avenue location, where they hadn't yet dissed us. And I'm glad we did, because the food was amazing. 

We started with the Miang Kum, which is spinach leaves that come with a plate full of tiny chopped things -- lime and ginger chunks, bits of onion, dried shrimp, peanuts and toasted ginger. You put a few morsels into the spinach leaf, top it with the sweet-herby sauce, roll it all up and eat it in one bite. SO GOOD. And then we shared the avocado salad, which was also really tasty if a little over-sauced. 

I got the prawns red curry, while my guy got the Pad Cha Talay, a blend of shellfish and fish with a nice pungent sauce. The curry was spicy enough that my nose ran, but I couldn't stop chowing on it until it was gone. It was also chock-full of prawns -- they didn't skimp. 

Like another poster's bf, I too am allergic to gluten and I was able to find plenty of things on the menu that are safe for me. And to top it off, the service was great.
author: Beth W.

description:
This place has AUTHENTIC thai food. I've been to thailand so I know how the real curry tastes. My bf is also part thai and he says it's aunthentic also. On the other hand, you hear customers whining about how great the place is. So this place is pretty great for thai food.

 I got the panaag curry pork and I'm coming back here for more. The pork was TENDER. We got the fish meal where they only have it on weekends. I wasn't used to eating stuff like that. My bf though said in his culture, it is considered really good. And plus it takes them a lot of time to make. Thai tea is cheap compared to Sukho Thai. I also got the cocnut ice cream with fried banana. Their coconut ice cream really had REAL coconut blended in. Mmmm. All that filling meal was only 34 something. I'm coming back here!

Customer service was 5 stars. The owner there I suppose was super nice and explained the menu to each customer very well. Although where I sat was tight spacing, I LOVE THIS PLACE =)
author: Vivian L.

description:
I have been wanting to come here a long time after hearing it was good and I am a huge Thai food fan.  Finally, last night I had the chance.  After a warm welcome by the pleasant wait staff two of us (another Thai food fan)  were seated and the menu looked terrific, especially the daily "specials" menu.  

I must say what was terrific stopped right there.  A fried soft shell crab over mango salad was, at best, passable with the crab tasting less than fresh under its far too heavy breading and served on a bed of  shredded mango (a bright spot)  Then came the Thai potstickers - sodden lumps which were just downright pasty with few of the wonderful flavors of what were to be the ingredients coming through at all. Ahhhh, and then Pad Thai - always a good indication of a Thai kitchen. Soggy noodles with rubbery overcooked prawns and some wilted coriander on top - yikes what happened here? New people in the kitchen?  Our final selection before deciding to order more was Chicken Curry with potatoes and  peanuts - it reminded me perfectly of a Delta Airlines lunch in 1999.  And we stopped ordering there.

Let's just say, having been in the restaurant business for years, I am well-aware that there can be disaster kitchen nights. But it really felt like something else was going on here; everything was just not very good.

But hey - those chicken wings everybody raves about were sure being consumed around us, especially by what seemed the local UCSF crowd. Will I venture back to give it another chance?  I really don't think so. But I sure wish the pleasant wait staff well.
author: Richard H.

description:
I love Marnee Thai!!!!!!!!!!!
Everything I've tried here is so good!
I never usually order curry in a Thai restaurant, but something about Marnee made me want to try. I did and I loved it! 
Curry, fried rice, noodles; all delicious! I even enjoyed the Thai iced tea! I usually don't care for it.

I've tried both locations on Irving and I like the 9th & Irving location better. There's more ambiance, but it is a bit more crowded and tables are really close together. I also think the 9th & Irving one gives you more food and tastes a bit better, too. The one on 23rd & Irving has a more clean-cut feel to the decor and the service is not as nice as the other one. Parking is easier around the 23rd & Irving one, though.

Hands down my favorite Thai restaurant in the city now. If you're craving Thai, go to Marnee's! It's the one, you don't even need to think about it!
author: Jamie W.

description:
There aren't many can't miss restaurants out there. This is one of them. The food is great, there is something on the menu for all tastes, and the service is top notch. I'm not even going to write a whole review for those of you who haven't tried it - just look at the other reviews on this page. Heck, take a look at that rating distribution chart towards the top. nuff said.

My only advice - go back and try the other dishes! I've gone back countless times, and I've never been disappointed. All the dishes are well thought out - and the chef is always innovating.
author: Eric C.

description:
Best Thai food I have ever had.  It is consistently delicious.  I usually always order pad-see-ew, but friends get me to share other dishes with them.  Everything is always great.

The service is attentive.  The portions are good...even better when you get take out.

I moved away from the area and I still go back anytime I want Thai food becasue every other thai place is a disappointment compared to Marnee.

YUM! Eat here!!!
author: Corrie F.

description:
Good food, especially the cashew chicken--best I've had in the City.  Pad Thai is a bit fishy, which drives my wife crazy, but I'm not a big Pad Thai fan.

Service is not as good, and atmosphere leaves much to be desired.  This is a good place to take out rather than sit down.
author: Matt H.

description:
Hubby's Review:

Been coming to this place on and off for years.  Never really understood why some people would make this their preferred Thai joint.  The food is very middle of the road as is the service and decor.  It's good if you're in the area...generally, I shrug my shoulders when this place gets mentioned...
author: Mr. and Mrs. L.

description: OMG the food here was awesome! Especially the angel wing. I freaking love those chicken wings. But the most awesome part of that night was when my order came out. I had order pad sa ew. It was delious. And the desert was great.
author: Tam D.

description: Alright I thought Marnee Thai was the best I've had but I was wrong! I went with my girlfriend a few weeks ago and they sat us in the back. The room was very tight and you can barely move! The service was horrible because we waited for 45min and they served us the wrong dish and all the lady could say was I can give you a discount! My first experience at Marnee was great but I dont know what happened this last time. After trying Chabaa Thai I will never go back to Marnee. Food is still good but for the price and portions and service Chabaa is way better!
author: nabil s.

description:
Went strolling around the inner Sunset last night, looking for some veggie eats. Marnee Thai looked to have a substantial vegetarian section, so my dining partner and I went on in.

Wish I could say the one star was for the food, but we never even got that far. Upon entering Marnee Thai, we were hit over the head with the most wretched odor. Our nostrils started twitching in tandem. 

"It smells like dog," J said to me.

"My thoughts exactly," I said. "It's like a kennel of wet dogs in here."

We left before touching the menu. GROSS.
author: Erica H.

description: Their pad sew ew is delicious! I love this place. They have a roti dessert that I come back for alone!
author: Linda L.

description:
It's been almost 4 years since I first reviewed this Marnee Thai.

 I have discovered is that I love their Pad Kee Mao.   Velvety and still chewy wide rice noodles with a sticky sweet/spicy coating.  It is delicious and the best take on this dish I've had.    Their curries and fried rice are also pretty darn tasty.  

I still haven't gone back for their Pad Thai that I very much disliked, but maybe I should give it a try again.  For Pad Thai I'm still partial to Lers Ros on Larkin (or the too pricey Baan up Irving at 7th ave, there's is delicious if probably too moist for some people)


Old Review Below:
----
I do not get it.  One of me least favorite Thai places I've been to.  

First off: The Pad Thai.   Absolutely horrible.  It tastes mildly of how vomit smells.  (I think it is tomato paste or ketchup that causes this).   The Pad Thai that the chef won an award for HAD to be different.  (EDIT: they used to have a recipe on the wall that mentioned katsup... this is no longer the case)

I ordered some kind of salad a few years ago, and I still think of it as the worst salad I've ever had.  The avocado was brown and mushy, the lettuce wilted and the shrimp rubbery.   

A few times I have had the sausage and roast pork over rice with gravy.  This has been ok most of the time; but one time it tasted really spoiled.

I do not understand the hype.  

My suggestions:   For SPICY "authentic" thai:  Lers Ros.
For super tasty, consistently high quality, and a bit tamer (like Marnee attempts), Chai Yo on Polk.
author: howard t.

description: 8pm Sunday. Waited about 15 minutes before getting a table. Crowded & hectic place so it was really noisy and not a good place to bring a date unless you like screaming at each other. Ordered pork curry and Har Mok which is the fish steamed in banana leaves(?) I think. Also had the coconut appetizer that came on an iron skillet. Anyways, added some steamed rice and they were all yummy good.  Service was a bit spotty. Had to remind the wait staff that we had ordered Thai iced tea but it finally did come. Otherwise, either come early or come late, I can see how this place can have long wait times.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great Thai food alone is reason enough to come here, but add to that the experience of meeting Ming, the owner, a fascinating woman who combines the arts of hostessing, waitressing, fortune-telling and palm-reading into an experience you will want to repeat again and again and you have a place you absolutely must visit and revisit.  

The curries are rich and flavorful, the Tom Yum soup easily serves three and is delicious, the noodle dishes are fresh and the portions are generous.  If you save room for dessert the mango sticky rice is the best any of us have had.  We'll be back soon!
author: Jed W.

description:
Authentic Thai food experience from a master. 

Order: corn fritters, pad Thai, pumkin currey, brown rice & chicken satay .

This is one of my favorite SF Thai restaurants.
author: Joe C.

description: you can't be too phased out when the first thing to your right when you walk in is the wall of awards and "best Thai (insert year)". I came here last Monday with my friend who insisted that this is THE Thai place to go to out of downtown. We ordered off the lunch menu. The portions were a good size for lunch. The rice came out kind of cold, but I was pretty hungry so I didn't mind. The service was great and the restaurant's atmosphere was very homey. The only funny thing I thought was that if you sit close to the door you can notice that the restaurant is slanted...I sat down and immediately thought, "I'm crooked" so we asked to switch tables and all went well from there :)
author: Sarah L.

description: Great food, good prices, only downside is that the place is small and usually full.
author: Luiz R.

description: Very good. I went with a group of 9 on a Saturday afternoon and we were able to be seated right away. We ordered a lot of dishes, some of the highlights were the pumpkin samozas, the corn fritters, and the pot stickers. Great place if you are looking for something easy near the park.
author: Zachary C.

description:
i got four words for you: ANGEL WINGS. PAD THAI. 

my love for pad thai is on and off and right until the moment i stepped into this restaurant, it was off. but marnee thai definitely brought it back. 

and their angel wings... there arent any words to describe the greatness of these things.  i ate with my family and a friend of ours and i really wanted to be a big greedball and order one more plate..... for myself. but i didnt. but i'm not making any promises next time.

we also ordered other things but my mind is going blank at the moment because i can't seem to get it to focus on anything other than the wings and noodles.
author: PauLine R.

description:
Date: "Ummm, you have a little something on your face."
Me: "Food? I have food on my face? Where?" (as I frantically wipe my mouth with my napkin) 
Date: "Actually it's, uh, coming out of your nose. A lot of it. And you look really sweaty. Are you okay?"
Me (wiping nose and turning red): "I'm fine. The food is just a little hot."

In retrospect, I probably shouldn't have asked for my food to be "Thai spicy" when on a first date with someone I was trying to look hot for and make out with later. But I do really love spicy food (especially when it can make my nose run and/or my face sweat) and Marnee Thai makes it damn spicy if you ask for it that way. I've never had a bad dish here and they have a good selection of veggie options as well. If it was closer to my home I definitely would go more often.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Let me first start off by saying whoever said the angel wings were finger licking good was absolutely right. Just think of thai influenced buffalo wings. The sauce was terrific. i've never tasted anything like it before. Maybe it's common in thai cuisine but it was pretty original in terms of what I've eaten. And the fact that the chicken was fried definitely made a difference in the taste. If it had been sauteed or some other method, it would not have been as good. This proves taht the chef knows what he's doing.

I had the pad thai. It wasn't anything special to me. I wasn't particularly fond of the sauce or the peanuts. This seems to be more of a personal choice though. I don't think ive ever really been a fan of pad thai. I heard the pad thai was good here so i wanted to try it to see if it was just cause I never had good pad thai. But i think it's just cause i'm not a fan of it. I had to drench it in hot sauce for it to fit my taste.

The environment was a little cramped and clustered for my tastes. I was seated next to this shelf that was stacked full of little knickknacks and statues. My friends couldn't even back their chairs up or else they'd hit the chair of the person from another table. The seating was pretty uncomfortable. And the table was too small to hold the dishes so my friend had to do some manuevering to be able to enjoy her meal. THis was partly the waitors' fault for not clearing the plates. 

Overall service was decent. Not crappy. But not just okay. They did constantly refill our water which had lemon wedges in them to give them a classier look. The food came out quickly which was great because I was almost starving. The waiter did forget my hot sauce and then proceeded to help other tables in clearing their dishes and taking their checks. But then he took one look at me and remembered he forgot the hot sauce and ran to go get it. And then he apologized for forgetting it. Everyone forgets once in awhile, as long as they look sincere and apologize, it's no biggy. 

The portions were bigger than what I'm used to at the usual thai restaurants. I'm usually barely content when i eat elsewhere but i actually could not finish my meal this time. My friend's thai iced tea was larger than normal too, but she got ripped off because half of it was ice. So suggestion, ask for less ice or no ice if you don't want to get ripped off on that. THat's how they get you.

This place is more of a sit down, share plates kind of dinner more than order your own thing. Rice has to be ordered separetly. 1.50 per bowl per person. If you're eating the entrees, you'd probably need two bowls so that becomes pretty costly. And it's kind of cheap of them to do that. 

Overall the angel wings really put me over the top. If i came back here, and tried everythign I wanted to try, I would definitely order the angel wings over and over. As for the pad thai, i'd pass on that next time and try something new. 

3 stars for customer service, speed of the kitchen, and a decent pad thai. The fourth star for the amazing angel wings.
author: Karen C.

description:
Beware:  Having a reservation at this place means nothing.  

We were a party of 6 and I called a day ahead and made a reservation.  When we showed up, they said, sorry, there was a slight delay, and our table would be ready in 15 minutes.  

But then.... 35 minutes later, when we started getting really frustrated, she said it would be ten minutes more, unless the people that were occupying half of "our table" ordered dessert.  

We were pretty mad and left.  I mean, why do they take reservations in the first place???  Also, why did she string us along if she knew she wasn't going to have a table for us?

While we were waiting, a few other parties of two came in saying they had reservations, but that didn't mean anything either.  They still had to wait, but because they were parties of two, they got in quicker.

We were saying that we should've stuck with some of our favorites:  Osha Thai, Pad Thai on Mission, Jitra Thai.
author: Andy L.

description: My husband and I love Marnee Thai.  We believe it's the best thai restaurant in the city.  We love the gai ga prow (sp) or spicy chicken and their pad thai.  Try their Roti with ice cream also for dessert.  It's delightful!  You have to try this place at least once.
author: Christine P.

description: Decent Thai, not too spicy and not too sweet. I haven't had Thai food for awhile. I would try this place again.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Marnee on 9th ave is solid, reliable tasty Thai.  Angel tofu is like candy, can't stop eating that garlicky, sticky stuff.  Curries are all excellent too. And good for carry out.  

For some reason people always say the parking around Marnee is really difficult.  I say move closer.
author: Richard A.

description:
It' had only been about two weeks (max) since I've been to Thai House Express on Castro, where I always eat my favorite food ever and by yesterday I was already experiencing withdrawal symptoms.

What is this magical, addictive food that I love so much? It's tofu pad ga prow, or here at Marnee, the #53 with chili, basil, and garlic. Goes fantastic with a glass of Thai iced tea.

Let me tell you how amazed I was when I snuck a peek into their open kitchen area and saw the cook plating my meal. He took some tongs and rearranged the veggies and tofu bits to make it look pretty, and then wiped any little stray dots of sauce off of the edges of the plate. Who does that? For a $7 meal? He even had a little spoon tucked into a pocket on his sleeve, presumably the 'quality control' spoon, which I also greatly appreciate.

The food was great, and satisfied my craving very well. I think I might like it a little better than TH's version, but don't tell anyone until I've made up my mind for sure. The only thing that bummed me out a little was that the portion was really small. Ok, it was normal. A single serving. I like to justify spending over ten bucks (or over 6) on lunch by saying "well its huge, so I technically don't have to eat dinner", and I wasn't able to do that here.

Still, yum yum yum! I'll totally be back. Just maybe not twice a week.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Marnee Thai is so awesome, that's why there's two of them! This one is probably the more "hip" one, with a more modern vibe to it, whereas the other one is more traditional.

4 stars for good food and excellent service,
5th one for superstar Kas! (thanks for the roti & ice cream -- SO FREAKIN GOOD)
author: Miss H.

description: I came with some friends, a couple of weeks ago, who wanted to get something to eat after attending a concert in GG Park. The place was busy but we were able to be seated right away. The food was delicious! I especially enjoyed the  spicy angel wings and the mango with sticky rice dessert.
author: LaShea R.

description: Went here on a Friday night at 845 pm, we felt as though we were being rushed out.  We ordered, food was out in less than 5 minutes, not sure how that happened.  Were asked many times, is there anything else, is there anything else?  Wish we could have sat there and enjoyed the food and not felt as though they were closing and wanted us out.
author: Pug P.

description:
My ALL TIME FAVORITE Thai Restaurant! Whenever I'm in the City and I'm craving for some REALLY great Thai Food, this is the place to be!

The restaurant is small, but the quality in food is 5+ stars.

Here are a few of my favorite items:
-Angel wings
-Chicken Satay
-Pad thai
-Coconut curry (Panang) shrimp
-Pumpkin curry (Seasonal) **Everyone must try this!

And to help you digest this wonderful meal, order the hot thai tea.
author: Jasmine W.

description:
When I first moved to SF, Marnee was my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.  We used to go there virtually weekly.  The environment is casual but nice, the food is flavorful and the price is very reasonable.  We usually spend around $35 -$40 for two for 3 entrees and including a beer for each.

My favorite is the Pad Nor Mai, which you can get with Chicken or Pork.  I always get the pork since that's what the servers recommend.  Pad Nor Mai is made with ground pork, Thai basil, eggs, bamboo shoots, chili peppers and onions.  It's very tasty...

Other good dishes are green or red curry, shrimp or calamari salad, tom yum gun  (spicy soup), Ma Kuer (eggplant dish) and fried rice.

It's not quite like the food Thailand, but it's definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in SF. 

Parking can be difficult in Inner Sunset, but there's usually parking in the GG Park in the evenings.  The get very busy after 7 or so.  If you want to beat the crowd, go early.
author: Paul K.

description:
The food here is pretty good, though I found the meat in the Panang Beef Curry to be kind of tough. The Pad Thai was great, though.

The only downsides are that the place is a bit dark and cramped, and the owner tends to bother her customers a bit too much. I know she means well, but someone needs to tell her to let her customers enjoy their food in peace.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I have had their tom yum soup three times over the past week as it is the only thing helping me get over a nasty cold.  The soup is perfectly spicy, full of veggies and extremely tasty.  It makes me feel better than than thera-flu and cold eeze combined.  
Everything else on their menu is delicious.  Also - they have good service, they are very clean and the prices are reasonable.
author: MJ E.

description:
My boyfriend and I picked up one of my friends from the East Coast at the airport last night and we headed straight to the Sunset looking for some yummy eats.  I had been to Marnee before and knew the food was pretty decent.  As soon as we walked in the door we were greeted by a beautiful vision in glittering purple.  May, the matriarch of the restaurant was so great to us that we left the place completely in love with her.  She told us exactly what we would love on the menu and served it up with a smile.  At one point during the meal she called upon her psychic abilities and filled us all in on our personality tendencies.  She told me I was full of love...which i, um, loved.  

The pad thai was nice and moist, and brown rice fluffly.  One less star for the tofu being a little mushy...otherwise an awesome experience.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Lunch time with the fam bam. Started with the delicious angel wings, had the pad kee mao with duck, pad sew ew with beef, yellow curry with chicken & potatoes and the sweetest thai ice tea!!. Loves the atmosphere, makes you feel like you're really having a meal in a tiny hut in Thailand. Not to mention the friendly waitresses..
author: Anonymous P.

description: Its a small little place that has a good taste. I admit that the look didn't seem appeling but the taste of the food was good. I order a Pad Thai and a Pad Ew. The Pad Thai has a different taste than the traditional one. It has a creamier and sweeter taste but none the less, I loved it. The Pad See Ew was only ok because the taste seemed a little bland but it may have just been my order. Tho the noodle were perfect and the chicken was tender, it just need a little seasoning. I really don't mind eating here again the next time I come down to SF.
author: Ryan V.

description: I know this place has plenty of awesome reviews and does not need another one, but I have to give a shout out to the Manager last Thursday night.  My friend and  I planned to meet for dinner midway between my home on the Peninsula and her place in Marin.  Needless to say everything went wrong, we both hit traffic, I forgot my phone and she went to the other Marnee Thai on Irving.  But the staff at the 9th St Marnee Thai looked after me while I waited, and eventually loaned me their phone when I realized she wasn't coming so we could connect and have a lovely dinner at the Marnee Thai on Irving street.  Thanks guys!
author: Nicole R.

description:
Don't get me wrong, the food is excellent, but the service is just as important. I won't be ignorant, I understand how there are cultural differences, but sometimes successful businesses must realize that assimilating in customer service is never a bad thing. 

First of all, my boyfriend and I were interrupted by another couple who were placed  just an earshot away. Literally, we could have had conversations with each other if we wanted to -- we sat so close that our conversation conflicted, and all of us had this uneasy feeling that despite we were strangers that we should politely pause to let anyone else talk. Now, to remedy this problem, they should have let the other couple wait since we had the table/area first. Many people were just about leaving. 10 more minutes won't kill anyone. 

While trying to maintain a pseudo-norm conversation with my boyfriend (which was difficult because the couple turned to face us to listen on...uncomfortable...) the main manager woman kept yelling out orders and just barking out orders...goodness...culturally, it's quite as authentic as its food...

The food of course is delicious, and I heart thai -- it is so delicious.  The duck is delicious and the pad thai is yummy too. Minus the service and seat placement, this place is the best.
author: Midori M.

description: Food was really good but the server forgot my friend's beer for awhile. Decent prices and omg this wonderful dessert which has Indian influences called Roti, get it with the coconut ice cream it's delish!
author: M S.

description: Really good Thai food. Love the duck curry! Been coming here religiously for a long time.Always good, perfectly salted! And how could i leave without Coconut soup ! My favorite! I even do pick up and the food is still fresh, never soggy, when i get home. Definitely a local favorite!
author: sofia r.

description: Marnee Thai has two location (Irving & 9th). The best Thai Restaurant in San Francisco hands down. Their food was wonderful. I have to admit how quick my friend and I was. Street Parking was crazy. Not that far from Golden Gate Park. I love how the neighborhood was quiet. I'll come here again.
author: Ronald N.

description: Efficient service.  Long lines during peak dinner time.  Softshell crab mango salad was a bit spicy yet refreshing.  Garlic pepper sea bass quite yummy (though not good for post dinner socializing).  Pad thai good not the best I've had but better than some.  Brown rice is offered as an alternative to white.  Not a place to linger over dinner but there are cafes to move to for post-dinner chat.
author: Kim S.

description: Both Marnee Thai places are great, but I like this one a little bit better because even though its a tight fit, its not as cramped as the original Marnee Thai. The food is yummy and there are a lot of vegetarian options. Sometimes when I don't feel like eating meat then I get  the corn cake, param tofu with a side of rice, and the woonsen noodles to share with a friend. Then you can  top it off with their mango sticky rice dessert and you've got a great veggie meal for two for about 40 bucks. Its a deal!
author: Theresa D.

description: Definitely not the best but I've had worse. The Marnee on Irving near 24th is way better, it feels like you are in an airplane in the one on 9th. Nothing too special.
author: Princess D.

description:
Really tasty Thai food with very polite friendly staff. We loved our lunches, but i noticed the couple nearby complaining about their food (too hot, too salty, etc) and the wait person very patiently going over varous alternative choices and bringing them  a different dish.

super yeah on the mango with sticky rice dessert - get the black rice!
author: odd c.

description:
I've been to Thailand a few years ago, and have bee searching out tasty, authentic Thai places since then.  And while I haven't had enough of the menu to determine the authenticity of Marnee Thai, it is the first restaurant here that has sweet roti - fried dough drizzled in condensed milk and powdered sugar - on the menu.  This was a street vendor delicacy that I fell in love with in Bangkok and have been searching for ever since.  Thai roti, btw, is different from the savory Malaysian/Indian roti served with curry.  Unfortunately, the roti sounded more like a funnel cake than a large, light fried crepe folded in over itself into a square (that I was looking for), so I passed on it.  Sounds good for someone with a sweet tooth, though!

The restaurant is small and narrow, with a splash of vivid fake flower and fruit offerings and a painting(?) of King Rama that happily reminded me of Thailand.  It is not a romantic place by any means though.  You'd go here for the food, not the atmosphere.

We started out with tom ka gai, which was standard in quality, imo.  A light, red-flecked broth with white chicken meat, straw mushrooms, a few slivers of tender galangal (a nice surprise), and lemongrass and kaffir lime leaves for flavor.

We then had hau mok (on the special menu), a steamed 'casserole' of tender white fish fillet layered over cabbage, and embedded in a mousse of red-curry-flavored coconut milk.  All topped with a soft, custardy egg.  It makes a good comfort food and I enjoyed the texture, but at the same time, I wish it had a little more flavor "oomph".  I relied a bit on the kruang prung (four flavors of condiments you can ask for, to add spicy and salty tones to your food) for this.  My dining companion noted that it was "okay, but grew on you".

Lastly, and the best dish in our opinion, was chan pad poo, a thin rice noodle dish with an chili garlic sauce that was perfectly balanced in spicy, savory, tangy, and sweet tones, and studded with crab (real crab, I'm guessing the canned variety for convenience).  I thought it was perfectly spicy, but my tastes run a little spicier than others, so you may ask for a slightly milder version, if necessary.  This is the one dish that we'd definitely order again, and recommend to others to get!
author: Laurie L.

description: So, the food was excellent and unique. We had plantains and biscuits with coconut that were delicious. I would have given 4 stars but the seating hostess / lady in charge screamed across the restaurant all night. At first, I thought this was funny/charming/a good story for later, but after 20 minutes of hearing her bark at her waitresses on the other side of our table I thought I was going to lose my mind. She had them move tables this way and that, we had to get up in the middle of the meal to accommodate this, and the whole time she was yelling in our vicinity. I get the whole, 'people are hungry, move your butt' attitude, but think she could have contained this a bit for the sake of my headache.
author: A H.

description:
I'm a little stunned myself, to be honest. After a yearlong Yelping hiatus, I find myself writing another review, even though I believed my online wordsmith days were done. But if you were at Marnee Thai with me last night, you'd see I have no choice. You weren't there. You didn't meet May. You just don't know. 
Such is the power of auntie May, the owner of this slice of deliciousness. When she completely disagrees with everything you order and decides she knows your tastebuds better than you do, you shrug and go with it (turns out she's right anyway). When she asks you to taste the steaming pork potstickers even though you're a loyal vegetarian, you take a little bite. And finally, as you're leaving, if she gives you an impromptu personality reading, declares your husband "caring and kind", and then asks you to review her on Yelp - well, you just do it. 
I see a lot of reviews debating the authenticity of the food here. Honestly, I don't really care. It's supremely tasty, and that's what counts. That goes for the aforementioned potstickers in green curry sauce, the corn cakes with a fresh diced topping of cucumbers and onions, golden triangles filled with pumpkin, and spicy green beans with tofu and mushrooms. Cannot speak for my husband's chicken with ginger, lemongrass, and peppercorns. But it looked pretty, which is half the battle in my book. 
If I don't give Marnee five stars, it's only because the service really could use a good kick in the pants. It wasn't that we had particularly poor service ourselves. Everyone who showed up at our table was smiling, friendly - or in the case of auntie May, endearingly straight talking. But it takes a while to get anyone's attention, whether to find out the wait for a table, or get a copy of the daily specials.  
However, none of this detracts from the amazingly tasty Thai goodness on our plates. It may have been the cold, rainy weather outside that made everything better, but you can bet I'll be back on a sunny day to test this theory. And if May orders me to update my Yelp review...well, that part may just be non-negotiable.
author: Purnima M.

description:
Really good Thai food for the price. Why the five stars? Sunset district is extremely competitive, to get a full star ratings, it have to meet my personal criteria of prompt service, good authentic food and pricing enough to feed a family of four to its full for less than $50.

We ordered Green Curry, Red Curry, Thai Fried Rice, 2 appetizers. Worthy to mention is the Angel spicy wings & Thai Fried Rice. Spicy wing is combination of sweet, with lots of garlic  and fish sauce based teriyaki... i think.  The fried rice taste EXACTLY like the one I had many in Chang Mai, Thailand one of the street food!
author: andre l.

description: Marnee Thai is not only the best Thai in San Francisco, but the best I've ever had! The chicken larb salad is to die forr, the curries are perfection and the whole fried fish is heavenly. You can't go wrong. Oh, and the owner will give you a psychic reading if you catch her on a good night :)
author: Maggie B.

description: Even though Billy Eichner would hate the name of this place, we loved it. MARNEE! It has a new yorky kind of vibe, packed and bustling but in a good way. The Pad Kee Mao was spicy as a mofo, just the way I like it. We got their spicy angel wings but with tofu, and freaking loved em. Do NOT miss the Roti with coconut ice cream for dessert. Oh ma dayum.
author: Amir T.

description:
YUMMINESS!!!! By far, the best Thai food in SF, possibly the Bay Area... and it's within walking distance from my house!  Dear God, why must they tempt me so when I'm trying to save money from not eating out so much?!!!
So, winners definitely are:

Pumpkin Curry - we had this w/ textured soy protein.  To die for.

Tom Kha Soup - a spicy traditional Thai soup with the coolness of coconut milk to complement it.  I usually don't like ordering this in Thai restaurants because they make it too sour and it makes me think something inside is spoiled - but Marnee makes it JUST RIGHT.  I could drink the whole pot by myself... oh wait I did...

Basa Fillet with Garlic Sauce - yeah yeah yeah the vegetarian police can get on my ass for this one, but it's Marnee's fault for making this SO GODDAMN good.  Tender but not mushy fish, it literally flakes off and melts in your mouth... and the contrast with the fragrant crunchy fried garlic makes me squeeze my legs tight in fear of a gushing orgasm.  If anything is worth breaking my usually strict vegetarian rules for, this is it... ten times over...

There's no BAD dish I had here, just some not-so-impressive ones. The Pad Thai and fresh spring rolls are pretty good but I think I make it better (and w/ no yucky fish sauce).  Mango w/ sticky rice dessert is good but portion is a bit small (of course I'm used to the big ass plate they gave me when I ordered at Noodle World in LA... oh how I miss you Noodle World...)

The place is a bit tiny (you can hear the neighboring table's conversation) so large parties and claustrophobics aren't recommended... oh but what the hell I'm claustrophobic and I frequent this place once a month.  Don't be a wuss and JUST TRY IT... the food will not disappoint.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Excellent Thai food-- probably the best that I've had up here in the bay this past year.  The wait staff splendid, helpful, and humorous.  

The egg rolls were fresh, tom kha kai was full of flavor and fresh ingredients.  

My favorite dishes are the roast duck layered over a bed of spinach (pairs excellently!) and the lamb yellow curry.  It's not often we find a thai place that offers a curry with lamb, so this was a nice treat!

If I must play devil's advocate, I would say the service is almost a little too fast as we felt a tad rushed.  Another thing to note is that their pad see-ew is a little atypical, but delicious with layers of spice and tomatoes. 

Overall, an excellent place for thai food.
author: Siao J.

description:
I was taken here on my birthday by some friends. A good experience, to say the least.

My only real problem was that it was extremely loud - a few others said this place has a quiet 'ambiance.' It was also uncomfortably small and I think this place could afford to remove just one of the tables and space everything out for some extra elbow room.

Other than those complaints, I really liked this place.
author: Courtney S.

description:
3.5 stars.  Came here for my friend's birthday dinner with about 25 people. Service was friendly and quick. I loved the decor

Loved: 
Green curry w/ beef was very tasty. The beef was very tender. My boyfriend had the Mango Fried Rice, which sounds sort of odd, but it tasted really good. Dessert was the Rotti with ice cream. Sweet, crunchy, a bit salty, and topped with coconut ice cream that took a while to melt =]. 

Hated:
Not enough rice. Many of us ordered a dish that would be eaten with rice but they only gave us 2 bucks. Let me remind you again that we had a bit over 25 people. 2 buckets is definitely not enough. It was my first time here so I'm not sure how this place works but usual places I eat at aren't like this. I would skip the Thai tea, nothing special, too sweet too.

I would probably come back again because I liked the dessert but not with so many people. If it was only me and my boyfriend, I would have given this place 4 stars.
author: Audrey M.

description:
This place was delicious. Went with a date for late lunch...nice quaint hole in the wall looking joint.  Prices were great...service great...decor and ambiance relaxing.

We ordered the avocado salad, mango fried rice (tofu), and pad Thai (tofu)....alll were so delicious...!!! Esp. the avocado salad which had prawns and green mango with a tamarind type dressing. mmmm mmmm

The fried rice was delicious...although i have to admit Osha's is better...It seemed like they may have left out the fish sauce (possibly because we asked it be vegetarian...if thats the case I appreciate they did that)

The pad thai...possibly the best I have ever had.


I would defn. call Marnee my second favorite Thai restaurant in the city.
author: N S.

description:
Not the best Thai food I've ever had, but not bad.  
And I'd never even heard of the place before I went, so it's not a case of being disappointed because it was overhyped.  I just wasn't overwhelmed with deliciousness.
author: Rachel J.

description:
I stopped in for a late weekday lunch with low expectations. A friend who had been earlier that week couldn't stop raving about their fresh egg rolls, which wound up being stuffed with tofu, chicken sausage, egg, cucumber, and bean sprouts and topped with crab meat and tamarind sauce to boot. While I wouldn't have chosen to order them, it was a delectable treat in a generous portion. (As an aside, they brought us regular egg rolls instead of the special. We felt really bad about sending them back, but they were very understanding). 

I had the Pad Thai. It was the teeniest bit overcooked, but it definitely met with my approval. The Thai bubble tea wasn't bad either. All in all, a really good family-style restaurant. 

I will definitely visit again if I'm in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't drive more than 10 minutes to come here. Also, there's plenty of 3-hour unmetered parking past Lincoln near Golden Gate Park.
author: kathy c.

description:
At first, I thought the place smelled weird.
I also didn't like having to wait but then I saw why.
The food.
Uh, yum. 
My cohort was thoughtful enough to allow us to eat an all vegetarian selection, we shared thus enabling us multiple eats of sumptious dishes.
What I particularly liked was the unstated daring of the chef that added  an extra this or a little bit of that to each plate that took up the
"had it a hundred times" selections quite a few notches.
Though the tables are quite close and ambience is not a word I would say it has, I'm not sure if I can blame that on Marnee Thai or the loud, obnoxious company at the table one over.  
To be sure I'll be back and if I don't like the place, I'll be sure to get the number for takeout for the food.
author: Sean S.

description:
So I've been to Marnee about three times now, and so far I've never been disappointed. The standard Pad Thai is very tasty and the prawn were cooked perfectly. The corn cakes, one of Marnee Thai's specialties are delicated little fried patties of corn, batter and seasoning that come with a spicy cucumber salad. Its really an incredible dish. The yellow curries are delicious and the angel wings are unforgettable but they're really messy so bring a bib. 

The service at the Marnee Thai on 9th is hit or miss. On my last visit, we were not well-tended to, however they were slammed at nine on a Tuesday night and I think they were short-handed. The real treat is getting waited on by the owner, Marnee. She is a lot of fun and will be happy to lend her opinions to your ordering. She adds a lot of personality and character to a very not-typical Asian restaurant. 

The place can get noisy and boisterous, so if you're looking for a romantic, date spot, I'd look elsewhere. But its a great neighborhood Thai place and one even worth seeking out.
author: Brandon B.

description:
If you need only one reason to go, then go for their pad thai. I'm a big fan of the pad thai (aren't we all, deep down?) and I fell in love with theirs. It could, in fact, be the best pad thai I've ever had.

We also tried their yellow curry, but not being a huge curry fan I wouldn't be able to comment. I ate it anyway so I can safely say it wasn't bad. I just don't know how it compares to other restaurants. 

Aside from that the service was friendly, prices were great, and the food was good - well, the two dishes we had. I will definitely return!
author: Andrea B.

description:
Great Service
Excellent Food
Fast...Curtious
Crowded...on a Sunday Night After 8pm...
author: Samuel M.

description: This place was so good that we went back and got take-out for our plane ride home back to Philadelphia. And yes, all those people on the plane were ever so jealous as the air became to fill with the wonderful smell of pad thai.
author: Dominic R.

description:
The best Thai in SF. My Thai colleague recommended Marnee as he says this is about as close to Thailand as you can get in SF. The  restaurant is clean, the staff very friendly and accomodating. 
The Angel wings, while maybe not the most authentic of their offerings, are to die for - delicately fried, slathered in sweet garlic. I want to marry them!
Everything else I have tried was excellent. Try their daily special salads.
Conversely...the Marnee Thai on Irving in the past was extremely hit-and-miss as far as food quality.
author: Mr. S.

description:
Excellent Thai.  The Tom Kha Gai is delicous and perfectly flavored.  They don't skimp on the little treats in the soup either, there's plenty of chicken and mushrooms, galanga, and onion.  Mmmmm......
The dishes are all top-notch.  They're big enough to share, but enjoyable enough to keep to yourself, too.  And, for the price, it's like stealing wonderful Thai food!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Just ate there and it was pretty yummy!

Had the spicy angel chicken wings, and although I don't like eating meat from the bone, I had to give these little sticky suckers a try, three words:  finger licking good.

Everything we had was good.  I especially loved the limeonade served over crushed ice - so sweet and tangy -- I had to have 3!

Plus the service was really good.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Cute, cozy, casual place, good for both group of friends or intimate dates.

Best dish:
BBQ chicken: marinated young tender chicken, roasted to perfection. So yummy that I wanted to suck the bones. The meat was very flavorful, even the normally dry to my taste white meat was amazingly tender. I love the skin, which I normally find disgusting, so crispy and full of flavor. I also finished the side decoration, a carved beet, yum!!
(Update: tried it again with thai sticky rice. YUMMY! Great combination!)

Pretty damned good: 
Shrimp Pad Thai: you all know what it is. What I love about it here is that the flavor is not overwhelmingly strong. All the flavors, saltiness, sourness, spiciness, and sweetness are balanced just right so you could taste everything in the dish. I do wish that there's more bean sprouts. 

Avacado Salad: avacado, shrimps, strips of mango, lettuce, cashew nuts, onions, with thai dressing. Soooooo refreshing and light but packed with the spicy tangy thai dressing. 

Not so impressive:
Tom Ka: spicy and sour soup with coconut milk, vegie, and chicken. Jhangthong Banbua in Santa Rosa is MUCH better. The one is just not well balanced in terms of flavors. Every flavors are so strong that they battle in your mouth which is not very pleasant. Couldn't eat anymore after 3 sips.

Overall a very nice Thai restaurant, with very reasonable price. If you want casual Thai but not noodles like King of noodles, here's a good option.
author: Yuchi C.

description: Yum. this place is always really loud and crowded, but the food is delicious. sometimes I prefer picking it up to to and eating at home just because it's pretty crowded, but always delicious.
author: Sky B.
