description: Huge fan of Marnee Thai.  Cute atmosphere, delicious Thai food, and friendly staff!  The Pad See Ew with chicken was delicious.  I'll be back!
author: Alice Y.

description: OMG! Marnee is completely delicious. The food, service, atmosphere, and location are all to die for. The prices cannot be beat and we only spend around $35 for the two of us. We always get the angel wings, pad kee mao (duck), and pad se'ew (beef). I do recommend sitting in the front part of the restuarant, because larger parties are moved to the back and the acoustics of the room makes you able to hear everyone else's conversation and not your own. Marnee is a diamond of San Francisco, and my girlfriend and I make this one of our regular places to dine.
author: Daniel C.

description:
This place has a good atmosphere, but its not really good for big parties due to the space constraints. The service is pretty good with waiters and waitress coming around fairly often to make sure you are doing OK.

The food is excellent, very authentic, they do make the papaya salad slight different then other places but it think that's just how it is. Pad Thai, shredded beef, curry are all excellent dishes for new Thai enthusiast.
I recommended giving this place a try. The price is very decent as well.
author: Dang L.

description:
I find that Thai food are not that hard to please me unless it's really dry and bland.  I usually have them with some spicy hot sauce :P There's mediocre and there's some that are very very tasty & delightful.  At Marnee Thai, it was very delicious and no wonder it's jam packed on a Monday night when my friends and I came here for dinner.  With reservations for 5 at 7:30pm, we found ourselves waiting for a good 15 minutes before we were seated.   The menu ranges from the traditional pad thai to a wide range variety of Thai food that was unheard of.  Some of the items we ordered were the pad thai, pad see ew, and a few more I forgot what it was... :(  We had some questions regarding some food plates at another table and asked the guy who promptly refilled our water glasses multiple times to see what it was or was called.  He had to return to the kitchen and had our waiter answer our request.  I felt that maybe he should have told us from the beginning that he was new instead of frighteningly walking away with doubts.  
The restaurant was pretty small with limited seats so I recommend to call in for a reservation.  Parking was easily found across the street.  Will return if I'm around the area & craving for some yummmy Thai food.
author: Lily M.

description: Only 4-stars?!?!?! This is the best Thai food I've ever had!! You're wasting your money going anywhere else.
author: Dave C.

description: My fiance and I have been here a few times and we both really like this place - really good Pad See Ew, Pad Kee Mao Pad Prig Khing and Thai fried rice. The red curry beef was just ok though - the meat was not as tender as it could have been. Definitely worth checking out. They have a second location on Irving and 12th but it's often way more crowded than this smaller location for some reason. I like that it's near the park and the 9th and Irving area.
author: Samantha H.

description:
very good thai restaurant.  I've been here countless times just because it is very reliable (every dish is good) and the people who own this place really care about presenting great food.  Just look at the hand carved radish flowers and fresh orchids decorating your dishes and table.  

My favorite dishes here: mango salad with shrimp, corn fritters, and any of the desserts.

I don't think they use MSG either (most asian restaurants do, especially japanese restaurants, suprisingly)
author: trang n.

description:
Delicious, flavorful thai. 
Recommended for smaller groups.
Curry is killer.
author: Carlene H.

description: We were not very happy with the overall experience in this restaurant.  The food was average at best (tip : don't buy any shrimp based meal, you would get very few of them in your plate).  Then there is the fly in the glass and the bill on the table before we were done...  not worth going.
author: Yann M.

description:
My first time dining here was on a busy Saturday night with a small group of friends so I was expecting subpar service and food. I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the samosas, fried chicken wings, pad kee mao with beef, and chicken kang dang, thinking that this was ordering light and would leave us room for dessert. We were very wrong. Not only were the dishes delicious, (Pumpkin in a samosa?! Addictictive peanut sauce in the kang dang dish to name some favorites) but there was so much food, we were full before we could finish all the food. (But we forced every bit down anyway because it was just that good.)

Now onto the service. I was amazed, no I was shocked, at the level of service here. You'd think the entire wait staff underwent some kind of synchronized dance class or something with how swift and smooth they were in attending to our needs. We even had a running joke at the table that the water level in our glasses never went below 2/3s empty because they would refill it.

I will most definitely be coming back to this hidden gem again.
author: Amy C.

description: Man, this place is ridiculously good.  Unreal, back when my wife and I used to live on 9th and Judah, we used to love going here.  I was not familiar with Thai food except for Pad Thai which I liked, so I decided to just start picking meals at random, and the plates were so good that every time I came I would force myself to pick a new plate, and I can honestly say that they were ALL good.  I recommend this place to anybody I know who looks for a dinner spot in the area.
author: Edwin O.

description:
I actually thought it was pretty good, but my date really hated it (which is odd since we shared the same dishes) -- and if I don't get a second date because I chose a lousy restaurant, Imma be soooooo mad. Actually, no I'm not... that's a terrible reason to not get a second date.

No wait for a table on a saturday night, though it was after 8 so maybe that's why. It was also a little noisy for my liking... hard to get through that first date banter with so much noise around us. I would eat there again, but not before trying some thai places a little closer to my house.

**UPDATE 2/16/09**
I didn't get a second date. Douche.
author: Wayne F.

description:
This might sound a bit corny, but on the few occasions that I am out on Irving, I am her with my mom. And we stopped in here for lunch, and we ate here. She's had authentic Thai food from Thailand (can't get more authentic than that), and she liked it. I just like random Thai food and I had a good time. It was good, and I had no complaints about the place.

And it's nearby shopping. So shop and lunch!
author: Michael C.

description:
Excellent corn fritters and fried tofu. Thai iced tea a bit too sweet.

Update:
The tom ka soup was really filling and the mango salad had a great dressing..but why iceberg lettuce?!?!
author: Anita C.

description:
Marnee Thai has a great selection of thai, a nice atmosphere and good service.  Everything I ordered I enjoyed.  Not only that, but it was inexpensive in comparison to some other thai places.

One note though, don't order the crab cakes.  They were soooo bad the last time I tried them that my group of friends only had a single bite before we realized they were horrible.

And of course, since it's on 9th ave, parking sucks.  Go to the parking lot next to Hotei if you don't want to waste time.
author: Serge S.

description:
TOTALLY AWESOME, and i'm Thai.  The owners are there everytime I go, and their food is outstanding.  Try the Miang Kum (hard to find even in Thailand), the Pad Cha Talay if you like things spicy!, and the Bod Bia Sod.  (I can't find these items anywhere else in the city.)

Bottom line -- There are tons of Thai restaurants in SF, but only a handful of good ones.  This is definitely one of the good ones.
author: Neda B.

description:
Context: Went hiking from the Cliffhouse all the way to Golden Gate Sunday morning. 

Then hit up Marnee Thai with many of my fellow hikers for lunch...needless to say we were hungry and a bit cold...

We ate family style so tried many different dishes. Marnee Thai definitely not much to look and had a bit of a weird smell but the food was good.  Really this should be 3.5 stars. Had pumpkin chicken curry and duck red curry both good. The BBQ chicken was also very good. We got garlic basil chicken and a chicken salad which were both flavored well but they used ground chicken. I don't know why but I really dislike the texture of ground chicken.   Had a pad dish with crab which some of my fellow eaters thought bland. 

Many of us had Thai tea since we were such a big group the brought the pot they used but did not have decorated tea pots which I though was strange. 

By dessert we were full but shared an order of fried banana and honey as well as Roti. I had never had Roti before and the fried dough with condensed milk was very good. 

In sum the food was definitely good and they had a lot of options. Though I think we were all a bit biased by our level of hunger.
author: Courtney R.

description:
There is no way to describe the amazing food that comes from this kitchen! Between all the great servers, the food, and the atmosphere , you really feel the warmth of this restaurant. I eat here so much because you just can't seem to get enough of this authentic Thai cuisine. If you start of with anything, you HAVE to start off with their AMAZING angel wings! Everything else is just phenominal, so you can't go wrong. If ever you don't know what you should get, May (the restaurant owner) is always handy to give suggestions. There are days that I just tell her I need 2 dishes plus my angel wings and she never fails me. I haven't had dinner with a friend that said anything other then that wasw the best Thai food they've ever had! 

The only down side to everything, is that they can get packed, but as they say, you can usually tell how good the restaurant is by how long the line is. And trust me, it's worth waiting for!
author: Jason L.

description:
This place is good. The calamari salad was flavorful and the texture of the calamari was excellent. The BBQ chicken was one of the best chicken that I've tasted. The texture, flavor, visual, and smell was all there. If you go here get the calamari salad and BBQ chicken!

Other dishes that my friends and I ordered were the pad thai which was good, but not great. The red curry with chicken was awful! I love eating curry, but I did not want any more of it after a spoonful. The taste and texture was awful. The curry base was chunky! BAD!
Another dish was #37 I believe..it's beef with baby corn and some other veggies.it was alright.

The service was good. The ambiance is not great. The tables are small.

4-stars because of the calamari salad, BBQ chicken, and service.
author: Chatree T.

description:
Tasty food and the portions are actually pretty big, I always have leftovers, a rare occurrence in my life. t does get pretty busy and crowded. Service can be sketch, but it is worth it.

Always perfect when I am craving something spicy, spicy, spicy, spicy.

Update 6/4/08: This has become my go to Thai place. It is just that solid.
author: Lee M.

description:
I've lived right by this place my whole life. Heard the rave reviews...but after trying it, I don't know what all the hype is about. It's good, don't get me wrong...but it didn't blow my mind and I love thai. 
The people are always polite, the food is good, but I've had better (Thai place in Millbrae if you're ever by the airport). It's very expensive and since it's basic thai I don't really get that.
This place is good if you like spicey food. It will kick your ass good in that department!
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
I love this place..!!!!

funny i went here for my hs prom.. and i can never get  sick of their environment, setting and decor of the place.. outside looks like a regular building but once u go inside its like you're in a little hut.  also I must say they have my favorite flowers: Orchids 

Best appetizer is the angels wings and papaya salad.. I've also heard that their beef salad is good as well. 

Overall,  I've been here more than 5 times and each time I left here feeling satisfied and wanting to try many other things. 

Also theres another location that bigger.. but I think it is not as nice as the once down by irving because of the cute lil hut..
author: Sally Y.

description:
I was a little worried when we got seated in the back room of the restaurant at a small table next to a huge group out for a birthday celebration.  I was sure that we would be seated and forgotten - but I was pleasantly surprised at the service.  They brought us a fan and an entire pitcher of water since it was so hot back there.  And they kept coming back checking on us, making sure we were all right - in fact they checked on us more than the table of 20 right next to us!

And the food?  Some of the best Thai I've ever had.  I'm no "expert" but we tried about 5 different dishes and every single one was better than the last.  Green Curry, Pad Thai, Pad Pra Ram, Spring Rolls... it was all perfect!  Next time I'm up in the area again you can bet I'll be visiting again - next time with a cooler seat though :)
author: Jason G.

description:
Best Thai food, yet.Just go try it. Haven't had a bad dish yet, will announce when i do. I love their fried-rice of any sort. 
1 star minus, b/c of the possible long waits at time and the size of the restaurant. Otherwise, friendly staff.
author: jasmin t.

description:
I personally like this Marnee Thai rather than the other one. The other one is very adorned with bamboo and made into a hut like restaurant. My problem with that is that the tables are WAY too close together. But even at both restaurants, the space is pretty cramped. It is great for groups because it can get pretty loud in there. The room is quite tasty! I've had the Pad Kee Mao, Pad See Ew, Tom Yum Soup and the crabcake and spring roll appetizers. I would recommend them all! The Pad Kee Mao is very flavorful with different spices and absolutely filling. The soup is delicious and if you order it for lunch with the noodles, it is a very large portion. 

Minus two stars because of the closeness of the tables, the wife of the cook who makes me feel uncomfortable and parking.
author: Vikki K.

description:
I was sick of eating at King of Thai every time i needed a thai fix. So, i decided to switch it up, and i'm glad i did. The restaurant doesn't look very pretty from the outside and one can easily pass by without noticing it. Walked in around lunch time with a couple of buddies of mine and we were seated immediately. I ordered the Vegetable green curry and the thai samosas. The samosas are INSANE! do try them if you swing by. Everyone in the group liked the food, much better than king of thai. The service was alright, somewhat slow but the food made up for the slow service. Oh, and the thai iced tea was sickeningly sweet. Avoid!

4 stars is just right
author: Tushar V.

description: Food's great but if you get take out plan on extra time.  These guys are very, very slow.
author: Sleeping Fish ..

description: i love that their pad sew ew has a red chili powder sprinkled on top.
author: Tina H.

description:
Dish: Angel Chicken Wings
Quantity: appropriate for amount that I paid
Quality: Good. Spicy but not light-your-lips-on-fire spicy. 

Dish: Mango Fried Rice with Chicken
Quantity: appropriate for amount that I paid
Quality: Good. The flavor was well balanced.

Service: They passed the glass half full test. What's that? I'm happy you asked. It's a measurement of how attentive the servers are. Despite how busy it was (restaurant was packed) they always made sure my water glass was never below half full. 

Miscellaneous: So I came here with my girlfriend for lunch because we had walked past it the night before and saw a decent sized line outside. 

The chicken wings, although advertised as spicy, were not over the top. If you're looking for wings that will burn a hole in your mouth, these are definitely not it. However, they did have a faint spiciness that, personally, I enjoyed. I'm sure some patrons out there find them spicy. I, however, do not. At that level of intensity, I suppose it's all subjective. 

The flavor in the mango fried rice was well balanced and there was no predominant overpowering flavor. I could taste the sweetness of the mango's, the savory flavor of chicken and a hint of spice. 

Overall, I'd come back here to try some of their other dishes. I did not opt for the stereotypical dessert (sweet mango rice). Next time.
author: Scott K.

description: Really good Thai Food - Love their Pad-Se Ew ; its a most try!!
author: Jane D.

description: Holy moly, get the Angel Wings for cryin' out loud. This sauce is so good it almost made me cry. Also had the basa filet, mango fried rice, pad thai and green mango soft shell crab salad. ALL DELICIOUS. Will be back ASAP.  =)
author: Teresa H.

description:
The atmosphere was so cold even the old fashioned heater was right next to our table.  
It took them almost 30min for our appetizer to come.  We had to remind them too.  One of my friends ordered something and had specified that she's allergic to one of the ingredient.  When the dish came, they didn't take the ingredient out but the waitress was arguing about it.  
We had to remind them twice when we wanted to add a bowl of rice during our order.
author: Elle Z.

description:
Really good Thai food. I work in the park so this is a regular lunch spot for me and my coworkers. It's a little difficult to get a seat, but the staff try their best to turn and burn the tables. 

  I always order the same thing- chicken with spinach and peanut sauce. i think it's called Pad Pra Ram.  I would love to try something new but I love this dish too much!
author: Lisa R.

description:
How I love Marnee Thai. Located in my old Inner Sunset neighborhood I always jump at the chance to go back again, specifically for the Khao Soy Chicken, my favorite Thai dish ever thanks to Marnee. Khao Soy is their delicious yellow curry served over noodles and topped with some pickled cabbage, chili paste, and lime. Wow. This dish is ridiculous. 

Aside from the Khao Soy Chicken I've never had a bad dish here. Their Pad See Ew is one of the best I've ever had. All their curries are great. I could go on and on.

Marnee Thai is, simply, the shit.
author: Mike P.

description:
I went here for the first time today for dinner, after hearing from people in the neighborhood that it was a great place. I'll definitely be back!

I had the Kang Ka Ree (yellow curry) with chicken. Also had an appetizer of Imperial Rolls - the crispy fried spring rolls. The food was exceptional, right from the first bite. Perfectly spiced curry, and the spring rolls had a nice mixture of chicken and shrimp in them.

I was very impressed by the service and the presentation of the food. My appetizer came with a beautiful orchid and other garnishes. The Thai women who work there wear traditional tailored Thai dresses (very elegant) and are quick and attentive.

The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that the place is a bit cluttered, which takes away form the ambiance. I sympathize with them on this, because it is a small place, and they do a lot of business there, so have to have their to-go containers, napkin-folding area, etc. right out where it's close to your table. The former bar is used for these things. Anyway, I kind of hate to knock off a star for this, but it is one aspect that sometimes might make other Thai restaurants more appealing. 

In any case I'll definitely be back to Marnee often if the food and service continues to be as good as what I experienced today.

NOTE: I've since been back for lunch, and it wasn't quite such a magical experience. The lunch special portion is just slightly less than what one would expect for a complete lunch. And no traditional Thai dresses on the servers at lunch time. They seemed understaffed and rushed. The server looked away every time she rushed by to put something on the table, and seemed almost hostile. I'll go back, but if that turns out to be the norm at lunch, I'm taking away another star.
author: Kent W.

description:
The food's pretty good, but not sure that it's "one of the best" Thai places in SF.

It's a cute place.  Tables are placed a little tightly.  The room in the back has a little more breathing space.  The servers are nice.  Food is served pretty quickly.
 
Have been here a few times and tried:
* golden triangles (only available on weekends): by far the best part of the dinner.  pumpkin and potato curry wrapped tightly in spring roll (?) skin and fried
* cold summer rolls: rolls were as expected but sauce was a little weak
* pad siew (sp?): a little too sweet, left a lot to be desired
* coconut chicken soup: nicely done
* veggie eggplant curry dish:  exceeded expectations

It's a cute place.  You'll definitely get a consistently good meal.
author: Linda C.

description:
On days I don't fee like cooking, I can always run down the street to my trusty Marnee Thai folks for some down right good finger lickin' food. Never had a bad meal or service on the plenty of times we've been there but then again, if you know Thai food and know what to order, then no issues right? It's a bit on the pricer side but we think it's well worth it.

Dishes that we've ordered:

Imperial rolls - A bit on the greasy side but be sure to blotch your napkins on these bad boys
Basa Fillet with fresh garlic and black pepper sauce - OH SO YUMMY. One of the best fish husband has had considering he hates fish.
Prig Khing - String beans with tofu and chili paste
Spicy Beef
Garlic Pork
Pad Thai - I've had better but it's not bad at all

All in all, always left with a very satisfied tummy.
author: Karen R.

description:
Odd (wo)Man Out!

Sorry kids...not a fan!  My boy and I had the tofu chili/basil style and it was kinda oily.  We also had the pad thai, good but not great.  I wasn't too thrill for the veggie menu.
author: Lisa L.

description:
So close to my work... delicious items!  

I actually ate there today, and was told by a new waitress that they did not have fake chicken.  I prodded a little more and found out she was new and unaware of the delicious vegetarian treat that my former coworker ordered as "soy protein".  Whatever you want to call it, not to have it anymore would be a crime!

It's always busy, I have enjoyed everything I have ordered and I have ordered a wide array.  Pad se ew, pad thai, and veggie curry are some of my top picks.  All with fake chicken, of course.

The service is sometimes lacking, but I guess they are busy... forgetting a thai iced tea could be forgivable... maybe.  
They gave me free dessert on my birthday so that counts for something.  Speaking of dessert, the dessert roti is delicious!
author: Kristina K.

description:
The tom yum with shrimp was good, but I think it would be hard to mess up a soup like that. 

The mango fried rice with beef was ok. The meat was a little rare but still tasty. There was A LOT of egg in this dish. The variety of ingredients used in this entree resulted in rice that was mushy and mildy flavored (mostly tasted like egg). 

I also ordered the pad kaprow with chicken. Now this dish was really good!!! The flavors were really concentrated, so I ended up eating less than half of my order with a ton of rice. Yum!

Service at this place is excellent. The two servers on the floor were super attentive and very nice. Although I wasn't impressed with the fried rice, I know that I will be coming back to try more of the "prize dishes" like the pad kaprow.
author: Nathalie N.

description: Hot cakes yum. Corn fritters blah.  Better at e&o trading. The dishes were over all good but very similar taste.  But the crowd at door was huge.  Maybe we ordered wrong.
author: Square P.

description: This place has the best pad kee mao I've ever had. It's the reason I keep returning. If you like your Thai spicy though, it's very difficult to get it here. I've tried multiple times to ask for "very spicy" and I end up with something akin to mild or sometimes with just an extra drizzle of red hot sauce.
author: Amy T.

description:
been to this and the other on irving.  consistently good.  coconut hotcakes--YUMMERS!  addictive, love 'em as appetizer and dessert. :)
tried the banana curry (duck) the other day--delish!
i haven't had a disappointing dish yet.
author: s t.

description:
Everything we've had is fresh and delicious. 
Do wish they would update their site so I can look at the entire menu at one time. But the service is professional. They are tolerant of kids. If you do bring kids, best to ask them to bring food out as it is ready and to bring the check with the last dish. Corn Cakes are good kid food. For us adults, we like the Tom Yum soup, Pad Kee Mao, Green Curry, Larb Salad and Spicy Angel Wings. The brown rice is also really good. 
We also really like the original location on Irving at 24th.
Go for the food! Your mouth will thank you.
author: Jen E.

description: Coconut soup is the best I've ever had.  You HAVE to get the ROTI, dessert, it's like a crispy pancake but not a pancake, served with coconut ice cream.  Heaven on a plate.  The coconut juice is also very tasty with real shards of coconut in it.
author: Jessica C.

description: I had lunch here with my family. There was something for everyone. I ordered mango fried rice which was a special that day. It was wonderful. The food was fresh and tasty.
author: Michele D.

description: Friendly staff, tasty not too hot. Great Thai tea. Yellow curry, pad cashew with chicken (*watch for peppers!), jazmin rice. We sat down for lunch around 12:30, and there were only two tables full. By 12:45, the place was packed! Ah, if the food isn't spicy enough, they give you a jar full of Jalapenos & vinegar.
author: Randal C.

description:
I don't recommend this restaurant.

1.  Bad service.     I stooped by this restaurant around 5:30 pm -- not a busy time. No greetings. And the waitress asked me to pick up the menu by myself. I ordered  Thai Style Fried Rice. After I got my order and returned to my office, I found that they did not provide tissue paper and spoon/fork/chopsticks. I had to go somewhere to look for spoon/fork/chopsticks.

2. Food not fresh.     The tomato in the fried rice tasted and looked not fresh. So I threw them away. The fried rice is just so-so.
author: Nan J.

description: This was my first time at this Thai restaurant and I was not disappointed.  The Tom Kha was awesome and the veggies they add are creative and it was the first time I had tofu (very firm) in the soup.  It was great, not as large as I expected it to be, but flavorful.  We also ordered the yellow curry which was very tasty and their mango rice.  This was my first time I had this type of rice.  It took a long time to appear on our table but as soon as we had some, I understood.  It was sooo good and the mango was a refreshing contrast to the warm rice.  The portions are small but the fullness of the flavors, good meat and superior preparation and presentation makes up for it. The guys sitting next to us brought their own wine ($10 corkage fee) and ordered some crab cakes, that looked so cute and looked very yummy. We left feeling very full and we will definitely go here again.
author: A. M.

description: Yes, its one of those places where you have to get one of their signature dishes. Don not get the curry or pahd see ew. Get the angel wings, pahd thai, papaya salad.
author: Beach L.

description: Excellent green curry. Subtle flavor, well balanced. Very good. Really liked the pumpkin samosa. Place gets crowded, come early.
author: Gary W.

description: Ate here for the second time after visiting the de Young museum. Have enjoyed each visit and looking forward to exploring their menu further.  Love the spicy Ma Keur (55).  Everything we have had so far was very tasty and well seasoned.
author: Dandyd S.

description: I eat alot of Thai food and this place is very very good, one of my favorites. I have never eaten a bad meal here and it's a fun fast paced great service environment. It is crowded and not a place to lounge and eat, it about good food and good service. Give it a try if you are in the area!
author: Jill T.

description:
Wow- Just had a feast.  Had the imperial rolls, Tom Ka soup (Spicy and sour soup with coconut milk, mushroom, galanga, lemon grass), prawns with chili/garlic/basil, red chicken curry and a thai iced tea.  It was AMAZING.  The imperial rolls didn't have the usual stuff that typically comes in fried springrolls- what they put in was really nice.  The tom ka was perfect in simplicity- really good fresh mushrooms, delicious broth.  The prawns were nice and spicy and the sauce was saucy.  The chicken red curry was exactly medium heat as advertised and the bamboo shoots a different veg for me in curry.  Delish.  And then the thai iced tea- you would think thai iced tea would be thai iced tea- but the one I just drank had a great balance of the flavors.

The take-out is lightening fast too.  Luckily I knew what I wanted at Le Video- gotta be the best video shop in the city.  

So glad I moved here- the weather is kicking my ass but that food-video store combo made it all clear.
author: Staci M.

description:
Went to Marnee Thai on a whim with some other runners after a workout at Kezar Stadium...we usually pick a place in the Inner Sunset to refuel after our workout, and we were fortunate enough to have a member of our group suggest this place. 

At first, we were slightly disappointed to be stuck in the back corner of the restaurant (and I mean WAY back, in the back room even!), but it turned out to be the best thing that could have happened to us.  The woman who waited on us was hilarious! (Could she be Marnee?  Not sure, but she's definitely in charge).  While she was a little pushy about the amounts and types of foods we should order (okay, really pushy), we all got a good laugh, and ended up with what we wanted.

For an appetizer, we ordered pumpkin samosas and spring rolls - the pumpkin samosas were delicious, and I would absolutely order them again.  The spring rolls weren't the best I've ever had, but we did get quite the lesson on the importance of the sauce that's served with them - she even served it onto our plates for us.  We were waiting for her to go around and tuck our napkins into our shirts for us, but alas, that never happened.

Dinner was fabulous as well - #64 pumpkin curry, #46 pad thai, a couple other really tasty noodle dishes (#41 and #42, although we weren't exactly expecting noodles), #22 panang beef curry, and some chicken and green bean dish (I think #29).  There wasn't anything that I didn't like.  The beef was really tender and flavorful, and the tofu and pumpkin was out of this world.  As for the noodle dishes, none of them were greasy, and they all had their own distinct flavor, which makes it hard to choose a favorite.

To add to the meal, we were fortunate enough to be seated next to another large party - a birthday party - that received the royal treatment from the staff - I assume they brought the cake themselves, but it was brought in with a little more than the usual flair - lights out, a gong, and strict instructions not to blow out the candle until after we'd all sung happy birthday to the poor young man.  

All in all, it was a great experience, and I would definitely go back for the food and the entertainment!
author: Jenni K.

description:
We first tried this place after receiving a gift certificate from a neighbor, and have been regulars ever since.  I'm a big fan of Thai food, and Marnee Thai has some of the best Thai to be had in the city.  What I love about this place is that I know I can order something different every time and will always like it.  Hasn't failed me yet.

I had to take off one star simply because three of the last five times I've been there, they ran out of the young coconut juice, which is my favorite beverage.  =(
author: Christine C.

description:
While on a day trip to SF, we were looking for a place to take my mother-in-law, who is from the Midwest and has never had Thai food. We also had our two kids with us, ages 8 and 5, who aren't that interested in trying new things. Luckily, this place was a hit with everyone. 

We ordered way too much food and our bill was outrageous, but everything except the summer rolls was enjoyable. We had the golden triangles (samosas with sweet potatoes and pumpkin), panang curry beef (with chicken), panang curry beef (with tofu), chicken satay, and for my mother-in-law, a soft-shell crab salad with mango.

The service was fast and the waitress was very helpful. I thought the tofu was some of the best I've had, but I wished the panang curry came with more veggies (other than the steamed broccoli on the side). 

We'll go again if we are in the area.
author: Amy B.

description: The BEST Thai Food in San Francisco period! It's a must go place and it gets crowded easily. Could be long wait at peak times.
author: Amy M.

description: This restaurant is very pleasant, pretty and comfortable. The food is really good. You MUST try the Volcano Chicken.  It is not only amazing, but,...did I say,...amazing! It's easily enough for 2 strong appetites and most likely 4 regular appetites.  The bar drinks are very good, too.
author: Norah M.

description:
Oh man, finally I found you Marnee Thai. Finally, a place that really challenges the flavors I fell in love with this past summer traveling through Thailand, but better, because I am 15 minutes from home, not 15 hours...So my friend the world-music-reggae-rockstar who grew up mere blocks away said you were the best in the city, hands down. Oh, how you surpassed expectations. 
Now the important stuff. It was real, service impeccable, authentic, high quality ingredients, fresh, legit. It looked like everything was epic,   I had the green curry, epic, chicken padkrapow, large and in charge good spicing, and fresh fresh veggies with tofu in a chili garlic sauce, bomb, usually i'm bored by tofu, but not this tofu, it was all good. I have to go back and try more. Pad Thai looked awesome, papaya salad looked amazing and bigger, nothing looked bad to me, open kitchen can see the legitness, very key, clean and efficient, rockin!
You know its the kill when you finish eating stuffed and stoked, and you see the masterful elderly asian family next to you feast arrive and had to ask the waiter what it all was to hope to remember and order it next time. 
Worth the minor parking karma issues, but hey its still only 15 minutes away, not 15 hours, and its just as good as anything Bangkok can offer.
author: Adam S.

description:
I heard about Marnee Thai via some TV show, and the reviewers absolutely raved about this place, which naturally got my expectations pretty high. I'd like to say that I'm fairly well experienced with Thai food in general, so Marnee Thai had some tough standards to stick up to.

When I first arrived, I saw a small group of people waiting inside and outside the restaurant. I could see they were incredibly busy and bustling, but I still received excellent service. I arrived about 20 minutes before my actual reservation, but they sat me as soon as they had a table, which was really nice :) My date hadn't even arrived yet haha, and they still sat me down. 

The environment was a little bit crazy with all the waiters and waitresses working their asses off, but for the customers, it was a very relaxed environment. It was a little bit loud and bustling, but very comfortable at the same time.

We ordered the two items from the specials menu: the hot cakes and the sea bass. My date ordered a garlic-based pork dish. 

Despite the crazy business of the restaurant, they served us within a very reasonable time, and the food was GREAT. The hot cakes were a little bit sweet, but pretty good. The texture was really interesting and wonderful and fun- crispy on the outside and milky on the inside. I wasnt SUPER crazy about them, but they were nice and light, but heavy with substance at the same time. Definitely good stuff. The pork dish was good- the flavors were well done, and it was a beautifully served dish with a pretty flower on the side :D The sea bass was AMAZING. I got it with the spicy coconut curry sauce (there are three different sauces offered with it), and holy crap it was good. The sea bass was PERFECTLY cooked, wonderfully crispy on the outside and melt-in-your-mouth delicious on the inside. The sauce was great, and the mushrooms taht went with it really added to the flavor. The image of it was great, too- a wonderfully red, tasty looking sauce topped with some green spice (parsley??) to add some viewing constrast. The sea bass was DEFINITELY a keeper. Absolutely wonderful. My date even commented on how good it was, and he's not much of a foodie himself xP

I can't wait to go back to Marnee Thai to try out their other dishes!! I was looking around at other tables, and it seems like you really can't order the wrong thing :)
author: Jade R.

description:
I have been there for lunch twice. I gave 5 stars for the quality of food. It's definitely one of the best Thai restaurants I have been to. My favorite dishes are its corn cake, pumpkin curry, Pad Thai, Angel wings, and Thai sausage fried rice. 

My only complain would be the services weren't consistent. One time was good and the other time was not so good.
author: Cherry L.

description: The best Thai place I have been to in the Bay Area.  We stopped by after going to Golden Gate Park and started with a very enjoyable potsticker special appetizer.  Never have I been so excited by a potsticker.  After some Thai tea it was time for our Pad Phed and Pad Woonsen, each of which had a distinct, rich and flavorful sauce.  The food was so good that a few bites into the entree I ordered takeout for lunch the next day, which included another order of potstickers and some terrific green curry.
author: Matt C.

description: This was the  1st place I'd experience Thai food, 15 yrs ago...  I've gone back a couple times since, I didn't find it to be best Thai restaurant in SF, however the food is overall delicious.  Its all true, the angel wings and  curries are all yummy.  I recall one time, they started closing, mopping up, cleaning, while we were still eating.  Talk about being rushed out and giving a hint.  Anyways, I forgive them since it was rather late and they've probably had a very long day since its so freakin busy there all the time.
author: S F.

description:
The Place: Marnee Thai is so small. There's probably a dozen small tables crammed inside the restaurant. It's located right near the 9th Street entrance/exit from Golden Gate Park, which is usually why I go there. Parking nearby is hard to come by though. If it's lunch time, the restaurant is extremely busy and has a half hour wait.

The Service: We got ignored all the time. It took forever for the waitress to take our order and forever for them to give us our food. When we got our food, I noticed that the table next to us didn't get their meal yet. Then two other tables got their food. Why didn't the first table get their food yet? Also, when our water glasses were near empty, we tried to get the waiter to fill our glasses. The waiter went to the table to the left and filled their glasses. Then he went to the table to our right. He didn't even fill our glasses. Really? All you had to do was turn your body 180 degrees.

The Food: Even though the service is terrible, the food is good. Their pad see ew is one of the best I've ever had. It's well made and really flavorful. Their award winning pad thai recipe is ok. The pad kee mao depends on who makes it. The first time I had it, the dish was incredible. The second time, the noodles tasted sour. (It's supposed to be salty and spicy.)

All In All: Marnee Thai has good food and terrible service. Instead of waiting forever for a table and then get snubbed by the wait staff, I'd recommend you save yourself the trouble and just order to go.
author: Jessica M.

description: Great decor and ambiance. I liked the fried rice with duck, and the very excellent Thai iced tea.
author: Anthony W.

description:
I didn't have a good experience but I don't want to knock the whole place based on one experience.

Me and my date sat for about 10 minutes before anyone came over to give us water and menus.  I wasn't too tiffed about this but after our appetizers came we were forced to move to another table so they could accommodate a large party.  Moving our drinks and food over to another table was pretty annoying to say the least.

Nevertheless, we had chicken curry and pad thai and it was good.  I think I was expecting more because of the reviews but I was satiated.  I still like Ploy ll way more and I don't think I'll go out of my way to head back here.
author: Nick L.

description: Over rated.  Nothing really out of ordinary.  Service though was quite bad.  Owner, manager and waitress often yell at each other and really stressed me out.  The food was so ok that I don't have much to comment on. So, that's it.
author: Carmen W.

description:
While the food was decent here, I have never been so insulted by a server in all my life. She completely ignored our African American dinner guest during beverage and dinner ordering, and when we asked her to come back to take his order she looked very put off, and wouldn't even look at him.

This is entirely inexcusable. 

I cannot in good conscience recommend this place to anyone, regardless of their race, knowing how we were treated. There are far better restaurants in the area that deserve your business.
author: Eric M.

description: This place isn't bad, isn't great. The noodles are pretty good, although the pad see ew (my fave) wasn't the greatest. I ordered pumpkin curry. It was okay but I like Coriander's in the mall better. Overall the atmosphere was fun for a group of friends and the service was accommodating.
author: Cathy S.

description: The roast duck and the pad kaprow are absolutely awesome. The duck is a little different from duck I've had any where else and is one of my staple orders. Pad Kaprow is nice and spicy, while still having a great flavor that's not lost in the spice. All in all, a place I very happily will return to again and again.
author: Chris S.

description: After living here for 5 years, this place is admittedly my favorite thai place in the city.  However, I think it is because I'm more of a stir-fry person, and less of a curry person.  People who have curries here are generally less impressed than those who don't.  The wait staff has always been very courteous and helpful, but on one occasion an older lady (owner?) came by and would not stop pestering me about my personal life, which I found extremely embarrassing and awkward.  Try to avoid her if you can.
author: Angband A.

description:
So, I f I can help it, I pretty much only eat Thai food. Save for the fried stuff it's healthier than most types of food, I love spicy everything, and I love exotic flavors. 

Marnee was one of the best Thai places i've been to thus far in the city. It's fully affordable, delicious, and nice inside. I like when the kitchen is semi-open, there's a ton of orchids, and it's just homey. 

I tried the Green Bean with Beef which was incredible, and Panang Chicken which was good, but could have been spicier, and the best Beef Salad I have ever had. The meat was amazing and the dressing was awesome. 

They're super nice if a little spacey, but I always care more about delicious cheap food than impeccable service. I'm no diva.

Go, it's good.
author: Rylie S.

description:
Like most reviews this place is fantastic with reasonable prices.  If you are a Pad Thai or Fried Rice eater I suggest you try something outside the box. Although both are really good

For appetizers I recommend the "Spicy Angel wings" (Deep fried chicken wings sauteed with chili-garlic sauce, top with crispy basil. Let me tell you they are dam good, and filling. I suggest picking some up for your super bowl party as you will be the man.  Moving to the main course I was disturbed reading the bad reviews regarding the curry dishes.  Number 23 "Kang Ka Ree" (Mild curry with coconut milk, turmeric, fresh herbs and spices with Yukon potatoes) with chicken is so Davine. To me it has a Indian curry presence about it.  Its the perfect for 2 people.  The Pad Prig Khing (Choice of chicken, beef or pork sauteed with spicy chili paste and string beans) complements the entire course with the sweet hot chili flavor leaving a everlasting taste on your palate.

Over all Marnee Thai = Bomb.  The Thai Iced tea is tasty, the service is good, and the bathrooms are clean.  The only negative thing I have to say is parking sucks.  If you're familiar with Irving street you know what I'm talking about.  Don't let that stop you.
author: Robert M.

description:
I went here for lunch with a few co-workers on their recommendation and I'd have to say that it was a good choice. Although the service was lacking , the food was really good. I went on one of those scorching hot days last week and since there was no air conditioning, it was a bit warm inside. It also didn't help that they had a big fan at the entrance blowing hot air into the restaurant, but at least they served ice water.

I ordered the Thai fried rice with pork and Chinese sausage and it was delicious. They had a mixture of diced chilies, kinda like the jar of sliced jalapenos that you see at most Thai restaurants,  that was awesome on my fried rice.

The only complaints I had were that the restaurant was a bit hot, they overcharged us on one item (but they fixed it when we showed them the receipt), and they shortchanged us on the change (a math error on the cashier's part).

Math error's not withstanding, I would definitely go there again if I'm working on Irving.
author: Felix T.

description:
Pleasantly surprised.

Pretty good food and a decent price.  I always past by this place but never actually walked in.  Its like a whole new atmosphere inside, very nicely decorated.  Only problem is that if you are a party of 2, you run the risk of basically sharing your table with the couple next to you.  There's maybe 3 inches of seperation between your table and the one next to you.  The place is small and loud and the owner commands the resturant from everywhere.  At anytime, she'll be screaming back and forth between your table and kitchen.  Kinda funny at first but gets annoying afterwards.  Nevertheless, a place worth checking out if you like Thai food.
author: Bart W.

description:
Oh my god!! Sooo Good.  
I have eaten here three times.  Twice in the restaurant and once as take out.  I feel that only this last time we had the true Marnee Thai experience.  We came on a Tuesday night,,,Not too busy...and we met "May."  
The food here is delicious! A few recommendations would include the fish with curry mousse in banana leaf.  Also the Avocado Salad was excellent.
While the food is always great, our most recent experience with May as our server/owner was truly memorable.  She created the most comfortable friendly and entertaining environment tor an overall fantastic meal!  Can't wait to go back soon.
author: Aaron C.

description: Food was acceptable, but we didn't get what we ordered--mostly due to the high-pressure sales pitch from the owner. We tried to order one thing, she changed it to something else, and yet a third thing showed up on the table. As for the food: the samosas were delicious, the pumpkin curry was tasty but nothing special, and the corn fritters were bland.
author: Brian W.

description: I'm a huge fan of Thai food, and I love Marnee's!  The Pad Poo is really REALLY good, it may not sound good, but trust me is a delicious crab pad thai. so good.  the Basa Filet is really good too, if you're trying to pinch some pennies they also have other fish that are available in the same sauce, I had the fresh garlic and pepper... so yummy~!
author: Mel H.

description:
if you're looking for excellent no-fail thai food, i'd probably steer you away from here.  but if you are interested in having a lighter dinner with just appetizers and yummy thai beer, then here it is! 

overall, the pad thai was good, coconut milk soup was so-so, spicy green curry was hardly spicy, seafood and noodle combination plate was bland.

what we were really chomping on with delight was the #13 beef salad that had an absolutely delicious lime dressing, and the crunchy imperial rolls and fresh summer rolls. the dipping sauces for both were light and sweet and better than your standard peanut sauce.  we also had to try out the coconut cakes which were doughy little white cakes made of coconut milk and flour and cooked into little rounds.  my little buddy called these "balls of joy with faces of happy."  yes they were!  everyone scarfed them up.

we came at a busy hour and waited around a long time for water and service.  this is just one of those places where the service gets worse with more people to serve.  however, the servers were extremely nice and the restaurant was nice and clean.  i'd definitely come back for a dinner made of appetizers!
author: Holly B.

description: Best Thai in Sunset, maybe whole city! Spicy angel wings, chic satay wraps and to die for Pad Thai highlighted our lunch. Service slow to start, but picks up throughout meal. Come prepared to wait for table...worth it!!!
author: Alan M.

description:
After seeing Marnee Thai featured on "Check Please Bay Area" combined with my love for Thai food we had to go. I made the wise decision to make reservations. We still waited 30 minutes to be seated. I think in part due to them being featured television over the past few days. Some of the people waiting in line had also mentioned that they had seen it featured on television. Now on to the food. The appetizers were typical thai fare.
It was the entrees  and the desserts that made it worth the wait. 
Knowing that I couldn't order everything I wanted. I ordered what the gentleman seated next to us was having. The Basa fillet was  so delicious. My wifes Pad Se-Ew, I was on a sampling bonanza, tasted so good. And my daughter's Panang Beef was so tender and flavorful.
The Roti with ice cream left us all with smiles on our faces. I plan to go back to order some of the other menu items I didn't get to order this time. :D
author: Brett W.

description: Best pad thai I've had in the city. One star docked for forgetting the extra fish sauce and chopsticks when I ordered to go.
author: Julie M.

description:
Pros: - fast service, water always filled
           - large selection of vegetarian alternative options.
           - Nice area, take a stroll in the park to digest or walk the streets
Cons: - not great for larger parties, if no reservations.
            - simplistic wine list, but you should be here for the food not      
               booze.
            - On busy street (try Irving and 9th area on sunday is free     
                metered parking
            - If you are of larger frame, such as myself, ask for the bench    
                seat, the wooden chairs not that comfortable over an hour.

Friends from San Diego came, checked the reviews, decided on Sun at 12:30 with no reservations.  Seating was under 5 min, took time to order, went with the Golden Triangles, Spicy Angel Wings, the Corn Cakes, and the spring roll while we decided on what main dishes to order.
       The corn cakes were just average, but all the other apps were finger likin' good.  who knew the golden triangle was a tasty veggie appetizer?
       Went with Pad Thai (good, not a lot of meat), chicken eggplant(nice and light), the Sea Bass with garlic (so good!), jasmine rice was served in a silver genie bowl (family serving).
     Dessert was painfully stomach popping with the fried banana with coconut icecream!!!  The left overs were packed in these mini takeout boxes save space in your fridge good for late night munchies.
     I would come again, oh if you have super clean bathroom issues, hold it and go somewhere else.  Someone dropped their curry chicken out from the other end and it wasn't cleaned up.  Paging Mr Haangsrivanang, Thai relative to Mr Hanky?
     Without tip $85 for all that shiznat, was awesome!
author: David K.

description:
Very good! the pumpkin stuffed "Golden Triangles" were very, very well flavored and nicely seasoned. Between the three of us, we got a tender, succulent pork special, a beef stir fry, and a very delicious shrimp and calamari curry. All were very tasty, the beef was not as spicy as was desired, the pork was just right, and the shrimp and calamari could have been a tad bit spicier. The friend banana and honey was..... eh, so-so. 

We will most certainly return!
author: Chris F.

description:
Consistently good.  I come here all the time - almost always get the green pumpkin curry with prawns.  The mango salad is great as well.  the basa fillet is also exceptional.  come to think of it, i have worked my way through most of the menu items in addition to eating gallons of their green curry.  

I prefer this place and their out sunset location to any other thai place i have been to.
author: andrew p.

description: I love marnee! she is as fabulous as the yuummy food!
author: tricia w.

description: We asked Marnee Thai about the Chilean Sea Bass on their menu - they were aware that this is a 'red list' catch that results in a lot of by-catch (dead dolphin, turtle, shark, sea birds) because of the way it is fished, but they felt that because "customers like it" they didn't need to worry about environmental impact. We like the food, but we won't go back - EVERYONE needs to do their part for this planet.
author: Fran H.

description: I heard great things about Marnee Thai.  I've been there before but it has been YEARS.  My gf and I had a simple dinner consisting of the golden triangles for the app.  It was delicious!  Crunchy fried goodness leading to a soft savory pumpkin/potato mash inside.  We also had chicken pad se ew.  It was the perfect combination of salty and sweet.  The dish came with broccoli, which was strange to me, but maybe that's just me.  We also ordered the pad pring khing, sauteed green beans with chili sauce with beef.  That was also really good but the chili oil left a huge oily mess on my plate which kinda scares the skinny bitch in me.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I actually think it deserves 3.5 stars. We had two main dishes - Pumpkin Curry and Pad Prew Wharn. The pumpkin curry was a little watery - I like it a little thicker. The Pad Prew Wharn was great! I will definitely get that dish again. And I thought the serving sizes were good. Overall, I would definitely go back.
author: A M.

description:
My meal there last night was by far the most pleasurable meal I've had in the last 3 weeks! 

My husband and I got there at around 8 and the place was busy (we might not go there during peak dining hours...).  Had no problems with the staff--they were all courteous and helpful. We ordered the Tom Ka (coconut lemongrass soup), the angel wings, coconut pancakes, and the roti with ice cream.

Tom Ka: big serving, and the broth was everything I was expecting it to be (creamy, light, lemony, and slightly spicy and sweet).

Angel wings: f-r-e-s-h, fresh! Not spicy, but the wings were crispy and the sauce was delicious (if your not a big fan of sauce, ask them for less, or maybe to put it on the side for dipping).

Coconut pancakes: where do I start? These were sublime! They are more like a cream of rice and coconut custard with tender kernels of corn, thinly chopped green onion and cream of coconut. It was like dessert before dessert, but not quite. DELICIOUS!!

We ended our night with the roti with coconut ice cream: crispy, fried pancakes (think fresh, homemade funnel cake), drizzled with sweetened and condensed milk, and topped off with a big ol' scoop of creamy coconut ice cream. I could have floated up to the heavens after that dessert!

This would have been a great last dinner, but it wasn't, so I will return--and with friends!! The prices are friendly, the waitstaff is friendly, and the food is to die for!
author: alex t.

description: I came here around 7pm on a Friday night and it wasnt too busy when I got there, however 15 min later, the restaurant was full. There was a back seating room which was nice. My friend and I shared dishes which was the pad se ew and the duck red curry. Both were pretty good. We also go the mango sticky rice dessert. I think that was my favorite. I thought the food was good, however I didnt think it was the best thai food ever. It was good though. I would give it 3.5 stars. The service was friendly and we got our food pretty quick. The only con is that the tables in the back are really close to each other. I would like a little more space between tables, but thats just what I prefer. I would go back here if im in the area. I also would like to try their other dishes and it was difficult to review on just two dishes alone. Dessert was good, however the mangos weren't too sweet- but I blame this on the it not being mango season!
author: tracey l.

description:
Yummy, yummy! 
Of the two locations, I prefer...both! We usually look to see if the 'father' is working. He is an excellent cook. My friends tell me he wants to be on Iron Chef. Hope he makes it! 

Marnee Thai I feel is the best of Thai food in San Francisco. The quality of food is high on the list of eateries in the City. 

No microwaves like at Osha. All the sauces are fresh as is the Tom Ka. 
Love this place for the food.

When we have visitors coming to the City for a few days, this is one of the places to take them.
author: Martha G.

description:
I ended up moving to Inner Sunset and eating at Marnee Thai more often.  While they are still quite a good Thai place, the quality seems to be less consistent lately (for both dine-in and take-out). After more experiences here, I have to downgrade them to a 4 star but all told I'm still a big fan.

I love that the takeout portions are more generous than dine-in, but I absolutely loathe that they give inaccurate estimates for pick-up times.  They seem to always say "15-20 minutes" but I've showed up on time and had to wait another 20-25 minutes more until my food was ready.
author: Jared D.

description: Pad Thai is awesome and flavorful!  So was the fried rice that my dad ordered!  Will comeback again!  Did had to wait before sitting down at our table but that's a given. ;-)
author: Samson K.

description: Oh, if your asking me what think, I'll tell you my story! So, if you love Thai, you'll love this dream place. Its like heaven! The waitress was very kind and listened carefully to our orders. My boyfriend got the eggplant dish and it was delish!!! I got the green curry and oh was it good! Go there before it gets too crowded!
author: Layla J.

description: We ate here at 3pm on a weekday. I had Tom Kha Gai soup and it was very tasty but the serving bowl was not covered and the soup was warm, then lukewarm. Had to ask for it to be reheated twice. My companion had Pad Thai and it was one of the worst we ever had: It was soggy and covered in heavy sauce. Will not eat Pad Thai here again. Disappointed. Perhaps the real chef works the dinner hours.
author: Barbara D.

description:
We were in search of a great Thai restaurant and found the reviews for Marnee Thai...unfortunately, our culinary experience was below expectation for a restaurant so highly rated...painfuly disappointing.  I waited two weeks for a cool-down period and just had to post.  Maybe my experience was just a fluke, but maybe it is more common than you think.  We've been around the block with Thai food, been to Thailand, and have lived in areas with large Thai restaurant options, but Marnee is a place I do not expect to return.

Why the frustration?  Bland, micro portions.  Chose a classic, Kee Mao with chicken requesting very spicy...ended up with some bland noodles lightly doused in a tomato sauce with a drizzle of what could only have been Tobasco sauce on top...essentially the worst Kee Mao I've ever had.  A good Kee Mao should be spicy, have that wonderful oil seeping on the dish, and a delectable smoky flavor (must have been Norweigans cooking pasta in the back room since it was very bland.)  No such luck today.  Second entree, a curry with tofu and the one redeeming point here was the curry flavor was good, but oops forgot to put anything, but two small cubes of tofu.  Ended up eating dinner again two hours later due to severe hunger and also had that burning frustration from searching for parking in vicinity of the restaurant...all for not.

What was positive? Ambiance very positive, service was good, got in right away with reservation, and definitely others find it exciting...all adding to the experience.  If you're choosing the social experience or maybe trying more of the appetizers and don't need an actual meal it might just meet some of the expectations out there.

In the end, it is time to move on to another Thai restaurant. The Mad Yelper is still searching.
author: Mad Yelper X.

description: MMM!!! I love this place! The owner's son is such a great guy, and makes great suggestions if you're having trouble deciding. Here's the bit of wisdom that he imparted to me: get the "spicy angel wings" but with tofu instead of chicken wings... AMAZING! A DEFINITE MUST WHILE IN THE INNER SUNSET.
author: Kjeld A.

description: Not that Marnee Thai needs another rave review but this is truly one of SF's best Thai places!  I went there with friends on Friday and we got a bunch of appetizers and entrees.  Of the best were the Angel wings and fried egg rolls appetizers.  This is one of the best places in the city for Pad See Yew which I always order and my friend's duck curry was very good as well.
author: Carly P.

description: I am in love with the food here. The space is a bit cramped at times. Since returning from spending time in Thailand I have not found better Thai food.
author: Samee M.

description: Thanks for showing up! I've lived in Inner Sunset for 9 years and have been going to this place for about 5  of them. They have been and still are the best Thai in SF IMHO. I rarely eat there, rather prefering to take out. Call ahead, place your order and take it home thus avoiding the waiting issue and "pass over" rez problem. The people that own the place are really genuinely very nice and accomodating people.  It sounds like the TV show exposure is testing the limits of their ability to meet demand. They have another place on Irving and 22nd if the 9th ave location is overrun. Check it out.
author: Robert L.

description: Awesome prices, friendly service, and the food was great! I can't remember the exact name of what I got, but it was veggies in a spicy peanut curry sauce. The sauce was just right-- not too peanuty but not too saucy. Will definitely come here again.
author: Jade S.

description:
I love the angel wings! 

this is the best thai food in the city for me!

everything is excellent.
author: Torres F.

description:
Bring your hat and you will make friends.

My best friend and I ate here after an evening of paper hat making at the De Young museum.  Everyone at the restaurant was super friendly and very receptive to our colourful creations.

The food was top-notch with service not unlike a lightning-bolt.  Try the corn fritters.  I also enjoyed the prawn salad.  Oh and the coconut milk based vegetarian soup.

Scrumptious!
author: Sean B.

description: I thought I'd never dine here again, but after getting takeout, I just fell in love with the food again.  Never, ever dine in, but never, ever hesitate for takeout.
author: Maulie D.

description: Love the hot cakes, papaya salad, and mango salad (great kick).  The various stir fry dishes we tried were all excellent - good flavors, high quality ingredients, and fair portions. There are other good restaurants in the neighborhood.  But we don't stop there often, so when we do it's hard to pass up another opportunity to eat at Marnee.
author: Mary Beth O.

description:
Went for a late weekend lunch with a friend who had tried this place for dinner the night before. She liked it so much, she wanted to go back!

We didn't wait long for a table, though this place felt packed. We did wait a while to place our order, and we were so hungry! The waiter got it and we quickly got our first dish: avocado salad. This was a delectable combination of lettuce, shredded mango, avocado, cilantro and a very tasty dressing.

We ordered really well. Other patrons kept asking us what our dishes were.

Three of our items came off the specials menu and those were the shining stars: avocado salad, sea bass cooked in banana leaf with a curry mouse (amazing) and hot cakes (not even sure what those were but they were like a savory dessert).

This place is good enough to go across town for with prices the same as any other Thai place.
author: Ste B.

description: The angel wings are a must have if it has improved...spicy and savory.  This is his signature dish.  The fresh rolls are another must have...granished with a sweet but savory sauce.  Do you love spicy and calamari, then you gotta try the calamari salad.  These are just my favorites...still working in trying everthing on the menu.  Dessert...gotta have roti with ice cream and sticky rice and mango.  By far the best Thai restaurant in SF.
author: MickYee M.

description: Good green curry. Nice flavorous Thai ice tea.
author: Kai H.

description: The food here is on a different level. Growing up in a small chocolate store, I learned that the most important ingredient is love, which Marnee has in spades. Chai and May are salt of the earth kind of people, they make of curries and spices themselves. Their flavorful menu is both delectable and visually stimulating. I am a regular here, and will continue to be as long as I'm in the area.
author: George C.

description:
I came here for my 22nd birthday because I have beeeen cravin' thai food for the longest time so I yelped the word 'thai' in sf and this was the first one that popped up with great reviews!! So I decided to give it a try and I'm glad I came here.

I rolled in with about 7+ heads and luckily we didn't have to wait long on a Saturday night (since we were already short on time to make it for cover at Mr. Smith's) annnnywaaays...my friend and I split the angel wings appetizer, pad thai, and green pork currry!! My friend jon and I are quite the man-eaters and so I was bummed out that we couldn't finish all three dishes, meaning that they give generous portions! The foood was awesome,  the angel wings were a little too spicy for my taste but still hella good, and the service was also great. Our waiter came without being asked when water needed to be refilled, helped us take our group picture, asked if we were okay--basically the usual service they get paid to do. 

But honestly, the reason why I loved this place is  because it is truthfully maaaah lifesaver. I didn't get a single hangover, didn't yack myself to death from the million shots of chilled vodka I took later that night. Lesson learned: it's great for absorbing alcohol?? haha
author: jessica w.

description: Woohoo! Angel wings!! The service was great as well. My hunny and I come here often and the food is always good. The best angel wings in the nation. ahhahah
author: Maria C.

description:
after my trip to thailand, i couldnt eat at any "thai" restaurants. all were not even CLOSE to being authentic. then a friend took me here. 

at number one, the lady of the house keeps a watchful eye on everything that goes on. ive never had a problem there with the wait staff. 

only one thing, i did have to ask them to make the tom yum goon a bit more thai-ish. the trip before, it wasnt eye tearing, mouth burning, youre gonna hate yourself tomorrow morning hot.
author: Euge L.

description: Food was okay.  I think it's hyped up!  Tried the famous chicken appetizer but it was disappointing.
author: Moko R.

description: Honestly, I've had way better Thai food and for cheaper... maybe it was because I came with a group of people for our "banquet" and the food was probably mass produced, but the pad thai was nothing special and neither was the green curry I shared with my friend... also, the restaurant was small and they scurried us into their "private" area in the back and the floor was so slippery that I almost kept tripping in my heels.
author: MJ S.

description: Pumpkin Curry so silky I want to bathe in it. I am all over this dish. It's technically a special, but they always have it. For $10 you get your choice of meat, prawns, or tofu with that, in a take-out tub that will feed three easily. They offer brown rice, too! YUMM-Y! The service is warm and fast and take-out is incredibly convenient. I have to take off one star for the utter mockery they make of chicken satay--fatty, lifeless pieces of dead bird marinated and grilled up to an unsatisfying floppy texture. Ugh! As devestating as that is to my peanut-sauce-loving ass, they score WAY high with that pumpkin curry. And at the end of the day, when my tummy's full, that's all that really matters.
author: Autumn K.

description: Good Thai food, not the best, but good. I had the Panang pork. The pork seems a little overcooked and and dry. Their soup was good, but pricey for what it was. Service was very good.
author: Jonathan C.

description: I haven't eaten much thai food before but I wanted to give it a go. I decided on this place to try. The service and atmosphere was nice. I ordered the beef curry and rice. The prices were more expensive than I'm used to but I think it was worth it. At first, I thought the portions were small but after eating it all, I think the portion was just right. I was full but not bloated. The curry was very tasty and I loved it.
author: Kevin K.

description: This is the best thai place I've been to so far ever since I moved to the city. I always get the Pad Thai though and it's fantastic. Large portions and tasty. I should really venture out of my realm and try something new on the menu. I'm sure it's just as superb. The prices are very reasonable too.
author: Jennifer H.

description: The food at the place was good. The only thing is that if you go there, don't get take out because they put your food into really small take out containers and whatever doesn't fit in (which is a lot) they throw away. Me and a friend were very disappointed when we looked into our containers later and found that more than half of the food was gone.
author: Mike W.

description:
I've been a patron forever. I've never tried this location as I've always gone to the Irving location. However, the food was pretty fantastic..

Angel Wings- Super duper
Papaya Salad with Soft Shell Crab - Yum-o
Mango Fried Rice- Good
Pad Thai - Best I've had in years
Green Curry - Spicy
Egglant - Slimy but delicious

I had to knock a star off since they sat us by the entrance and there was a freaking humming sound that hurt my ears.

Service was good as well.
author: Brian W.

description: While in SF, my family and I came to grab dinner here. Everything was delicious and tasted really authentic. The waiters were all attentive and accommodating. Prices were moderate. I personally wouldn't recommend this place for big groups because it's pretty compact, so I'd suggest you guys call to make an order/take-out in advance. Nonetheless, I'd definitely come back!
author: Peggy C.

description: Pad Thai & Angel Wings. Get it. You will not be sorry.
author: CC M.

description: Unanimously considered a winner in this neighborhood for good reason; the food is great. You're going to wait and the service is not perfect but you will forget all about that after your first taste. Thai food is always magical but this place stands out.
author: Dan K.

description: I love this place. So good!!  The food has a unique flavor unlike any other Thai restaurant I've experienced.  I love their Larb Chicken Salad. I'm a big fan of the red curry too. The service in the restaurant can be a little questionable. I often have to wait a long time to be served, but as soon as the food arrives, I forget all about the wait. It's worth it.
author: Carey L.

description: Marnee Thai the best Thai food in the city. All of the awards are well deserved, I haven't been to the second one but I know if it's of the same caliber as Marnee Thai one then I know what's up. Well the food ya um freaking awesome every dish is made with love and you can tell by the presentation of the food, two items I always get the green papaya salad which has the perfect marriage with spicy sweet in your face and the freshness of the crunchy papaya peanuts are key this is very healthy as well, the other is the crab fried noodles I am addicted!! like I said anything you pick will be absolutely outstanding
author: stevo A.

description: Best Thai food in San Francisco...period.
author: Carter Y.

description: My first time here was soon after returning from a two-week trek through Thailand, so my expectations were low . . . I anticipated Americanized versions of the dishes I'd enjoyed in both upscale restaurants and hole-in-the-wall joints during my vacation. I was more than pleasantly surprised, I was ecstatic. This is the real thing. You can't go wrong with anything, but the assemble-it-yourself stuffed spinach leaf appetizer, spicy green papaya salad, chicken satay, any of the noodle dishes, and prawns stir-fried with garlic and pepper are tops on my list. A dessert of mango with sticky rice helps offset the heat. Beautiful, intricate fabrics, woven hangings and pictures of royalty always evoke memories of my trip. I'm told if Marnee herself is in the restaurant, you might get an impromptu fortune telling, and definitely some guidance on what to eat.
author: Gourmet G.

description:
After the TV program on KQED we were expecting a lot but we were very disappointed. I would give it 1 out of 5 stars. The fresh statay was good, but the tom yum (my benchmark for thai restaurants) was mediocre. Plus, they completely forgot the soup and people on both sides of us were served long before we were, even though we arrived at the same time. I had to ask 2 times for the soup.

The curry dishes were unremarkable. I have eaten lots of Thai food, in Bangkok too, and this did not come close, no matter what people say.
author: george p.

description: My neighborhood go-to Thai. It's places like Marnee that make my city-defector friends now in the 'burbs lament that they can't find any good thai food. Not cheap but certainly not expensive, fast, and so awesomely delicious. I'm a curry girl and their red curry with prawns and bamboo shoots does it for me every time. Also great panang curry, sautees, noodles, salads... Can't go wrong.
author: Madie S.

description: Solid Thai cuisine.  Hits the spot.  Husband says it's the best Pad Thai he's ever had.  I don't want to be too repetitive, considering the 400+ reviews for this place also giving Marnee 4 stars.  So here are some food highlights:  Avocado Salad--surprisingly lovely appetizer; nice balance of creamy avocados, fish sauce, prawns, mint/basil, onions, lettuce.  Pad Nor Mai with minced pork--very flavorful and spicy and will have you wolfing down lots of steamed rice with it (in a good way).  Pad Kee Mao (my favorite Thai noodle dish)--noodles had great texture, nice and spicy!
author: Beth K.

description: Another excellent Thai place...everything we had was really fantastic, I am a huge green curry fan, and it was really very good here. Yum.
author: Amanda D.

description: I miss living in the Inner Sunset for a few reasons, the biggest is Marnee Thai.  I probably save a fortune, because I've stopped inventing reasons to reward myself with dinner there.  But you?  You have accomplished (something, anything) with style and deserve Thai samosas (pumpkin!) and massaman curry.  Congratulations to you.
author: Shannon V.

description:
I've eaten at the other Outer Sunset location quite awhile ago, which is decorated a bit nicer, and it was famous for their award winning Pad Thai. They are not shy about telling their patrons about that kudo.

Since then, I've bounced around at other Thai restaurants and not eating anything too exotic from the typical offerings on the typical menus.

Saw the Check Please! show and got excited to "check" it out again at the newer location near to Le Video.

The line outside is as fierce as Burma Superstar, but got lucky and partnered up with another pair to share a table and were seated within a few minutes. C'mon... a business should NOT be penalized because it is swamped with customers aka fans.

There is definitely a "buzz" in the atmosphere at this place and it seemed like a huge foodie pow-wow gathering.

The selection of authentic Thai dishes is impressive and is backed up with truly enjoyable flavors and taste.

Believe the hype, prepare for the wait...there is a reason for it!
author: Rod A.

description:
This was a huge disappointment. Save for one appetizer, the general take from our party of four was mediocre. 

I had ordered a vegetable dish "Thai spicy", which means as spicy as possible. When I asked why it wasn't at all spicy the waitress simply stated the cook forgot my request (?!). The second try was only a little spicy, and the vegetables were equally overcooked. I gave up.
author: Jackie H.

description: A-OK.  My friend found a sticker still stuck on his bell pepper in his roasted duck dish.   Now say that 3 times, fast.
author: Jane N.

description: AWESOME. Been here a dozen times and never had a bad experience.  Everything is good. Some of the best Thai noodles I've ever had and they are very consistent.
author: Nick C.

description: Probably the best thai food in the city. The noodle dishes are incredible and the curries are amazing as well. The steak for the curry was perfect and unique (similar to a delicate stewed beef). Highly recommend the Pad Kee Mao. I get it every time and it is always delicious. The fried banana with ice cream wasn't great, but that could have been an off day. Overall incredible.
author: Tim G.

description: I've reviewed so many awesome Thai restaurants that it's starting to become a bore, and Marnee is no exception; they execute perfectly what I expect from Thai cuisine. Everything about their noodle and curry dishes is spot-on and ingredients are fresh and flavorful. I'd recommend Pad Kee Mao if you're in the mood for noodles, or the red curry will always be a win. Atmosphere is cozy and their location is ideal -- right next to Golden Gate Park.
author: Seth F.

description:
My wife and I dined at Marnee Thai with two long-time SF residents who had heard of the restaurant's great reputation.  We were all familiar with Thai cuisine, and all of us had been to Thailand before.  We had reservations, but even at 5:30 PM on a Sunday in the summer the restaurant was very busy, with people waiting outside, and we had to wait about 20 minutes.  The food was worth the wait!  All agreed that it was some of the most delicious Thai food that we have had.

The staff was incredible, remaining calm and pleasant despite a stressful situation.  The receptionist was a delight, keeping us regularly informed of the progress on getting a table.
