The servers were quick, and they were pleasant and helpful.  Our order came amazingly quickly, and the servers were readily available when we needed a refill of the ever-delicious Thai iced tea and a Singha beer.  The angel wings were a surprisingly delicious appetizer.  The massaman curry chicken was an excellent and very tasty not-so-spicey dish with some crispy basil thrown in as a pleasant surprise.  The pad thai was among the best, and a silver noodle plate and a salad with some fruits in it were delightful.  For dessert the mangos and sticky rice were great, and the roti with ice cream was an unexpectedly delicious treat.

Marnee Thai is an exemplary San Francisco hole-in-the-wall restaurant--one to which I will invite touring friends who want to see why San Franciscans love their city.  Tight quarters, but easily made up for by the food.  The treat cost the four of us just $90.
author: Ed S.

description: Only the best Thai in town in a town full of Thai. Try the curries..red,green or yellow..all good.  I would not consider going anywhere else when craving Thai.
author: Bleep S.

description: Went here based on Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. Ordered the Angel Wings, Basil Chicken, hot and ice tea with rice. The Angel Wings marinade was full of flavor and the quantity was more than enough for two. The Basil Chicken was also very favorable and the only way to eat it is with rice. The decor was pleasant with a straw theme. The service was decent too. Will definitely recommend and visit again.
author: Jason N.

description: There are a lot of good Thai restaurants in the city, but this one tops them all.  Everything is good on the menu.  The food is made by one of the best thai chefs in the country.  the pad thai is a must as it is an award winning dish.  if you cant decide, take the advise from the staff, they are very friendly and knowledgeable.  tell them what u like and dont like and they will pick the right dish for u.  when u finish your meal, order a roti with ice cream.  nom...nom..nom
author: Ozzy C.

description: Ordered the Beef Panang, and I do have to say I've had better...WAAY better. The flavor was decent, but the meat's texture was like a chimechanga. (Gross right?). I wish i ordered a noodle dish, my friends ordered the Pad See Iw and Pad thai, both of which looked good and were tastey! My new Thai philosophy is when in doubt, order noodles...
author: Chynna Y.

description: I got some take out from here a couple of weeks ago, based on a recommendation by a friend. The high quality of the food, as well as the authentic decor inside the restaurant impressed me and I definitely have to go back here again. The prices were very reasonable, and service staff was extremely friendly. I got my takeout during the week, and when I stopped in to pick it up, the place was packed, so reservations might be a good idea.
author: Michael H.

description: Holy Shit. Yum. If you get the Panang Beef and the noodle dish on the menu just below the Pad Thai (I'm pretty sure it has the word "Poo" in it, but don't let that scare you) you can't go wrong. I was drunk with scrumptious food. And since when is Thai beer so delicious?
author: Rachel B.

description: Oooooh...i LOVE Marnee Thai!  Everything I've had there is so good.  The decor is nice....service good, maybe a little overzealous.  YUMMY pad thai, and, I only have two more words for you:  ANGEL WINGS.
author: Eileen H.

description: Has anyone visited new location of second Marnee Thai? Try their banana blossom salad there, it's delicious!  Curry sqaush chicken is another of my favorite. Everything there is as good as the first - Basically, Marnee Thai without the crowdness of the first location.
author: Angela H.

description:
AMAZING!!!

there can be a line at times, but once you're seated, food comes at a reasonable pace. Its a calm atmosphere with kind waitresses! Their food is amazing and perfectly sized. I have always left full. They have an amazing eggplant dish as well! I suggest to go with a group and order several dishes and share! That way you can taste the different flavors!
author: Christina K.

description: Growing-up, nothing could make a Cold War dinnertime standoff erupt into full-scale hostility quite like green beans. On one side, were the parental units with a righteous belief in the goodness of all things vegetable and a knack for authoritarian rule. On the other, was a utopian yours truly with a die hard commitment to the demise of the evil green empire. So bad was the green bean scourge the mere sight of those things used to mean an all out declaration of war. But as it turns out, they aren't so bad after all. Five gigantic stars to the peacemakers at Marnee Thai.
author: kevin w.

description: This is my favorite Thai Restaurant. I do not eat curry but this is the ONLY place I will eat it! Red curry at that! Try their Panang Beef...it's delicious. and their desserts are savory and satisfying.  The place can get pretty busy, but it is very well worth the wait. The staff is always friendly and the food comes out in a timely manner. I think the ONLY downside I see here is the parking/location. You know how the Irving area is. But don't let that stop you!
author: Ginger M.

description: My boyfriend and I came here at a pretty off time, around 4pm but by the time we finished our late lunch/dinner, the place was bustling. We started off with tom yum soup was pretty good - though I've only seen this soup made with straw mushrooms, they used a pretty standard looking one, it was fine. We also had these noodles with crab and a red curry, which were both quite good. It was more than enough food for the two of us, we had plenty to take back. Attentive service. It wasn't like the most amazing best Thai I've ever had (I live in LA and frequent Thai Town on a regular basis) but I still enjoyed my meal here. I would definitely come back.
author: Lisa K.

description:
What's not to like? This place has some of the best Thai food in SF.

Had pad thai w/shrimp, just right. Coconut-based soup w/chicken & the chicken was NOT dried up like at many other places. Prig king chicken w/string beans, nice flavor. Beef w/one of the curries was tender & the bamboo shoots tasted fresh vs. out of a can.

Fried bananas w/honey was good -- the honey itself tasted high quality, free flowing and sweet.

The only downside was that the owner wasn't there that night b/c she often gives you a face-reading/fortune whether you ask for it or not (at least she did in the past when I ate at their other location).
author: D L.

description: Love the Miang Kum appetizer.  It's so good we order two each time.  Food is 5 stars (yummy), and ambiance is 4 (a little crowded).
author: Yvonne C.

description: This is a teeny tiny restaurant but it gets packed like nobody's business. I can see why. The food here is very delicious so you better be hungry. I love their Satays. I had their Pad Thai for dinner and wow. If you eat here, make sure you are ready to take home leftovers. The portions are HUGE! We also had angel wings for appetizers and those were very tasty but very messy. The place has a cozy authentic feel of a real hut (it's as big as one too LOL) and the owner is a sweetheart. Call ahead for reservations.
author: Michelle G.

description: I have eaten here a few times and I've always seen Chef Marnee in the kitchen. The pad thai is excellent and so are the spring rolls and chicken. It is a small restaurant but still I'd recommend this place for a date night.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Be careful if you're a vegetarian here.

I eat fish but not meat and ordered a noodle dish with prawns. When the dish arrived, it had pork in it instead of prawns! I noticed this right away - fair enough, I guess "pork" and "prawn" sound similar - so I wasn't particularly worried and the server took it away to cook up another dish. Problem was, the dish came back just a few seconds later and it seemed to me that there was still meat in it... I got my husband to try it and he said it definitely tasted like meat - we even saw (and he tasted) some pieces of meat that could not be mistaken for anything else. At this point I lost all confidence in the meal and couldn't eat any more. 

I was really disappointed as I have read many good reviews about this place, but I certainly won't be going back.
author: Laura J.

description: This place is fantastic!  The service was a little slow, but what else do you expect from the best Thai place in San Francisco?  the chicken satay wraps were delectable, the sweet and sour chicken with pineapple=yummy, and the pad Thai was a joyous experience!  I will NEVER go to another Thai place again!
author: Sarah A.

description: Never eaten in since this is a take out place for me, but the food is pretty good.  The pad see ew is my favorite.  They even know my name by my telephone number when I call ahead!
author: Tim T.

description: I sometimes secretly like it when I'm standing outside a restaurant trying to decide whether or not I want to go in and someone who works at/owns/is a family member of someone who works at or owns the restaurant comes out and convinces you that you should eat there. Anyway.. spicy angel tofu somethings... I don't know what they were, but I died afterword.. in a good way.
author: katharine s.

description: Oooh I love Marnee Thai.  We pick up our food, but they always deliver.  It is fresh, delicious and even well packaged to go.  This is one of our must haves as often as we take out.  We both love to cook, so it's not that often, and when it is it better be good.  Believe me, you won't be disappointed ordering from Marnee Thai in the Inner Sunset!  When we dine out, we go to the outer sunset location.  In our opinion, 2 restaurants are not enough!
author: Erika B.

description: I like the cozy setting of this Marnee than the one on Irving.  My friends and I ordered 4 dishes, and we ate everything.  1) it was because we were very hungry; 2) the portions are kind of small.  The raisins in the mango fried rice gave it a unique sweet flavor, which contrasted well with the savory part of the dish.  I liked the chewiness of the wide noodles in the pad see ew, but they may have been slightly overcooked because it was soft.  The pad thai was a bit too sweet and tangy.  Eggplant with ground pork was flavorful, but it was too salty.  Overall, the food was pretty good.
author: Cindy H.

description: I love going here when in San Francisco -- lots of great places in this area ...the food is great and the people are very friendly -- and very reasonable -- I would be a regular if I lived in the neighborhood!
author: Tom D.

description: Spicy Angel wings, Penang Beef, Tom Yum Goong...I love it all. Their food is even better than what I've tasted in Bangkok. Perhaps that says something about it's authenticity.
author: L R.

description: I used to work right across the street from this 9th Ave location and when we're too lazy to go further, we'd order from here.  We've never been disappointed with their food.  Our office favorites were the fried corn appetizer and the Chan Pad Poo.  Yes, something w/ Poo on the end.  It's a noodle dish similar to Pad Thai, but with crab noodles and it's got a bit of a tangy taste to it.  The only 2 complaints I have about this place is:  #1 - horrible parking (which is out of their control) and #2 - inconsistency in the flavor.  Sometimes, the noodles will be on the sweet side, other times it would be a little too oily.  But overall, it's not bad.
author: Selene K.

description:
cute, cozy, little treasure in inner sunset.

i've had my share of thai food in many different places, but marnee thai is absolutely delicious. i'm sad that i've only been here twice out of the many times i've visited sf. 

this time, i ordered the beef pad-see-ew, which was SO delicious.
the beef was really tender and juicy, unlike some thai places that overcook their meats, making it dry and tasteless. the noodles were cooked just right, not too soggy.
my sister ordered their yellow curry with chicken that was really yummy as well. their service is pretty good. refilled my water when it was empty without having to ask. 

just great.
author: Sharon O.

description: We live nearby and it's our favorite place to get Thai food, the food is exceptionally good so is the service. Sometimes it gets crowded, and we don't mind as we crave for nice authentic Thai food.
author: Irina E.

description:
Service -
great. was seated promptly with friendly staff

Food - 
pretty standard fare, small portions for average priced meals.
Tried the corn fritters - bland but OK
Had the green thai curry pork with rice - great veges cooked perfectly. Small portions again
Tried the yellow curry fish - OK, blandish

The meals all came out over about a 10 min gap- but there were 6 of us

Overall, I would try them again and try some of the specialty dishes
Maybe next time ask fro the meals to come out around the same time
author: C Y.

description: I always get the same two dishes whenever I eat here - the chan pad poo  (similar to pad thai, but spicier and with crab meat) and the avocado salad.  The chan pad poo's  noodles are always cooked perfectly - not quite al dente, but with a nice chewiness to them.  Although I'm not sure if it really has crab in it (if so, it's in miniscule pieces), the flavor is amazing.    The avocado salad is almost like having a dessert but with fish sauce in it - I know that sounds gross, but it works in this salad.   The staff are always courteous, albeit a little harried.  My only complaint is that I wish they'd get their carpet shampoo'd.  Sometimes this restaurant has a weird off smell.
author: ML P.

description: Truly the best Thai place I have tried here in the city. I am so glad they are so close to my house too!! We went here for dinner with my BF's dad and were not disappointed! For three of us, we ordered enough food for five. We had 5 appetizers and 4 entrees! Everything was even better than the last! We had a spring roll made with shrimp that was just perfect. Chicken satay with a great peanut sauce. Soft- shell crab ( I tried a bite, but I dislike soft-shell) that the boys said was great. Golden Triangle with a veggie filling. Then we had duck, sea bass with black pepper and garlic, yellow chicken curry (a little heavy with potatoes), and I had a mixed veggie dish with peanut sauce. We only made it out of there with a SMALL box of takeout! We also had two hot teas, coconut juice, and 4 beers. We made it out of the door for $109! That's incredible! Every dish was so full of flavor and layered with the right amount of spice! Even writing this review, I want to go back to try more. Service was a little lack luster as we waited without even a greeting for nearly 10 minutes and throughout the meal, our server was busy at other tables. I don't mind though, we were happy and full.
author: Jena D.

description: I saw this place on Check Please Bay Area and I ordered everything that they recommended.  I was blown away.  The angel wings were perfectly crispy and sweet (finger linking good), the hot cakes were a piece of heaven on earth (nothinng like you will ever have) and the panaang pork was melt in your mouth delicious.  We also ordered the rice noodles with crab, which is basically like Pad Thai with crab. It had the perfect amount of crab with a bit of sweet and spicyness to it.  It was just my boyfriend and I and we left nothing on the plates.  We are definetly coming here at least once a month.  The 35 minute drive from Oakland to one of the busiest parts of SF is worth it.  Oh yeah, and I recommend that you make reservations and request to be seated in the back of the restaurant.  The front part is loud and super packed where you can barely move, whereas they have a hidden room in the back where the ambience is spacious and a bit more peaceful.
author: Cheryl T.

description: Delicious food, friendly and efficient service, and very generous owner.  Thank you for providing an excellent place to enjoy Thai food.
author: robin l.

description: I've consistently had good experiences at Marnee Thai. I enjoy the whole in the wall feel and the authentically Thai ambiance. The menu boasts a wide selection and most importantly tasty entrees. I"m personally a fan of the Pad Thai and the different curries. The angel wings are exceptional, too. Marnee Thai is a great place to take a group of friends or a date if you're looking for good Thai food. Highly recommended.
author: Alex G.

description:
the best, most addictive and caffeinated thai iced coffee i've ever had

seriously, do not drink this @ night!!

good veggie selection
and overall very nice
angel wings (some sort of chicken wing thing) are a specialty appetizer
and definitely delicious
lots of choices
author: Eva S.

description: The thai food here is the best! nuff said. Go eat there!
author: Laura C.

description: awesome thai food.  i was however disappointed that my dish was NOT spicy at all when we specifically told the waiter we wanted our dishes to be extra spicy ...
author: Janice M.

description: came to this 9th/irving marnee the first week it opened and was disappointed so i've been going to the original one in the outer sunset. my friend chose this one for his birthday party of seven, and while they sat us at a long table, they split all the dishes in two for us which was very convenient. the food was tasty, and i actually liked the decor here more than the thai hut decor at the original. however, the original has the owner who gave me a very nice face reading once. when the bill came, the birthday boy grabbed it so i said, "thanks, happy birthday." our waiter overheard and came back with a gong and ice cream, first turning off the lights and striking the gong to get the whole restaurant's attention to sing to my friend. he thought i tipped off the waiter on the way to the restroom and was mad at me for the rest of the night
author: Diana B.

description: Marnee thai is just to die for and the spice is nice! I have been going to this place since it opened and never had a bad meal. The pad kee mao is my favorite noodle dish of all time. The appetizers are all just delicious its so hard to pick a favorite. It is crowded and it can get loud and cramped inside but all worth it. The fried banana dessert is sweet and the coconut ice cream puts it over the top.
author: Nadia N.

description:
As a Thai, I am very picky about thai food. I would say many dishes in Marnee Thai have a reminiscent of Thai food I had in Thailand. Especially  Thai style noodle dish : 

Pad thai and Chan pad poo are very authentic. It is delicious. I have to admit that this is one of the best pad thai I have had after I came to the US. Kuay teaw kai kua (Stirred fried noodle with chicken) is also very incredible. 

Even if some of the dishes in the menu are not that special. Pad thai and their Thai style noodle dish already made this place worth paying a visit once in a while.

I would really recommend this place for everyone who wants to try real authentic pad thai.
author: P O.

description: Sour eggplant, slow service. Why are people so enamored of this place? Oh yeah, the angel wings. When an angel gets their wings, this place gets another star.
author: Suzanne R.

description: I don't get what all the rave reviews are about.  We went there with a group from my work yesterday and were sat in the rear of the very tiny restaurant near the restrooms.  I couldn't wait for the food to come out because all I could smell was urine....gross!  The papaya salad was the best I've ever had- the perfect blend of spiciness and sweetness and they added iceburg which gave a different layer of crispness.  Next we had the chicken satays, these were also very good.  I'm not much of a curry person but I must say the curry wasn't too overpowering with just a hint of coconut milk. I always base my impression on the pad thai, my favorite thai dish.  I was very disappointed.  The noodles were gummy and my coworker pointed out a ketchup flavor. Not good at ALL!  I wouldn't come back here based on the pad thai alone not to mention the turn-off of the pee smell.
author: anne m.

description:
yelped this place, close to the golden gate park

ate here and enjoyed it.  they are yelp friendly
had good customer service, & had some food that yelpers recommended and enjoyed the food immensely

will go back again!
author: Pang M.

description: I am very picky about my Geng Khiaw Wan Gai (Green Curry with Chicken).  Marnee Thai, on top of the excellent service, serves up real quality Thai food.  Their papaya salad (som tum) is real great--order it non-spicy, and then ask for the ground chili powder to adjust the heat level.  Impressive list of vegetarian dishes as well!  Some items, however, felt they have been catered to Western pallate.  You may even get your fortune told by Marnee herself (she's awesome!)
author: Grace M.

description: So I was getting a burrito next door and decided to order a Pad See Ew for my daughter and I wanted to see why this place has so many rave reviews.  The pad see ew was very mediocre and the price was $$$$$$$$$$. I've had better ones from places that don't have as many good reviews.  Can't wait to have some much better Thai food when I go down to LA!!!!  The staff was nice though.
author: Katniss B.

description: I just ate some Marnee Thai for dinner and DAMN was it good. Speedy service, too, and just enough for two people + some leftovers. I don't think you can go wrong w/ any of the dishes, but don't forget to wash it all down with a Thai Iced Tea!
author: Anika K.

description: I appreciated their distinctly Thai flavors going on their salad and their fried roti dessert. But something is starting to feel processed about the presentation. LIke they are drunk with their success and the portions will give way to fancier plates, and the exotic names on the menu won't be because it's in their native tongue but because they figured fusion just might be the way to go after all. Just please don't.
author: Jean W.

description: Marnee is definitely a jewel in the inner sunset area, right near golden gate park.  The food is extremely fresh, light and flavorful !  I had the sauteed prawns with pineapple and a homemade sweet and sour sauce.  Also I highly recommend the Avocado + Mango salad to share for two !!!  The atmosphere is fairly casual and pretty traditional.  The service is very good as well !
author: Katie L.

description: Excellent food, but they lose one star for their poor, poor service. They know their food is good and when they deliver your food, they just plop it on the table and turn around. They advertise themselves as authentic Siamese food. it's kind of worth it, though, the food is just great. The employees dress in traditional Siamese wear.
author: Justin R.

description: Where should I begin?  The service was great and fast- if anything, a little overly solicitous. The food was delicious too, and they definitely have the best thai iced tea I've had so far....reasonably priced....good atmosphere, especially for such a small space, it doesn't even seem crowded.  I can see myself becoming quite a regular here.
author: Barbs J.

description: Banana blossom salad is my favorite at this place...decent Thai food and cute setup.
author: Yan M.

description: Great yellow chicken and potato curry, string beans tossed with flank beef, and eggplants with ground pork were the most delicious. The pad thai was a bit bland. I've had better. Nice warm Thai tea to warm up the body was a good compliment. This was certainly a good meal for about $15/person.
author: Oanh N.

description: Marnee Thai is wonderful!  I really love the Phad Thai, but you can't go wrong with any of the dishes!  Marnee Thai is a total hole-in-the-wall type of Thai restaurant; if you aren't looking, you can miss it in an instant.  Granted, I have absolutely no sense of direction, but it doesn't reach out and grab your attention.  Go for the food (which is great); overlook the service (which is just ok).
author: Matt P.

description: This place is just as good as the original.  I usually like to come here for lunch though because I love noodles and that's when most of the noodle dishes are served.  Be adventurous and try something besides Pad Thai, if you haven't already.  There are other noodle dishes that taste just as good or better.  I actually prefer Pad Kee Mao, for the stir fried noodles category.  Try the noodle soups too, also delicious.  I think they have the best Yen Tha Fo.  Don't forget to end your meal with dessert!
author: Sandy J.

description: Ok first I just want to give a shout out to the bus boy who was on point with the water!! I got the Pad Kee Meo w/ Chicken and it turned out to be pretty darn spicy. I'm pretty new to spicy foods so it was an experience to remember but I have become a big fan of Thai as of recently thanks to my GF. I usually am pretty basic with a soup or some fried rice but this time I was convinced i needed a change and this was the perfect entree. I've never been to Marnee Thai prior to this and I just want to say the service was excellent and i am now a big fan of both this restaurant and Pad Kee Meo. I'm proud to say i can do spicy, all though this might not be as spicy to most. I'd say it has a very cozy environment nice for a second or third date.
author: Richard R.

description: I consider this as the best thai restaurant in the city.  the papaya salad is perfect - spicy and fresh.  The corn cakes are yummy and so are the fish cakes.  You can't go wrong with the curry dishes.  So good.  I think I've been there like 20 times.
author: Julia H.

description: Everything about Marnee Thai strikes the right note to me - the small, lively space, the everpresent line for a table, the inexhaustible, effervescent May manning the host stand and tables, and the always delicious food.   I've sampled many dishes here and they've all been flavorful and perfectly balanced.  In addition to all the standby Thai dishes, there are a few I haven't seen anywhere else (Miang Kum and the Spicy Angel Wings - not sure those are so authentically Thai but my lord are they good).  If May and Chai are around, they'll probably make at least an appearance, and May might even "read" you and your group, as happened on my recent visit with family from Oklahoma.  Graciousness and amazing eats.  I always leave planning my return.
author: Jes H.

description:
I was really excited to come here after reading some reviews from my fellow yelpers. So after watching a movie at the metreon my driver (Cindy W.) took me to this place on a Sunday around 545pm. 
The service here we had was excellent much like a king and queen having servants LOL. No really service was great too bad I couldn't say this for the food we ordered today.
First on deck: green papaya salad. Not spicy enough for me and Cindy and adding chili pepper didnt make it any better. Jenny K. If you're reading this your papaya salad is so much better. I'm used to scarfing down this dish like there is no tomorrow since spicy food makes u eat like a vacuum. 
The Hok Mor (not sure of the name) came next  which was was similar to a quiche; consisting of curry paste/snapper/spinach. It wasn't even hot. Took a couple of bites and was not satisfied and happy that the pad Thai had just arrived.
Pad Thai looked great filled with lots of tofu and chicken. Took a few bites, added chili pepper and chili powder but still disappointed on how it tasted. The noodles were too rubbery/chewy/thick for me and didn't quite live up to the pad Thai from Krung Thai in San Jose.
I don't like leaving leftovers and if I'm really full, I'll ask for a doggie bag. But for every dish today we had leftovers and didn't want to bring any home. 
The only other plus for this restaurant was the sticky white rice and coconut icecream; my only recommendation.
 I may or may not come back since I live in Fremont. If not then I'll be trying the new Bangkok cuisine in my 'hood!
author: Maynard M.

description: This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant. The food here is unbelievably good, and it is consistently good. My favorite dishes are the Pad See-ew, Tofu Praram, Beef with string beans, the Corn cakes appetizer, and any of the green curries. The service is not great when they are busy, but the waitstaff is friendly and helpful. Sometimes you just need to ask for stuff, and they are very accommodating. The Thai ice tea is as it should be, which is to say, excellent.
author: Kathleen B.

description: Very good Thai food.  That's what every single placket and award says on the walls when you arrive, so it must be good.  Well it's true.  Very fresh ingredients, great full flavor and none of the usual take out gut bomb you get from other places.  Will need to actually sit and stay to get the complete experience, but a great find.
author: JP Z.

description: Creative, attentive, cheap.  And tasty, too.  I haven't been this suprised in quite a while, folks.  That addictive roll of rice dough, sweet sauce, cukes and fresh asian veggies alone will bring me back.  Put it this way: after a quick bite here with friends, I kept thinking, I really need to come to Inner Sunset more.
author: MScott S.

description: I went here for the first time last friday evening, and I must I quote myself saying "this is probably the least relaxing meal I've ever had"....but wow! was it the most  yummy Thai food I've ever had.  Since we were starving and the restaurant was packed, we requested the empty bar seats and were sat right away. Yay!  It was pretty awesome to sit overlooking the loud & chaotic kitchen (very clean, too) and have all our dishes come at us from all angles.  When there was some confusion over a dish, it was fixed right away---great service.  Absolutely LOVED the Artichoke/Banana Blossom Salad, the Pad Thai (buttery noodles..mmmm) & the creamy Pumpkin Curry (w/ tofu & veggie's)!
author: Sierra S.

description:
value, quality, TASTY. the combo is all there. 

get the miang kum and those rice cake apps that come in individual little mini pans. heaven. 

their pad thai and pad see ew are tasty numbers as well.
author: who k.

description: Best Pad Kee Mow ever! I often call ahead and pick up dinner on my way home from this wonderfully tasty thai restaurant. Have never eaten there - it's always packed - but their pickup is just as good. I just wish they delivered!!!
author: Lucinda N.

description: Very authentic Thai cuisine. I was invited to dine here with a very good friend and found the place quite enjoyable. The ambiance was excellent and the wait staff was attentive (they always filled your glass with water). The food was delicious. Loved the Miang Kum, and the Pad Thai. Parking was also quite a breeze.
author: Bill D.

description: Great Thai food with an awesome atmosphere.  A little out of my neighborhood, but I will definitely  make a trip back.
author: Matt S.

description:
Too sweet!

I ordered Thai Iced Tea but it seems they put too much condensed milk! Also was Angel Wings, they are too sweet either! 

Satay Wrap was just fine but too little for the price of $10.95! I spent 23 bucks but still felt not full, even I am a girl.
author: Lei J.

description: I thought all thai food was the same-pretty burnt on it, actually-but Marnee was a little bit new. Their tom ka gai was a huge hodge podge of unexpected and glorious yummies. And you feel like you are eating in a tropical hut with grass leaves on the ceiling.
author: Deva G.

description: Pad kee mau was gluey with overcooked noodles in a too sweet sauce. The tasteless soft shell crab was overfried in oil that desperately needed changing, and the accompanying avocado mango salad was sodden. Too bad, because the menu looked so promising.
author: Karen S.

description: Too good to miss.  Too good to describe.  Corn fritters for my 3 year old, Singha beer served cold cold cold, pumpkin curry savory and hot, avocado papaya salad makes mouths water.  Follow it all with mangoes and sticky rice with coconut milk.  Dang.  I'm going tonight!
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I love Thai food and was extremely excited to make a stop here BUT I was very, very dissappointed. 

The pad-thai was bland and the only thing I enjoyed was the thai ice tea. 

The service was terrible (maybe I came here on a bad day?). We stopped by on a late afternoon and we were the only guests along with a couple a couple of tables down from us. My friend and I were dress casually in jeans, a t-shirt and our chucks and the couple were dressed a bit more uppity than us. We walked in with smiles and asked for a table for two and the waitress tossed her hands indicating we could sit anywhere. She didn't even greet us or crack a smile. She just had this dull, rude expression on her face--like she didn't want us there or something. We BARELY GOT any attention while the couple got asked questions like "How's the food there? More water, sir?" And when they left, they said goodbye to them; whereas when we left we didn't get ZIP! What the hell is going on there?? And they got my friend's order wrong and overcharged her (that goes to show how much attention they payed to us, huh?) I felt so disgusted by their service I didn't finish my food and left a dollar tip ( they didn't even deserve the dollar but, eh, i'm nice). 

I just wanted to yell at the waitress for treating us so poorly. And I am not exaggerating either. 

Personally, I know I won't be making a trip back here--at least not to this location.
author: Van D.

description:
I went there after reading all these rave reviews on this site. I was disappointed: the food was nothing special. The only thing which I and three of my companions really liked was Tom Ka Gai.

The duck in red curry and  Pad Kee Mao pork were OK,  Chilean sea bass was dripping fish oil and had strong fishy taste, pretty much ruined. Pad Thai shrimp was not good at all either. 

But the worst thing was the service. The server was very rude, tried rushing us through ordering (there were just three tables occupied in the entire restaurant), suggesting that we just go for specials instead of considering dishes from the menu.. Then when we tried to get four cups for the three person serving of Tom Ka Gai it was again a problem - three cups max! Trying to understand her when she was reciting the options was impossible because of a strong accent. 

Overall the attitude reminded the proverbial "Soup Nazi" from Seinfeld. I certainly would not recommend this restaurant - maybe if this lady waiter is not there.
author: Vadim B.

description: I agree on the angel wings. Place was great overall, and reasonably priced. We paid $20/pp with 4 people and no drinks. Will definitely be back.
author: Fred S.

description:
This is Thai food in a casual setting done right, which is rarer then one might think.

Although prices are a bit high, relative to "average" Sunset prices, the extra dollar or two is well worth it.  Excellent appetizers  are a good start if you wish a sit down meal; the tod mun and imperial rolls are both delicious.  The entree list is extensive; I have a friend who swears by the curries.  Personally I prefer noodle dishes; every one I've had has been superb.  Even the vegetarian options are good enough to make me reconsider which protein I'll have liberally dumped on my entree.

Great food, fast service, and pretty decent prices.  Marnee should be the baseline by which all Thai eateries in San Francisco are judged.
author: John B.

description: This is by far my favorite Thai Food place ever.  It's pretty quick even when it's busy and I can't leave without ordering the spicy, crabby goodness that is Chan Pad Poo!  If you are ordering one of the curry dishes just ask for extra curry, the server will look confused but the chef will oblige!  I took my dad here once who has been to Thailand numerous times and he was surprised by the authenticity!  It really is dee-lish, next time you're jonesing for Thai go to Marnee.
author: Brenda L.

description: I LOVE soft shell crab.  If they put it in a burger with pickles, onions, cheese, and ketchup, I would probably still love it.  So when I saw that there is an option to add the soft shell crab onto their papaya salad, it was an instant sell.  BOY was it good.  Their papaya salad, though, is spicier than most I've had elsewhere.  But good thing I had their yummy Thai iced tea to help with the spice (FYI...the milk in it neutralizes the spiciness).  Their pad thai was definitely one of the best I've ever had, and their angel wings were definitely a lip-smacker.
author: Liz C.

description: Been here 2x so far, and I definitely plan to return.  Food is amazing.  I've had (or plate-theived) the: pad thai, yellow curry (extra spicy), chicken satay, pad see ew and tom kha.  All were incredible, the pad thai being my least favorite, the yellow curry being my favorite.  I love the decor of marnee thai, especially in the back room where there were a ton of orchids.  Dim lighting and not-too-cramped seating (definitely not "spacious" but decent) all made the experiences good.  Both times the service was just ok. But I blame it more on being understaffed, rather than negligible.  Zero waiting on both visits.
author: Courtney N.

description: Good, but not worth all the hype around it.  I have to admit that the food is fanstastic, and the pad thai is the best I've EVER had (outside of Thailand, that is).  However, "psychic" Marnie can sometimes be a bit too overbearing.  Back when I was living two blocks away, I could deal, but I wouldn't make a trip out to the Sunset just for Marnee.
author: Serena Y.

description:
Writing a review of Marnee Thai is like writing about the family restaurant with Mama keepin' watch over EVERYTHING that goes DOWN. I mean she knows all. Spoo-kay!! One night I was passing by the restaurant with food from another Thai establishment that shall go nameless to insure their protection.  Marnee looks up through the window with that "Just saw you on America's Most Wanted" look on her face. I knew at that moment there was/is NO OTHER Thai place. She gave me the stare down. I had left the gang. Was she going to come out with her crew and make me go through the Marnee "beat down" again? I felt dirty!  So I let time pass before going back. Thought I'd give the place a break. Then I missed the taste of Pad Kee Mao with duck! The Green Papaya salad! and yes...Marnee herself. When I went in she gave me that look "Uh oh here comes the 'beat down.'" But no. Welcomed with open arms. The prodigal son returnith. "I haven't seen you for a while, what happened?" Translation: "Don't you ever leave Mama if you know what's good for ya bi-ach!!" 

5 duckets for the long history Marnee and I have. 5 duckets for Marnees food. 5 duckets to keep me family ass from gettin' wooped.
author: Johnny C.

description: This restaurant provided my first taste of Thai food and I am now hooked. I've tried the spring rolls and different pad but it is the pad thai which really gives this place a shining star. Great food and good takeout prices.
author: Chris J.

description: Just got back from there. My girlfriend had the shrimp pad Thai and I ate the Pad Cha Talay. She said that her Pad Thai was good. My meal was certainly tasty. I let the chef spice it as he pleased, which came out quite nice. Typically, places over spice so that you can not taste the actual food. With my dish I could taste every distinct piece of seafood. The presentation was excellent and the service was great. Only 4 stars because I'm not a huge fan of Thai food on the whole.
author: Erik S.

description: I had heard so much about this restaurant, especially their Pad Thai, and I wasn't disappointed.  There was a bit of a line to get in, but the wait wasn't too bad.  Go early if you can.  The Pad Thai was great, as the noodles were of a very good texture.  The angel wings were very good as well.
author: Pilan C.

description: Went to Marnee Thai after seeing the Musee d'Orsay exhibition at the De Young.  I had heard great things about this and wanted to try it for lunch at 2:00 pm.  The service was dreadful.  The menus were thrown onto the table by the waiter.  We had asked for the luncheon menu which he never brought to us.  We flagged down the waitress who brought 1 luncheon menu for 2 people to read.  The restaurant only had 6 people in it so there was no shortage of luncheon menus.  We both ordered the Pad Thai with shrimp.  The food was not evenly distributed with one plate having much less food than the other.  The Pad Thai was delicious and they did return numerous times to refill the water glasses.  Food is 5 stars however the service was just 1 or 0 stars.  I was surprised how unfriendly and the lack of even a hint of smile from the wait staff.
author: Stan W.

description: Came here for dinner and this place got a nice atmosphere to it. Next time I come, I won't be the lonely guy at my own table lol I was hungry so I got the curry and pad thai. yum yum! If you like super spicy, here it is!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Thai food at its best!

Quite often, when I, as a skinny, pale white dude, ask for "extra spicy" at a Thai, Indian, or other endemically-spicy-cuisine restaurant, I can almost see the staff's eyes glaze over as they make the food maybe 1% more spicy, lest the delicate honky's head explode and he run screaming, like a decapitated chicken, from the restaurant, thus depriving them of revenue. This, however, is not the case at Marnee Thai. My dining companions (one of whom loves spicy food in all its iterations, the other of whom likes heat in moderation) ordered the Pad Kee Mao, spicy. The dish came out figuratively glowing with glorious heat. So much, in fact that one of my companions couldn't stomach it, while the other consumed it sparingly. Happily, this left me with almost an entire plateful of Pad Kee Mao, which I eagerly devoured. The other dishes were extraordinary as well, including the red curry, the Masaman curry, the golden triangles, the pad thai, and the tom kar gai soup, all of which should be washed down with a Singha, which they serve perfectly frosty.

So what keeps it back from a 5-star rating? The place itself. It's cramped, narrow, and woefully understaffed. The servers try valiantly to accommodate the large crowds that inevitably show up, but with such an unworkable space, there are always long lines and you're constantly rubbing shoulders with and overhearing the conversation of your neighbors. I'll have to try the original Irving Street location and see if it's any better, atmosphere-wise.
author: Chris T.

description: I fell in love with this place from the very first time I went.  The pumpkin curry is super good, its got that wonderful curry flavor with a hint of sweetness from the pumpkin.  The vegetarian dish we ordered was also very good, I forget the name.. but it had eggplants and those mini corn looking things.  Its usually packed but its never too long of a wait.  The for desert the roti with coconut ice cream it super good =)
author: Melody M.

description:
the food + service is good!
we ordered: 
papaya salad which was good.
fish cake was alright.
red curry pork was spicy and good, but I've had better curry in San Jose.
and 2 other main dishes that i cannot remember.. i didn't order it. =P
overall, the place deserves a 4 star for both food and service. 
i just wished the place itself was a bit bigger. :)
author: Tu N.

description: I use to love this place - so much so that I didn't write reviews about it because i wanted to keep it a hidden jewel, but the last two times I went, the food quality has changed.  I hope it's just a fluke, but the pad thai was flavorless and all I tasted was ketchup and the Spicy Angel wings were over cooked and flavorless.
author: M W.

description: Went there tonight, and I would say it's very ver good -- but not amazing. My friends and I had the special summer rolls (spring rolls), pumpkin curry, some kind of noodle dish, and green curry chicken. Green curry chicken was not as spicy as I requested, but after loading it up with chili sauce I was happy. :)  Nice, friendly service, good on the water refills, reasonable. If the food were spicier and the annoying women next to us weren't obsessviely talking about thier fiances and how they must have a black-tie wedding, and think lowly upon people that "rough" it in the outdoors, I would have given it 5 stars. Perhaps the next goaround. :)
author: Kristi D.

description: What can I say this by far the best Thai restaurant !! Angel wings, and Chilean sea bass with garlic sauce!!  delicious!! with jasmine rice!!
author: Shirl C.

description: I don't even know where to start except for the fact that this place is off the hook. My co-worker and i ventured out here to grab a quick bite before going back to a meeting. she raved about how amazing their food is. When we got here the staff was nice and gave us time to look over the menu instead of breathing over us like some other places. We had their angel wings and mango fried rice. Holy moley! the wings were drenched with this spicy and sweet sauce that gave it an amazing favor! i'm a big fan of pineapple fried rice and their mango fried rice just got me hooked. the favor is indescribable. i will definitely come back especially after that meal!
author: Lynn P.

description:
Average at best.  Doesn't compare to Lemon Grass at all.  The Yellow Curry with Chicken had nasty pieces of grizzle in the meat, and at least half of the meat without grizzle was dark.  Also too much cinnamon flavor.
The PadKraPow was loaded with shrimp, but they were unflavorful and tasted frozen.  But the worst part of the dish was that there were 0 veggies with the dish.  We had 8 shrimp in sauce with no veggies.
The mango black stick rice was by far the highlight of the meal.  Very good.
The brown rice was also done well.

All in this is the 3rd time I've been here in 1 year and I'm done.  It's never been great and continues to be small portions and very avg.
-Shawn
author: Shawn D.

description: I love Thai food and this one is up there as creme. You might go deaf with the lady yelling in your ear the orders to the kitchen but the food is worth going deaf.  The Pad See Ew is one of the best I've had.  The BBQ duck was very tasty.  The only negative thing I can say is that we had a table for 2 and for all the food we ordered, there wasn't enough space on our table.  FAT BOY!!!!!!
author: Key C.

description: Great Thai food! Came here with some family (group total of 7), so we ordered a bunch of different things to all try. Also, they were able to take our large group in just 5 min on a busy evening, so that was nice. Just a warning though, I like spicy food, but when they say spicy they mean SPICY.
author: Jordan H.

description: Pretty good thai food.  The pad see ew is not oily at all and has good flavor.   Their curries are very flavorful and have the perfect consistency.  I like the thai iced tea, which is not as sweet and syrupy like some places.  The service is great, very friendly and efficient.   This is my place to go when I am craving Thai food in San Francisco.
author: Jen C.

description: Just had a delightful late lunch here (too late for the lunch specials): Thai pork meatballs (appetizer), a small cucumber salad, and a dessert of mango with sticky rice.  The combination of tasty food with terrific service and a delightful atmosphere explains why this place has received so many 4-star reviews--deserved, in my opinion.  Because of the odd time of my meal--about 3:30 PM--there were not that many tables taken, so I had an opportunity to observe another diner who mentioned to the waitress that although he could not find fault with the preparation of one of his dishes, it just didn't appeal to him.  The diner said that he would be happy to pay for the dish, however.  After taking the dish away and conferring with a supervisor, the waitress returned and offered the diner the option to order something else without being charged for the dish he didn't like.  While service like this used to be commonplace, it is no longer, so it's most heartening to see that it's not totally extinct!
author: David L.

description: GREAT Thai food and great service. I love the noodle dishes. Usually not a huge fan of Pad See Ew over Pad Ke Meo, because the former is so bland, but at Marnee, it's all WONDERFUL. I love the angel wings! You've GOT to try this place!
author: Megan S.

description: The food was excellent, best Thai place I've been to in a long time.  I found the staff extremely accommodating and very attentive.  May is very personable and will greet everyone who enters their doors.  She's a wonderful host!
author: A P.

description:
This is my favorite thai place in the city.  I must disclose that I am what you might call a pescatarian and my boyfriend is a vegetarian, so our sampling of the menu doesn't cover everything.  However, we both love this place and can eat here frequently without getting bored because there so many delicious veggie friendly items on the menu.

One warning - your food might not all come out at the same time. Given the size of their kitchen, though, I am impressed that they are able to turn out so much food so quickly.  But if you eat family style, like we normally do, then it's not a  big deal.  It doesn't impact my opinion of the place because the food is so freaking good.  The presentation of the food is nice and the people are friendly.  And did I mention they have awesome food?

My personal favorites:

Angel Wings with tofu (or chicken) - the chili sauce combined with the crispy basil leaves is really tasty and hard to resist.  I have forced many out of town visitors to try it and they are always impressed.

Any Curries - we usually get yellow curry with pumpkin and soy protein, which has a really nice texture and is a great alternative to fried tofu (sometimes that's  all you can get as a vegetarian and thai restaurants).  The curry is very flavorful and their yellow curry in particular is the best I have had anywhere.

Chan Pad Poo - noodles with crab, egg, and a sweet chili sauce.  Mmmm...
author: Katie B.

description: I was really expecting more from this place I guess.  It's not that it was bad, it just wasn't that good, especially for what the bill came out to be.  This area is one the epicurean capitols of the city and I had always passed this place and wanted to try it and finally did.  The interior was rad and the staff was very professional and dressed pretty cool but when it came to the food it was lacking.  I really like Thai food especially curry but the chef's special yellow curry with scallops that I ordered spicy just tasted flat.  For one thing it had way to much egg in it and to follow that it was not spicy at all.  The tom yum soup was good but not above average.  After looking around and seeing the entire place packed with white people lilke myself I got the feeling that they cater thier food to the crowd that goes there and if I can't get spicy then it isn't Thai.  It seemed very dulled down and whitewashed to please the patrons.  Like I said good but not great.
author: Sin F.

description: Loved this place.  Very casual restaurant with open kitchen and great food.  For 2 people we ordered 2 appetizers (beef satay, corn fritters), soup and pad thai with shrimp.  All dishes were excellent.  Soup was too spicy for my taste but next time I need to remember to ask for mild.  Food was delicious, portions are big enough and service was attentive.
author: Marina F.

description: Very good food.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I walk by all the time and think "nah."  But then my boss and I had lunch there a couple weeks back and now I think "yeah."  Wonderful green papaya salad - and HUGE.  Everything else had that fresh, tasty quality.  All the flavors were distinct, there was none of the muddiness/muddledness you get at some Asian restaurants.   (You know, where you suspect there is just one sauce that they use for everything.)
author: darla s.

description: When this place is good, it's really good. But sometimes, it's just okay. Despite the inconsistency, I continue to go there hoping for the really good.
author: Kathryn T.

description: Awesome thai food in the Sunset...place is pretty tiny but adequate. I never liked anything with coconut in it (I hate coconut) but their coconut milk chicken curry is fantastic, I actually dumped all the sauce on my rice after the chicken was gone.
author: Cliff C.

description: Its not a huge place, and its fairly popular which makes for a loud atmosphere.  I give this place the credit it deserves, because the food was good, well presented, and was fairly quick service considering the number of customers they had at the time.
author: Michael C.

description: best thai i have ever had. very consistent, never had a bad meal here before.  i love the yellow chicken curry and my b/f loves the sea bass. we always order the avocado salad and the hot cakes for appetizers. love love love!
author: Abbie A.

description: Walked in here with a friend about ten minutes before they were set to close and they insisted on seating and serving us.  The food definitely slipped a LITTLE bit, but what do you expect when they're trying to close the kitchen?  I'm sure I'll find something to complain about at some point.
author: Alex Z.

description: Very good food & service, however people were packed in the tiny space (which felt like a dungeon with low ceilings). Group of us ate family style, so I'm not sure exactly what I ate. I was a bit disappointed that they did not have brown rice option.  The best part was that it was extremely affordable.
author: McCracken C.

description: Not impressed. Came with a group of 4. We all couldn't finish our plates because it was tasteless. I ordered the guey sew por, first time I have ever ordered non spicy thai noodles, and the salt they added was too strong. I guess if thai noodles aren't spicy it doesn't taste that great. Service was okay but not prompt. It took a while for the waitress to come over and take our order, she was more helpful with the table next to us where they wanted to order dessert. When we received our food, they forgot to give one of my friends utensils.
author: Robin L.

description: Some of the best Thai food I've had in the Bay Area.  My old roommate grew up in Inner Sunset and has been eating here for years, and I can definitely see why.  Pretty small place, but it's always been worth the wait.  Great pad thai, great curry, great praram, great imperial rolls.  No complaints.
author: Janina M.

description: This place was recommended by one of my co-workers and we just happened to be in the area and gave it a shot.  It was very good and tasty.  I did go at an odd time for lunch (3PM) and the food came out within 5 minutes of ordering.  Definitely coming back here again and taking some friends and family over too.
author: Tim L.

description: An OK meal overall, but not the best thai I've ever had. Had the thai veggie samosas which were OK, the red curry with beef which was a bit greasy and a chicken wok dish which was the best out of everything we tried. Still, the food was nothing special. The place itself was very noisy and the space was very small and cramped. May try the one on Irving and give it another shot...Not a memorable meal experience.
author: Chris D.

description: This  place has great food, mostly the Angle Wings. I have been there a countless number of times and the service is great. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was for the way the place looks It doesn't look pleasant inside or out, I would have never went here unless someone would have told me the food is good. Also, they give really bad water. Other than that the places is great, and the food is amazing.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I feel bad for not loving this place, because so many people seem to.
PARKING: Good luck
INTERIOR: I did take-out, however the decor was interesting and looked like effort had been put into it -- and I liked the overall vibe. Long narrow place, with kitchen in front on left half of the galley and small tables down the right. Tables were right next to each other, so I'm sure you'd get chummy with your neighbors. Went on  Sunday afternoon and it was full. (The primary photo for this listing does not look like the interior of this restaurant -- perhaps it is the other location? This place was much more cluttered/casual.)
FOOD: Ordered two things: Summer Rolls and Mango/Chicken Fried Rice. I'm a fresh spring/summer roll snob. I order them everywhere and have high standards. First impression: for $7, I should have gotten more. There were two pretty small rolls... smaller than Safeway's, which would have cost $4.50. They were also rather loosely rolled, so that they fell apart as I tried to eat them and dip them into the sauce. Not impressed. The fried rice was delicious -- however it was outright oily. I've never had oily fried rice before. The flavors were great... a mix of savory and sweet (with the mango), with a nice amount of zingy spice... and the portion was huge. I feel like it was very indulgent though for me to be eating something so oily, so I'm not sure I'd order it again.
SERVICE: Both of the folks I dealt with couldn't have been nicer.
BOTTOM LINE: These two items, plus a couple bucks tip -- had it be a $20 dinner. I'd probably have given it four stars if the total had been $15 and/or it weren't so difficult to park.
author: Zoe H.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Marnee Thai! Absolutely delicious, fresh and delicate flavors of all dishes, a family-run business with incredibly gracious and friendly wait staff, and they make wonderful recommendations based on your tastes and preferences.  And you have to try the Homemade Hotcakes (on the special appetizer menu) they are sweet and savory and to die for.  The Basa fillet with garlic and pepper sauce is also one of my favorites, bursting with flavor!  I live in the neighborhood and I confidently stand by my claim that it's THE best thai food in San Francisco (and there's a LOT of thai places here!)
author: Dominic M.

description: This place is great. Wonderful food, even better service. The atmosphere is casual, but very cute.
author: Shoshanna C.

description: Great service...wonderful food. Mango duck fried rice is superb.
author: Jacob K.

description:
Best Thai food on the West Coast! I recommend it to everyone who has a taste for thai food. Delicious authentic thai food presented on elegant dishes at a reasonable price. Perfect for a night out with your significant other. 
The service was very courteous and the food came out quite quickly. I recommend the avacado salad, pad thai, chicken fried rice, egg rolls, and corn cakes. The rotee with coconut ice cream is to die for! A must visit if your in the Bay Area! Once you go to Marnee Thai you won't want to go anywhere else to get your Thai food cravings on!
author: marvin v.

description: The best Thai food ever...with different items to choose from on the menu and off the menu, the traditional to the adventurous. Marnee really stands out as one of the best in the city by far. The food is usually fresh and good, the thai iced tea is also really yummy. I need to go back VERY SOON!
author: Gina R.

description: This place is SOOOOO Good. My boy Alan took me here a few months ago. It has great ambiance and atmosphere. The noise level isn't too loud so you can have a conversation at the same time it's not so quiet you have to use your 6 inch voices. Their Angel Wings are really good. Sweet and Spicy! Check it out!
author: Rana A.

description: If you want Thai noodle dishes, this is the place to go.  I still prefer Sukhothai for curry dishes and appetizers.  They are also very accommodating for large groups in their back room.
author: Kelan T.

description:
Fantastic...just fantastic!

Keep up the authenticity and the good work.
author: Scott G.

description: I met my bf here :) But that's besides the point, I love there Duck Pad Kee Mao!  Hands down.
author: Jboogie L.

description: Always a solid dinner choice when in the 9th and Irving region. Just had the beef salad, corn fritters and panang curry with beef. The beef salad was a little disappointing, but the panang curry was surprisingly good. Solid service. Not too loud.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The chicken pumpkin curry was absolutely awesome with the right amount of kick to it. I never knew you could add pumpkins to curry so it was a revelation! Ahhhh...the pad see poo (I think that is what it was...it was wok fried thin rice noodle with crab meat). It tasted delightful. We were there over lunch but this noodle portion was huge. Small cosy restaurant with efficient staff. :)
author: Topazskye L.

description: The deep fried crispy tofu is awesome! The perfect blend of crispy outside, silken inside with a spicy yet sweet sauce. Marnee does an excellent pad se ew as well. So close to the park too, perfect for a bite before or after a nice walk.
author: Will A.

description: This is a favorite thai restaurant.  The food is always really good.  The owner can be loud and a bit pushy but I think she means well.  She's not afraid to voice her opinion, so if you want some recommendations, ask her and she'll tell you!  I like the decor in the original Irving location better than 9th Ave.  Parking can be a pain at both locations so be prepared to walk a few blocks.
author: Stacey L.

description: Really great food! I shared a samosa appetizer (amazingly crunchy outside with curry goodness inside), pad thai (my first tangy pad thai with perfectly cooked noodles), and a coconut chicken dish (well balanced with a little kick of hotness). Definitely will be back for more!
author: Joy C.

description: Maybe dining in is better than takeout? I don't know...maybe I was just biased because my last Thai experience (at Thai Time) left me really satisfied, and I had similar high hopes for Marnee Thai. I actually got the same dish here that I had at Thai Time, a Thai style fried rice, and it was just dry and bland. My husband got a chicken in peanut sauce served over wilted spinach, and his, too was just not great - the spinach was so stemmy it was hard for him to chew. I won't rule it out for future meals, but they'll have to do a lot better for me to improve my rating.
author: Beth T.

description: I've always liked this place.  i recommend the tom kai gai soup (sorry if the spelling's bad), the chicken satay, and the chan pad pooh. Also their green papaya salad is good.   I've never really loved their curries.
author: Jeannie P.

description: great thai option in the irving area.  I would give it 5 stars only because i've only had great experiences there.  it really isn't a 5star restaurant, but the combination of convenience, location, food, service, and price...pretty hard to beat in the sunset district.
author: Roy N.

description: I love the Pad Thai at this place! I've gone there many times for it. Actually it's all I've had there but I really love it! I eat the whole dish. The price is good too. Take the N subway and when it turns south on 9th, get off and head north. They are great!
author: David A.

description: Service is great and if Pad Thai is your thing, try it with the silver noodles here and you won't be dissapointed! One of my top picks in the Inner Sunset and for good reason. The food is great here and much better than a lot of other joints in the city.
author: Douglas L.

description: The food and service are great here.  I always end up with the woon sen soup and barbecue chicken.  It gets a little crowded so I end up ordering to-go.  As far as thai places in the sunset, I think the food here is better than the rest.
author: Bruce B.

description: The best I can say about the food is that is affirmatively mediocre.  The eggplant is terrible: gray and unappetizing, hard and greasy.  The pad thai is okay but you better like clumpy noodles and be up for a scavenger hunt if you like egg or tofu or anything other than bean sprouts.  The imperial rolls are edible if undistinguished.  All in all, it was a waste of money, which is a shame given the many excellent Thai options in San Francisco.
author: robert l.

description: The food here is phenomenal. Authentic, flavorful and unique. The atmosphere is steamy and cozy, and the service is extremely attentive - they take a zone defense approach to waiting, with a new person constantly attending to check on the table's needs. When we leave this restaurant, we sometimes feel like we are floating on air. Don't know if it's the flavors, the tight quarters, or the general ambiance, but it's a really neat Thai experience, lacking in pretension.
author: a m.

description: Great food and fast service. Good yellow curry and beef salad.
author: Julia G.

description:
This was the second birhday celebration we had there.  Chai and his team did a great job.  We met with Chai on Monday and went over the menu choices.. our party of 21 had very diverse eating habits,  some are vegans, some vegatrians, some allergic to certain  foods and they provided us with many choices for  all who were invited.

Thanks to Chai, Kazz and May or is it Mae?  You made my birthday special!!!!
author: don b.

description:
oh dang. mmm.

chef specialty pork dish, pad thai, prawns. 
i was quite surprised. pretty darn good.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
it is my favorite THAI restaurant to date in SF. 

i highly suggest:
*Spicy Angel Wings WITH crispy tofu -- it's available either/or, but you can ask the waiter for the combination. it's VERY flavorful. i love the chili-garlic sauce. it's been really hard to find spicy angel wings that top Marnee Thai's.

*Tom Ka Gai -- this spicy coconut soup is HELLLA GOOOD! i didn't think it would like it that much since it's coconut milk, but i was so wrong! it's my ultimate fave!

*Roti with ice cream -- try this dessert. it looks like a pancake. it tastes like funnel cake plus there's ice cream on the side. a perfect ending to dinner!

...the one thing that sucks is the parking. hit up the restaurant before the dinner rush because it can get pretty crowded. they also have 2 locations. the one on irving is much smaller + cozier
author: krismarie b.

description: The angel wings and corn fritters are spectacular, but they don't compare to the dessert Roti.  The yellow curry is also a hit.  Just like a good inner sunset-er I try to pimp out this restaurant to everyone I know. The only bad part is now the wait can be a pain, but if you go early you're golden!  All hale Marnee
author: Chris W J.

description: Step into the tinder box of kindling that is this restaurant.  Angel Wings.  Tom Yum soup.  Then pay your bill and go elsewhere for the main the course.  If you venture to stay, don't order anything with bbq pork.  It's really Chinese char siu they nicked from any of those Chinese deli's on this street.  Very dissapointing.
author: K W.

description: There are two locations. I highly recommend the Irving Street location. The food taste better and the portions are slightly more. You can't go wrong with the shrimp pad thai and chicken wings that they garnish w/ crispy basil. mmmmmmm.
author: Gwen D.

description: I love thai food and this place did not disappoint.  I'm particular about my pad thai, which most places can't seem to get right, but this place does it well.  I gave a - 1 star for the server that was yelling orders across the room while we were trying to hear each other over the crowded room.  The seating was really tight and she could barely make her way around.  Otherwise, everything we tasted was yummy.
author: Blu n.

description: 4.5 stars. The food is excellent (the pumpkin curry is to die for), the staff is nice and helpful, and the prices are reasonable. I took off half a star because the seating is a little cramped, which can be uncomfortable.
author: Ramon E.

description: Hands down the best thai in town. Delicious, fast, friendly service. and sophisticated taste. Recommended highly.
author: bora o.

description: Love it, love it.  I will always get crap from my friends because I will always order the green curry chicken and mango sticky rice.  Absofuckinlutely amazing.  I can eat that combination every day of my life and be the happiest little girl in the world.  Sure, I have encouraged the others that I eat with to try different things, but my favorites are already decided.  The pad thai really is phenomenal here, and the tom yum just above average.  I have yet to try the angel wings, but have heard rave reviews from someone who has failed to let me down yet.  There are other Thai restaurants in the area, but this is hands down the BEST.
author: Meredith N.

description: We first heard about it on the show "Check, please" Some of our favorites? Spicy Angel Wings and ending with Mango with Sticky Rice.  Nice stop before walking to the museum. Drawback is that there aren't many tables.  I noticed that there were a lot of take out orders.  The second time we did take out and ate in the park.  On a nice day, a great alternative.
author: Karen L.

description: it felt super cold eating here that day but the pad thai was good like i remembered and came in good portion. my friend's thai fried rice was really flavorful and delicious but was much smaller in portion than mine. we ordered two thai ice tea which i found way too sweet. each dish cost $7.95 which is a bit on the expensive side. i would like to try chabaa next time to compare.
author: Helen L.

description: Been going here since 2002. Great for take out or dine in. Dining in is a little cramped, but the price and food is worth it. Gai Somoon Pria and Pad Kaprow are my favorites right now. Have not tried the store on 9th, but probably just as good.
author: Paul L.

description: good food. feels something like a hallway. focus on the food and it's fine.
author: Fzarond K.

description: The best Thai food!  Stopped by on a busy Sunday and had an amazing lunch.  Highly recommend the Nam Tok, homemade hot cakes and mango fried rice with shrimp.
author: Nancy L.

description: Do not order take away from this place. We ordered the scallop thai curry, a bean noodle dish and egg plant. The Scallop dish was terrible, the bean noodles were clumped (I can make better bean noodles myself) and the egg plant dish was tasteless.  I payed 50 bucks for this food and I feel I've been robbed.  I should have returned the food but what a hassle driving across town to do that.
author: A P.

description: The food here is really delicious! I came here for lunch recently and got the angel wings, hotcakes, pad see yew and the duck noodle soup. The hotcakes were so tasty - I ate 4 of them! It was pretty crowded on a weekday for lunch so I could just imagine how crowded it gets on the weekends and for dinner. Definitely better than your average Thai restaurant.
author: Keromi K.

description:
I love Marnee Thai.  It's not the best Thai place in the city.  It's not even the least greasy Thai place in the city.  But I love it.  And why is that?  Because I love their pad kee mao.  

According to the menu, pad kee mao is "rice noodles, pan fried with choice of chicken, beef or pork, chili, garlic, tomatoes and sweet basils on a bed of lettuce" and all that adds up to delicious.  Greasy, but delicious.  Marnee herself recommends it.

I've probably had it 20 times and I'd have it 20 more.  

Btw, Marnee Thai has two locations.  I think the 9th Ave location is a bit cuter (same tables as when it was Avenue 9) and the tables are slightly less crammed together, plus it has a back room that I bet could host a big party, but parking is easier at the Irving St location.
author: Joyce T.

description: The food was very good, wide range of dishes to choose from.  I would and will eat here again.
author: Alured P.

description:
How we got here was a random recommendation by a Thai gentlemen I met while adventuring around town; he said that Marnee Thai was the best in the city. We were happy to seek it out and had higher expectations.

The Chicken Tom Ka (?) and pumkin thai samosas were a great start. Wow.. great start. Downside was the samosas were brought out first and were somehow only just warm. We were halfway through them and suddenly the soup showed up. Okay, we're cool.. wait, the soup only just warm, too. 

We're getting concerned at this point.

Mostly through our soup when they attempted to take it away since the food had arrived. Whoa -- I'm not quite ready! But we quickly finished what we had to get through and the food was placed. Green curry with eggplant, basil, chicken.. and we asked for "spicy". The food was warmer but had only just enough heat to be considered "medium" in my book. Beyond that, the flavors and textures were just right.

In fact, all flavors and textures were good-to-great. HOwever, the overall just warm temperatures of the food, combined with the sense we were being rushed (ironically, they took my card to pay the bill and were forgotten 'cause the hostess(?) got called off to a large party that was there shortly after us .. we waited 10 minutes to check out)  didn't sit well. I might try it again cause I feel there was much potential (and hopefully warmer food) in our future with them. However, it may be awhile. Maybe our problems were due to the large party (I think I overheard them mention it was 36 people). Didn't even want to stick around for dessert.

Bummer!
author: Mark P.

description: Best thai food in the bay area no contest.  Nuff said.
author: chris w.

description:
I have been to this restaurant a couple of times.

Their decor is OK ...not outstanding(it is not a birthday party restaurant).

I think their garlic/ginger/tofu stir-frys are outstanding, but I have not had a very good experience with their curries.

I live far away from this restaurant...i wudnt travel to eat at this 
restaurant...but if i m in the vicinity..i wouldn not mind eating here...
author: Pooja P.

description: Worst service. Tiny portions. Ok food. Cmon yelpers, keep it real- this place ain't all that!
author: J K.

description: We had a group of 8 people.  All of our dishes were very good.  Notably, the Pad Thai and Spicy Angel Wings were excellent.
author: Jeannine L.

description:
NEVER! NEVER WILL I EVER GIVE U BUSINESS MARNEE THAI! 

I've promised myself to never go to Marnee Thai again! their service is horrible. They used to have better quality food and better service but they've really gone downhill. It's really crammed in there all the time. I can hear every couple's conversation next to me when i'm sitting at the table because the tables are so tight next to each other. They're very pushy about what you should order from their menu. And lets be real, this isn't a fine dine place like Fleur de lys for it to have tiny artistic portions, it's just another homie restaurant on Irving and yet they're frugal about their portions. 

I, as always, ordered the peanut chicken dish (i forgot the actual name) and my friend ordered deep fried crab over a bed of salad. In all fairness, their food usually tastes good. BUT THAT NIGHT I WAS GOING TO THROW ALL OF OUR DISHES BACK AT THE OWNER'S FACE! first off, they are not graceful at timing to bring both dishes at the same time- 15 minutes after my friend got his dish, mine came along. 

My friend's dish comes along and he takes a bite out of his crab and realizes the the breaded and deep fried crab is soggy, rubbery,cold, and old. Now please people, we all know what fresh deep fried anything tastes like; it's crispy and hot. Knowing that any decent restaurant in sf would gladly take back it's food if something was wrong with it, my friend and i agreed to tell the hostess/ waitress/owner. So we expressed our thoughts to the lady expecting that she would simply apologize and order another dish for us but instead she starts arguing and telling us how freshly deep fried the crab is. Soon after, she goes into the kitchen and starts screaming at the chef in Thai and comes back and offers us to reheat the crab in the MICROWAVE for us! even a diner wouldn't say that to you in SF!Come on people, you CAN tell the difference between a freshly fried french fry and an old stale french fry, how hard is it to tell the difference between a newly fresh fried crab and an old fried crab that was made at lunch?! she was extremely rude, we're giving you business and supporting your restaurant and instead you come screaming at my face and get angry?! 

so as i tried just forgetting about it and tried to enjoy the rest of my time left with my friend, she has the nerve to come by to ask me how our meals are and tries to flatter me by saying how big and beautiful my eyes are! lady, i don't care, you ruined my night and put my friend and i in a bad mood on a Friday night!!!!!!!!!! 




All i wanted was a decent dinner to enjoy my night with my friend. 
I live in a city that offers amazing food where ever you go, i know what good service and fresh good food is! 


NEVER AGAIN, NEVER AGAIN!
author: Setareh s.

description: Good food! We ordered summer rolls, mango fried rice with prawns and yellow curry chicken. Summer rolls were very refreshing. The curry was def. my favorite! My only complaint about the food would be that mango fried rice was a little dry, but still pretty good... Very fast and friendly service! Most def. will be back!  Not a fan of their website (takes too long to load and have to open 10 different windows to see their full menu)
author: Alexandra K.

description: my wife and I enjoyed a fantastic meal here, complimented by great service.
author: zach e.

description: Tried this for dinner one night, not impressed. Staff is very nice and friendly, but the praise pretty much ends there.  Food is mediocre, and definitely is not worth it for the price.
author: Amber M.

description:
I seem to end up at Marnee Thai at least every other month since moving to the hood 2 years ago.  After my first visit to their Irving Street location, I thought, "Hey, this place is pretty good."  After my second visit, I became a believer.  Over the last 20 something odd months, I've never had a bad dish at Marnee Thai, nor do I know of anyone who has ever had anything bad to say about the place.  Send your friends and family there, and they will thank you!  

The quality of food is definitely above the reasonable prices charged.  A+ food.  I only have one issue with you Marnee Thai, I want to eat inside a hut at your 9th Ave location!
author: Ben H.

description: The food is amazing but the service is terrible.  Fortunately, the food is so good you can forgive the service.  I recommend knowing what you want to order before the waiter comes to your table for the first time.  Once you get your order in, the food comes pretty quickly.  Everything I have tried here has been absolutely wonderful.  There's not a lot of seating, so you might have to wait if you come for dinner.
author: Brig M.

description: With a plethora of Thai to chose from, thai restaurants must employ that special something to keep your business.  Marnee thai on Ninth ave. has that and more.  First off the service is great, not because of the speed, but mostly because of the friendliness of the servers.  Everytime we dine here, the servers remember us and remember our favorite dishes.  As a few other reviewers mentioned the "chan pad poo" is amazing, their pad thai, pad see eww, and curry dishes are also spectacular.
