The can't miss item is "kao soy chicken" but make sure you bring your appetite as this is enough for three people.  Most of the dishes are plentiful in size, and their thai ice tea is splendid.  Next time you are in the inner sunset, stop by for some great thai!
author: Fern P.

description:
one of the best Thai restaurants in SF city. i love spicy food and i couldn't find one Thai restaurant with real spicy dishes before i went to Marnee Thai. you can just ask the waiter to make the dishes spicy. 

green papaya salad, tom yum, fried rice are my best picked!
author: Florence C.

description: Best Thai food ever!!  Try the pumpkin curry. Oh and don't forget dessert (my favorite part of the meal).  Mango sticky rice!!  Yummy.
author: Emily G.

description: quick ,friendly service. I do find their food, esp. the noodle dishes quite oily and soggy. a good occ  alternative when I need a quick thai fix .
author: aj s.

description: I have to say that every thing here I have ever eaten has been fantastic. To list it all out would require more time than I have, but the items screaming for a mention is the sauteed Chilean Sea Bass Basa with Pork, ginger, mushrooms and onions! OMG! oh and the roti with the coconut ice cream is an absolute must. I gave 4 stars because the place is small but seems like they could remove a table or two in order to make it feel less cramped.
author: Brandon L.

description: I'm disappointed in myself for not coming here hungrier! I was shocked to see how large their menu was and how many vegetarian options were available, Marnee Thai isn't messing around. It took me at least 10 mins to decide. I was really pleased to see they had vegetarian soups; I've always wanted to try thai soups but they've all had fish or chicken. You can replace meat with veg soy protein in practically any of their dishes. The soy was incredibly dense and chewy, much like seitan, and way delicious. We ordered the summer rolls, which were well packed and fresh but the dipping sauce wasn't very spicy or memorable. I ordered the Pramam Phak with veggies and fried tofu in a peanut curry sauce. The sauce was very flavorful and spicy, a nice twist on the typical thick peanut sauce often associated with Praram. The veggies were fresh and the tofu was beautifully crispy. My partner had the Pad Cashew Nut with the veg soy protein. It was spicy and savory with onions and peppers. Rice does not come with the meals, kind of a bummer, but only $3 for two people. Just keep in mind your $8-9 dish is really $10-11. I cannot wait to come back, super hungry of course, so I can eat up! Please please please consider delivery!
author: Cori W.

description:
Today was the second time me and my man went to eat at Marnee Thai. The first time I went was because I saw the great reviews made on Check Please and the food and the service definitely left an impression on I and the 7 others that I came with. Everyone loved it and one friend of mine who has been to Thailand many times commented the tastes and smell of the restaurant reminded him of his visits. Since then we have been dying to come back and since we live kinda far from the restaurant, we were so excited to be there and grub. 
The food here is soooo tasty. They season everything really well and its not overpowered with just spiciness. All the dishes I have tried has its own distinct flavor and is soo satisfying. Our favorites were the coconut hotcakes, the garlic pepper seabass, the avocado and mango salad, a yummy scallop and prawn dish and the panang beef. Yumminess.
Its funny to see that a review before me experienced a rude customer because I would have to say that the only bad thing about my visit here tonight was a picky customer who had nothing to do but complain about the food and the service. Seriously people need to change. How are you going to complain about the food and eat it all up and then wait till the end to continue to complain to the manager to say that the waitress was at fault for basically just taking your order?! Its clear that the service here works as a team and everyone tried to accomodate this lady. She ate all her food and still wanted some sort of discount at the end. Puhleeese. And although it was none of my business, it became part of my dining experience and it made me upset because my boyfriend and I thought that the same waitress was extremely nice. She helped us when we asked for a recommedation and even told us that we may be ordering too much food (we knew it but were excited to have leftovers). She was great and the rest of the crew kept busy constantly filling our waters and tea..clearing the table and packed up our food. What more can you ask for? And all for such a reasonable price.
I will always look forward to coming here. Marnee Thai is the bomb.
author: Fatima R.

description:
it was a good meal.  the angel wings are fried chicken drenched in a sticky honey sauce. it's a lot sweeter than san tung's version.
the soft shell crab salad was disappointing- lots of veggies with  2 tiny pieces of crab.  also had the pumpkin curry, pad thai, and fried bananas for dessert, which were all pretty solid.  it was a heavy meal though!
i'd return to try other dishes.
author: Big e.

description: Great food and ambient, corn cakes, incredible food, pad thai, award winning chef !  5 Star
author: Judie R.

description: Marnee Thai, my favorite thai restaurant in all the land. Well actually i like the one between 23rd and 24th more because it is closer to my house but they are identical. The food here is delicious. I have only been to this location once and it was a sit down dinner with around 20 people. This place is not suited for large parties. The food here is delicious, my favorite being the pad see yu. Something about those basil leaves.
author: KC F.

description: Consistently good food. We pretty much only eat here for thai food. Haven't had anything I didn't like. We always get the garlic chicken wings, or is it basil chicken wings? The corn cakes, pad thai, basa fish and pad thai. Have tried other dishes all of which are very good. The 9th ave location gives you more elbow room than the irving location as there are banquettes along the wall so you don't have to keep moving your chair in and out as other patrons try to pass. Servers are pleasant.
author: Lori E.

description:
one of the best thai places in the city. the peppercorn dish is awesome. i take folks from LA here and they talk about it when i go to visit them. try to find a thai restaurant in LA. good luck. 

i really don't eat here enough.
author: H K.

description: Did I already mention that I LOVE Thai food!  One of my friends watched "Check Please! Bay Area" and recommended we experience this restaurant before I leave for Thailand! So, myself and eight friends enjoyed a family style meal served by the owner's son.  This restaurant is small and quaint.  As you enter the narrow hallway, you will see numerous articles about this quint place and pictures to stare at as you wait to be seated.  You'll also get to watch the cooks at the opposite end as you peak into the kitchen and rub your tummy!  LOL!  It's really fun to eat Thai food family style; I have no idea what foods came my way; I just wanted to eat Pad Thai. I just put different delicacies on my plate and ate like a mad woman.   I also tried some dumpling that my friend said would be considered "street food" in Thailand.  I ate one and was trying to wrestle with my friend for the last one!  Before my trip though, I need to figure out why my nose kept itching.  I tried something that sparked my senses and taste buds.   Oh well!  Thailand here I come!
author: Vivian B.

description: We were told that the wait would be 3 minutes - it was more like a half hour.  We then ordered the angel wings which in the past were delicious.  This time they had too much crust and the chicken was lukewarm.  We then did not receive our second appetizer.  When we asked about it, we thought they would bring it right away, but it was brought at the same time we asked for our bill.  We waited about a half hour for our other dishes after finishing the appetizers.  The rest of the food was good.  They are very busy and it appears too rushed.  I was here once before and it was great.  Also, at the Irving Street restaurant, the owner can be rude so I chose to come here instead.
author: Nora S.

description:
i'm a Thai novice.  the first time i ate here i ordered at the suggestion of a friend.  pad thai with chicken, perfect spice level, so savory.  when i went back i inadvertently ordered the same thing - but i was thrilled to notice  that when it came out!  it was just as good the second time around. 

the shrimp egg rolls were awesome too - big chunks of shrimp.  

everyone i've dined there with has always enjoyed their food to the max as well!  gets pretty busy and its a small joint, so you may wait a little bit.
author: Sarah M.

description: It's the best Thai restaurant in SF :) highly recommend!!! I love the angel wings.
author: Ashley T.

description: I have Marnee Thai once a week.  I am definitely a creature of habit... I always order the "Tofu with chili, garlic, and thai basil" it is amazing.
author: Betsy C.

description: Three words. Banana Blossom Salad. We dream about it, even though it's not on the menu very much. I love the green curry rice noodles. Mmmm.
author: Esther L.

description: very good thai restaurant! nice setting, affordable prices, and has all the popular thai dishes. great for lunch with a friend or casual family meal.
author: Jen M.

description: Excellent food, service, & reasonable prices. Don't wait in line, make a reservation. Our party of 4 had the sea bass, pumpkin curry, duck, and a vegetarian curry.  All were wonderful, especially the sea bass.  Had the wings as appetizer and still around $100,  that is nothing in this city for great food.
author: darren f.

description:
I had chao talay and deluxe vegetables tonight and was very disappointed in both dishes.  Chao talay is described as mixed seafood sauteed in garlic, hot peppers and sweet basil.  All I could taste was salt and faint basil.  This was a simplistic and one dimensional dish somehow destroying all the flavors I have to imagine were originally contained in the calamari, shrimp, scallops, salmon, and mussels. And the vegetable deluxe would have been all right - not great - if they had not added numerous hefty chunks of translucent white or pink "fresh" tomatoes.  Here's a tip: skip fresh tomatoes when not in season.  What a total waste of money and food.  I'll hope for better results next time I visit Marnee Thai.

Postscript: these people are Nazis. They called me at 10pm the night I posted this review to ask what my problem was.  They  tried to be apologetic for the mediiocrity of the food and offered to remake the dishes, which I nervously accepted.  Unfortunately they were no better on second pass.  I will not be returning - ever.
author: j d.

description: i want to love this place, and the tofu angel wings are amazing and something I've never had elsewhere, so I'll be back if not just for them, but other dishes I tried- the curry veggie dish, the pad thai, were decidedly lackluster. not fully my cup of tea.
author: Liz S.

description: wow - the pad see ew with beef was like magical greasy sweetness in my mouth.  you gotta try it.  bring me back your leftovers when you do.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: i have a special place in my heart for Marnee Thai. it was one of the first restaurants i tried before moving up here and by far my favorite thai in the city. whenever my family visits, we always come here for a satisfying, inexpensive meal. there are many dishes to choose from to suit each of our appetites. we are usually greeted by the chef/owner's wife, who always strikes up friendly conversation with my family. they also offer a meat alternative for most dishes. my recent favorite is Spicy Angel wings...replaced with tofu. my sister always orders pad thai with crab and thai style fried rice. their dishes are consistent and packed with so much flavor. i love coming here...i feel comfortable and at home.
author: Heather W.

description: this is one of my favorite thai restaurants in sf.  i enjoyed it enough to wait in line outside their smaller location in the outer sunset before the larger, newer place on 9th ave. opened up.  angel wings and angel tofu are deep-fried sticky sugary goodness.  i don't think i've ever been disappointed by any of their food.
author: Jeff W.

description: My former roommate took me here once, but that's not how she became a former roommate.  Unlike her, this place rocks!  I've been to Thailand and I know what Thai food is supposed to taste like!  For awhile, I thought Thai food was played-out until I came here.  I don't like my Tom Yum sweet at all and this place makes it just right.  I love the bamboo decor - I used to live in a nipa hut once...
author: Raging R.

description: i love thai food. a friend of mine owns a restaurant down in orange county and in pleasanton, so i am really biased towards thai food. this place passed on my standards though. I love the spicy dishes and i was satisfied!!! Was a little more spicier then others i tried. but it was tasty!!!
author: Angela V.

description: Marnee Thai serves the best Thai Food in SF. Here are some of their best dishes:  -Spinach leaf appetizer thing. It comes with tiny dried shrimp, coconut flakes (yumyum!), crunchy peanuts,  onions, cilantro, little lime slices... Oh and a delicious, tangy sweet sauce. You put all these ingredients in a spinach leaf and EAT IT. It is very tantalizing! Refreshing tasty good.  -Chicken Satay. I love to load their perfectly grilled chicken up with peanut sauce.. PEANUT!!  -Angel wings. Crispy, fried chicken in a super tangy spicy sauce.. Your fingers will get very sticky!  -Hor Mok. This is an entree of steamed fish in COCONUT milk served in a big leaf. The fish has a fishy taste, but the coconut (!! yum) offsets it, making a very fragrant and delectable dish.  -Yellow chicken curry. Very good, spicy, nice amount of potatoes, chicken, and peas... MMM!!!!! Get this DEFINITELY.  I've had some shrimp dish too. I think anything you get here will be amazing and yummy. Yay!
author: O K.

description: It seems that recently the food and service has gone downhill fast! New management/owner, cooks??? Was just there this past week...They seemed to be in big hurry to turn over tables. My friend and I hadn't even gotten half way through our appetizer when the waitress brought out our entrees...already cold! Not only was the food cold but it was bland, rubbery dry noodles, mushy eggplant.  Yuck.  THEN we are obviously no where near being done when she comes over and asks if we want everything packed up to go.  I understand if you have to accommodate other parties but we were not taking our time or hogging table. We were eating at a normal pace, trying to enjoy our unenjoyable food.  Rude service, bad food. Not worth it.
author: rosie t.

description: My favorite Thai food in SF - best dishes are Chicken Massuman Curry and Pad Thai.  You can order for pick up - dont forget to get some of their spicy fish sauce - its good on everything.
author: Katie S.

description: the food is average, there is defintely better thai food in the sunset. the service is horrible-the hostess is rude and i had to ask multiple times for water, utensils and other things. if the prices were lower and if it was a hole in the wall i'd put up with this service. i'd go to king of thai over this place any day.
author: julia t.

description:
A friend gave me a gift certificate for this place, which I had never heard of prior to that.  I did a little homework on Yelp before paying Marnee Thai a visit, so that I would be prepared with the order.  I decided to use my generous gift on inviting my husband for a Friday night date.  When we got there, we were warmly greeted by the staff.  Although we had to wait a little before being seated, a couple of staff members came by twice to make sure we had the menu to browse.  One informed us about the specials of the day, and asked us if we wanted to put in our orders while waiting so that we wouldn't have to wait once seated.  Another one came to reassure us about how much longer we needed to wait until our table was ready.  All this service, just from waiting for only 10 minutes.  Or maybe it was longer... but all the attention we got, the wait didn't feel that long at all.  
When it came to ordering, trusting the Yelpers' reviews, I ordered the "Angel Wings" for appetizers, the "Pad Thai" noodles, the "Padang Beef" and the vegetable deluxe side dish.  The explosion of flavors and spices that emanate from all these dishes were phenomenal.  
The Angel Wings were wonderfully crisp with a syrupy coating.  The Pad Thai noodles might have been the best I've tasted so far as I really enjoyed the texture of the noodles: cooked "Thai al dente" where each noodle strand retained its chewiness all enhanced with a welcomed-complexity of the sauce a combination of sweet, salty , nuttiness with a bit of tang.
Although the Padang Beef tasted good, it wasn't outstanding and would easily feature in one of my "forgettable dish" with time.  The vegetable deluxe was good as well, nothing exciting though, just there to make me feel that I got my daily serving of veggies.  

Overall, we had a great experience.  The service was outstanding, the food rich in flavors, the atmosphere bustling and alive.  My husband and I felt like we were dating each other all over again!
author: Nadine M.

description: had the green curry and pad see ew, here today , they were both  delicious dishes. i asked for the curry very spicy and wow, did they deliver . it was hot, it was devil hot. i think next time iam just going to get it regular. i just moved up the block so ill be back with the wrath . Eat here its legit!
author: James H.

description: food here is not bad, service is mediocre. i would give this 3.5 stars, but not a 4. food is tasty. cant complain.
author: Ed W.

description: the food is great, but go early, the wait is not so great. the chicken curry is INCREDIBLE!!!!!
author: Virginia J.

description: this place is quite delicious.  i got in to the joint prior to the rush.  my friend and i got the back table.  we shared the the gang jued soup, which is the one non spicy soup.  it was quite delicious.  i love getting the traditional tom ka, so i was pleasantly surprised by  silver noodles and pork (our choice).  they we shared teh pad se-ew.  all delicious!!!  in fact, i inspired my roomie to get some of their award winning pad thai for lunch today.  SCORE for Marnee!
author: Sharlene C.

description: I just went to eat here yesterday. It was okay. But I prefer the one down the block, Chabaa
author: Thao C.

description: Two stars because the last time I ate here the food was so good that I couldn't wait to come back.  Yesterday, however, I came here with my sister expecting great food again but it was hard to even think about the food (just so-so) because after waiting outside in the rain for 25 minutes for a table -- along with all the other people who were waiting) we were finally seated at a table in the back.  No problems there.  I ordered spicy angel wings for an appetizer right away but they took a really long time to arrive.  Finally after about 25 minutes, the waitress comes over and tells us that she needs to move us to another table because she wants to use the table that we've been sitting at for half an hour for another party.  "Sorry but can we please move?"  WTH??  It was totally unacceptable to even ask us to move let alone to insist that we move to another table.   That's the kind of service that you gets you a big fat 0 for a tip.
author: I. B.

description: Ordered the pad thai and panang beef.  The flavors for both were different than the typical Thai place.  The pad thai could had used more tamarin sauce and the beef was from a roast and a bit tough.  Disappointing since we had heard so much positive.
author: Paul C.

description: The only reason they didn't get 5 stars was because they need more waiters! Which is really just a sign of how popular/good they are. After reading reviews on Yelp, a group of friends and I checked out this place before going to see Eddie Izzard. Food was delicious! Not one person was disappointed. Service, however was exceptionally slow and we had to ask the waiter 6 times for refills on drinks and a bottle of soy sauce. But flavor is what matters most to me so I say go for it!
author: Jennifer D.

description: i just went here for the first time last night and had a great experience. our group of 7 was seated after only a short wait and our order was taken quickly. we had a wide array of appetizers and entrees and there wasn't a mediocre dish in the bunch. the red curry was especially delicious. service was swift and the prices are about what you'd expect. all in all a really solid place and i expect to start taking guests here on a regular basis.
author: moey m.

description: my favorite thai restaurant in the sunset.  great pad thai, nice tangy tom yum soup, and i also highly recommend the green bean and shrimp with red chili paste.
author: Roshni R.

description: just like the location on irving...this place rocks just as much. food is tasty and pad thai is delish. c'mon, coming from a chef that won best pad thai? you gotta check it out. the wait is not as bad as the irving location but parking sucks. for the irving location...parking isnt bad but wait can suck at times. too bad you dont get the best of both worlds. but its still a place to definitely check out.
author: Tuan D.

description: Oh f@@K me in heaven, THis place is a real find. The old lady who runs the place is a riot - if you see her - please chat to her, unstoppable. She took care of me like I was her son. I ordered the green curry and she was like "you like spicy, how spicy you want it" - I turned to her and smiled - "how spicy can you make it " aww brave boy"  was the reply - I was not disappointed - delicious - 3 singhas later and a gallon of water I was done - im back anytime anyone wants to go - email me - im so there!!!
author: Stuart g.

description: i still haven't found a favorite thai place yet. the one i use to go to for years closed down b/c the family decided it was time for them to retire. it's hard for me to eat thai food b/c i always get a stomach ache afterwards and there hasn't been a place since, my old one that the food has tasted good. my friend told me bout marnee thai. the food is pretty good, but still can't compare to my old one. the corn cakes and pad thai are yummy. we always get a meat dish to eat with white rice, but dere still hasn't been a fav meat dish yet.
author: Karen H.

description: I went to both locations in outer and inner Sunset, menu is identical but there are some small differences in flavor. Overall, this is probably ok place to get americanized 'fusion' thai food but if you crave real Thai flavors then look elsewhere.
author: Mikhail K.

description: I lived in Thailand for a few years and know what I'm looking for in Thai food...and even with a seemingly endless number of options in the city, I've been disappointed. That is, until I sat down to eat at Marnee Thai. It has the right combination of great food, friendly service, a warm and lively atmosphere, and an overall good vibe. Lots of vegetarian choices and a convenient location are icing on the cake. Highly recommended.
author: John D.

description: I should preface my review by saying I went to the 9th&Irving location.  Didn't find it so charming, so I'm guessing maybe the other one in the mid sunset is nicer?  the food is very good, but the other all dining experience was kinda meh.  Pales in comparison to Dragonfly, which so far is easily my favorite of the more expensive places in the inner sunset.
author: J B.

description: I get tattooed at the place next door, and when you need some spicy, this is the place to get it. I had the Dang Pang chicken curry soup, holy sh8t was it awesome!! it was one of those dishes that was so hot the only way you could kill the heat was by eating more, and when you finished, you had to run for a soda, or bread or something....best in the city i think....great prices too!!!
author: Unhappy C.

description: eh. it was okay. after browsing their menu online for literally hours at work i was so let down. i get there to pick up my to go order to bring home and study all night with a full belly... it was tiny and loud. i was so glad i didn't stay. the pad thai was good. the roasted duck fried rice was good. but nothing special. definitely on the upper side of three stars, though, i'll give them that. i think i will give them another try one day.
author: Jessica W.

description: i have only had takeout from marnee thai, and i have only ordered one dish, over and over again.  still, this place deserves five stars because they do so well at my favorite dish in all of thai cuisine: the green curry with tofu.  i get brown rice with it, and dump the rice in to the curry, then slurp it all up like a disgusting pig at a curry-filled trough.  this curry is good.  it's really, really good.  this curry gives me the feelings.
author: emmie k.

description: I expected a little more from this place. It had a weird smell walking in to start. The service was good. The Yellow curry chicken disappointed me- it too watery. Panang chicken was good. Haven t tried anything else on the menu.
author: John c.

description: Great  food and atmosphere and a very attentive staff. The waiter recommended their rice cakes-WOW! So unusual and tasty and full of flavor. The food is very tasty and there's nothing that I have tried so far, that I didn't like.
author: Olga S.

description: Marnee Thai is SO good. I love Thai food and this is one of my favorites in the city. There are a million other places that look yummy in the Sunset, but every time I venture over here the call of Marnee Thai is just too great, and I always end up there. The food is delicious, the price is right, and the portions are perfect, leaving you full but not uncomfortable. I've eaten here a number of times, and it has always been great. I have yet to have something I didn't enjoy. I recommend the basil chicken (very spicy), the yellow and red curry, the panang beef curry, and the chicken satay. The service is great--they are very attentive and get you what you need, when you need it... including more rice (for free!). The only potential negative is the fast pace, which I don't mind, but it could be a problem for others. It can feel very rushed in there, and some may feel pressured to eat quickly and leave. However, I don't think it's intended to be a sit-down-relax-and-eat-for-2-hours type of restaurant, so it works. If you are in the Sunset, definitely check this place out.
author: Bridgette A.

description: Food still delicious but the ambiance at dinner was too loud.  The tables are very close to one another all in a row.  The birthday table of 9 next to us was so loud I couldn't enjoy my meal.   I recommend going to the other Marnee Thai for as good food less noise.
author: Mona B.

description: the other place that i'll go out of my way for to go eat at.  all the dishes are great and the potions are decently sized.  i remember having this spicy angel tofu dish that was really good!
author: Swarup B.

description: pretty much one of the best thai restaurants I've been to. the food was delicious and every flavor was hit spot on. the pad thai was just exactly like how it should taste. the mango salad had an excellent cilantro lime dress, not too sour not too swetet. the chicken panang curry was excellent as well, however i'd like more sauce to come with that. it was mostly chicken drizzeled with a bit of sauce. other than that, great great food and excellent flavor
author: Jules N.

description: it pretty good i had my first eggplant and chicken green curry dish here. and the padh thai was pretty good. not spectacular. i kinda went on a date here ( he paid! i left tip ). we came near closing and were seated in the backroom with a birthday party group. the owners or hostess' seemed really nice and it gave that feeling like it was a really family run business.
author: Maureen M.

description: this is my favorite thai restaurant. the thai salads are super spicy and they always make a combo seafood one for me since its not on the menu. i like the spring rolls too. the coconut drink is really good as well. the fiancee really likes the pad thai, curries, and the angel wings. its a little expensive but that may be due to the fact that i eat a lot. the owner's son is really nice and will always change things in the dishes i order without any fuss.
author: chloe w.

description: Take-out was marginal. Chicken was kinda funky and tofu / vegetables were meager for the noodle dish.
author: Shane H.

description: This is my go-to Thai place in the city, because of the delicious pad kee maow and fantastic staff. The pad thai stinks here, but as long as I don't order that, I am a happy camper.
author: Presto G.

description: this place is yummy! they serve some bomb ass garlic pork. it was cooked and marinated to perfection.  nice little spot. big plus that they dont close down for a few hours between lunch and dinner.  they serve a big portion of cucumber salad with their chicken satay.  all around good spot for great eats.
author: Aber M.

description: One of the best experiences I've ever had a Thai restaurant, and I've been to MANY in Los Angeles and San Francisco. What set Marnee Thai apart from the rest was not only the quality of the food, but also the quality of service. My rowdy group of 8 showed up an hour after our reservation time and we were still seated within 5 minutes in a cute secluded room in the back. The place had a decent amount of people but our server still had time to be extremely attentive and made sure our drinks were full and that we liked our food. And even though we ordered quite a bit of food it came promptly. Our waiter was extremely patient and made many suggestions such as the avocado salad and coconut soup which were ORGASMIC! He was also very accommodating of our friend who had a peanut allergy. He overheard one of my friends mention my birthday and he and another waiter came out with a gong and free yummy coconut ice cream with a candle which I thought was adorable. We were the last in the restaurant but we didn't feel rushed or pressured to leave. Usually restaurant staff get a little grumpy at the end of the night and want to get home ASAP, but the closing staff all said goodbye and wished us a good night. Although some have complained about the prices, I thought it was reasonable and well worth every penny. Overall Marnee Thai blends exquisite authentic Thai food with exceptional service.
author: N. M.

description: Everything was decent, but nothing blew me away. The place is small and when we arrived barely anyone else was dining, but by the time we left the place was full. Be prepared to sit very close to the people next to you. Golden triangles were quite good, but how can you screw up fried food? Pad Thai was everything you would expect and nothing more. There were only 4 or 5 shrimp and the chicken was cut so small I barely even noticed it. Vegetarian curry was good but not spicy enough for me. Brown rice was cooked very well. Thai iced tea was good but not amazing. Standard thai restaurant but nothing to write home about.
author: Michael K.

description: Hello.  How this establishment got 4 stars is way beyond me.  Thai food is a marriage between the great four sensations, sweet, salt, hot and sour.  The taste of the individual components has nothing to do with the final flavor.  For example, nam pla- fish sauce is one of the most disgusting flavors on the planet.  Yet, Thai food is impossible without it.  Marnee Thai misses the mark.  The staple of Thai food, Pad Thai totally missed the mark.  It was soggy.  I could not tell where the noodle started and the bean sprouts ended.  it was mush.  The corn fritters were good.  No dipping sauce at all.   The beef satay, another staple was not cooked on a hot enough fire, tasted like it had been boiled.  The peanut dipping sauce was bland, no flavor other than the peanut.  Did they use Skippy peanut butter?  There was no masuman curry available, we made do with a bland yellow curry.  We had the "chicken laap".   They forgot to add the chicken and it was soggy.  If you canned Thai food, this place would be a hit.  Four stars for Marnee Thai is very generous.  It's one good virtue is that it is close to Golden Gate Park.  Try the Mexican place across the street.
author: craig u.

description: I love this place! The angel wings are so good! I really like the thai ice tea and the roti with ice cream is very good for desert. I came here with a friend to celebrate a birthday and they went so far as to dim the lights and bang a gong. It was pretty embarrassing for my friend but also very entertaining to watch.
author: Miranda R.

description: After going to Thailand for 2 months, none of the Thai restaurants in the Bay Area satisfied me anymore. I found most Thai restaurants to be too Americanized; a lack of spiciness and excessive amounts of sauce or sodium added to the food. Of all the Thai restaurants that claim to be authentic, Marnee Thai is the only one that seems to be true to its word. The dishes were just as good as the food I ate in Thailand, and the employees were actually Thai! Those who dislike the food at Marnee Thai must come to the realization that they probably do not like Authentic Thai food. It's a shame that some people dislike this restaurant because that's what the food in Thailand actually tastes like! Maybe those people who dislike Marnee Thai like the greasy, sodium-heavy, Americanized Thai cuisine, which is fine as every person has their own preferences.
author: And R.

description: Marnee Thai is definitely my favorite Thai restaurant in the city, and I like to think I sorta know what I'm talking about since I visited Thailand a few years back. When I have a yellow curry with chicken and a green papaya salad craving, Marnee Thai is where I head. Although sometimes the craving is for green curry with duck and a mango salad. Or maybe pineapple fried rice and cucumber salad. And a Singha to drink and help with the spice and some coconut ice cream to finish the meal.
author: Adrienne D.

description: ZOMG! We've eaten at Marnee Thai like 18 million times and it's usually great, but tonight they busted out this coconut rice cake with fresh coconut, pumpkin, and corn served on a sizzling hot cast iron muffin-like pan. It was off the hook - go try it now! It's made in house, and you can't get this anywhere else!
author: Cindy and Aaron M.

description:
i'd heard about the short little cute woman who runs the joint and tells people what to do and what to order but i've never met her or even received a glimpse of the mystery woman. then one day a woman dressed in traditional thai looking garments comes from across the room with a gust of smoke and bright lights following behind her (minus the smoke and bright lights). mystery woman, could it really be you? after coming here multiple times in wonder? finally! it is! .....and then she opened her mouth and was loud and demanding. in a motherly way i suppose. i loved it! 

a friend of mine orders the green tea and she says "oh, i bring you thai tea instead. you like. if you no like i bring other one. but you like. it's sweeter." then we try to order some dish and she goes "oh # (i forgot the number so i'll make it up) 7 is betta. you get #7 it tasting betta." we go along with all she offers because, well, it seems we don't have much choice in the matter. she's taken over our ordering! then for dessert we tried to decide between the fried bananas or the roti. without even asking her or motioning for her opinion she comes over to the table and says "fried or fresh?" our response, "uhhh, what??" "roti is fried. mango with sticky rice is fresh. which one you want?" of COURSE we go for the roti as it has been aforementioned (look below). anyway, she was cute and demanding and i wish she were my grandma! (not to take away from my actual grandma! love ya g-ma! but she's totally awesome) the night would not have been the same without her. she was the highlight of dinner, no doubt.

mystery: solved.
author: Regina C.

description: I see alot of people giving 5 stars recently... honestly I don't see what's so good about this place.  It's just "alright", I would give an extra half star if I could because they offer duck meat.  The red curry was not rich enough, the tom yum soup was not rich enough, the pad thai was too "tomatoey", the special mango fried rice was bland, and the thai fried rice was terrible-- bland and wet is all I could say.  Angel wings were okay.  It just seems like everything was not as "spiced" as they should be.  No offense since I'm definitely not an expert either, but I think the non-asians out there overating this place. It's like why Americans like Panda Express, the "fake" Chinese food.
author: Joyce C.

description: one of the all time greats. the angel wings are awesome, the curry is delicous and the atmosphere is bustling. good for eat in or take out.
author: Mark U.

description:
To celebrate my 18th bday, my 3 long time buds and I headed out to Marnee Thai.  
I made reservations for 4 for 5:45 PM.
We got there at 5:50. Turns out, I didnt really need the reservation.
As usual, one of us was late,  so we sat around waiting...and waiting... all the while, we had ordered Thai Iced Tea+Coffee+ Thai Iced Coffee. 
Great stuff!  I had the Thai Iced Coffee, it wasnt as ..."Thai" as I hoped it to be but it was still yummy.=) 
So, when we finally ordered, I decided on the Pumpkin Curry but with Beef instead of the veg soy protein. (Me Heart Meat) 
It was SOO GOOOOOOOOOD. the Beef was SO TENDER! but....i managed to find only 3 pieces of pumpkin.....
My friends' other dishes were good, or so they said, with the exception of the Pad Se-EW? My friend said it was the most oily thing ever, and we are all chinese!  Greasy food to chinese people.....hm. you be the judge
They charged us $2.00 each for Brown Rice....Hm. I still think it should come with the dish, not as an extra but thats acceptable...

the service there was fantastic...until we had to wait 15 minutes for dessert and remind them 3 times....thats the only reason im taking off a star....I think thats kinda rare at this place since the waiters are very attentative, maybe they just had too much to do...but still....15 mins....=/

oh! before i forget, the bathroom review: 4/5. 
They play music in the bathroom! COoL! but the door is kinda weird, it shorta shakes on its own lol 

Overall, the food here is DELICIOUS the service is GOOD
and worth it. 

I ll be sure to come back but i do hope that i dont have to wait 15 mins for my black sticky rice with coconut ice cream which....I seriously thought was vanilla for a while....

anyhow. yea, it was good.
author: cindy L.

description: I began eating at the first Marnee about 18 years ago.  I have said for years that this is the best Thai food east and west of Thailand.  Chaiwat, the owner, recently told me that it has been rated in the top 50 Thai restaurants in the U.S.  (What a surprise!)  Every dish is excellent.  I love Thai food and could easily eat it a few times per week.  I have my favorites  of course and am happy that Chaiwat has new specials all the time.  Both Marnee locations have excellent service.  Take a date or a group, where you can order many dishes.  If arriving by car, don't stress looking for parking in the neighborhood; go less than two blocks into Golden Gate Park and it's a done deal.  If you find a better place to experience Thai food and hospitality, let us know.
author: Ted N.

description: Good selection of thai food. Nicely presented. Will be back here to try more items on the menu.
author: VVVV H.

description: Great food.  I take guests here when I want to impress them with tasty, beautifully presented Thai food.  The service is friendly as well.
author: Joshua M.

description: i had the Thai fried rice, combo noodle soup and pad phen (?) to go.  all were very tasty but i wish the noodle soup had more meat and vegetables and a coconut base.   that's not their fault.  I don't think noodle soup was even on the menu and although it was thin, the base was still flavorful.  I hope they add a hearty noodle soup to the menu for cold days like today :).
author: Ton W.

description: I'm so happy Marnee moved to the Inner Sunset. I've been going to the original one for years, but am much happier with the new one on 9th. Especially the wait, it used to take forever to get it. Now, I've never had to wait for a table! This is probably the best Thai food in San Francisco, and I've tried a lot.
author: Anna L.

description: Mmmmmmmmmm!  Great Thai.  Their spinach appetizer, Meing Kum, is TDF (to die for).  Also, pumpkin curry...................................
author: sally g.

description: The BBQ chicken is a delight .The rest of the food including the Papaya salad was outstanding.OK the ambiance is what it is but who cares.Love it
author: B O.

description: Great thai food and best in the Inner Sunset.  I added a star for the super vegetarian friendly items on the menu (tofu and gluten!).  Some favorites: pad see ew; pumpkin curry; panang curry; summer rolls.  I've done both take out because they're busy for dinners and dined in and had nice (yet loud) meals. Try it. :)
author: A M.

description: One of my two favorite places for Thai in the city. It can be a little on the slow side, but the food is never anything less than delicious. Almost always crowded, but that's because it's worth pushing people aside to get to the curry!
author: Mike B.

description: always on point with taste and service.  love this place.  thank goodness i am walking distance and dont need to search for parking around there.
author: Tom L.

description: consistently great thai food and relatively authentic
author: Matt B.

description: marnee thai catered my daughter's wedding of 200 guests in menlo park and they were great. nice people, excellent food, reasonable price.
author: john s.
